description:
I really like this breakfast spot! Their Lemon Dill Crab Shrimp Cake Benedict is scrumptious. With my most recent visit, I ordered the Salmon Rotolone Tartine and my friend ordered the Spicy Pop Pulled Pork Scramble so I got to try some of that as well. The scramble was heavier than the tartine which gave more of a lighter, fresh taste to brunch. Honestly all of their dishes come with crunchy potatoes. All the dishes I've tried so far are delicious. Will probably become a regular here! 


As always in the City, street parking is limited and I didn't see a parking structure nearby but can't confirm because I mostly walk and do ride-share when I'm in SF.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Stopped by mid afternoon for a late brunch. I was greeted as soon as I walked in and there were a few open tables so I was immediately seated. They also have bar and outdoor seating available. 

I was in the mood for something sweet so I ordered the lemon souffle pancakes and the fresh squeezed orange juice. They serve breakfast items all day but after 11 am they start serving salads, burgers and sandwiches too. 

The orange juice came first which was sweeter than I was expecting it to be. It tasted as if sugar was added but otherwise it seemed fresh. I would have preferred it to be colder too.

The lemon souffle pancakes came out hot and smelled amazing but they tasted okay. The lemon flavoring was evident with certain bites but it did not taste as if it was blended in well. The pancakes were a little more browner than golden and also carried somewhat of a brunt griddle flavoring. The pancakes also came with a side of strawberries, blueberries and an orange.

Overall it was average and I might have ordered the wrong items or had a orange juice batch without the best oranges. I would return to try something else.
author: Dave S.

description:
+ THE FOOD
I'm not usually a big fan of egg benedicts because of the hollandaise sauce, but this place has definitely changed my mind. My friend and I ordered the lemon dill crab cake benedict with a side of fried potatoes. The crab cakes were pretty large and super flavorful. They were placed on top of a slice of thick bread (sourdough?), which I prefer over their English muffins. Their hollandaise sauce was very light and I enjoyed that it had a more predominant lemon-y, savory taste to it. The potatoes were so crisp and delicious as well. The meal was really filling but not to the point where I felt terrible after (which I usually do after eating regular eggs benedicts haha). 

+ THE ENVIRONMENT
We came during a weekday lunch and there was luckily no wait at all. There was plenty of parking in the streets nearby. A big plus for me was that there were ample outdoor seating so it was dog friendly.
author: Cindy C.

description:
Solid brunch place in Nob Hill area. 

Yes, you'll probably wait, but it'll be worth it. 

Service: 4 stars. Friendly, helpful, and understanding, they checked-in on the line as well as our table when we needed drink refills and more time to order. 

My friend and I sat at the counter  facing the window and liked people-watching. It's pretty cramped but they manage to fit so many people in the small-ish space, I'm impressed. 

We both ordered the Norwegian Benedict which was large and filling. The house potatoes were warm, crispy, and popping with flavor. They did not scrimp on smoked salmon which I was happy about, and I also liked the capers. The chive hollandaise was creamy and rich, and the grilled sautéed spinach wasn't overly salted. The eggs were runny and flavorful. 

I'll definitely be back for another brunch date to try the lemon dill crab shrimp cake Benedict and the lemon ricotta soufflé pancakes. 

Great location on California St., lots to do and see in the area.
author: Lizzie S.

description:
Food: B+
Service: B+
Location: B

Solid brunch menu. 

Incredible dirty chai. 

Food fell a bit short from my expectations, particularly the zucchini pancake and hash. 

The Texmex scramble was my favorite. Perfect consistency, good spice, and the perfect sauce and avocado to complement the dish. Highly recommend.
author: Barron C.

description: Wanted to go for a long walk to breakfast and found this little spot past the espicopal cathedral.  I think it's owned by some Vietnamese people who were just awesome.  The menu was just decadent.  I went for the Chile Verde Egg Scramble and it was most certainly right on point.  My girlfriend got the banana souffle pancakes...truly need to figure out how to make souffle pancakes. Coffee was hot and delicious...left stuffed...funny because we just wanted something lite!
author: Aaron C.

description:
True rating: 4.5
Here's the breakdown:

1. There will be a line. There are no reservations or waitlist. You just stand outside in a line. I went on Saturday morning around 10am and there was a long line. But, the line goes by fast. 

2. It's small and crowded inside but they have outdoor sitting available where you can bring furry friends. 

3. Service is fast and kind. We didn't have to wait long for our food and the waiter was kind and helpful.

4. Their freshly squeezed OJ is delicious. Worth the $4.5!

5. The food is pretty good. It's not out of this world amazing but it's definitely good. Lemon Dill Crab Shrimp Cake Benefit is good but not crazy good. The Banana Souffle Pancake was pretty good. Would recommend this one. [pictures attached]

6. Prices are on average around $17 for one dish.

Overall, I would recommend this place for someone who is looking for a cute little brunch place to go on a weekend. I would also come back to this place for the future.
author: Shin L.

description:
A truly excellent breakfast/brunch place.  When our SUV broke down during a trip in San Francisco, we searched for a place to eat nearby while the vehicle was evaluated.  Luckily Mymy was nearby, and the people at Nissan highly recommended it.  I'm so glad I listened.  Everything was delicious.  It was easy to find a parking space on a weekday around lunch time.  The place is tiny, so I would assume during the weekend this place has a long wait.  Even on a weekday, the place was packed.  I think there are only around 10 small tables, so don't bring a crowd.

Anyway, the only reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars was 1 reason.  It was mid-Summer and the weather was quite hot, and this place has no air conditioning or at least didn't put it on.  It was uncomfortably hot inside, and everyone - even the staff - were sweating.  If I could give another half star, I would.

The food?  We tried the breakfast plate with eggs, potatoes, toast and bacon, which was all cooked perfectly.  The French Toast was amazing.  The fresh berries and crisp crust on the toast was perfect.  The banana soufflé pancakes were a pleasant surprise.  This is one of those dishes that seems to be everywhere in S.F. these days (every breakfast/brunch menu in town).  I would point out that at some places the soufflé pancakes are light and airy and look like a risen soufflé.  These looked like regular pancakes.  Maybe they fell.  I don't know.  They also used to offer blueberry banana pancakes but I guess they won't put the blueberries in now.  Didn't see why they couldn't add blueberries to mine, but okay.  What stands out is that I'm not a huge fan of bananas to the point I would order that flavor of pancakes, but these were delicious.  So, if someone can cook something you normally wouldn't order, and it is great... chances are a fan of bananas would die for these.

Wish the temperature inside was more comfortable, and that they had those blueberry banana pancakes.  Otherwise, highly recommended.  Top notch food.
author: David C.

description:
After eating brunch here.....my boyfriend and I both got really bad stomach pain, resulting in some not so great news (you know what I mean). 
I got the norweigan benedict which is english muffins w/ smoked salmon and poached eggs. It was SOOOO dang salty. I had about two bites of the salmon and I was done. It was extra salty because of both the salmon and sauce on top... I couldn't even finish it. 

My boyfriend got the lemon dill benedict which was much better then mine so I stole some of his food because mine was very unsatisfying. Just give me a bunch of water. 

Best part of the meal? The crispy potatoes. Everything else? Not so much.
author: Winnie L.

description:
3.5

We got pretty lucky with the wait! Our group of 4 was 5 groups behind in line, but they were all doubles. When a 4 person table opened up, we got to skip the line and only ended up waiting less than 10 minutes. 

Service was really quick, maybe even a litttttle too quick? My family's really fast at deciding what to eat, but even we weren't ready. Their latte was really good although I can't report if they charge extra for almond milk. 

The banana soufflé pancakes were...'maybe just interpreted to be banana pancakes? Not sure cause they definitely weren't soufflé but maybe we read the menu wrong? If so, my parents still loved it though I didn't think it was sweet enough. I think I prefer IHOP. 

My lemon dill crab cake Benedict was kind of small in portion despite it being almost $20. It tasted pretty good, and the crispy potatoes were amazing. I was surprisingly full. 

It was alright. Not mega amazing brunch compared to other places in SF. But satisfying enough with pretty good service. I'm glad we didn't wait too much longer for it.
author: Lilian K.

description:
This is a pretty great brunch spot, but man does it get crowded! Luckily, the first time I went it was before the lines started (before 11am), so there was no wait. 

The make a great Salmon Benedict with the crispiest potatoes ever! 
Will definitely be back to try something sweet! 

A lot of their seating is also outside in the sun, so be careful to dress appropriately incase you get stuck outside.
author: Hanna S.

description:
My friend and I made a special trip just to try this place out. This gen is nestled in at the corner of California St and Larkin. We got there around 10:30 and we were quite lucky to find a parking spot down the street from the restaurant. Upon walking up to the restaurant, we see a few people lined up outside. They have a line for people to stand in to get a table; no check in sheet, nothing fancy. Just form a line. There was only a few parties in front of us but I think it only took 15-20 minutes to get to the front of thr line and be seated. As we were standing there, the line slowly grew longer and longer. 

We were seated inside by the window (they have indoor and outdoor seating). We originally wanted to sit outside since the weather wasn't bad and we were scared it would be to cramped inside. However, much to our surprise it wasn't. The interior is pretty small but the tables are spaced accordingly so you don't have to worry about hitting the person behind you haha. 

Anyways, oncecseated our waitress immediately brought us water and asked if we wanted anything else to drink. And left us to it to look at the menu. We pretty much already knew what we wanted. I ended up ordering the banana pancakes with potatoes and longanisa on the side and my friend ended up getting the Miss MyMy. While we were waiting for our food, I was getting super hungry stating at everyone elses food. Everything looked so good! It didn't take too long for our food to come out but it felt like forever since I was so hungry.

The pancakes were so fluffy and to die for. So goood. Best pancakes I've had in years. And their potatoes and longanisa were . My friend enjoyed her food as well but she kept picking at my pancakes. The food was all delicious. Overall, our experience was great. Super fast, friendly service, and great delicious food. What more could you ask for? When in town again, I wouldn't mind stopping by here again to get some more pancakes!
author: Misty T.

description:
Oh the Lemon Dill Crab Shrimp Cake Benedict! I get Benedicts at almost all my brunches and this is my absolute favorite (mama's on Washington is a close second). It's not just that they did a perfect job cooking very single thing on the plate - the fried potato was crispy and not very greasy; the garlic sautéed spinach was fresh and tender. Their special lemon dill hollandaise, which was so incredible and so unique, added a refreshing and balancing flavor to complement the crab and shrimp.

The Challah Bread French Toast was one of my fav French toasts. It was so soft and moist and importantly, not too sweet. The fruits and nuts perfectly complement the texture of the bread.

Perfect place for brunch on a sunny morning. We got seated outside so we didn't even go inside the entire time - which I just realized was kinda funny.
author: Iris H.

description:
Skip the pistachio latte -- it doesn't taste like pistachio and is no better than that powdered stuff you can buy in the store... Plus, if you're ordering food, you won't want the extra volume of it, since your dish will be quite tasty and, unless you skip the potatoes that fill up half your plate, you'll fill up on food very easily. Yes, this place is pretty darn low-key, which seems in contrast to the high-ish prices for eggs and potatoes. But, the food is good and worth a try. 

Bottom line: Good food. Fill on up!
author: Rebecca P.

description:
Second time coming to Mymy for hearty breakfast/brunch especially coming from the East Coast time zone. 

Highly recommended. Lemmon Soufflé Pancakes,  Salmon Rotolone Tartine and Harvest Time were all delicious and shareable.
author: Selina Y.

description: This place is phenomenal!!! Quick service and delicious food! They also have mimosas. The fluffiest pancakes I've ever had because they whip their egg whites and then fold it into the batter. They also have zucchini pancakes and chicken apple sausage for those that don't eat pork. Go with the Benedict's with potatoes or with the pancakes. You won't be disappointed. Will def be back!
author: Stephany C.

description:
I came here a while ago and the wait and service was AWFUL. I came with a party of five and wrote my name down like usual. It was a busy time and there were a lot of people excited to try the food, so I understand that there was a wait. However, multiple times, when a table of four would be free, the waitress would seat parties of four, even when we said we wouldn't mind grabbing and extra seat and sitting on the side of the table.

The wait ended up being over an hour, and the waitress was very rude whenever we nicely asked her about the tables. She would say "I've worked here for a long time and I know how to do this so just wait". Alas, we waited it out because we had already waited a long time and didn't want to waste our wait time. In the end, after letting three parties of four and multiple smaller parties who came a lot later than us through, she gave us a table of four.... with a chair on the side....

If she would have juect let us have the first table that was available when it was our turn, we would have been seated in maybe 25 minutes. Instead she made us wait for nothing. 

When we ordered and got our food, she was just took our order quickly and threw down our food when it arrived. The food was alright but overall was a horrible experience.

The interior of the restaurant is very small and cramped.
author: Gracie W.

description: This place is SO good!!!! The best Benedict I have EVER had! I walked in on a Friday morning, was seated very fast, no actual server here everyone helps each other out and they have an efficient system. I had the lemon dill crab cake with the hollandaise on the side, it was perfectly executed, soft, savory, and the potatoes on the side were fabulous too! I can't wait to come back next time I'm in San Fran to try something else here but I will definitely be ordering that crab cake again!!
author: Zahra H.

description:
OVERALL: Good spot, wait is not too bad, and I liked my pancakes (what they're known for), though the scramble my friend wasn't the best. Glad I tried it, not sure if I'd make the trek again from the Mission.

THE WAIT: About 15 minutes on a Saturday around 11am. There was a line of about 10 people ahead of us, but it moved quickly. It's especially faster to get in if you are in a group of 2!

SWEET GRIDDLE
* Lemon Souffle Pancake ($13) - 4 stars
Light and fluffy, soft, with great lemon filling. A tad dry.

TWO EGGS AND SCRAMBLES
* Frisco Scramble ($14) - 3 stars
The potatoes were great, but the scramble was a bit oily and congealed.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
This is my new favorite breakfast spot in the city! Everything about my experience was perfect. The restaurant has a very warm and cozy feel. Staff was very attentive and helped me decide on what to order. I easily found parking space around the corner with meter around $2.25 per hour. I called in advance to see how busy it was before coming in and they said it wasn't so busy due to the rain. 

The food was amazing! Everything I ordered I was so pleased with. Here's what I got:

-Pistachio Latte: Perfect level of sweetness and didn't go overboard with the pistachio flavor. Great start to my meal.

-Crab and Shrimp Cake Benedict: Nothing like your traditional Benedict! The crab cake tasted very fresh and the exterior was beautifully golden brown. I'm not the biggest fan of hollandaise so i was excited to have that very refreshing dill sauce. Came with a side of really crispy and addictive.

-Banana Souffle Pancakes: HEAVEN ON EARTH!! These pancakes were so fluffy but felt like silk in my mouth. Came with vanilla cream, bananas, and walnuts on the side. When i took a bite of everything together i could've sworn I seen Jesus! lol

I will definitely be back!
author: Mary R.

description:
My(oh)my what a wonderful day, plenty of sunshine headed my way. Ironic song lyrics for a rainy Saturday, but nonetheless....

Grabbed brunch here with a couple friends and really enjoyed it. I had the crabcake benedict and tried out some of the zucchini pancake and parma flavor benedict. 

The flavors on the crabcake benedict really went well together-- the thin sliced sourdough bread, topped with wilted spinach, then topped with a sizeable crabcake. The lemon dill sauce complemented the egg, which was runny enough for an eggs benedict. They are pretty generous with the side of crunchy potatoes-- I loved the crunch outside and starchy insides.

The zucchini pancake was moist and flavorful. It tasted great even without the syrup. I don't even like pancakes normally. The flavors on the parma flavor benedict also really went together well (mozzarella, proscuitto, tomato basil). 

Solid 4/5 for food. Focus wasn't on interior decoration or anything, but it was a nice space, though somewhat smaller. We came at 9am on Saturday and had a ~15 minute wait for 3 people. Service was pretty tyical. No reservations available!
author: Nicole H.

description:
Came here with my girlfriend for brunch.  We came there before 9 and missed the whole rush.  The line really got long.

I got the crab benedict which came with an abundance of crab. It was spread on top of avocado on top of a slice of bread. Not the typical english muffin.  It was light on the hollandaise sauce which is okay since the creaminess of the avocado made up for it.

My girlfriend got the shrimp longganisa grits which was also really good. The grits was done properly and didnt taste. Grainy. The longanesia was like sweet and savory sausage.  

Would come again next time i come to SF.
author: Ryan L.

description:
Oh Mymy my! Look what we have here...

A couple of my friends and I decided to try Mymy after disappointingly turning down Mama's due to their extensive wait time. We figured, as a party of 8, it would be highly unlikely that we land a table within the next hour or so. With that, we decided to take a little drive a few streets down and try Mymy instead.

Now, if you already know how brunch goes down in San Francisco, it goes a little something like this: 
-if your driver friend is smart enough, they'd drop you and your friends off at the front while driving around aimlessly for almost an hour finding parking, JUST so you could land in the front of the line outside the restaurant.
-Once you manage to write your name down, you hope that the wait time is under an hour, especially since you decided to skip early breakfast in order to fully enjoy your Brunch meal.
-Your name is finally called half an hour later (which is barely a wait in the city without a reservation), are starving, and while looking at the menu, decide to order all the foods.

Fortunately, our entire party of 8 had only waited a mere 15 minutes for our table. Granted that we were seated outdoors, we had to admit, it happened to be a really, REALLY nice day in the city that given morning, so it was very hard to complain.

For my meal, I really wanted to try something I have never tried before. I skipped on everything typical 'brunch-like' such as the pancakes, waffles, eggs benedict, scrambled eggs and sausage...all of that. Instead, I had decided to opt for the CHORIZO JALAPEÑO TARTINE ($14), which consisted of pepper jack scramble chorizo, roasted jalapeños, chipotle aioli, and roasted miche.

NO RAGRATS WHATSOEVER.

This had to have been the best damn brunch I had tasted in a looong time. Real talk, folks.

What I loved most about it was the side of freshly made, crunchy on the outside - moist on the inside, seasoned potatoes and that bomb AF chipotle aioli that was topped on my eggs and Tartine bread (SF reppin').

What I also love about this place is that they support local Bay Area bakeries and foods to use in their dishes. I find it really hard to love a restaurant that doesn't support fellow locals in the food business.

Another popular pick from our group was, of course, the Eggs Tartine ($13) which is basically almost the same thing as the Chorizo Jalapeno Tartine, but without all the spicy ingredients. This meal is perfect for those who'd prefer a more mellow brunch option.

Our server throughout our experience was on top of her game the entire time, topping off our water cups and asking if we needed additional silverware or condiments. She tabled everyone seated outside the restaurant as well as some tables inside, and with that, have to give her major kudos for putting up with all the needs of our big party.

A major downside to this place is definitely the parking situation....and I'm sure all of you who went here by car can agree. The parking struggle is r-e-a-l in this part of town. So, unless you drive a SMART car or something,   almost guaranteed that it will take you at least 20 minutes to find a decent spot around here.

Otherwise, I definitely plan to come back again soon (maybe with a rented SMART car) so I could try more of their "House Favori" items!

+Street parking only
+California Street cable car also rolls through this location, if you are used to taking that method of transportation
author: Kate T.

description: I got the Dungeness crab eggs Benedict which was really good and decent portion of crab. The loss of one star was from the banana pancake, the syrup to pancake ratio was off and we were left with about a third of the pancakes dry. Don't get me wrong, the pancakes were yummy but dry after all the syrup and fruits were gone. Definitely gotta come back for that grapefruit mimosa tho!
author: Julia L.

description:
I was in town for a conference and had a pretty great breakfast here! We were seated immediately (it was about 8:30 on Sunday morning) and the service was great. Neither my friend or I were feeling very adventurous, so we both ordered the french toast. I also got a soy latte, which was delicious.

Overall the food was delicious, and the fruit on top was fresh. The strip of bacon that came with the french toast was thick and crispy, which was nice. I had no complaints!
author: Kristin W.

description: Great spot for that "after late night been drinking" breakfast!  Carafe (2) of the hangover Mimosa really did the trick!  The food is excellent with good flavor and variety.  We sat outside on a perfect SF weather morning.  I will say that the inside seating seemed tight. Kind of glad we enjoyed outdoor dining.  Definitely will be back.
author: Will E.

description:
We ended up here by default actually, but thank goodness for it! Our original plan was to go to Swan Oyster Depot just a block away but that place was packed and we were starving, so we decided to come here since we passed by it on our way. Such an adorable little cafe/restaurant!! It's located at the corner and looks kind of like a hole in the wall, except for the tables outside. There was no wait when we came in around 11 am on a Monday morning, but it slowly started to get busier. It's pretty small, so tables are very close to each other. The servers are so nice and friendly and very down to earth. 

And the food... omg... is INCREDIBLE! First of all, their menu options are so different from your ordinary breakfast spot. They put their own special twist on the classic breakfast dishes. For example, I ordered their crab and shrimp cake benedict, and that was probably one of the best Benedicts I've ever had (and I've had a lot!). I give it 5/5 stars! The crab and shrimp tasted so fresh but not overpowering. It had the perfect amount of crisp. The green sauce they drizzled it with was creamy and kind of garlic-y which I love. I highly recommend it! My bf got the BLT benedict and that also was super delicious. My favorite part about my experience here is the red velvet latte. Once I saw it on the menu, I knew I had to get it. I was more curious about what it looked like rather than its taste. It came out red and beautiful and served in a clear glass mug, and I know people were looking at it when they served it to me! It's so pretty to look at! It tasted just like hot chocolate, but a little less sweeter which I liked. I will definitely have to come back whenever I'm in this part of the city again!
author: Michelle R.

description:
Mymy is such a cute cafe and appears to be the kind of place for a quick meal. The service was basic, the waitstaff only stopped by to take our order, bring our food, and bring the check - nothing to write home about. The tables are a bit close together in this small restaurant, so not the place for an intimate conversation.

In regards to the food, the lemon soufflé pancakes were so fluffy and delicious! I definitely preferred that over the Baja California Benedict, which is topped with Dungeness crab and avocado. I ordered the Benedict based off the pictures online but was a little bit disappointed with the small amount of crab. The potatoes that came as a side with the Benedict was basic, albeit good! I took off one star because although the food was good, I'm not sure if it is worth the price.
author: Carol C.

description:
We got to the city in the morning and decided to go to Mymy for brunch. We arrived around 11:30 am and there was a long line formed outside of the restaurant. While waiting in line we explored the menu and made our food choices. I want to say we waited around 30-40 minutes and because we were a party of four it took them longer to get us seated (multiple parties of two behind us in line were seated before we were). When we finally got our table, we requested some water. They gave us a small jug with four glasses (it was definitely not plenty for a group of four dehydrated individuals). We ordered two carafes of mimosa (one orange and one grapefruit, $21 each, pre-mixed). After scanning through food photos on their yelp page, I went with the Baja California Benedict ($22). The mimosa was pretty strong and not "juiced-down." Although the Benedict was delicious, I do feel it was a tad bit overpriced at $22 and if I were to return here, I would choose a different benedict option. 

Overall, I wouldn't say it's anything I would go out of my way for. I would recommend going here only if the line is not large and it is isn't super busy - otherwise I'd go elsewhere.
author: Ella M.

description: This place is so amazing! The food is so good and the service is prompt and efficient considering the size of the place they keep a steady flow. My husband and I were in San Francisco on vacation and i found this place on instagram through a food blogger, and I'm so happy i did because when I'm able to get back to SF I will be going there again!
author: Michelle S.

description:
It must have been a fluke with the wait tome last time because we waited 45 minutes this time for a group of four. After returning for a second time, I feel like MyMy's savory dishes are stronger than their sweet dishes. We got the following this time:

Salmon tartine (5/5): an open faced sandwich that comes with scrambled eggs, smoked salmon, avocado, and some kind of creamy dill sauce on top of a single slice of rustic bread. It was very good, and I liked the crispy fried breakfast potatoes that went with it. 

Challah French toast (3.5-4/5): this was good but not particularly memorable, although my daughter loved and ate all the fruit that came with it. The French toast came with a single strip of bacon on top that somehow felt slapped on and not part of the dish; I wish for ease of eating that it had come chopped or crumbled on top.

For next time, I'd probably stick with their savory dishes, which we've loved.
author: Rachel L.

description:
My oh my, Mymy. 
You sure specialize in a yummy brunch which explains the long lines. 

It's been on the brunch list for a while but we've often gone elsewhere when met with the long primetime wait. Finally ate here when we stumbled in right around opening (8-ish am).

Man the brunch is tasty. Loved the salmon tartine. Artfully presented but packed full of flavor between the smoked salmon, chive omelet, cream cheese, and avocado. It's so satisfying and everything just works well together. Split something sweet while you're at it. We shared the lemon ricotta pancake. Well-balanced and not too sweet. Lovely fluffy pancakes accompanied by strawberries and syrup. 

It's not the largest space but the food is good which explains the longer lines. Come early if you want to get seated but it filled up fast when we were here.
author: Jon L.

description: The food was good but it didn't look like the plate that I saw online. However, they were fast with making my food but they should provide a bigger glass of oj because $4 something for a 6oz cup isn't worth it.
author: Tiffany F.

description:
I was not able to see their name on the menu until after we had eaten and I had to look for their name after, it was outside the restaurant on the awning. But my parents recommended to try because there's always a line for brunch. 
We went on a weekday and got seated immediately, it did get filled up after 10 minutes. Food was delicious, potatoes, eggs, toast were all done right. Had their banana blueberry pancakes too and I couldn't stop telling my parents how tough it is to find someone that makes it so good! And they were with me, we shared our food.
author: Annie M.

description:
Wow! The line outside is worth the wait! This place was so delicious! Came here Saturday at 12p and the place was packed! Line was discouraging but went by fast. 
I got grapefruit juice(wow), the side order of crab cakes, toast, and avocado (so I can make avocado toast). Everything was so good! The crab cakes were made to perfection and melted in my mouth. My avocado toast was super good too the avocado had great texture! I will be back to try more of the menu! :)
author: Megan M.

description:
Best breakfast for two crazies!! We just had to try this place out! So many good choices...it's hard to pick one so why not order and take to-go and have it later?! That's what we did! I just had a hard time deciding on what to get? Don't you get that sometimes?!

Came on this Sunday late morning and the line would not end and kept getting longer. The wait is not so bad though. Friendly service and pretty attentive for a big crowd. 

They have indoor and outdoor seating and we got to sit outside so I was not able to see or take my pics in the inside. Good thing it was warm out in the sun. Only disadvantage was people will watch you eat but as long as you don't mind it... ;-)

Our cafe mochas was good and good size. We both ordered a Benedict plate. I had their lemon dill crab shrimp cake and my hubby had their Baja California crab cake. My hubby's was good since it's all real crab but I really liked my choice! Everything tasted well together. I really liked the sauce. A must try! The potatoes wedges were so good and crispy, too. It was hard not to eat them. I also really really wanted pancakes as my dessert so we ordered Banana soufflé pancakes with a egg white meringue vanilla curd with a little berry sauce in it! The pancake itself was so good and light! If I didn't have the Benedict's, I would have been satisfied with this by itself!

Our experience was very good and will definitely come back when we are in the city! It's rare for me to give 5 stars, too so that tells you something! A must place for food and service! [158/100]
author: Edna G.

description: Very good. Creative and tasty dishes. The crab cake eggs Benedict was delicious. Definitely a good breakfast spot.
author: Dandy B.

description:
Went there twice for brunch, both times waited in a line, but it moves pretty fast, just in time for menu selection.

They don't have many vegetarian options, but can substitute meats for avocado in most items, which worked for me. Eggs Benedict were pretty good, omelette less impressive. On a pricey side, but food is very decent and service is fast and friendly.
author: Anton B.

description:
I'm updating my review from 4 years ago from 5 stars to 3 stars. Food quality is not as great as 4 years ago, but still good. Customer service though has plummeted. They are rude and simply don't care about their customers because they have established "good brunch" reputation. They only care about how fast can they get the customer to pay and leave and get the table ready for the next $$$.

I've had too many rude experiences here to come back. Good food, very bad brunch experience.
author: Joao A.

description:
Long lines and great food. $$

We found this place on yelp while searching for brunch places on Christmas weekend. Most places were closed but this restaurant was open till the afternoon so we headed over only to find a long line of people who had the same idea as us. As the line moved we decided what we wanted and since we were waiting around 25 mins that was plenty of time.  

The restaurant itself has a cosy interior with seating both inside and outside. We sat inside as it was a cold outside. The staff is very quick here so we promptly got our coffee and the food followed shortly. 
We tried the Norwegian benedict ($14.50) , Salmon tartine ($14.50) and the French toast ($13.00).  The food presentation was fantastic ( specially the French toast ) 8.5/10 and everything tasted very fresh and delicious. All dishes were really good, the toast was perfectly sweet and fluffy 8.5/10, the tartine had a huge piece of salmon and avocado with the eggs 8.5/10 and lastly the eggs benedict were divine 10/10. All dishes were served with their house potatoes which were crispy and delicious 8.5/10. 

Note: The portions were big and allow for sharing too which was great. The coffee has free refills and was appreciated on a cold day but is not any special bean, just regular hot coffee. 

Overall the meal was approx $20.00+ per person which is not exactly as economical as other places but definitely has really good food and I recommend it to all. 

Will be back for sure! Yum.
author: Shivani B.

description:
Food isn't good and drinks are very expansive.
Place is ok although it smells like fried food. service is ok.
author: Benjamin P.

description: Solid breakfast joint. Large portions and a nice homey atmosphere. We got the Salmon Rotolone Tartine, Harvest time and the Lemon Soufflé pancakes. The crispy potatoes are addicting! The Salmon Rotolone had a healthy portion of lox and the eggs were very fluffy. The aioli was slightly overpowering so I would get it on the side next time. The Harvest time was also tasty. I love pesto and the vegetables were cooked well, not mushy. I wasn't too crazy about the Lemon Soufflé pancakes. I didn't really taste the lemon flavor. But overall good experience. I also love the Van Gogh pieces of art on the wall.
author: Vivian C.

description: Very good crab shrimp benedict! I visited around 10:30a on a weekday which seem to be right before the rush. Staff was very friendly and efficient. My potatoes were great and crispy. The star of the show was the dill Hollandaise which complimented the fish extremely well without being overly dill. Would come back!
author: Andrew A.

description: Went there around 11 for breakfast and it was delicious! My friend and I had the French toast, dirty chai, and a breakfast sandwich. They are a busy little place and a bit pricy, but so good! I would definitely go back.
author: Kelsey Z.

description:
What a wonderful brunch experience!
I came here with my friends from LA and they absolutely loved this place! 

Atmosphere // Came here on a Sunday morning and it was a sunny day. The atmosphere was pleasant and the wait wasn't too bad for a party of 3. 

Food // The food was sooo good! Price is pretty average for SF. 

- 6 hours corned beef // Delicious! The egg on top of the perfectly meat was mouthwatering and the potatoes really hit the spot 

-I also got the red velvet latte // I dont think I was a fan since it was kind of sweet, but if you like red velvet, this one may be worth the shot. 

Overall// I plan on coming back! It's kind of on the other side of town but I think it's worth the drive over for this place!
author: Emily T.

description: Benedicks are great, pancakes were tasty. Lemon riccota pancakes are actually really nice and light!
author: Jana B.

description:
My original 5 star review for this place got overwritten for some reason.

Disappointing brunch experience today.
Service and food quality went down hill. No longer do they serve the crispy sheets of hash browns, they serve home fries instead now.

Servers literally only come peek at your table to see how far along you are with your meal. They do it quite often and never once bother to talk to you unless you flag them down. They don't bother to play it off or ask you "How's everything going?" They don't smile and look like everything inconveniences them. My brother ordered an iced tea and it never came so we had to remind them and by that time, our food already came.

Yes, their food is pretty good but we started coming here since they've opened and the last few times have been good but during our last visit,  we've noticed the food quality went down. They started cheaping out on ingredients even though they've raised their prices. I ordered a side of toast because I didn't want my tortilla and it was $3.50!!!! Seriously for 2 slices of bread and some butter? 

To put the cherry on top, they forgot our bill... I'm literally sitting here writing this review right now waiting for the bill. To get a better sense of how long it took. I started writing this review on my IPhone before we were able to flag a server down, finally flagged one down, she cleared the table, we waited...we finished our water, we waited a lot more...and then they finally came back with the bill. They didn't come back to pick up our card so my brother had to run in to give it to them.

Ridiculous. There's more brunch places in SF. Won't be coming back because the attitude, the wait and the food quality is not worth the money and time. Sucks because I always recommend people visiting the city to this place for brunch...
author: Kelly L.

description:
If you come here on a Sunday, expect a long wait. I waited at least 30 minutes to be seated but it seemed it have died down around noon. 

There were too many waiters coming back and forth. We had 3 different people ask us the same questions over and over, if we ordered or food, what we wanted, it got quite annoying after a while. We expect one person to wait us, not 3. 

I asked the waiter what assorted fruits I'd be getting with my lemon pancakes and she said strawberries, blueberries and raspberries. I was excited, all my favorite fruits. When the plate arrived, there were only strawberries and a small sad looking blueberry. 

The pancakes were great. The orange juice was very watered down... no one likes a watered down orange juice for brunch.
author: Ami S.

description:
My my, oh my. Brunch at Mymy....

It's easy to get too used to the bajillion fancy brunch places of SF, when non-millionaire's bacon is boring, when Benedict runny egg yolk pops are becoming too commonplace on Instagram, when you become weary of the standard hour-long wait. But despite four years of hard-core brunching in SF, I was impressed by Mymy and left with the same starry-eyed happiness. 

Mymy features brunch staples, with a bouge upgrade--think 6-hour corned beef hash, custardy French toast, pancakes with caramelized bananas, a salivation-inducing side of a sheet of hash browns. They also make fresh grapefruit juice or orange juice mimosas. Prices are reasonable (~$15), and we got away with sharing three entrees for four people and still ended up taking potatoes to-go (best breakfast leftovers ever). 

(+++) Lemon dill crab cake Benedict: Not that you can go wrong with crab cakes... but Mymy's version is excellent, with fresh crab surrounded by a crispy panko coating and topped with an herbal housemade lemon dill Hollandaise. The contrasting dimensions and complementary flavors are on point, not too dry or soggy, not too rich and overall excellent.

(++) Salmon rotolone tartine: Smoked salmon with *avocado!* and soft scrambled eggs over a slab of bread. At first glance it almost looks like yet another pricey toast, but it comes together really well as a delicious and satisfying entree. The bread is artisan bakery-grade, with a rustic chewy crust and a soft fluffy interior that tastes like sourdough--the perfect vehicle for lox/eggs/avo and a drizzle of the yummy dill sauce.

(+++) Blueberry banana souffle pancakes: It has the same wow factor as the souffle pancakes from Griddle Fresh in Noe Valley, with a magically fluffy texture and an impressive layer of meringue in the middle. How I can go back to non-souffle pancakes, I do not know. The blueberry banana sauce was delicious, fruity but not too sweet, and the presentation with the blue and yellow swirls is beautiful with latte-art-like design. It also comes with syrup, which is also great quality but isn't needed, but of course I poured it over my pancakes for the Instagram.

The ambiance is cozy, and Mymy feels like a niche of a family-run local business on the edge of Downtown SF (which I particularly appreciate, given gentrification and the somewhat gilded vibes of shiny new brunch places.)

As with all popular brunch places in SF, I highly recommend coming on weekdays if possible, or early on weekends. Otherwise, be prepared for a grueling long wait and the need to fight over street parking (metered and non-metered nearby). At the end of the day though, it's all worth it and you will leave with a very happy stomach (and Instagram).
author: Edna C.

description:
A few of my friends and I were in town for a wedding and wanted to grab a great brunch before the festivities began on Friday. The restaurant does not take reservations and a hostess does not put your name on a list. You simply wait in line on the sidewalk. Yes, you heard me correctly. You wait in line for your table. At first I was a little thrown off, but we were second in line and it moved pretty quickly, especially since we had 6 in our party.

We were seated at a table outside. It took about 10 minutes to be asked for our drink order and of course by then we were ready to order food as well. The group started with a mimosa carafe ($18) with grape fruit juice. I'm more into that tomato juice AM vibe so I grabbed one of their Bloody Mary's made with soju ($9). I didn't try the mimosa (you can't mess one of those up anyways) but my Bloody Mary was fresh, spicy and had the perfect amount of garnishes. 

It was almost 1 PM, and although I almost never turn down breakfast, the Blackberry Grilled Shrimp Salad (garlicky grilled shrimp, spinach, arugula, greens, chopped avocado, toasted almonds, blackberry and cabernet sauvignon dressing - $14) caught my eye. It was unreal! I can't wait to return and try one of their famous benedicts. Mymy was all around a great experience with affordable delicious dishes, tasty brunch cocktails and friendly service.
author: Mary-Lauren S.

description:
Came here on a sunny Sunday afternoon and surprisingly the wait was only 20 minutes for 2 people. Not bad at all compared to the other fancy brunch places where you have to wait 2 hours+. 

Ordered the popular Dill Crab & Shrimp Cake Benedict with a side of potatoes and it was DELICIOUS! I usually don't care for potatoes but the ones here are cooked extra crispy and has a nice crunch to it! The Benedict itself was also really tasty and I can see why it's one of their signature dishes. The green hollandaise sauce is amazing!

We also ordered a jug of the Orange Juice & Grapefruit Mimosas for $19, which was equivalent to 5 glasses total. It's worth ordering this instead since one glass here is already $8! Just a tip!
author: MyTien P.

description: This place is delicious.  We ordered the TexMex and homemade crab cake benedict, the flavors from both dishes were incredible. The coffee fantastic.  They have few tables outside that are great for breakfast.  Cheers - Brady Bunte
author: Brady B.

description:
I was originally heading to a coffee shop next door, but stumbled upon Mymy and am so glad that I did! It's located on the corner, and has inside and outside seating with a charming friendly neighborhood atmosphere. There is no waiting list, but the queue outside goes fast. You can't be seated until your whole party arrives, but when they do, make sure to let the hostess know so that you can get priority.

We got the Frisco scramble, which came with two slices of toast, scrambled eggs with cheddar and apple sausage, and potatoes. Their potatoes were nice and crisp on the outside, but rather greasy. Their Lemon Souffle pancakes are worth getting - fluffy pancakes with an impressive meringue filling when you cut into it. Freshly cut strawberries and butter/syrup are on the side. This was so much better than a lemon meringue pie.

The matcha latte and pistachio lattes were delicious and worth getting as well. Next time, it would be great to try one of their mimosas with freshly squeezed juice or one of their creative eggs benedict.
author: Lily C.

description:
Mymy was the best restaurant decision I've made while visiting SF.

Food is SOLID and they just happen to have all of my favorite things. 
I came here on a weekday for breakfast right as they open at 8am.

The service was efficient and speedy-I was seated right away and able to order as soon as I reviewed the menu.

I ordered the pistachio latte (MAJOR treat for latte and pistachio lovers), the brioche french toast and the chorizo jalepeno tartine. Yes I went all out!  I loved the chorizo---hard to find good chorizo in NY so this was definitely a treat. The sauce and flavor was superb. Another highlight of this dish was the PERFECTLY crisped potatoes. Most places don't get this right, however MyMy nailed it! 

Overall, I give this experience a 5 because it doesn't get much better than this for breakfast. The food and service stands out here---not a place for people looking for a brunch vibe or fancy decor.
author: Whitney L.

description:
I stopped by for brunch at Mymy on Labor Day and waited about an hour for our party of six to be seated... surprisingly quick for SF brunch standards and for a party that large. We were seated outside along the sidewalk (thank goodness because it was pretty hot inside). Started off with a carafe of orange mimosa which had a generous amount of champagne. We all ordered our own dish but we sampled each others:

[1] 6hr Corned Beef Hash - smart to advertise the 6hr corned beef hash because it sure caught my eye. Housemade corned beef brisket with onion, bell pepper, lemon dill, topped with two poached eggs and served with house potatoes. Delicious dish, the corned beef was perfect. 

[2] Parma Flavor Benedict - prosciutto, fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, grilled asparagus, topped with chive hollandaise and two poached eggs served on wheat bread. Very fresh and flavorful benedict with the mozzarella and tomatoes. Both of my friends really enjoyed this dish and it seems to be one of the more popular items on the menu. 

[3] Custardy pain de mie French Toast - just as it sounds it was sweet, creamy, and delicious. Served with seasonal fruit. 

Overall the service was great, food was good, and the wait wasn't too terrible. Parking can be tough in this area but not impossible.
author: Elaine N.

description:
If you're looking for a good brunch place nearby, you definitely should stop by Mymy. I had the Lemon Dill Crab Shrimp Cake Benedict and it was BOMB!!!!

I've had crab cake benedicts at other places but this one definitely takes the top :) The lemon dill hollandaise not only gave that good color diversity for that insta story post, but it was a perfect complement to the crab and shrimp. And the crab cake a work of perfection and the fried potatoes on the side were amazing! I loved how the potatoes had the right amount of crispy. When I saw the dish, I was honestly just as excited to eat the potatoes as I was for the crab cakes.

My girlfriend and I sat outside and it was cool watching the trolley cars pass by on the hilly roads. So I guess you can say there is a strong SF presence in the ambiance of this place. 

The only downside to my brunch experience was the Norwegian Benedict. It was good, but the salmon was a little salty for my taste.
author: Jovin K.

description:
A solid neighborhood spot for brunch. Portions, quality, and prices are all quite decent here, whether the benedict dishes, pancakes, or other dishes like tartines or beef hash. It might all not be the most mind-blowing brunch ever, but it's certainly delightful enough and gets the job done.

Service is reasonably fast and efficient, and the space manages to pack in a reasonable amount of people despite being rather compact. There can be some monster waits here on weekend mornings, so if you're here earlier, the better. Not a bad choice to have if you already live in the area or are close by.
author: Vincent L.

description: The eggs were poached perfectly on my Parm Benedict. The flavor was wonderful. I was also happy that they offered me a side of avocado when I let them know I couldn't have the potatoes or  fruit. Come early to avoid the lines.
author: Paula Z.

description: Came here on a Sunday morning around 9am. There were no tables available for inside dining however, they had outside tables ready. We were hesitant to sit outside since it was a chilly, cloudy morning but there were heaters over the table which kept us warm while we ate. I ordered spicy pop pulled pork scramble. I ate every bite. The menu said the salsa verde would be spicy but it was mild in my opinion, delicious nonetheless. Even though we were seated outside, the wait staff continued to check in on us, seeing if we needed anything and ensure that we were satisfied. Cool place.
author: Bianca S.

description:
I had a strong craving for a sweet French toast or something similar and thought photos of the soufflé pancakes looked amazing so off to brunch we went.

Luckily we got a table immediately; a few minutes after we were seated a line started growing. The restaurant is pretty small with only a few tables outside so I can imagine there's usually a wait here. Also there's no waitlist so you just have to stick around in line until a table frees up.

We ordered the Banana Soufflé Pancakes and the Salmon Rotolone Tartine. I was most excited about the pancakes but unfortunately they were our least favorite of the two. The merginue described on the menu was cooked into the pancakes and had this odd texture and flavor - think a layer of thinned egg whites in your pancakes. The banana part was also lacking - just two small halves of lightly cooked banana.

The Salmon Rotolone Tartine on the other hand was fantastic. It looks unassuming and the bread seemed to thin by the looks of it but the lox + soft scrambled eggs underneath + avocado = amazing. The side of crispy potatoes were nicely crisped too.

Service was good, but I'd stick with the Salmon Rotolone Tartine and maybe try the Challah French Toast.
author: Lindsey C.

description:
Fluffy pancakes is the way to describe this place. It is an Asian owned diner that serves up some excellent brunch. Fluffy pancake and great choices toast are this places speciality.

Their potatoes are excellent, that with the pancakes are the best thing at the place. Usually there is a line, but if you have a late lunch the line is often shirt. Service is quick and prompt and they will get you in and out in less then an hour after you sit down if you don't have to wait in line too long.

I still haven't found a place that does souffle pancakes here in the States, but this is quite good would definitely come back here again.
author: Duncan H.

description:
I used to love this place, but it has changed. 

The food was ok and the service poor. I ordered the BLT Benedict. The eggs were cooked perfectly, however the potatoes were not really crispy, as ordered.  Let me be clear, a well-poached egg does not make-up for the rest of the poorly cooked meal nor the insultingly terrible service.

Plus, they no longer have hash browns. Yes, no more hash browns. They stated that the vendor stopped providing them and they were unable to find another good vendor. Seriously?  

Also, I had to ask for a coffee refill -- more like beg. And, when I did finally get someone's attention, he tried to force me to take it to go, with open tables and no line. 

I think over $20 bucks for mediocre food and terrible service, at a minimum, paid for the little time spent at the table. So, please don't try to push me out the door with a to-go cup of coffee because you never freshened it up, refilled it, nor even stopped by my table the entire meal.
author: Kiki I.

description: This is the worst place on san francisco, the service is horrible, they treat costumers with no respect. The food takes forever and takes forever to be seated. NOT RECOMMENDED
author: Lisandy A.

description: My my!  This place is amazing for breakfast. Known for their egg benedicts, but chose the Harvest Scramble and it didn't disappoint. Their Yukon potatoes are probably the best I've ever had! Also, the Pistachio Latte is unique, creamy, and delicious!
author: Paul T.

description:
One of SF's popular spots for breakfast and brunch - make sure to plan your visit and check out the wait times on Google Maps.

The space is small, but the portions are generous. Our table enjoyed the Banana Pancakes and a range of Egg Benedict variations. You can't really go wrong here with anything, just make sure to come hungry!

Food comes out fast, and prices are in the medium range.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
This place is bustling with a ravenous crowd and the number of positive reviews convinced me to visit to try their brunch. I was definitely intrigued by the highly acclaimed lemon ricotta soufflé pancakes! Unfortunately, I left the restaurant heartbroken. 

These pancakes were unpleasantly dry and dense. My husband agreed after tasting them himself. Inside of them, strangely, was a flavorless mass of cooked egg whites. The odd texture was just plain unappetizing. I read in another yelp review that one of the servers explained that this is how a soufflé pancake is supposed to be like. Doesn't appear or taste normal to me. Also, isn't the addition of ricotta supposed to add moisture for moist and fluffy pancakes? 

My husband and another one of our table mates were also unimpressed by the dishes that they ordered. 

The one positive of my experience was the divine pistachio latte that I ordered--it had an elegantly distinct pistachio flavor. I recommend ordering one! 

Ultimately, I can say, with conviction, that we've had better brunch.
author: Merica S.

description:
Not a lot to say about MyMy other than "amazing." I went here with a group of 6 people on a Saturday around 1 pm, and we were able to get in without a wait or reservation--Everyone in the group got different things on the menu and everyone's food looked and tasted amazing. 

If you like pancakes, French toast, ect. they have a large selection and also, some of the best banana pancakes in the city. 

They also have an amazing and vast selection of tartines (Basically a thick toast with various toppings, think avocado toast.) with everything from Salmon to Brussels sprouts on top. 

A quick note about booze, because I myself barely ever go to brunch without it--MyMy does serve alcohol, but does not have a full liquor license, so they only serve beer/wine/champagne/sake. Their Bloody Mary is actually made with sake instead of vodka, but I was into it. 

While they don't serve bottomless mimosas, they do have large pitchers of orange juice or grapefruit juice mimosas, which make drinking with a large group more economical. 

The restaurant itself is pretty small, but if you can snag an outside table on a nice day, MyMys feels like the perfect brunch spot.
author: Liz S.

description: This place is a gem in San Francisco's pacific heights area.  The service was friendly and somewhat the kind you expect from a diner.  The breakfast was memorable and unique but delish and oh so bomb.  Banana soufflé pancakes?!! Do try! And they had a salmon avocado omelette thing that was sautéed with cute little gourmet mushroom.  I recommend this place for the price being reasonable and the food delectable.
author: G ..

description:
Hands down the best breakfast I've had in a long time. Shrimp and longanisa cheddar grits with Brussels sprouts, pico de gallo, two poached eggs and blistered shishito peppers... who thinks of such a delicious plate??

Also* 

I was served a latte within three minutes of ordering it, and then was served my meal maybe five minutes later (despite the restaurant being 100% full)
author: Yasu T.

description: Change my review from four to five stars. The pancakes and pretty much everything on the menu is delicious. The shrimp grits were phenomenal. The food is as good as ever. The change in ratings was because of their super wonderful service. Went with a friend whom I haven't met for years and there was much to catch up on. Even as the restaurant was busy and forming a line, they never rushed us by handing us a bill. They very gently reduced the frequently of refilling our coffees and let us know in more gentle, subtle ways that it would be nice if our seats could become available for those waiting and ready to eat.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Absolutely delicious brunch place with amazing benedicts and fluffy, light pancakes! This place probably gets crowded during the weekends, but I came around 12PM on a weekday, and there wasn't any wait at all, although it was quite crowded still. 

AMBIANCE:
Some chill, jazzy, bossanova-like music playing in the background. It's a rather small place, but there's seating both inside and outside. Waiters/tresses are all very friendly. 

FOOD: 
1) Smoked Salmon Benedict - Two poached eggs with delicious smoked salmon, wilted spinach, and capers on a slice of fine bread with some crispy potatoes on the side. The flavors went so well together, and definitely a good portion for the Benedict. I'm typically quite picky about my potatoes, and though these potatoes weren't the best I've had, I enjoyed that they had a crispy exterior. 
2) Lemon Ricotta Soufflé Pancake - Highlight of my meal! I've never had pancake like this, though I know quite a few places in SF serve this kind of pancake. It came with two fluffy pancakes with a glob of butter and seasonal fruits (berries in this case). The pancakes were so fluffy, and the middle was very fluffy, very much like a soufflé, but also therefore not a lot of flavor. However, the surrounding part had a good amount of lemon flavor.
author: Jacqueline T.

description: Delicious! We waited in line for maybe 20 minutes for a table for 2, but it was worth it! It's a good sign when you can't decide what to order from the menu. I went with the Tex Mex Egg Scramble and it did not disappoint! Just the right amount of flavor, heat, simple pico, and avocado. The potato home fries were great too! The amount of food was quite generous. I can't wait to come back and try something else!
author: Katie R.

description:
I really wanted to love MyMy based upon previous reviews. However, I was slightly disappointed. To begin, the place is cute inside and was quite busy at 9am on a Thursday. I was seated immediately and ordered my entree. It was brought to me within about 5 minutes, which I found to be very quick. This always makes me think that the food has been sitting out and not being prepared fresh. I ordered the Frisco scramble with egg whites. The scramble came with a side of potatoes and toast. 

The reason I am giving this restaurant 3 stars is because my food was quite cold when it was brought to me. The potatoes were also room temperature and it was apparent that they had been sitting out for quite some time. The egg whites in my scramble were also a bit runny.

When I received my breakfast, I was so excited because it looked quite great! However, the freshness seemed to be lacking as well as the temperature of the meal. 

Overall, I can see how this place has earned 4 stars. It is quite popular and inviting. However, I think I would try a different breakfast place the next time I visit San Francisco.
author: Colleen B.

description: Yummy this was our first breakfast while visiting San Fran. We were not disappointed in any way everything on our plate was so good. My husband had the crab cake eggs Florentine. I had the zucchini ricotta pancakes with scrambled eggs, potatoes toast and bacon. I'm a picky eater and asked to exchange the pancakes for banana pancakes no luck. Very happy they didn't because they were so very good. The juice is fresh as with most restaurants in the area. Waited about 45 mins to be seated but very happy to do so after the delicious food.
author: Olivia M.

description:
Food was amazing. I ordered a pancake dish and it was amazing. The mimosas were pretty awesome too. The place is small but has a nice charm. 

The staff were very friendly. The only complaint I have is the wait. And that isn't even a big deal as I was only in line for 30 minutes and a line means it is good food. 

This is so far one of my favorite brunch places in San Francisco
author: Jason S.

description: My wife and I had breakfast here every morning from Monday to Friday during our recent work related visit to San Francisco. Mymy was very handy to our hotel so we could walk here in a few minutes.The service we received from our server Beach was first class and lots of fun. Every morning we tried something different on the menu and we were never disappointed.They serve you quick and get the meals to your table very fast.The cafe has a very cosy atmosphere inside and all the staff are very friendly.We enjoyed ourselves very much.
author: Michael B.

description: This is in a really cute spot and they have really good service. The food is really good but every time my boyfriend and I go we get SUPER sick. I'd recommend it If you don't have to do anything afterwards or if you have a strong stomach. Otherwise hard pass!
author: Anne P.

description:
After looking at the gorgeous hash browns pics I decided to go to Mymy. The wait for 2 people wasnt too bad and the waiter was very accommodating.

As I was about to finish my order, my waiter said: "we no longer serve hash browns". Damn, well I guess I'll just have the home fries with my crab & shrimp cakes benedict. Other than the fact that they no longer serve hash browns, the food was great.

I would come back and I would love to update my review if I could get some hash browns next time :)
author: Josh Giosue D.

description: AMAZING BRUNCHHH. If you want a fulfilling yet delicious brunch come here- mimosas are really yummy too. Can't go wrong just so freaking amazing all around
author: Hannah P.

description:
No more crispy hash browns :( 

Today was my 9th time at MyMy (!!!!!) and the food has been consistently amazing every single time. 

There are 34 seats inside the restaurant, and you can sit outside during the non-winter time in SF (almost all year long). You stand in a line to wait (there used to be sign ups, but I guess having a line of people standing outside the restaurant is neater). Contraband coffee (super great) is around the corner, so feel free to grab a cup while waiting. 

TIP: on the weekend, come before 9 am to avoid a wait. You'll get your seats faster with a smaller group (2 is ideal, but 4 is okay too). 

Pancakes - I've tried them all. Banana soufflé, lemon ricotta, zucchini, chives, every single one is an excellent choice. You'll def get full! They recently added a French toast (I guess to compete with Olea because Olea has bomb French toast). 

MOT burger is always a great choice, so is the crab cake eggs Benedict. The Tex Mex hash is scrumptious too. 

So yes, come to MyMy. If you find the line intimidating, Olea across the street is good too! Very different style tho. 

After brunch you can walk down Polk Street to Russian Hill and do some shopping, get some coffee, eat more!
author: Dana Z.

description: This neighborhood restaurant has a very trendy atmosphere.  This is a smaller cafe, so it can get crowded. I had the Eggs Benedict, which was amazing; it came with potatoes and had an orange slice on the slide for garnish. The orange juice was the best I have ever had. The service was great. Id definitely go back.
author: Steve P.

description:
Summary: try any of the scrambles: my pick would be TexMex.  Also get the banana souffle pancakes. Drink options: pistachio latte & bloody mary.

This has been my go to place in the city.  Every few months they also come up with new dishes for everyone to try as well. 

I love their scrambles.  They change the specific selection. However my recent fav has been the TexMex.  All scrambled eggs are so fluffy and the potatoes add a nice touch.  The mix of flavors do really well.  Their tartines are generally pretty good.  You have to eat it with the bread on the bottom.  This adds to the full dish's experience.  

A sweet alternative for brunch would be their banana soufflé pancakes. It's not too sweet to overwhelm you.  However it's an additction for my taste buds.  They are so fluffy and melts in your mouth.  I'm generally not a sweet person, but I still like it.  

On to drink choices.  I like their special coffee drinks.  My pick is the pistachio latte. You can really taste the pistachio in the drink.  Like any other gourmet latte, it's great coffee with a cute design on top as well.  I also like their soju Bloody Mary.  I probably still think Mama's on Washington Square Bloody Mary is better, but Mymy's is still good.  Mymy's is less hearty, so you can still have room for their scrambles & fluffy pancakes.
author: Shirley C.

description:
Simply impressive, takes time to seat groups of more than two but it's totally worth the wait. 

Love the simplicity of their menu, the have amazing coffee and celestial mimosas. I have no hesitation recommending it highly. Even tho you may have to wait. Salmon dishes are a MUST!!
author: David K.

description: This place was close to our hotel. I was looking for a good Salmon Benedict and this was what came up on Yelp. The reviews were really good so we expected to have a really nice breakfast. The line was out the door, which is always a good sign. The Norwegian Benedict I ordered was the worst I've had. Firstly they cheap out by serving the dish on wheat bread slices instead of an English muffin. The hollandaise was bland and tasted like it had been microwaved. The salmon was too salty and dry. I didn't even finish my meal. My partner did not enjoy her meal either. We will not be coming back.
author: Stephen W.

description:
Amazing pancakes & tasty breakfast potatoes. However, they no longer serve hashbrowns in their menu because their vendor stopped supplying them.
So if you are like me and my friend who came here with high anticipation for the crispy and beautiful hashbrowns from the Yelp pictures, do not get your hopes up. 
Also, parking is definitely difficult to find.
author: Mariah D.

description:
Popular spot for food coma inducing brunch food at very reasonable prices for SF! I visited Mymy again for the second time and had a pretty great experience. 

Interestingly enough, Mymy is one of my many favorite brunch places run by Asian management. I'm surprised I haven't heard about this place more, as I only heard about it from one friend. You can identify this place pretty well by spotting the long lines outside of the storefront near Polk Street.

Be prepared to wait, or come early! I came around 10 AM the first time and waited probably 10-15 minutes to seat a group of 4. This time around, I came around 9 and to my surprise the place looked busier than usual - but that makes sense given the day I went was Father's Day. The staff will get a headcount of everyone's groups and arrange seating accordingly. I would say that groups typically range between 2-4 people as the restaurant is quite small. There is outdoor seating as well. The waiters here are visibly very busy and rushed, so props to them for managing this place well!

The menu consists of your standard brunch dishes such as scrambles, omelettes, pancakes etc. Entrees will run you about $13-15 which I consider a great value. Generally in my experience, the food has been very plentiful and filling! 

Frisco Scramble - Chicken apple sausage, leeks, shallot, tomato, avocado, cheddar. Comes with a side of potatoes and whole wheat toast. I was curious to try the chicken apple sausage and it did not disappoint. The scramble and potatoes were very flavorful overall and I happily took some home for leftovers! My main criticism is that the ratio of the scramble to potatoes seemed a bit off.. as there were a lot more potatoes to fill up the plate than expected. It also cost's $2 to replace potatoes with fruits which seems kind of unreasonable to me (wouldn't the potatoes take more effort..?)
author: Chelsea W.

description:
One of the top reviewed brunch places in SF and I finally had time to check this place out with a group of friends. 

The first view that greets us is a line outside. There's no clipboard to put your name down. You must wait in line in the order you came in a first come first served basis or risk losing your spot in line. Coming on Saturday for brunch actually wasn't a bad wait and we got seated in 20-30 min. 

Overall, the service was great, the waitresses were nice and very attentive and our food came out rather quickly. In terms of quality of the food: the pictures of the lemon pancakes were deceivingly thinner than what I had seen in pictures but delicious nonetheless. Their Benedict's were all terrific and I had heard great things about their crispy potatoes (comes with all dishes) and was not disappointed! 

Overall I would come back but there's so many more places to try!
author: Alan C.

description: Everything was so good!! Make sure to get the crab cakes and French toast! Line went by quick and service was really quick.
author: Donna K.

description:
Time: 8am on Memorial Day
What: Breakfast with my stepdad
Where: Mymy

Wow, it was so good. This may be the best brunch place I've been to in SF. And the prices seem so reasonable! We got there a few minutes after opening and were seated right away. My Lemon Dill Shrimp Crab Eggs Benedict tasted as good as they sound. I've been on an eggs benedict kick recently and these were top notch. The eggs were poached perfectly with just the right amount of runny yolk. I loved them. I also ate almost all of the potatoes too; the seasoning was addicting.

We decided we will have to make a repeat visit soon. Every plate that was brought out looked incredibly delicious.
author: Yi Z.

description: Overpriced for the quality. Tried several times to see why is the line so long for eggs
author: Oscar C.

description: Cute brunch place with great food! The lemon dill crab cake benedict is a classic here. The lemon dill sauce is unexpected but refreshing. I also enjoyed the norwegian benedict, which was less heavy. Don't forget to try the potatoes, they're amazing!
author: Janet C.

description:
This is a really good neighborhood brunch place if the wait was not so long! The ambience is more diner-style and cozy than hip. 
We tried the crab cake benedict, parma ham benedict, salmon tartine and the challah toast. I think the crab cake benedict is a must-try for first timers. The crab cake is nicely seasoned, and the lemon dill sauce goes well with the crab flavor! But once you have tried it, go for the salmon tartine on your next visit/make your friend get it so you can share! It's less heavy compared to the other options, and is perfectly creamy and dreamy with so much avocado. 

The potatoes on the side are perfectly crisped up. Regular potatoes in comparison to sweet maple's herb-tossed blend.
author: Julia C.

description: The place looks food but the food is average! I asked the waitress for the most recommended dish (usually it works for me) but this time I got the Mexican omelet and the dish was small and didn't taste well. Everything was extra (including the bread). Would not go again!
author: Amit F.

description: Excellent place for breakfast, they're quick to seat you(whether you want it inside or outdoor dining). Nice ambience, the pistachio latte is to die for! Will be going back here again should I ever find myself at the city in the morning!
author: Seth P. B.

description:
Came here on a trip, we had a late night and wanted a delicious breakfast. My friend was seeking an eggs Benedict and this place is apparently king of eggs Benedict. We walked over and there was a line about 15 people deep. I'm usually not one to wait, but we decided we walked all the way over, we should wait.
I ordered a sandwich, which I didn't eat because it has sesame on the bun ... I'm allergic and the waitstaff told me they didn't have any bread without sesame which is So strange... because the eggs Benedict didn't have any on it.. but who's going to argue? 
My friend loved his BLT Benedict, he ate the whole thing.. and it was a big one. 
The grapefruit mimosa was awesome, I was a fan! I would come back but not sure what I would order to eat!
author: Jessica W.

description: I give this place 3.5 stars...I didn't have to wait In line for a long time or anything so my expectations weren't super high, but I definitely expected more than what I got. I just wasn't blown away by it. Food was solid, but I wouldn't go back. There just wasn't anything super special about what I ordered.
author: Jenna B.

description:
God this is my absolute favorite brunch in all of SF. The crab cake lemon dill benedict. Honestly, all of a SF brunch places are extremely overpriced but this place I would wait for. 

Ordering + service: Of course the wait is long, probably an hour or more. It's not the largest brunch places, but some added outdoor seating makes it medium sized. The servers aren't the nicest but they are far from unsatisfactory. 

FOOD: I've been here several times. The first few times they accompanied these flat hash browns but this time they served us crispy potatoes. Not that I'm complaining because I prefer crispy ones. But if you're looking for that hash brown, it ain't there right now. 

- Challah Bread French Toast (4.5/5): It was pretty damn good. I struggle with finding sweet brunch that is over indulgent and makes me go into sugar overload. But I think that the strawberries, cream and bacon give you the left tart and savory, coupled to a not overly sweet challah toast. It was above average, you can't go wrong with ordering this. 

- Salmon Tartine (5/5): I love smoked salmon and this was really amazing, paired with a perfectly cut hipster avocado. The egg omelette was soft and supple and the picked red onion added a kick that upped the dish even more. 

- Parma flavor benedict (4/5): It was an above average, perfectly poached egg, great flavor combo benedict. We needed a savory that didn't have lemon dill sauce, so we tried this. And it was pretty god with fresh tomato, mozzarella, and nicely stringy prosciutto (because you know how prosciutto is odd like that). 

- Lemon dill crab cake benedict (5/5)!!!: Can I say 6/5? It was perfect with the dill sauce. The spinach was perfect. I don't know how to describe. It's simply my favorite brunch in ALL OF SF. Not to over hype it... just order it, with semi high expectations. 

I love mymy's. It's a place I would wait in line for all the time. And pay for it all.
author: Kimberly Y.

description: Saturday brunch with friends and dog.  PERFECT.  Great seating outside and dog friendly.  I had the bloody mary made with not vodka, because no liquor license, but had Saki, I think.  Anyway, it was the best - so good, large is size with plenty of lemon, olives, celery and so good.  We all did egg dishes and they were all great.  Large portions, good prices and you wait on line but not that long, or didn't seem very long, maybe 20 minutes at noon on a Saturday.  The service was very nice and greatly accommodating, it's nice when someone comes to check to see if all is good.  And they were super attentive to our canine companion, which was really nice.  I really enjoyed this place and have to say all the food was fresh, hot and nicely presented.  My benedict had the perfect amount of hollandise sauce which I appreciate.  You don't want too much and you don't want too little. Thanks Mymy for such a fun brunch.
author: Lauren A P.

description:
Was on a outing with 3 childhood friends, We went to sweet maples first, the line was way to long. Two of the four of us had been, last time there, a young lady told me about My My, it took a few years for me to try it, However a wonderful blessing. The fournof us had the most amazing breakfast on a sundaymorning. The wait was about 20 minutes, and well worth it.  We shared, the Challeh french toast, baja california, and harvest time with avocado, 
the potatoes crisp on out side, potato in middle, not heavy, food was fresh, well prepared, nice portions, reasonable cost, and momosa. Will go back!
author: Lynne J.

description:
Finally got the chance to try this brunch spot today and I have to say this place is now officially on my list of favorite brunch spots! I went here around 12:28pm on a Sunday and we waited for less than 15mins for 2 people. That was a plus because usually brunch spots take around 1 hour wait before we get seated.


Norwegian Egg Benedict:
- The smoked salmon was so delicious that it melts in your mouth. They used sourdough bread which was a great choice with the egg Benedict and smoked salmon.

Lemon Dill Shrimp Crab Cake:
