- This dish was so delicious, it was the first time I ever tried a crab cake. The cake was so crispy and flavorful. The sauce that was used for this dish was so good, better than other egg Benedict's sauce to be honest. 

Overall it's a great brunch spot, and I'm glad I got the opportunity to try it out. I also loved the fact that they serve crispy potatoes instead of hash brown now with the egg Benedict because I personally am not a fan of hash browns. Definitely coming back again in the future and recommended to come try!
author: Christopher G.

description: Really great place some friends recommanded to us ! We had Benedict eggs for the first time ever and it was amazing ! We didn't find another place where it was as good for the rest of our stay in SF.
author: Maëlle W.

description: Parking is a little hard around this area, but I am so glad my friend recommended this place for brunch. Obviously the line for a table was upsetting, but for a Wednesday afternoon, we only waited half an hour in line before we were finally seated. Inside can be a little cramped, but the food was amazing! I ordered the blackberry grilled shrimp salad, which was perfect, because I wanted to order something on the lighter side. The shrimp was grilled to garlicky perfection, and the sweet champagne vinaigrette was just enough to balance the savoriness of the dish. I'd come back again, though I would get there earlier, so I could avoid the line.
author: Connie X.

description: I had been wanting to check out mymy for a long time but the wait always drove me away. I finally woke up early on a Sunday and decided to check it out since I didn't think there'd be a line that early. I was wrong but the wait was only 20-25 minutes, not too bad. Aside from the constant line on weekends, this place is pretty deserving of the wait. The food is good and the portions are generous. We got the French toast, Mexican scramble, and a matcha latte. Loved every item. If you have the time and patience to wait, you won't be disappointed.
author: Tanya C.

description:
Delicious--and everyone knows it. We were a bit frightened by the line but they let us jump the whole line when a small table for 2 opened up. So the secret is to come with your honey and not the whole family!
We each ordered a Benedict--both fabulous. And the potatoes are like candy. Presentation was lovely, not surprisingly given that the place is entirely staffed by young Thais with a great sense of courtesy and visual esthetics. 

Even if you are stuck in line well worth the wait.
author: Laura A.

description: Waited about 40 min for a table for 2 on Saturday at 10am, so pretty classic SF brunch lines. Both the sweet and savory options are great - I got a harvest scramble, which was pretty good, and my friend got the zucchini ricotta pancakes which were very good. Portion sizes are generous and everything is served with deliciously crisped potatoes so you'll definitely be quite full after! Would come again to try the other items on the menu, especially the French toast!
author: Hali M.

description:
Mark my words. THE best brunch spot in SF. I've been to nearly every brunch spot in the city, and Mymy takes the cake!

I know, I know. There's a ton of these Asian fusion brunch spots in the city. What makes this one any more special than the rest? Well, let me tell you. Consistency and quality. 

Been coming here for years and the consistency and quality of their food hasn't changed one bit! The two dishes I always get are their crab shrimp benedict and lemon soufflé pancake. And the hash browns that come with the benedict!! Seriously, they're the best! Throw in the grapefruit mimosa or soju Bloody Mary, and you're good to go! It's 100% worth the wait. 

People in the city love waiting in lines. Everywhere. All over the city. It drives me insane. I'm definitely not the biggest fan of waiting - especially if it's going to take over an hour - but this is one place I will wait for. The line honestly looks longer and scarier than it is. Typically it'll take up to 25-30mins, depending on the size of your party. 

The service here is super efficient without being rude. The food comes out within 10mins or less. I've never left Mymy feeling disappointed. No one I've ever taken here has been disappointed. Mainly, we've all felt stuffed. 

5 stars!!
author: Jennifer L.

description: Okay. So first confession is that usually I don't like soft eggs. Actually, I only really like deviled eggs, but that is a topic for another day. We went here because when I am on vacation, I like to try new places that are not obvious, and I like to push myself. So based on the reviews, we came to Mymy, which was a .5 mile walk from our hotel. We were completely impressed. I highly doubt the place has more than 10 tables, but the service was so incredible. And, even though I don't like eggs, apparently their benedicts are really popular. I can see why. I had the lemon dill crabcake benedict and my husband had the baja california benedict. Both of us cleaned our plates. Mind you, we came at 8:30 on a Wednesday morning and this place was hopping. OH and I almost forgot.... the potatoes! Omg..  those potatoes were EVERYTHING! So, definitely go!
author: Courtney R.

description:
Mymy is one of my favorite brunch spots in the city. All the items featured are creative and full of flavor - I've especially Iiked the scrambles I've had there, with interesting ingredients I wouldn't think to put together but work really well.

There is almost always a line out front, but I've never found it too bad. There's also a little coffee shop around the corner to get some caffeine while you wait. 

Overall, Mymy is well worth the wait!
author: Holly L.

description:
Came here on a Monday around 10am and thankfully there was plenty of street parking outside! We got seated within 15 minutes. I'm super impatient when it comes to waiting so this was a plus! They don't have a waiting list; you have to physically be in line to save a spot. They also don't seat on a first come first serve basis. Instead they seat you based on the number of your party. The restaurant itself is pretty small and in a shape of an L. They have additional seating outside, but the cold San Francisco weather makes it almost unbearable. 

I ordered the frisco scramble and substituted the cheddar for pepper jack cheese. The tomatoes were too watery and made my whole omelet soggy, which I'm not really a fan of but overall it wasn't bad. They no longer serve their breakfast items with hash browns ): so sadddd but their crispy potatoes are pretty good! My brother got the Norwegian Benedict and really liked it. 

The service was great! Servers were really friendly and refilled our coffee multiple times. I'll be back another time to try their crab cake Benedict that I was eyeing from the table next to ours.
author: Nancy C.

description:
Brunch is about as important to me and my friends as the Superbowl is important to Tom Brady. Maybe even more important. We just love brunch THAT much. 

This place lived up to our brunch expectations!

First of all, the staff is efficient without being pushy. I cannot stand it when the staff makes you feel like you're in a hurry to order, eat and then get the heck out. They don't do that here! And better yet is that the food comes out within 10 minutes of you ordering. Um, AWESOME SAUCE.

Second, the food is DELICIOUS. Crab cake Benedict is the best I've ever had. My tastebuds did a happy dance as I enjoyed every bite and morsel of that dish. And the french toast? Can I get a HAIL MARY for the french toast?! I don't typically like sweet things for breakfast. I've always been more of a meat and eggs kind of gal, but the french toast can and probably has changed my mind and mouth forever. The potatoes.... oh LAWD. The potatoes are amazing. Perfectly crisp on the outside--just the way I like it.

Third, it's not crazy expensive. It's your typical brunch prices, but the quality is sooo much better than most places I've gone to in SF. 

So summary of this review:
1) Order anything.
2) Make sure you get a side of potatoes.
3) Consider coming back to try everything on the menu.
author: Tracy D.

description:
Came on a saturday morning and there was already a line at 9am! This place is super tiny inside which explains the wait. Luckily the wait was only 20 minutes for a table of 3 so definitely come early!

Service was okay. They are super busy and not the MOST attentive but nothing to complain about. Prices are also reasonable, definitely standard for a brunch place (about ~ 10 dollars a plate).

Food:
-Frisco Scramble - 5/5 - YUMMMM. Honestly one of the best scrambles I've had. They give a hefty amount of avocado which obviously makes everything 10x better. The hefty pieces of chicken sausage inside was DELICIOUS. and the potatoes at this place are BOMB. they're so crispy and seasoned perfectly. Also probably best potatoes I've ever had haha.
-Lemon Ricotta Pancakes-4/5- I really liked the concept of this pancake. There is fluffly lemon ricotta in between the pancake layers. the pancake itself is very thin so that the lemon ricotta can shine. I appreciated this a lot but I think I'm personally just not a huge fan of the ricotta? I would definitely at least TRY this if you're interested but I wouldn't order it again for my own personal tastes.

I really liked this cute quaint place and I would definitely recommend this brunch place to all my friends (ESPECIALLY THE POTATOES!!!)
author: Isabel L.

description: Yummy Asian inspired brunch spot. The chorizo jalapeño tartine is pretty good and so is the challa French toast. All big portions.
author: connie c.

description:
Stopped by at 2pm on a Saturday and didn't have to wait. Ordered french toast, it was bland and I was unimpressed. Maybe I should've ordered the pancakes. 

Our waitress tried to be polite, but I couldn't help but feel rushed. 

Overall, meh. Just meh.
author: Debbie M.

description:
Delicious out of control amazing Benedict's. They have about 6 options that all sound amazing so it was difficult to find one that I wanted. Good thing I went with a friend so we could split two options. 

The eggs were cooked perfectly. An difficult but necessary accomplishment to make a good Benny. 

Only issue was the bread was basically falling apart it was so soggy, but it was soggy with delicious flavor so t didn't cause too much trouble.

Overall a very fun diverse menus with lots of options for almost anyone to enjoy a great meal.
author: Michael S.

description: Simple but great! Nice cozy place with super sweet staff! The menu had a lot to desire but I chose to make my own scramble! Delicious! Must try in the city!
author: J Y.

description: Small but comfy spot. Bloody Mary with soju was on point. Banana souffle pancakes and the harvest scramble really hit the spot. Everything we had was maticulously good and the service was nice.
author: Irving P.

description:
There's a line but wait wasn't bad since we were okay to be seated at the counter. The food was amazing! I had the lemon souffle pancake and my friend ordered norwegian benedict. Can't go wrong with either. 

Will return to try something different on their menu.
author: Lillian r.

description: Best brunch place my fiancé & I have ever had!!! I absolutely recommend it! My fiancé ordered the Chorizo Jalapeño Tartine & I had the French Toast. He loved his plate so much we're going back Wednesday to have brunch here again before we head back home to Texas. The customer service was also really nice :)
author: Evelyn M.

description:
If you come here and you don't try the orange juice, you are simply a fool. That was the best glass of OJ I have had in my life. That was the best glass of juice I have had in my life. 

I highly recommend the Norwegian eggs Benedict. It came with such a large piece of salmon and it was so good that I thought it would swim away. Also the potatoes, omg the potatoes are just wonderful. I'm glad that they switched over from I believe hash browns? 

I shared a plate of French toast and while it was good I would have rather had some of the banana pancakes my friends were having.

Most people would see the line and go to the brunch place across the street, but don't be scared, unless you have over a hundred people in front of you, it won't take long. The line flies by. 

This place single handedly made me like brunch.
author: Andrew V.

description:
Delightful and Delicious. I enjoyed the Eggs Benedict for breakfast and came back the next day and had the Seafood Salad for Brunch. The food is heavenly and the crab cake with sauce on the salad was magical!!! My ~ Oh ~ My

Don't hesitate to enjoy this establishment when you are in San Francisco.
author: Gary P.

description: My favorite was the zucchini pancake, seriously I could eat 20 of them. The flavors are amazing with the cheese and chives.  The crab cake Benedict were good but not enough sauce, although we got it to go. Salmon Benedict was awesome. I wish they had updated their menu because we got potatoes sautéed instead of the hash browns that I had seen on yelp.
author: Tara K.

description:
Came here for a nice brunch after church and before an adventure at Alcatraz with some friends. It was around 1pm, and I waited maybe 10 minutes or so for a table. I was debating between the tex mex scramble and the pancakes, but I usually have at least one savoury item for brunch, so I ended up getting eggs.

- Tex Mex Scramble: it didn't look like a massive plate (compared to the pancakes I saw at other tables!) but boy was it filling. There was a mountain of scrambled eggs with avocado, salsa verde, and a sauce on top. It also came with 3 warmed up little tortilla shells wrapped in tin foil to put the eggs in, which was a fun touch.

This was a decent and satisfying meal for sure. If I'm ever back in the area, I'll definitely try the pancakes!
author: Joanna C.

description: Small local place with phenomenal breakfast food. It was a hotel recommendation so I was skeptical..turned out to be excellent. Will return tomorrow morning to try some of the other dishes that looked really good.
author: Raluca M.

description: Breakfast was super delicious small place but  very warm environment!! Very friendly staff and service was quick I'm from Brooklyn where we have plenty of dinners and restaurants so I know a little about good food and this place has it very very good!!
author: Sandra R.

description:
I enjoyed my brunch here! The cafe itself is pretty small, right on the corner of Larkin and California. It's run by a couple of Vietnamese owners, but they sure know how to serve an American breakfast!

Initially, I was worried about the crowds, based on all the reviews I had read, but I think that might just be a weekend thing, because I was seated immediately on a Tuesday morning. However, with the restaurant being so small, it didn't take long for it to feel full. I ordered the Norwegian eggs benedict, which comes with two perfectly poached eggs (and I really mean PERFECTLY), on top of a generous portion of frseh smoked salmon, and some greens, all on top of a nice piece of toast. The bread wasn't too tough like some places, and it's really easy to cut through, especially when you pop the eggs and let all the yolk drizzle out and get soaked up by the bread, making each bite completely yolktastic. I asked for my hollandaise sauce on the side, but it had a really nice lemon-y texture, which worked really well with the salmon. 

Usually, it comes served with hashbrowns, but I opted to substitute in fruit for an extra $2. The bowl of fruit was small, but it had a good variety of berries, cantaloupe, pineapple, grapes, and a papaya slice. With the fruit substitution, the dish was $18. Pretty typical for the San Francisco area, I'd say.

All in all, Mymy knows what it's doing! Service was extremely quick and friendly (I was in and out in less than 30 minutes). I can definitely imagine crowds being an issue on the weekends or later in the morning, so don't plan on coming here with a huge group, and just try to be early in general! Definitely worth the trip to Nob Hill to try this place out!
author: Austin T.

description:
Much like many other brunch destinations in the city, there were long waits and cramped quarters.  Less like other brunch destinations, the food was generally good though there were some misses.

My salmon and avocado tartine was hearty and tasty - creaminess for days from the avo and egg and a nice hit of savoriness from the salmon.  My wife's eggs benedict was well done too, just nothing out of the ordinary.  The one big flop was the souffle pancakes...the egg whites inside each cake was almost completely uncooked and threw off the texture completely for me.

Service was solid and the coffee was quite good with some cream.  Overall, a respectable brunch spot, but the location, atmosphere and steep prices will make a return visit less likely.
author: Eric F.

description:
My favorite brunch item here is the Shrimp, Longanisa, and Grits.  The dish is full of complexity -- from the buttery grits to the gooey poached eggs, from the sweet longanisa to the salty salsa, and from the nutty toast to the spicy shishito peppers.  I can eat that dish for breakfast, lunch, and dinner...and maybe again for a second dinner.

1 star off: The Lemon Souffle Pancakes sounds good, but I found that the souffle part and the pancake part were cooked separately and then put together.  The two parts fell apart when I tried to eat it.  It would be nice if it was one true souffle pancake.

Lines can get long at times.  Given the amount of brunch option in the city, I would not wait just to eat here.  If you are in the area and there is no line, Mymy is mymy choice.  (I don't have a stutter.  It's my pathetic attempt to be cute with a pun here.)
author: Ally W.

description:
Ambiance: very small location.
Service: average, finished our drinks before our food came out.
Drinks: Pistachio and Red Velvet Lattes were good
Food: I loved my Oriental chicken salad, the lemon souffle pancakes were ok. It had a tiny hint of lemon flavor it tasted more like egg. We didn't finish it. Big Papa burger it a little bit above the average burger. The meat needed more seasoning. The french fries were good.

Everyone was eating the egg benedicts. Maybe we should of tried that instead.
author: Linda H.

description:
YASSS, SF breakfast/brunch!! Brunch is my absolute favorite meal! I came here during my winter break with my parents and was very satisfied with the food!

Parking: On the street, I can't remember if it was metered though... 

Service: Quick. My family and I were tucked into the corner so once we were served we were kind of forgotten? But that's okay! 

Ambiance: Not your typical American Mom & Pop diner but not one of those hipster brunch spots either. 

Food: Flavorful! Huge portions! Kinda heavy though. 
Tex-Mex Scramble: This was my favorite dish out of the three we ordered! The scramble was very flavorful with the spices, onions, and meat mixed inside topped with avocado and salsa. The hash browns were amaaazing! Thin and crispy! I really don't like thick hash browns that are still mushy in the middles so these were probably the best hash browns I've ever had! The corn tortillas come wrapped in foil that you can use to eat the scramble with like a breakfast taco!

Dill Shrimp Crab Cake Benedict: Also yummy! This was my mom's favorite. She lovesss crab cakes! They were crispy and seasoned nicely. Perfect with the poached eggs on top and toasted English muffin underneath... YUM! Once again served with a side of those amazing hash browns!

Lemon Ricotta Souffle Pancakes: Very fluffy thanks to the ricotta! But kinda heavy. These were a little disappointing tbh. The lemon flavor wasn't distributed evenly throughout the pancakes so some bites had a really strong lemon flavor while other had none... I think The Plow has my favorite Lemon Ricotta Pancakes. 

I really enjoyed my experience at MyMy and would recommend it; especially that Tex-Mex Scramble!
author: Jessica N.

description:
Enjoyed the BLT Benedict dish. Generous portion.  Lots of flavor.  Country potatoes fried to a crisp, I like 'em that way.  Price = $14.

Rapid service with smiles.  

Small dining area, tables & chairs packed close together.

Overall:  Humble, somewhat funky eatery that serves satisfying quality food.
author: Tom S.

description:
I love coming here for brunch on the weekends. If you come a little on the later side (around 1pm), you can avoid most of the lines, and I mean honestly why get up so early on weekends? For the  times I have been here, I have almost always sat outside. I actually prefer that over sitting indoors (can get a bit hot/stuffy in there). The overhead heating is plenty to keep you warm and some fresh air is always nice. 

My favorite items on their menu have got to be the pancakes and eggs Benedict. I'm not usually a pancake person, but Mymy has totally changed my opinion about that. Their Lemon Ricotta Pancake is AMAZING. Definitely try it out.

There is also a coffee shop right next door called Contraband that my friends enjoy visiting. If you are getting too bored/hungry/cold waiting in line for Mymy, just send one member of your party to get some coffee and pastries for you :P
author: Angel C.

description: We went to this place on a Wednesday afternoon and got to bring our dog as well! There was no wait. We had the salmon Tartine and the Italian tartine. Both were amazing, each had sauces that were so yummy. We wanted to try more things but were too full. Would come back again!
author: Joshua L.

description: Came to San Francisco last minute and stopped by this amazing spot! There was a bit of a wait but honestly I would've waited an hour. Everything on the menu is delicious, the presentation is there, the coffee omg! Do yourself a favor and check this place out. Amazing!!!!
author: Amelia V.

description: We came in the middle of the week mid morning so it wasn't crowded at all. Service was quick and the French toast and huevos rancheros was excellent. The menu serves up exciting options and new takes on regular breakfast which was a welcome reprieve after traveling for a month and finding standard fare.
author: Arlene D.

description: I love Mymy, but when I went this week since I've been dreaming of their soufflé pancakes, I was surely super disappointed. I have been to Mymy's 4 times before this. There is no such thing as the fluffy soufflé pancakes existing anymore here. Their thin crispy hash browns are now literally crispy potatoes. When they brought out my banana 'soufflé' pancake, I was a little upset and thought I ordered or that they misheard wrong but the waitress told me that they do not do the double layer egg white pancakes anymore. So, if you are looking for the old Mymy crispy flat hashbrowns and soufflé pancakes, they do not exist here anymore. Their scrambles and Benedict are still the same and still yummy though. Service here was decent, I came on a weekday before lunch time and there was no wait. The whole liter of mimosa is def needed here when they brought out the pancakes.
author: Janet Z.

description: We got there and tried to ignore the agony of waiting behind the 30 people that were already lined up, but we pushed through and made it. May not work for some who are in a hurry but if you have 45 min to kill in line it's definitely worth doing so. They don't have a waitlist it's literally just a "hop in line" system. The pistachio latte which we got with soy milk was outstanding. The Mexican scramble was so delicious with the chipotle aoli it wasn't dry like most scrambles. Their potatoes are out of this world- super crispy on the outside and mushy inside. Great place for a weekend brunch.
author: Jaklin G.

description:
I legit have passed by this place 30 times on a weekend, and every time the line is out the door and down the street. So when I was up early on a Sunday where the rain was pouring down I made a risky decision to head over to Mymy with the thought that not nearly as many people would be out in the weather. The bet totally paid off- at 10 am on a Sunday my BF and I got seated right away. ****unless another big storm rolls through I wouldn't expect this- bring some games to play in line and expect a lengthy wait!***

The food is simple but amazing. We opted to split an order of the Tex Mex scramble and the Baja California Benedict. Both were equally as delicious.

The benny doesn't have heavy hollandaise sauce which is refreshing, and the lump crab meat and shrimp really makes this feel like a lighter dish than you'd normally experience with this type of dish. It's on top of a homemade english muffin with some avocado and all in all wonderful.

The Tex Mex scramble was a bit greasier than the benny, but so flavorful and awesome. Really great balance of chorizo, pepperjack, avocado, salsa, and jalapenos. It comes with hot corn tortillas if you want to make you own little breakfast burrito.

Def a place that lives up to the hype and one you should try to frequent as often as possible.
author: Elliott W.

description:
Incredible brunch

I had the pancakes which were out of this world.

The breakfast potatoes with eggs Benedict were delicious as well.

Had a coffee to top it off!
author: Man vs F.

description: Not worth the money. Very basic and to expensive for just eggs or French toast. Ridiculous honestly.
author: Job V.

description:
First time trying their crab cake benedict $16.5 and  banana blueberry souffle $13. It has over 1000 review, so the food should not be that bad. It's decent, can't comment much because I am no food expert here. The poach egg is not as runny as I would like though. Overall, no complain.

Service is not good at all. Forgot to give us water and not once that they check on us if food is ok or not. Lastly, TIPS is INCLUDED but they NEVER mention. When u signed your merchant copy, there is a blank to fill tips. 

Overall, this is a place that if I ever need to return for me is a hangout or meet up with friends as I live closeby.

* this place is small. About 30 seats indoor and 15 seats outdoor.
author: Jenni L.

description:
I'm not a fan of this place. 

First of all, when you get there, there's no waiting list. You instead have to wait on line. There's obvious benefits to this, one being you don't have to worry about missing your reservation since you're required to wait there. However, I usually enjoy walking around the area I'm in and getting coffee while I wait to be seated. You can't do that if you have to stay in line.

Second of all, I was seated at a table outside, which was basically on the outside of another table. I was fine with sitting outside, but in car terminology, we were "double parked," which was incredibly awkward because the waitress had to lean over me to talk to the other guests. 

Third of all, the eggs benedict I ordered (lemon dill crab cake benediction) was cooked way too much. My favorite part of this dish is usually the runny egg and mine wasn't runny at all. The crab cake part, however, was exquisite. 

And finally, they automatically included a 15% tip! I understand if a restaurant does this when there's 5 or more guests, but I was only there with one other person. They shouldn't have automatically included this in our check.

All in all, I probably won't come back here.
author: Remy B.

description:
Came here on a Saturday morning and it's not as crowded as some of the other popular weekend breakfast spots in SF. 

I ordered the Parma Flavor and it was one of the best eggs benedicts I've ever had. The pairing of prosciutto with mozzarella and egg is fantastic. 

The service was quick and allowed split checks. The restaurant itself has a dim and cozy feel to it. I would recommend this place if you're a fan of breakfast!

Food: 5/5
Value: 4/5
Service: 4.25/5
Overall: 4.75/5
author: Brian G.

description: Luckily we didn't have a long line for Saturday brunch. I had eggs and longanisa but wasn't a big fan.
author: Laura D.

description: Food was absolutely delish! Only problem was I couldn't finish the huge portion. I ordered the banana souffle pancakes. Hubby ordered the 2egg breakfast. Very nice ambience, servers were excellent. Next time we come back, I'll definitely try one of their egg Benedict's, like the salmon one! Not too busy on a Tuesday morning. Great place, great food!
author: Gerri G.

description: Mymy is a very solid place for brunch, probably the best in the neighborhood. As you may have noticed from the other reviews, the line is obnoxious and long on weekends especially. Here's my trick: this is not a group brunch place. Even three people is pushing it. The seating is limited, and it's going to take you a long time to grab a table for 4 or more people. It's perfect for 1 or 2 though - their service is fast, so turnover for two-tops is pretty quick. I've never had to wait more than 20 minutes with 2 people. And with that wait, it's definitely worth it. The savory options are the best for sure - I'm partial to the scrambles, since I'm not a big benedict person. This time around I got the Harvest Time scramble, which was pretty unique with some great Mediterranean flavors (big fan of the Kalamata olives!). The crispy potatoes are fantastic, although I will join the chorus of folks mourning the next level hashbrowns that used to come with everything - goddamnit, I miss those hashbrowns. Their coffee is pretty good (my coffee snob SO endorses it!), and they sometimes have unique lattes which are nice (last time I got a pistachio one). All in all, would 100% recommend if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Megan B.

description:
TLDR - Tasty brunch without the hiked up prices typical of SF but expect a wait on the weekends. Worth a visit but not on the top of my list for a return visit soon. Try the corned beef hash or the spicy pop pork scramble! 

I've walked by this place quite a bit without realizing it was Mymy. There's usually a line queued up outside on weekends, but weekday mornings don't seem too bad when I've passed by. My friends and I came on a Friday around 11:30am and had to wait maybe 15 min for a table for 4. There's no waiting list or anything so you have to actually stand in line and your whole group has to be there to be seated.

The place is very small so I wouldn't recommend coming in a large group. 2 is probably ideal in terms of getting a table more quickly, but up to 4 people is reasonable. There's a very homey, diner-like feel inside that reminded me of diners in Tahoe for some reason.

Classic brunch menu with eggs (scrambles, benedicts) and sweets (pancakes, french toast) as well as a lunch menu after 11 with sandwiches, salads and burgers. Only a few things stood out to me: the Corned Beef Hash, which I got, and the Spicy Pop Pork Scramble, which a friend got and I tried a bit of.

Food was served pretty quickly and while it was pretty tasty, I didn't find it to be mindblowing. The poached eggs in me and my friend's Corned Beef Hashes were very overcooked when they were first served to us, so that was incredibly disappointing, but when we showed our waiter, he took our plates back without a fuss and brought them back with perfectly poached eggs. The portions looked pretty big but I didn't find myself to be quite satisfied and one friend said she was still hungry after too. However, Mymy is probably one of the cheaper brunch spots with most dishes being $13-15.

* 6 HRS CORNED BEEF HASH ($14) - 4/5
[corned beef brisket, onion, bell pepper, lemon dill, 2 poached eggs w/ toast & crispy potatoes]
I was a little uncertain about getting this at first because I've definitely had overly salty corned beef one too many times, but I wanted something very savory and was not disappointed. Their corned beef were perfect little bites of flavor. Super tender and just salty enough. I loved the grilled peppers and onions too, which added a little sweetness and balanced out the corned beef. Of course a perfectly runny yolk pulled the hash together. I asked for mine with a side salad instead of the potatoes, which they substituted without charging extra (substituting fruit instead is an extra $2)

* SPICY POP PORK SCRAMBLE ($13) - 4/5
[house-braised chipotle pulled pork, onion, roma tomato, pepper jack w/ toast & hashbrown]
Had a bite of my friend's scramble and thought the pulled pork was delicious! Loved the sweet chipotle flavor and crispy hash browns, but I felt like the portion size was on the smaller side. No wonder she wasn't full after.

Overall, not a bad brunch spot but nothing really screams at me to come back.
author: Jessie L.

description:
We heard a lot of great things about this place.  We waited about 15 minutes for a table for 3 at 8:30 am on a Saturday.  The restaurant is no-nonsense and is very laid back.  We sat inside, where it was pretty warm.  This place would benefit from open windows or air conditioning.  

We shared a pitcher of mimosas and each ordered breakfast.  My florentine benedict was delicious.  I appreciated the addition of mushrooms, which I do not normally see.  However, the potatoes were too salty and were more like french fries than home fries.  My husband ordered the french toast, but he said it was coyingly sweet and did not make a big dent in it.  The mimosas were delicious, but when are they not?
author: Lauren M.

description: We came here for our last meal before leaving San Francisco, and it was definitely worth it! I had the Baja Eggs Benedict, it was full of fresh crab meat, the only negative was the bread, I'm not a fan of the toast instead of English muffin. My husband had the Norwegian Benedict, same complaint in the toast, but the smoked salmon had a great sweet and smoky flavor. My kids split the Challah French toast, it was a nice sized portion, and I got a scrambled egg and sausage on the side for them to do split as well. The potatoes that came with the Benedict's were some of the BEST breakfast potatoes I've had, they were nice sized, and fried after baking. They were tender and crispy on the outside, and there were little crunchies on the plate that were so delicious!!
author: brittany d.

description:
We waited about 45 minutes in line during brunch on the weekend, the sucky thing here is that they don't have a sign-in list. So you can't leave the line. Lame. 

But it's totally worth it. I came here for the lemon dill crab cake benedict and that was amazing! The portion was also really YUGEE, I was soooo bloated when I finished. The lemon dill hollandaise worked really well with the crab cake. Their hash browns was perfectly crispy.. I wanted to try their french toast and pancakes but I don't think I would have made it out alive. Will come back and try other things!

How come I've never heard of this place before???? It's so much better than... say.. Idk... Zazie's
author: Yen P.

description:
Love this place!!! The food was delicious and food coma inducing, in a good way :)

We had a The Tex mex and the salmon tartine, which were both delicious!
author: Sophie Y.

description: The salmon tartine was spot on for me! So much flavor and a generous amount of sliced avocado on top, which really gives it plus points for me because a lot of places tend to be cheap about how much avocado they put. It was super delicious and the potatoes were crispy and well seasoned as well. The plate had a good amount of food and I left feeling more than satisfied.
author: Jeana Y.

description: I had seafood salad last week, it had plenty shrimp and crap cake. Really enjoyed it.
author: Annie K.

description:
Another cute American brunch place in SF. Be prepared to wait on sidewalk for brunch.

[FOOD]
CRAB FISH BEIGNETS WITH HOLLANDAISE SAUCE [3/5]: It's essentially 2 egg benedicts with a special lemon sauce that's unique to Mymy. It's hard to consume this dish elegantly because everything just explodes and turns into a mush. By then the dish doesn't taste any different than a regular egg benedict. They also came with a plate-full of hash brown. 

TEX MEX SCRAMBLE [3/5]: Egg scramble cooked with salsa, potato, avocado, and what tasted like thousand island sauce, served with 3 soft tortilla and a plate-full of hash browns. It was savory and a little spicy, but did not stand out too much. 

[PRICE]
$13-20/dish, which is typical of brunch in SF. With tips/tax, you'll be paying ~$20. Yes this is expensive, like everything else in the city I guess you are partly paying for the experience (which including waiting lol). 

[SERVICE/SETTING]
Limited seating inside and 3-4 tables for 2 only outside. Very cozy interior, but your clothes may be stained with a little greasy smell. Be prepared to wait outside if you have a large party. Street parking is available but limited. 

[OVERALL IMPRESSION] 
This is another one of the hyped up brunch places in SF. Very typical brunch menu but for a cost that's 15-20% more than your typical brunch place. Nothing I found particular special that would make me want to wait another 30min-1hour for.
author: Wendy F.

description:
I was actually the first to review this place when they opened in 2010. 
I've been several times over the years but I haven't been a die hard fan. I always thought the hash browns were a little weak and while good, I didn't think this place was amazing. 
Decided to try it again today. First thing I noticed while standing in line was the new potatoes (like country style). 
I was seated pretty quickly since I was solo. 
I ordered the Norwegian Benedict (I am part Norwegian after all) and it came out super quick. 
The dish wasn't perfect, the Benedict was warm and not hot, but the new potatoes were spot on. Much better than the old hash browns. 
Service is amazingly efficient and overall it was excellent so I can see why there is a line every weekend. I don't care for that aspect but it seems to move quickly and food has improved since my last visit so I'll be back soon.
author: Matt H.

description:
oh My oh My, Mymy is an amazing brunch place!

I came here with a group of 5 for brunch a while back when I was visiting in the area, and unfortunately, we were met with a pretty long wait, even though we came on a weekday. The seating area is really small, and your party needs to wait until another table has finished eating before they let you be seated. 

However, the food makes up for what are typical shortcomings of a lot of brunch places (the wait). I had the chorizo jalapeno tartine, and all I can say is FLAVOR. Everything was perfectly seasoned with just the right amount of kick. The portions were a good size too, and I left feeling pretty full. Our food came out pretty quickly. No complaints about the service. We had our 5th person join us later in the meal (we ordered for her at the same time as everyone else though), so I'm not sure if they let people get seated without the full party, or if they just made an exception for us.

If I'm in SF again and looking to brunch, Mymy will be my go-to-spot!
author: Jerry H.

description:
I was here while I was sick as a dog. Made my way over 'cause I heard there was good chow. The rumor was correct.
Great coffee, eggs perfectly cooked, sourdough toast.... Yum. Nice crowd, good spot, right by Trader Joe's. 
I enjoyed it greatly. Get her before the crowds.
author: Paul W.

description: My friend and I saw the Soufflé Pancake pictures that posted by lots of Mymy's customers on Yelp, so we went to the restaurant and tired it out. Unforturnately, the Lemon Soufflé pancakes I ordered looks very differently from those posted on Yelp earlier. The lemon souffle pancakes were not fluffy at all just like as the regular pancakes with lemon flavor. It disappointed me not getting the real Soufflé pancakes. If their current chefs were not able to make real souffle pancakes, then the restaurant should change their menu to avoid misleading customers. Other than pancakes, the Crab Benedict we ordered was very good though.
author: Jessie L.

description: Was kinda disappointed with the pancakes they were dry and didn't have a great ricotta taste as I would of imaged. Service was ok waiters took quite a while to ask us for our drinks and food order. Wouldn't mind going again to try more things off the menu
author: Ivan C.

description:
4 stars because I got food poisoning :( However, the food at this place is phenomenal. We got the Norwegian eggs Benedict, crab and shrimp Benedict and florentine Benedict. Each Benedict was as fresh and delicious as the other! Additionally we got the banana blueberry pancakes! so yummy. For the three benedicts, one order of pancakes, two mimosas and one iced tea the bill came to $80 which wasn't too bad. For taste this place is A1, however I do have a couple things I didn't like. 1) There is no written wait list. You have to wait in a line outside the restaurant which can take quite a while being that the place is packed! If you walk away and lose your spot in line, oh well. 2) The food took quite a while to come out. There was a table that got sat after us that got their food before us. The server didn't apologize or really seem to care. 

Overall, I would come back to this place solely because their Benedicts are the best I've ever tasted!
author: Tanita J.

description: Called and asked how long the wait would be, I was told 10 minutes. I walked for 15 minutes from my hotel to get here the line is out the door and it has been 45 minutes and the line still hasn't moved. I'm eating at the restaurant across the street outside and have been watching. Don't go here unless you want to wait for hours.
author: Annie R.

description: Great food. I arrived around 8:45 am and was dining solo, so I was able to get a seat right away. Coffee and food came out quickly! I think I was in and out of the restaurant in 30-40 minutes. By the time I left, there was a line outside the door, so bigger parties might want to try getting in early! The Chilaquiles Verdes dish was incredible - and I loved the Van Gogh theme of the place.
author: Emily S.

description:
Unfortunately, my favorite brunch spot is no more. 
1. It takes way too long to get in on the weekends and you now have to physically stay in line the whole time.
2. In the last year they've bumped up prices by a couple dollars an item (may not seem like a lot but that's high inflation for just 1 year).
3. This was the deal breaker, the crispy delicious hash brown is gone and replaced with semi tasty, yet mediocre home fries. [Note: many people in their reviews are also disappointed by this, clearly this was a huge draw to Mymy]

Sad to say but I don't really want to come back anymore.
author: Rachel R.

description:
Nomz.

Mymy is solid. I've passed by this place a number of times on the weekends, and it's always poppin' during brunch hour (aka a long line around the block). 

I finally visited as a group of four for Saturday brunch. We came around 11am and while the line was definitely already wrapping around Mymy, we got to pass a bunch of people in front of us who were parties of two when a table for four became available. We only ended up waiting around 15-20 minutes!  Honestly, pretty amazing for weekend brunch in SF.

I ordered the Frisco scramble. It was topped with a nice serving of sliced avocado, and the side of potatoes were on point - nicely seasoned and crispy. 

If you're looking for a hearty brunch with generous portions, check out Mymy!
author: Christine T.

description: Mymy is a small quaint place on an incredibly hilly part of the city. Don't be fooled. When you enter, it is all hustling and bustling. The food is good, the latte hit the spot. This is also a short walk away from Mr. Holmes' so it's easy to get desert after. The only downside for me was sitting near the door where the waitresses also stood by, it was a little cramped and I don't think I had much personal space.
author: Isabelle V.

description:
I brought my dad and my little sis here for a late lunch while waiting for my mom's procedure at St Francis up the block. I was hoping to get my dad some yummy soufflé pancakes, because who doesn't like fluffy pancakes?!
Well!
I ordered the corned beef hash, and my little sister ordered the pulled pork scramble, and we ordered the lemon soufflé pancakes, all to share family style like any Chinese family would do :P And a green tea latte whose name caught my interest.
Green tea latte: Good on a cold day, came out piping hot, they neglected to make any design with the milk foam, light green tea flavor, too sweet and creamy after I drank half. Couldn't finish. 3.5/5
Corned beef hash: Made with real cubes of corned beef, came with two beautifully poached eggs with a green hollandaise, and crispy home fries. 4/5
Pulled pork scramble: Well seasoned, nicely spicy with the green salsa. Also came with home fries. 5/5
Pancakes: THESE PANCAKES.
I cut them open (see pics) and was like "..." What is this inside, ricotta filling? Tasted it, it was EGG WHITE FLUFF. Literally, beaten egg whites. No sugar, slightly savory. I'm thinking... did they make this wrong? So I asked the server. No hesitation, when I asked if it was supposed to be like that, it tasted like just egg, he said "Yes. Soufflé."
Ok now I know you put beaten egg white into a soufflé anything, having made soufflés myself. But since when do you glob on the egg whites and not fold it into the batter?! I had to scoop it all out (see pics) of the pancakes, it was so strange on my palate. And because the egg whites weren't folded into the batter before cooking, the pancake itself was almost as dense as bread with a lemony flavor. We couldn't finish it. And I tell you, my dad does not like to waste. Hard pass. To each their own, people seem to like their pancakes. It's definitely not "meringue" as some of the reviews put it. 1/5

So, TL;DR, would I come back? Yes for the salties, no for the sweeties.
author: Karen C.

description: I love love love this cozy little place.  The staff were attentive and nice.  My server even kept my plate in the warmer when she realized I was going to the restroom.  The food was mind blowing.  The potatoes and Harvest Time scramble were outstanding.  The flavors for such a simple dish were on point. If you visit San Francisco, this place is a must!
author: Kathleen T.

description:
Mymy... you don't need my review but I wanted to thank you.  I have an aversion to pancakes, and don't particularly care for potatoes.... you have turned me around.  Brunch is my favorite meal, so despite the dauntingly long lines, I came here for the crabcake eggs benedict (accompanied by potatoes which I typically disregard).  Everything - amazing.  Crack of a crabcake.  Palatable potatoes... a superb starch.

I reluctantly shared my meal with my brunchmate, splitting the banana pancakes, of which I expected to only take a bite.  After devouring every morsel, I can only fault you for the extra spin classes I have to now take to cycle off the exorbitant amount of calories consumed. GRAZIE MI AMORE!!!!!!
author: Tara C.

description:
3.5 stars

We tried to choose a place for brunch which didn't have an insane wait on a Sunday morning. We yelped this place, called in and found that the wait was only about 30 minutes. When we arrived, we found out that you have to stand in line and that there is no wait list. Since the line wasn't super long, we decided to wait. 

We got the lemon dill shrimp cake which was pretty good. The crab/shrimp cake was surprisingly good and the lemon dill hollandaise was not bad. I wish it was a little more lemon-y or dill-y though. There was just a hint. They didn't give us a giant sheet of hash browns which is what we were expecting (from yelp pics), but we got house potatoes instead. They were actually pretty good, but we had our hearts set on a giant hash brown. We also go the lemon ricotta soufflé pancake which I was really excited about, but was kind of disappointed with. It just tasted more like eggs, less like pancakes and barely any lemon flavor. Maybe I'm confused on what a soufflé pancake is, but it was just okay. 

Overall, this place as okay food and the place is more homey and not as up to date as some other brunch places.
author: Sophia Y.

description:
WOW. amazing. Can you guys bring Mymy to North Carolina?

My friend and I were visiting San Francisco, and came across Mymy on Google Maps and Yelp. The Bloody Mary's with Soju definitely caught our attention. The drinks were tasty, and the food was S'GOOD. The potatoes were so big...you don't get potatoes like that in NC. 

We enjoyed our brunch outside while watching cable cars go by, and the service was pretty fast for sitting outside. I will definitely come back or recommend to a friend!
author: Sarah C.

description: This is possibly the fastest brunch place in SF. The line actually moves quickly and you can be in-and-out in no time. I love the crispy potatoes and the portions are hearty. I'm not a fan of the lemon ricotta pancakes here (griddle fresh has better, IMO), but the omelets, hash browns, and everything else I've tried is great.
author: Dani P.

description: Wow the pancakes were some of the best I ever had . Service was good and the coffee is very cause. As soon as you enter you a bit feel like home . Worth the journey. Go for it, I doubt you will be disappointed. Just look at the photo :))
author: Emmanuel B.

description: We passed this place a couple of times the first couple of days of our visit. We decided to stop for brunch Saturday morning. It was busy and there is a line outside the restaurant. The wait was not too bad. They get the food out quick and the tables turn over fast. With that being said, the food is very good. The portions are HUGE!  Worth every bite! I ordered the Tex Mex and it was very tasty! Definitely will come back on our next visit to SF!
author: Linh T.

description:
There was a long line to be seated but the line went by fast.  The place is not very big.

I ordered the chorizo jalapeño tartine and it was excellent.  It came with these really good potato side dish.  My friend ordered the dish with the pulled pork and that was good too.

We shared an order of the lemon ricotta pancake.  We were both disappointed with that one.  It was pancake with egg white meringue In the middle.  It was more like beaten egg white than a meringue.
author: Diana h.

description:
Zucchini Pancake with Parmesan Crust
Housemade sour cream pancake, chipotle honey drizzle, served with two eggs sunny side up

It was Sunday morning and we woke up hungry. It was already 9am and the lines were getting longer (as typical in San Francisco). Thankfully, Mymy wasn't too bad for a party of 2 (roughly a 20 minute wait). I ordered the zucchini pancake which was an interesting mix of savory and sweet. As a sour cream pancake, it has a much lighter consistency and a very savory component. It wasn't as filling and hearty as I'd like, leading to an A-Okay rating.

House coffee hit the spot. I could drink it black but it wasn't particularly memorable.
author: Tammy T.

description: Food was yummy (may want to order easy cheese - they put on a ton) but staff was not very friendly or welcoming. We had a nice table outside and were able to beat the Saturday morning rush. Very close to the table next to us but overall the food was good!
author: Kristen C.

description: This place can be really great but first the potatoes are dry and tasted like rubber, also food was cold by the time we got our order, felt like we were being rushed also the wait staff is very rude not friendly and acted like they didn't want to be there. Lucky there's much more better places to grab breakfast without overpriced food and a mean waitstaff.
author: Richard S.

description: Omg the zucchini ricotta pancakes are AMAZING!! Everything else was very good too. The potato's were crispy and full of flavor, bacon was cooked perfectly as well as the eggs. The coffee is actually really good too. Small place with some outdoor seating. I randomly just stumbled upon this place but will definitely be back!
author: Monique L.

description: The reviews were correct! We got there around 8:30 am and there was no wait. The place is small but the food was amazing. I had the BLT Benedict and it did not disappoint. Coffee was good ... service was quick. I would definitely come back here .... maybe tomorrow morning :)
author: Brianna M.

description:
This is my first time trying Mymy out (because Zazie had a super long line at the time), and I'm glad I did! This place is a great spot for brunch, and the wait wasn't too long. They don't have a waiting list, so you have to form a line outside and wait for your turn.

The service here is alright. They tend to not pay much attention to you after you order, so make sure to get their attention to get what you need if you are in a hurry.

I ordered the Norwegian egg benedict, and it came with with smoked salmon, garlic sautéed spinach, capers, and chive hollandaise sauce. It was pretty amazing because of all the different flavors mixed together with the poached eggs. You have to get a bit of everything in each bite. I'm not really a fan of their english muffin since it was super thick, but it was still enjoyable. The best thing about this dish was their hash browns! I love my potatoes, and these hash browns were perfect. They were crispy, perfectly browned, and complemented the eggs well. You can be sure that you'll be stuffed and full until dinner time (maybe that's just me) or until the late afternoon!

Overall, the food was pretty great, and I just crossed off another breakfast/brunch place off my list!
author: Vicky Y.

description: Delicious breakfast for both my husband and I. I also tried the green tea matcha latte and if you're into that, it was seriously out of this world!
author: Wendy R.

description: Oh my my goodness, this place is such a treat!! Delicious and perfectly prepared brunch every time. We ended up coming back multiple times during a trip to San Francisco because it was that good. The crab cakes are a must try! Yumm
author: Lauren G.

description:
Pros:  friendly service
           
           
Cons:  ok food.  Souffle pancakes were dense and      dry. May be I went on a bad day. Drinks were ok.
author: Bayarea K.

description:
I don't know what's more concerning- the fact that I live so close to here (this could become a habit) or how incredibly overly sweet their ice mochas are. But I digress: 

Had a friend visiting, and we wanted to attempt the daunting: finding delicious brunch on a SATURDAY morning without devoting hours to it. I was able to make it happen with a little YELP from my friends. Found MyMy was very close and the food looked great, so we set out on foot. 

There was a line (as expected) but the line looks worse than it is. It goes by fast AND I much prefer the line method than the "put down your name and hope for the best" method. That way it's very straight forward how many people are in front of you. 

This is the place you want to go for FANTASTICAL Eggs Benedict. The Dill-Crabcake Benedict is delectable, don't miss it! 

Blueberry Soufflé Pancakes were lovely, fluffy and not too sweet. Unlike the iced mocha, which I would skip unless you like things so sweet it shoots directly to your frontal lobe and you shudder. 

Service is fast, efficient and friendly. Pro Tip: decide what you want while you're in line, order right when you sit down- be a pal and help those in line get to their eggs quicker. 

Solo dining? They have a counter area, with a window view -perfect for a quick and pleasant breakfast with you, yourself and you. 

I'll be back soon MyMy for some more crab crab- you're my new I-have-a-visitor-let's-walk-down-to-MyMy's-for-brunch-Go-To. Also, I need to try the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes next time!
author: Amanda A.

description:
Their food is good, no doubt. Crispiest potatoes that I've had which made me keep digging in when I normally don't likes spuds. Portions are pretty big and the pricing is a bit on the higher side. Wait time for food is looooong. If you go on the weekends or at certain times, the wait to be seated can also take an eternity. Restaurant space is cramped so it's understandable. 

I wouldn't suggest the souffle pancakes. I was craving pancakes and it didn't hit the spot. It was kinda eggy but didn't do much in terms of taste. I did enjoy the other items we ordered, however.
author: Julie L.

description:
I came back for breakfast recently, and I have to say, that it was not good in my opinion. I'm not sure if it was my eggs or hash browns or both that were cooked in coconut oil or something similar...I did not enjoy it. I felt like I was eating suntan lotion...did not like it and it bugged me throughout my meal...service was not too attentive either. They took a long time to come and take our order - and we were starved! I don't think I'd come back here again.

Oh and the owner will write to you and say sorry for your experience, but "We're fortunate that so many people do enjoy our food and service"...that says to me that they are not willing to at least assess their current business practices some to see if they can be improved at all. Nope, I'm not going back here again, period, and I will not recommend them to others.
author: Maile N.

description:
SO glad we went here instead of a typical fancy-brunch place. Not only was there no line at 9am on a Friday, but THE FOOD WAS SO DELICIOUS! And it really means a lot when my foodie fiancé says "This is the most delicious thing I've eaten in a long time" in regards to the Tex-Mex scramble. SO delicious and flavorful. 

Also had the banana pancakes; I only ate the edges of this (it was that good and filling). Pro-Tip: always ask for the toppings on the side, as well as a side of syrup! 

Bloody Mary's were fantastic and yes: they have carafes of mimosas on the weekdays!
author: Mikkel J.

description:
It might be the carafe of mimosas talking,  but this place is GOOD. AS. HELL.

Located on a busy street corner, I was surprised to discover that the huge crowd of people outside weren't pedestrians, but actually people in line to get in! If there's any sign of a good brunch spot, that's one of em.  

As our last spot before heading to SFO, and even with huge luggage in tow, they were able to seat us almost immediately and kept our luggage stowed safely, which I appreciated.

It's a very small cafe, and there's indoor and outdoor seating.  So as to not miss our flight, we took whatever table we could get, but outdoor seating would have been nice too.  Since we ubered there, can't say much about the parking situation, but this is SF, so who's driving anyway? Lol.

The service is quick, efficient, and friendly.  The staff answer all questions and were very attentive despite how busy it was.  The menu had much more than I anticipated, and it's definitely not a Norm's or IHOP brunch spot.  If you're eating here, you're eating goooood, lol.

Originally we started with coffees and the intent to just have something simple like pancakes and eggs, but that was quickly out the window after we saw the carafe of mimosas on the menu.

I had the seafood eggs benedict and my boyfriend had the hash dish.  BOMB. Everything was fresh, and you can see them preparing it as the kitchen is within clear view of the dining area.  This is awesome if you like to watch your food get prepared, but bad if you're buzzed on mimosas and your eyes are bigger than your stomach.  Long story short, we ended up ordering more food .  And LET ME TELL YOU, the lemon ricotta pancakes are HEAVEN.  Plus, with fresh fruit on the side, there was no need to feel as bad about all the other bad choices we had made that morning lol.

Overall, 10/10 would come back, and 10/10 HIGHLY recommend.  I ended up falling asleep in the uber on the way to the airport and BARELY made it through TSA, but worth it? HELL YEAH.
author: Katrina D.

description: I love this place. Great job on the potatoes!! And the salmon was smoked and eggs were cooked just right. Nice job mymy! This place had great/friendly service and it was clean. We didn't wait long for a table and they were always topping off my moms coffee.
author: Danielle L.

description: Amaaaaaazing! I had the BLT Benedict and I can easily say they are the best I've ever had. Everyone else I was with loved their breakfast as well. The bit chocolate and dirty chai latte were also delicious (French toast and lemon soufflé pancakes). We got there around 10:15 am on a Saturday morning and the line was only about 20 minutes. Will definitely be coming back when I'm back in SFO.
author: Cynthia U.

description:
Eh. If you don't have good coffee, you aren't going to make this girl too happy. Their coffee is diner coffee. There, I said it.

The breakfast was fine, nothing to write home about (or give a glowing review). The crab benedict was light and delicious, with lump crab and mini shrimp. It was good, although not memorable. I'd normally never get that at $20 a pop, but my friend insisted. Eggs were poached perfectly and on a nice thick english muffin with a thin layer of fried hash browns.

The lemon ricotta souffle pancakes were a huge portion, just not my cup of tea. Not quite as flavorful as I was expecting, and the souffle portion was just a really weird texture combo with the pancakes.

Overall, a solid brunch spot, that I'm not quite sure is worth travelling for. If it's a neighborhood joint, than no doubt. 

Outside seating was pleasant, although the tables are teeny. The service was solid, it is located in a great 'hood and I may have ordered wrong; so there's also that. That coffee, though... no bueno.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
Ugh, I wish I lived in SF so I could come here again! There isn't a waiting list, you just stand out on the sidewalk and they'll seat you when your entire party is here.

The crab cake benedict was to die for! The creamy poached egg yolk runs over the crab cake  that was just a party in my mouth. I'd also recommend the banana souffle pancakes which were light and fluffy as air.

I felt like the service was a little rushed here but I understand because they're trying to have quick turnover. This did allow for the wait to only be 15 minutes when I could see it becoming well over an hour because of how popular it is.
author: Abby T.

description:
3.5 Pancakes

With such stellar reviews it was inevitable that I might be let down a tad.  My omelette was good not great. Their famous souffle pancakes were rather rubbery in my opinion...not light and fluffy. Food is good and it is consistent...but it is not like wow amazing.

Highly recommend coming here during the week as I am sure the weekends are  chalked full of long waits and hard to find parking spaces.
author: David G.

description:
It's always stressful when my parents come to town for breakfast because I feel under pressure to pick an epic place to eat. They are not picky, and they don't mind waiting if there's a line, but I only want the best for my parents when they visit me. Duh. Oh and it's always awesome when I get to check another breakfast or brunch place off my list.

I picked Mymy for its excellent reviews and scrumptious-looking food photos. Luckily my parents and I are morning people so we arrived first thing in the morning on Sunday. There were also a few people waiting for the restaurant to open, and the wait only got crazier. All the staff members here are so efficient and hard-working. Even my dad commented.

My eyes were glued to the banana blueberry soufflé pancake on the menu. I don't normally like pancakes, so I took a leap of faith. The description was a mascarpone cheese stuffed pancake with vanilla curd and candied walnuts. WHAT!! How does that NOT sound amazing. The two pancakes tasted as good as it sounded. One of the best I've ever had. The pancakes came with butter and syrup, but it was sweet enough as it was.

Mymy is a tiny restaurant with limited indoor seating, but they also have patio seating that lines the outdoor walls. Get here early (first thing in the morning if possible) so you don't have to wait in line. Apparently you need to form a physical line, not just write your name down on a list. Whatever you have to do, it's totally worth coming here. Try their pancakes! My dad got their corned beef hash, which was amazing too. I'll be back!!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
I've been here twice now and both times have been fantastic! While it's a pretty tiny place, we never waited too long, even on a Sunday. I don't necessarily think people park it there and never leave. Plus, the food comes out super fast, so they hustle 'em in and out!

I admittedly got the same thing both times too... I just can't stray! The Tex Mex Scramble is just so good. It has all the essentials... chorizo sausage, avocado, and a delicious drizzle of chipotle aioli over a bed of hashbrowns. They also give you a side of soft tortillas. It's a carb overload, but I'm okay with it.

They don't skimp on the portions either. I promise you'll be full all day... Or at least until dinner if you're like me!
author: Rachel C.

description:
When I first saw these pancakes on my friend's snapchat, I immediately knew I had to be there ASAP! 

I ordered the norwegian benedict, which is their smoked salmon benedict, and it was pretty tasty! I also got to try salmon rotolone tartine and I have to say, it was way better than my benedict. The red onion and dill added so much flavor to the smoked salmon and omelette. Also, those potato wedges were way better than my hashbrown! And of course, my friend ordered her lemon ricotta souffle pancake that she's been hyping up. I never liked pancakes so when I tried this, my first impression was this is not a pancake!! It was so fluffy!! To be honest though, I wish it was more lemony. 

The line for this restaurant seems very long, but rest assured, it goes by super quickly!
author: Samantha C.

description:
There's this goal for me to try all the best brunch places in SF. It's mostly difficult because when you look at up brunch in SF sometimes it's just a large list of great spots that I've been to, but there are a few I haven't. So part of what I do on the weekends is to go to these awesome spots since brunch is my favorite meal of the day. 

I ended up getting the parma flavor benedict with prosciutto, mozzarella, tomato, basil, grilled asparagus, and chive hollandaise.  It was delicious - although a bit too much since I was hoping for a light breakfast. 

You line up outside and don't take down names or anything; when it gets close, they'll ask for the number in your party and after telling them, they'll let you know where you'll be sitting. It's kind of nice that way since you can see how many parties are in front of you pretty easily, but as someone who ended up sitting outside, it was bothering me there were so many people watching me eat and hoping that I'd eat faster. 

Protip: get there early and get ready to stand in line.
author: Nina Y.

description:
Mymy has been on my brunch bucket list for a while. I feel like I have bookmarked it for a while & finally today I got to try it. Glad I was not disappointed.

Got here around 10:00am and there was a line outside. I guess that's normal. I haven't gone to a popular brunch place in SF ever without having to wait. Anyways, they don't allow you to put down a name and come back, which is a good thing, imo. The line moved fast and I think we got seated within 15 minutes of waiting. 

A table outside was available for our party of 4. It was actually cold and windy this morning, but after waiting a little, we got a bit more warm and decided that we don't mind sitting outside. & Good thing because they have a heater outside!

I shared two different Benedict plates because I wanted to try both. We got the crab cake with shrimp one and the Norwegian one. Both delicious! Green sauce on the crab cake is a bit overwhelming, but it's okay. Norwegian benedict had a good amount of smoked salmon. I wish the egg yolk was a bit more runny, but it was still good. I'm glad I split two different ones to be able to try both. My favorite part of the breakfast though is the HASH BROWN. Super thin, light, crispy, and such a big piece. My friends got the tex mex scramble (looked bomb diggity) and also the soufflé pancake (very fluffy.) Conversation of how she explained the pancake: 
"You know how sometimes you take a few bites out of a pancake and you feel done?" "Is that how you feel?" "Nope!" I guess she really liked them and didn't feel like it was too much.

Anyways, overall it was very yummy and I am very content. I'd be down to come again try something else, or even get the same thing too, and in fact would recommend for others to come try!
author: Melody W.

description:
Great brunch spot - trick is to come early!  We came around 10am and barely waited more than 10 - 15 mins and were seated right away. 

It's a pretty fast place, you get your menu's and they are ready to take your orders shortly afterwards. 

The menu has lots of great choices - everything to meet your needs:  good balance of sweet and savory.  The benedict section was calling my name.  I decided to go with the crab one.  It was a perfect choice.  The portion was filling but not overwhelming.  We also ordered bloody mary's which were a bit plain.  It felt sort of like vodka with tomato juice and a shake of pepper with celery garish.  

I would definitely try some of the scrambles...the fact that you can "create your own" sounded like a dangerous option!  I will definitely be returning.
author: Kimberly L.

description: Got the Lemon Dill Crab Cake. Was a bit pricey for the amount that you get, but worth trying! Also beware that there is a line even near their closing time.
author: Stephanie H.

description: My friend and I both found a hair in our food. They didn't charge us for it but didn't offer us anything in return like to pay for the mimosas we ordered. Ugh.
author: Tracy L.

description:
Once was a fave. In fact ive sent so many out of towners here but came this weekend and the quality has gone down a lot. No more crispy hash browns. Souffle pancakes were dry and tasted like they had a layer of egg white in it. Not meringue at all. 

Left disappointed. :(
author: Christine H.

description: Mymy offers a friendly neighborhood casual ambiance with high quality brunch food. I would give this place 5 stars, but I do think the food is overpriced for what you are getting. Granted, this is San Francisco we are talking about here, and nothing in this city comes cheap.
author: Katlyn H.

description: We spent 10 days traveling in and around San Francisco and MyMy was one of the best breakfast experiences of our trip! Excellent food,interesting choices, wonderful staff, and pleasant atmosphere. Highly recommended!
author: Thomas V.

description: We were a group of seven that came in on a Saturday morning. We were seated fairly quickly. The food here is good! Their Crab Cake benedict was quite savory and tasty. Their fried potatoes were good but it was all a little too much oily food for me. We also ordered the grapefruit and orange mimosas. We preferred the orange mimosas to the grapefruit ones.
author: Kavya T.

description:
Who would have thought pancakes could be so fluffy? One bite of these lemon ricotta pancakes and your tastebuds will be invigorated. I couldn't believe that the special ingredient was the ricotta mixed into the pancake to make every bite so delicious. 

Last but not least, the crab Benedicts were just as yummy. The sweet blue crab pieces were fresh and the potatoes were extra crunchy! totally worth the 20 minute wait.
author: Linette F.

description:
Honestly, this place is pretty meh. I was expecting more due to the great reviews, but this place is dominated by out-of-town tourists who really don't know what good SF food is.
I got the Corned Beef Hash and was underwhelmed.
author: Devin G.

description: This place always has a pretty long line for brunch. Prettty good, but standard breakfast food. They have all the normal things you would expect. The potatoes are definitely the highlight here.
author: Cynthia M.

description: Had an awesome breakfast here last week with my daughter. Service, prices, eggs, omelettes, corned beef hash all top notch. Will return for sure next visit to this amazing city.
author: Jimmy G.

description: Standing in line right now! The food looks great, but even better is how they managed to get a USPS truck parked next to the line providing shade. Love the hardness and general quality of the concrete that the general contractor who laid the pavement outside the restaurant used. A+ pavement, would stand again.
author: Adrianna N.

description:
Pretty decent breakfast place. There can be quite a bit of wait during the weekends, but I came here on a weekday. The food is good quality but nothing to wait an hour for. I got the norweigian benedict and my wife got the tex mix or something like that. Both very good and fresh and well prepared. I think there are too many similar breakfast places in the city that are alike that I was hoping for something different. 

Overall I do recommend this place if you are in this area. The parking here can be tricky. There are a lot of conditions on street parking. Just pay attention to all the street cleaning and the neighborhood limits.
author: Moses L.

description: This was a great place to eat. It is pet friendly and the food was delicious.  The country potatoes were crisp and light. The Parma Flavor Benedict was an fresh take on Eggs Benedict and so tasty. The poached egg was cooked perfectly and the tomatoes added a nice touch to the meal. My two daughters had the omelet and Eggs Tarteen.  Not a bite was left.  We also ordered the Lemon Ricotta soufflé pancakes just for taste.  They were tender and sweet. We were so full and happy at the end of the meal.  Great service and so filling that the meal held all of us until 9pm when our flight left. It was a great place and would come back again
author: Kristin B.

description: Came here from out of town and it was fantastic. Exactly the kind of breakfast food we were looking for, I had the Tex Mex Breakfast and it was phenomenal. It's laid back place and there's nothing too special about the space, but we were very satisfied with the food. The earlier you get there, the less wait there is. We came early morning and were seated pretty quickly.
author: Jennifer Y.

description: From the quick service to the charming decor to of course the food, Mymy is definitely classified as a perfect classic brunch spot. I ordered the crab benedict and it was great, the lemon dill hollandaise was on point. My bf ordered a burger which was better than your average burger. Not sure what russian aioli is but it's fantastic. Their ingredients are noticeably super fresh, I can already tell this is the type of place where all the items on their menu would be a good choice! Perfect for a friend's brunch, a date, or maybe even alone if you're into that (there's a counter). The many great reviews on this place definitely do it justice, will for sure be returning!
author: Monica A.

description: Wow this an amazing breakfast spot . I had the corn beef and hash it was simply one of the best breakfast I have ever had in SF . With fresh squeezed OJ. This place has it all. Fast..clean... excellent place to try out if you're in the area. Parking can be challenging but it is always worth it . Defiantly deserves  #10stars
author: Ahoy H.

description:
We needed a place that didn't cost an arm and a leg and wasn't a solely brunch option on a Sunday morning.  I had bookmarked Mymy (is it my-my or mi-mi?) since it was close to our hotel.  It looked good to my man so off we went.

Mymy was a short 5 minute walk downhill (thankfully) on a nice Sunday.  We got there and waited right where the "Line Starts Here" sign was.  There was just one party ahead of us so we didn't wait more than 3 mins.  Once inside, it's funky and crowded and loud.  Typical hipster place.

Basically we were looking at eggs, sandos or sweets.  After much deliberation (and talking myself out of pancakes), I chose the eggs tartine with egg whites and he had the tex-mex scramble  We also started with waters and coffee that was filled regularly.  The egg tartine I had had bacon and gruyere scramble with roma tomato garlic relish, aioli and toasted boule.  It was all on a thick slice of bread.  It tasted like a pizza to me, and the tomato overpowered the entire dish so I didn't enjoy it. The breakfast potatos were really good and I wish I had more of those.  His tex mex was done before I knew it.  It had chorizo, garlic, jalepenos, onion, basically all tex mex ingredients with hashbrowns and toast.

Service was good, we got different servers each time we needed something.  Fast turnover and there was a line forming around 9am when we were leaving. I wish I tried the pancakes as that looked good, but was afraid of being carb loaded all day.
author: Milee S.

description:
So on our last day in San Francisco, we were looking for a great breakfast spots after a good 30 minutes of looking through yelp. We found Mymy!! Not only did the food look just as good as the photos, it also tasted just as good. Omg their potatoes were the bomb.com and of course there poached eggs were unlike any other I had ever had. The only issues I had with the place was that the restaurant was very dirty! I understand that restaurants are busy especially since the line was out the door, but please make sure everything is kept clean. 
Thanks for the yummy food!
author: Janet P.

description:
came here this morning for a nice breakfast with the hubs. arrived around 9 am and got seated right away. we got:

hot water & hot tea

salmon tartine - super yummy, creamy and light. i think there were at least three eggs in that little scramble on top. i couldn't even finish the whole thing, which is pretty rare. the crispy potatoes were excellent! super crispy throughout the meal.

corned beef and hash - a nice not so greasy take on corned beef and hash with the same delicious potatoes that came with the tartine

the service was fast and friendly. it took a while for my tea to come but it did arrive without a reminder. the food came out fairly quickly and we got to see all of the plates coming out of the kitchen, which was fun.

i definitely want to try one of the eggs benedict next time. the french toast looked amazing and i was so tempted to add it to the order...
author: Vanessa S.

description:
It was a windy Saturday morning, so luckily my friend and I got a table inside. The wait was surprisingly short for a small and crowded restaurant--just around 15 minutes for the two of us at noon. They really have a fantastic menu. I wanted to try it all! After MUCH deliberation, I decided to get the crab & shrimp cake benedict that was served over a large, square, flat, thin, and crispy hash brown and with a slice of orange. (The photos on Yelp of it just looked too good.) Yum for the most part. Just wish there was a bit less shrimp maybe. My friend ordered the harvest salad and loved it. I was impressed by how fast the food came out for Saturday brunch. Wish we had the room in our stomachs to try their pancakes, which look and sound amazing, but we were pleasantly full. 

Taste | 4
Atmosphere | 3
Presentation | 5
Service | 4
OVERALL | 4
author: Lana L.

description:
My favorite part of brunch is the potatoes. Yes, potatoes. So if your potatoes aren't good, then your brunch isn't good. Sorry.
