That's why when I saw Mymy's potatoes, I knew I HAD to come try them. Mmmm, they did not disappoint. Super thin, crispy and flavorful, I didn't even eat them with ketchup - what!

Mymy is a super solid brunch spot. Whenever Shawn C. and I brunch, our usual is one benny and one sweet dish (usually French toast) to share. We did the same here and got the Baja California Benedict ($20 because of dat fresh Dungeness crab) and French toast ($12.50). Although not the BEST I've ever had, both were still realllllllllly good. 

There's a lot of amazing brunch places in SF and Mymy definitely makes it on the list.
author: Laverne N.

description:
Great for brunch. Nice big portions, quick service.

I had the Mexican scramble, nice tortillas, good spice, good spice on the potatoes. 

Good amount of outdoor seating with headlamps. The pancakes looked delicious!
author: Elizabeth J.

description: The zucchini pancakes and chorizo and egg toast are uh-mazing! Small corner local spot in the cute knob hill area of town!
author: Lindsey S.

description: This place is great! We were six people and each of us took different plates and let me tell you that each plate looked amazing and I wanted to eat everything! The seafood benedict was great, the waffles were good and I took the salmon egg which was delicious! Make sure that the whole party is present or else they will not seat you since it is pretty busy especially on weekends.
author: Khalil S.

description: Was a pretty good spot but now has lost its appeal because they don't have their crispy pancake-like hash browns. Now they're pretty average and there are so many places to go in sf that doesn't have the crazy wait and get the same food quality.
author: Samira I.

description:
We ordered a few dishes for our group. The banana pancakes were BOMB and SO DELICIOUS!  The eggs were nicely poached and the potatoes were crispy and yummy. 
The service was okay, but the food definitely surpassed our expectations, no wonder why this place has such rave reviews! 

Will definitely come back when visiting SF again! Loveeeddd itttt!!!
author: Luba K.

description:
The food is excellent, the bloody mary's are really good! 

There is a wait line, and sometimes it is long! but it is worth it, we sat outside and enjoyed the sun and watching people while we had the brunch. Highly recommended!
author: Ali M.

description: This place is delicious!!! I have had several of their devious and I haven't been disappointed yet. If you come on a weekend expect a wait. It's a small place only sits about 30 people but well worth the wait. I love this dish called the Tex Mex, I order almost every other time I come. This is a must place for me when I come to San Francisco, thankfully that's weekly!
author: Thomas M.

description:
I've eaten at Mymy at least 5 times. Their food is wonderful, nothing to complain about. 

However, Mymy's service is probably one of the worst I've ever experienced. It's like they go out of their way to be rude and make dining more difficult. I understand there is always a long line and you want the tables to turnover as quickly as possible, but it does not mean patrons should be treated with disrespect. 

During one of my visits, I was with a group of 3. After waiting 30 minutes, we were seated at a table that fits 4. We told the waiter that we had another friend coming toward the end of our meal who would NOT be eating; he was literally going to sit and wait until we finished. Understandably, Mymy does not seat you unless your whole party is there. We explicitly said he was not going to order, so it was not going to prolong our meal at all. Our waiter refused immediately and said it was not possible. His reasoning was "because it was policy" and then proceeded to go out of his way to REMOVE the fourth chair that was at the table already. He literally was petty enough to remove the chair - one that he would not have touched if we weren't trying to be polite and tell him of our friend's arrival in advance.

I don't understand why that was necessary. We were not hurting business in any way and would have taken just as long to eat regardless of if my friend showed up or not. 

I went back again recently (because the food is actually good). My party of 2 was seated outside and the sun was smack in my face. I moved my chair to another side of the table so I wouldn't be facing the sun. Someone else at a table right next to mine was also seated on the same side. Our waiter came up and said I could not sit with my chair on that side. Sure, that's fine - but then why do you let other tables sit like that? Why is your policy inconsistent across parties?

I will definitely not return to Mymy after this experience. Sure, their food is worth waiting for, but I don't believe that makes up for the rude waiters / management, who frankly make it quite obvious that they are trying to turn over the table as fast as possible. No, thank you.
author: Evanny H.

description:
Four stars for the food. Crab&Shrimp eggs Benedict are a must try. 

-1 star for the huge egg shell still attached to the poached egg. 

-1 star for the crappy service.
author: Andy C.

description:
YO, foh all my vegan sistahs and brothas out there, read me :)

Today was my second time eating at Mymys, my first was a really long time ago so I don't really remember my experience but LEMME tawk about this one. My friend and I decided we wanted to get brunch here so we arrived around 1140 and there was a verrry long line waiting for seating. Intimidating, yes. Worth to wait around? Yes, because why? The line goes by quick, these people here def KNOW how to get you in and out in a timely proficient but NOT RUSHING manner. Got seated within 20 minutes in an outside table which was absolutely divine as the weather today was clear, sunny skies with a little breeze.

Knowing my options were kinda limited didn't intimidate me at all. So what if they don't have much "variety" for the vegheads out there (btw this is still veg friendly for those who eat eggs, but I do not), YOU DON'T NEED a variety of options to enjoy a pleasant brunch w a friend! After viewing all the options they had available and contemplating if I should just order a sandwich but take out the meat and cheese, I decided no, Imma CARB the f up. Sides of potatoes are $4 a plate? Shooot, let's go. I asked the server to give me 2. She stopped me for a second and mentioned that my friend I was with ordered a benedict combo already came with crispy potatoes! And I said, yesss I know, but these potatoes are just for me. Can I get two sides of it and a side of sliced avocado ($3) ? And she said oh! Okay.

Now deep down inside my heart I knew not to expect much because I mean, going out to eat as a vegan really can be a trial sometimes and you just know you cant really eat what you desire out since most of the amazing food is cooked at home, so I was just prepping myself to be served with my friends benedict in a beautiful platter while I would get 3 separate small plate appetizers as mine. 

LO AND BEHOLD, we get our plates and they beautifully put both orders of the potatoes onto one plate with the sliced avocado on the corner and one orange slice on the other corner, essentially making my plate look like a normal little brunch platter to match my friends. 

I was ecstatic. Peep my pics posted for the plate.

ANYWAY, stuffed myself to the brim w these taters which if you're wondering, are TOTALLY worth it. Absolutely unhealthy, but who cares, CRISPY, fully cooked on the inside, seasoned perfectly. Amazing.

My friend got the proscuitto benedict and fully enjoyed hers too!! She couldn't even finish it!

Anyway, I was more than impressed with this place just because of that whole way they plated for me. I KNOW THAT MAY SEEM SO LAME TO SOME OF YOU, but to me, it really made an impact. The little things matter :'). Thank you MyMy!
author: Kaitlyn E.

description:
Oh my....ohmyohmyohmyohmy!!

This is my friend's favorite brunch spot in SF and I'm so glad she finally took me here!!!
When you get here, instead of writing your name down, you stand in line, which I like so much better...

Lemon Ricotta Souffle Pancakes: Man, the hype with this one IS REAL. The souffle makes the pancakes SO FLUFFY...its like biting into little clouds...sighh.. and then you get all the lemon-y flavor..PURE PERFECTION!

Chorizo Tartine: Basically chorizo on top of scrambled eggs on top of a piece of sourdough bread! Simple but delicious! Great hearty meal that really hit the spot! I loved they cooked the potatoes too, not too burnt but had the perfect crisp to it!

BRB dreaming about those pancakes.....
author: Heidi L.

description: SO UNBELIEVABLY DELISHUS. I did not expect this little hole-in-the-wall to blow my mind. The food is made with a unique sassón
author: Suyan C.

description:
Food was good, plenty of seating inside and out. We had breakfast; eggs, potatoes, zucchini pancakes and toast! 

The place was crowded but the wait was not long at all.  The meals price is an average of $13/person without drinks.
author: Christina F.

description:
It is for sure a 4 starts. Food is really good, which is a good start. It's a bit too busy, but it's ok. It's not 5 stars because it's pricy. 
I had a classic mymy pancake, amazing. But 18$ is a bit too much. My partner had eggs, which she decided the style. Really good, but again a bit too expensive. I would recommend and return (:
author: Rafael M.

description:
My friends and I stumbled in here post-Bay to Breakers and how lucky we did! This place was much better than we expected by far.

Mymy is pretty small but they were able to sit our group of 6 within 5 minutes of waiting in line. We were sat outside with some other large parties but it was a nice day so we didn't mind at all.  Everyone at the table ordered different things. My boyfriend and I split:

  -Iced Americano-Surprisngly good, I am always worried about ordering Espresso drinks at     restaurants but this really hit the spot. It may have just been that I was thirsty post-run ;)

 -Banana Blueberry Souffle Pancakes-SO GOOD. Literally the lightest pancake I have ever had. You can LITERALLY see the Mascarpone and it makes it so light. If I could eat one thing for the rest of my life, this would be a solid contender.

 -Salmon Rotolone Tartine: Also great and substantial. The potatoes served with this were out-of-this-world. The Tartine was very refreshing and delicious. My only gripe was that there was too much cream (maybe aioli?) and it was overwhelming during some bites.

Everyone else loved their food. My other friends ordered the Tex Mex scramble, Norwegian Benedict, Asian Chicken Salad and a burger. Many "yums!" all around. I'm so happy we stumbled across this place and cannot wait to be back.
author: Carrie W.

description: We went to this place after Mama's on Washington had a line down the block. We had the Crab and Shrimp Eggs Benedict and the French toast, they were delicious. Seating was cramped and the service could've been a bit better, but it's understandable since it was Saturday morning and there was brunch rush.
author: Sam S.

description:
This brunch place has quite a small venue contributing to the long lines for their Sunday brunch. They're quite strict about the entire party being there and they cross your name off right away if you aren't present, so make sure you wait right outside! I ended up being seated outside. 

My friend ordered the Frisco Scramble and I ordered the Vanilla Sponge French Toast. I was really happy with my french toast, as it was nice and crisp on the outside but soft and creamy on the inside, and I would definitely recommend it! No syrup was needed, but it did get a bit rich towards the end. My friend was pretty satisfied with his scramble as well. The food came out faster than I expected considering the amount of people there, which was definitely a plus. Only down side is I still don't know how to pronounce the restaurant name.
author: Catherine S.

description:
Parking: It was morning time on Sunday, we parked about a block away at a meter and walked to the restaurant. 

Service: We had to wait about 15 minutes for our turn to be seated. The service was okay, I felt like they were kind of hasty but they were super busy. 

[[Food]]

-Bloody Mary: LOL I thought it was so funny how they're Bloody Mary's are made with SOJU. Being Korean I had to get that. The Bloody Mary here is GOOD. Do get it! It's a little light on the alcohol so you won't really get drunk or anything.. I think =P 

-Banana Blueberry Soufflé Pancake: THIS IS SO GOOD!!!! It is super light and airy like a soufflé but in a pancake form. 


-Baja California Benedict: The shrimp was seasoned and cooked wonderfully. It was nice and savory!  I liked this one better than the Parma Flavor Benedict. 

-Parma Flavor Benedict: It was good! A little lacking on flavor compared to any of the other Benedict's. But the Hash Browns that come with each Benedict dish is superb. Definitely a lot of butter going on in those potatoes.
author: Julia S.

description:
Five stars for that lemon dill crab shrimp benedict!!! That green sauce is absolutely divine and compliments the crab shrimp cake beautifully! The sauce is creamy without being too heavy, and gives just the slightest pinch of a tart flavor. I love the super crispy and flat hashbrowns, too!

We unfortunately didn't like the lemon ricotta soufflé pancakes as much as we expected to. We believe they stuff the pancake with an egg white soufflé and were hoping they would be extremely fluffy and airy... however, they were still quite dense and cakey for us. In addition, the egg white soufflé contributed to the overall batter to taste [and sometimes even feel] egg-like! We had to make sure to eat them with a lot of maple syrup to hide the egg taste! (Update: tried the banana blueberry soufflé pancakes, and they too have that egg white soufflé layered in. Similarly, they tasted and often felt egg-like. Regardless, if I had to choose, I would pick the blueberry pancakes over the lemon one! I enjoyed the vanilla-based cream on top as well as the blueberries cooked within the batter, which both contributed to a more moist texture!)

Came around 11:30am on a weekday, and didn't have to wait for a table at all! I wouldn't mind coming back for that lemon dill crab shrimp benedict or trying their other dishes!
author: Kris C.

description:
My favorite Breakfast/Brunch place...ever. Waited outside in the rain for a few minutes to get a table on a Friday morning but totally worth it. 

The Lemon Ricotta Soufflé Pancakes are heavenly. And the Harvest Scramble with asparagus, tomatoes, onions, pine nuts, and pesto is one of the most flavorful dishes I've ever eaten. 

Great coffee, friendly staff. Home run!
author: Joe V.

description: Terrific breakfasts and reasonably priced for the area. Staff was great. Coffee cup always full. I had the French toast which was delicious. Also at our table the salmon tartine and a Frisco omelette and Norwegian Benedict. All came with lots of avocado and delicious fried potatoes. Worth the walk!!
author: Ellen B.

description:
Terrible service here. Waiting for table in a chill weather for an hour with my friends. While server is not willing to have small party to switch to the next table. We had 7 people and table ended up too small for all the dishes that we ordered. Server yelled at us by not having enough space for him to place the dish on the table. No matter their food it's good or bad. I will definitely not coming back here again. 

With yelling from server and we got automatically 18% tip charge on our bill. Tip should be volunteered when it came with good service. Not automatically charged when there is a bad and terrible service provided.
author: Jenny C.

description:
Mom and I decided to share one sweet and one savory dish for a weekday lunch meetup...both were delicious! We actually settled on dishes that we've tried at other brunch places, but Mymy definitely one-upped both is certain aspects.

The parma flavor is stuffed with procuitto which was a delicious, savory replacement for Canadian bacon! The poached eggs were also made flawlessly and both of us swear that these English muffins were much larger than normal. We also liked the addition of a generous tomato slice and the grilled asparagus. However, the crispy hashbrowns were maybe just a bit too crispy as they were more like a potato chip than hashbrowns. But overall, this was a very delicious dish.

For our sweet dish, we opted for the lemon ricotta pancake. I 100% appreciated the fact that it wasn't delivered smothered in sweet sauces. It was just lightly dusted with powdered sugar and delivered with maple syrup on the side. This really allowed for us to pick up on the lemon flavor. Without a doubt, these pancakes were also amazingly cloud-like and a perfect choice for a sweet (but not too sweet) option!

All in all, mom and I were happy with our choices. Staff was friendly, but did fail to check on us outside diners after a while....we pretty much had to go inside to pay our bill.
author: Elaine Y.

description: New to the city and was looking for a brunch spot on a Sunday. I saw this on yelp and walked over. I was surprised there was a line out the door, I thought must be good! I looked at the menu and everything looked delicious! So I waited and long story short,  it was worth the wait! I waited about 20 minutes. I ordered the MissMyMy - ricotta zucchini pancakes, crispy potatoes, poached eggs and Longanisa (Filipino pork sausage). Service was great. The servers wear unique aprons, designed with superheroes. I thought that was cool and a conversation starter. Overall, extremely satisfying experience but be prepared to wait in line especially on a weekend!
author: Kristine J.

description: Based upon a recommendation from the bartender at Liquid Gold we decided to try Mymy for breakfast. They have outdoor seating but we chose to sit inside and it is a little tight. We were fortunate to get in before the rush and were seated immediately. Coffee was good, hot and plentiful.  My wife had the Zucchini Pancakes and loved them while I chose the Lemon Crab Benedict and was not disappointed. Their crispy potatoes were delicious. Great, casual place for breakfasts.
author: Dave W.

description: Oh Mymy, I love you, ha ha... honestly, the best French toast. Been here 5 times I think, never lets me down. Quick line, delicious food, outdoor seating, friendly staff.
author: Raj S.

description:
I came here for brunch earlier today and had a good meal. Wait surprisingly didn't take too long, even though there was a longish line. I came around 11:30am and was seated 20 mins later. Note: you need to wait in line to be seated, there's no hostess to take your name down. 

I ordered the BLT eggs Benedict. The English muffin itself was delicious- not your typical store bought English muffin,but don't know if they make it fresh in house. It was fluffy and huge. It came with chopped bacon, roasted spinach, sautéed tomatoes and tons of garlic. Was flavorful. The egg was perfectly poached and came with light hollandaise sauce. It was nice not having too much sauce on because then it makes the eggs Benedict supper soggy. Came with a side of roasted potatoes that were good.
author: Samantha G.

description: Really like this small breakfast spot. Had a tex mex scramble that had a ton of flavor. Big portion. The potatoes are ridiculous. Perfectly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Good service. Good prices. Great for a quick and easy breakfast.
author: J A.

description:
Brunch is one of my favorite pastimes and I can happily declare that Mymy has reached a special place in my heart after this Saturday's brunch outing with my friends. My friends and I originally had plans to go to another place for brunch but due to a long wait, we decided to find a different place to eat. Stumbling down ten blocks, the four of us went inside Mymy around 1:45pm and luckily, there was no wait. We were able to snag a table in the back before the restaurant filled up. 

One of my friends already tried the place before so she recommended her favorite dishes and we went along with her choices. For the four of us, we shared the: 
-vanilla sponge french toast
-lemon ricotta souffle pancake
-lemon dill crab shrimp cake benedicts
-salmon rotolone tartine

OMG THE BENEDICTS! AND THE HASH BROWNS! They were worth every penny of the $16.50 spent. Crab cake was excellent and I love the lemon dill sauce drizzled on top. Aside from that, the hash browns was super crispy and thin and altogether that entire dish is a 10/10! If you have to get only one item, I would suggest this one!

The rest of the food was also very delicious but kind of pales in comparison to the benedicts. I do like the pancakes because they had a lemon ricotta souffle inside of the pancakes which gave it a light and fluffy taste almost like a sponge cake. French toast and salmon tartine was also great. The tartine came with a side of crispy wedges so that was good!

Ambiance wise, it has a diner cafe feel even though outside would make me think it was some fancy restaurant. Service wise, there wasn't any problems. Our bill came out to around $70 and they had already added the gratuity 15% and tax to it. I'm not sure if they normally do that for parties of four people but take note of your bill so you don't end up double tipping.  

Overall, great little place. Definitely will come again for the benedicts!
author: Diana C.

description:
The food was awesome and I love the customer service from all the staff and the aprons on point marvel Mario the French toast was excellent and I got to make my own scramble which was nice because I got to put shrimp in it that's it OK 
In addition too, the food was delicious in a great area. Highly recommended
author: Jacqueline M.

description: I figured a place with more than a 1000 reviews should be good. I've been here at least five times, and I still don't know why I keep coming. Servers aren't overly nice, and they don't check up on you. I always get the Tex-mex scramble and a couple times they forgot the tortillas. Either they ran out of it, or they just forgot? One thing I did really love was the hash browns and now they only have potatoes. On my most recent visit, I decided to try the Norwegian Benedict. I expected it to be on an English muffin, the whole thing just tasted weird on wheat toast. The salmon was really good though. Overall, I don't think I'll be back.
author: Jeanne C.

description: Nice, cozy place. The pancakes are really good.
author: Ankit A.

description:
This is my breakfast spot!  Always a short line to get in, but that's expected.  The food is phenomenal and the staff are great!

Ex Restaurant Manager 
Purdue Hospitality Graduate
author: Jon R.

description: Solid breakfast/brunch spot on the corner of Larkin and California. Street parking is available but can be tight. Recommend Lyft/Uber for maximum convenience, especially since there is no waitlist and you must wait in line, which can be a time suck on busy days. L-shaped interior with bar seating along the short side windows. Expect to rub elbows with fellow patrons as the space is quite cozy. Service was on point, simple, fast, no frills. Bonus points for double refills on the coffee. Ordered the Dungeness crab Benedict (no avocado, chive instead of jalapeño and bell pepper sauce). Heads up, it comes on toast and not English muffins. Eggs were beautifully poached. The crab was scrumptious, I just wish it was a patty rather than a thin smear across the toast. Essentially, you're eating poached eggs on a crab tartine with hollandaise sauce. The accompanying shrimp were small but well seasoned and perfectly cooked. Potatoes were hot and rustic. Recommend getting a side of bacon to enhance this dish with layer of smoked savoriness. Overall, a nice place for a hearty breakfast if you're in the neighborhood. Bonus tip: it's one block away from Trader Joe's so a perfect precursor to your next trip for groceries.
author: David L.

description: I wanted to try out one of the local brunch places in San Fran And I'm glad I chose this place! The waiting line wasn't very long. I've waited about 15 mins (totally worth it) i checked out their menu before I got a table inside to save some time.  Their food is beyond amazing. We got the Tex mex and the lemon egg Benedict. They were just perfect. O wish i had the chance to try out the rest of their stuff. This place is a gem.
author: Shaikha A.

description:
Came here for brunch around 10AM on Sunday with the boyfriend and the line was super quick. We only waited 5-10 minutes to be seated inside.

Got the baja california and i gotta say, wow for $20?! lol i see from an old photo it used to be $15 in 2015 and i'm just like ahhh that seems like the right price for eggs benedict....

Everything was cooked perfectly though and delicious. Plus service was standard/good.

Split the baja california, orange juice, side of bacon and side of potato something with the boyfriend and it came out to about $40 it was just the right amount of food for both of us to not feel overly full and provide enough sustenance for the hike we were about to go on in Marin.

Oh, SF brunch, HOW CAN YOU BE SO EXPENSIVE. we didn't even order drinks......
author: Mimi T.

description: The food was okay.. a bit salty and served on the colder side. I wouldn't have mind the extra sodium and probably would have gave it five stars but not when your serving cold eggs and potatoes.
author: Zahra Shay R.

description:
Come early to beat the breakfast rush because as we were leaving, there was a line forming. The restaurant is pretty small, and we got there around 9 and were seated right away. 

I ordered the banana blueberry soufflé pancakes and the bf had the 6 hr corn beef hash.  My pancakes were amazing!! Fluffy with egg whites present throughout the layers makes for airy pancakes!! My bf loved his corned beef hash which had chunks of corned beef, two poached eggs and hollandaise sauce. The crispy flat hash browns were delicious!! I highly recommend this spot for breakfast!!
author: Vy T.

description:
This is the place to come on a weekday for brunch/lunch if you can. Every time I pass by on a weekend, I see a line that goes on for days. Good news is that if you are willing to wait in line, this place is worth it.

Two things that are an ABSOLUTE MUST:
1. Hash Browns with anything. Literally the most crispy hash browns I've ever eaten.
2. Corned Beef Hash. Like real corned beef. YUM
author: Jennifer C.

description: Food was incredible. I had the salmon and it was cooked to perfection and servers were very friendly.
author: tony v.

description:
Thoroughly enjoyed my breakfast here. Good
Food quality and taste. I was going to walk past this place but when I saw the food on the plates of the customers sitting outside I made it to the corner and turned around. Happy I did. Slightly higher price but DEFINITELY worth it!
author: Brett W.

description: One of the best breakfasts I've ever had. Went on a Tuesday morning, no wait at all. Servers are attentive, food was brought out super fast and it was Dee-Lish-Us! I had the 6hr corn beef hash. It was nothing short of amazing, the dill sauce was scrumptious. My BFF has the pulled pork scramble. I also had a carafe of mimosas. Hands down, would recommend this place to anyone who asks. Can't wait to go back.
author: Val B.

description: Probably the best Eggs Benedict in the city. Get there early to avoid waiting for too long. Outside seating is nice if it's not too cold.
author: Dinesh S.

description:
Wait for a long line outside and crowd seat inside.
The waiter was Impatience and rude. 
Sooooo Disappointed! 
 
BTW, food is delicious.
author: Joanne L.

description:
To be fair I'll start with the positives: 
-Greeted at the door,  sat right away
-Wait staff were readily available to answer any questions
-portion sizes are big
-creative presentation

As i entered, once I indicated that I was as a solo diner I was quickly directed to their communal counter, which was fine but I was not given the option of sitting at a table, which I found interesting.  

Perusing the menu, I found the prices to be quite high, ($13-20) I realize it's Silicon Valley but once I tasted the meal, it did not meet adequately justify the price by any means, other than portion perhaps.

I ordered the salmon tartine and the chive cream was super heavy, thick, and overwhelming the entire taste of the meal, very unpleasant. The potatoes were a bit overcooked and salty. The meal included red onions yet they were plated on only one side of the tartine and by the time I reached that side I was stuffed and grew tiresome of the bland taste. I told the waitress it was not good and she just kind of gave me an empathetic shrug.  

I was in town for business and certainly have no desire to return.
author: Naomi R.

description: My tongue just went to sleep on a soft pillow that is my lemon souffle. Accompanied by a zucchini pancake ..... Try it. You won't regret it.
author: Gaspar I.

description: Great little spot for breakfast. The lemon soufflé pancakes were just lemony enough and the chorizo tarting had a nice kick.
author: Alison L.

description:
Was on an eggs benedict spree during my recent trip to SF and the lemon dill crab shrimp egg benedict at Mymy did not disappoint. It came served with a sheet of hash browns which were equally delicious. Greasy, but that's what vacations are all about. 

Don't let the long lines intimidate you since they move rather quickly, especially if you only need a table for 2.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
No waiting list; you just stand in line. If your entire party isn't there yet, they'll just skip you but let you stand in line. I think it's a much more efficient way than calling names.

All the food was good. Spicy pop pulled pork scramble (great textures). Tex-mex omelette (delicious orange sauce like at La Vic's or Iguanas). Banana blueberry ricotta pancakes (filled with ricotta!). Zucchini pancakes (savory with a thin Parmesan crust). And most of all, hash browns (super thin but that means you get more crispness). You may even need to order an extra side.

The space inside is small but there is seating outside too. Friendly folks running the place.
author: Shannon L.

description:
As tourists in San Francisco, we arrived around 8:30 AM on  Friday morning, and we're so glad we were early - by the time we left, there was a line at the door. Come early if you don't want to wait!

We ordered: a) Blueberry Souffle Ricotta Cheese Pancakes, b) the French Toast, and c) 2 teas. 

I can't even describe how delicious this was. The French Toast was chewy, sweet (but not overly so). The pancakes were heavenly, light, and so flavourful. Everything was so carefully cut and prepared, and service was friendly, and attentive - everything a tourist could want before beginning a day of sightseeing. 

Our total came to around $38.00, tip inclusive. Highly recommended!
author: Barbara D.

description:
SERVICE: The staff is very welcoming. I don't know if it's just coincidence but every time I come here, there's always a guy near the door so as I walk in, he greets me. Maybe he was on his way to check in on the tables outside, but I'm just going to keep believing he was there for me. :D 

FOOD: This is the part that was surprisingly disappointing to me. My grandpa does not get out much for food so I like to take him around the city when I can to explore the diverse culinary culture that this city is known for! The banana blueberry souffle pancakes were dry despite all the vanilla and berry compote. The potatoes were a tad over-fried in my opinion and the small scrappy pieces make me feel like I got the end of the batch. I ordered the MOT sausage burger which is basically a brunch-style egg sandwich. Now that was pretty darn good with the Italian pork sausage, grilled oyster mushrooms and fluffy bun. But, I've also tried their smoked salmon benedict which was a little on the salty side. 

ATMOSPHERE: Nothing to brag about. If I remember correctly,the inside has a bit of a Spanish vibe to it with the villa-esque orange walls and artwork. Tables are mildly close together so get comfy! The inside is shaded well so if you get seated by the window, you can enjoy the warm summer afternoon without feeling the burn of it!
author: Greg Y.

description: I heard that the brunch line for this place is really long but it wasn't too bad (and I am a really impatient person that has no time to waste on a line) and I got here right at noon on a Saturday. I was early to meet a friend and waited less than 10 minutes before someone asked me to go inside the restaurant. I think Mymy is much better than some of other American brunch places in the Bay area that either lean too greasy (like Brenda's...) or are too expensive for eggs and toast. The service is actually really quick, which makes sense given that most of the menu is a twist on either eggs & toast or waffles/pancakes. I got the mediterranean eggs with toast, which came with olives, asparagus, spinach, ricotta, and hemp seeds cooked into the eggs. The portions are on the bigger side so you get two meals in for one :).
author: Meryam B.

description:
Decided to go here based on Yelp reviews and I wasn't disappointed. The place was cute, nice decor. We got here right after it opened based on what last reviews said. It was pretty full when we got there too so you know it's a good place! There's a pretty good selection of food and because of that I had such a hard time picking something to eat haha I ended up getting the chorizo tartine and my sister the smoked salmon tartine. Both were so delicious with a great kick of flavor. I especially loved my dish because it was just the right amount of spice. And the aioli that came with it? So so good :)

The service was great, very attentive. They came around a few times doing refills of coffee, which I thought was a good touch.

I'd definitely come back when I'm back in SF!
author: Eleanor A.

description:
My husband and I came here because of the reviews and truly, it was so average. The potatoes were okay at best, and they take up half your plate. The eggs were fine, but I wouldn't consider them worth the wait in line. 

Also note, that even when it slowed down, it took the staff a long time to take our order and to even get us water. Never checked on us and I had to flag them down for whatever we needed.
author: Alana S.

description: Delicious food and excellent service. Which the place was bigger and they had a more effective waiting process outside.
author: Justine J.

description: Cute little spot in the city. The plates are very filling and perfect for brunch/ breakfast. Place is small for inside seating and they have some outdoor space too. Great spot to run into. Would certainly plan ahead. Kudos to them on getting people lined up for seating. Line up outside vs taking a name- give you a very good idea on how long you want to stick around. Zucchini pancakes were a hit for us! Worth checking out for sure!
author: Christina W.

description: Secretly the best brunch place in the city! I regularly get the chorizo dish which is hearty and delicious. They do something with the eggs to make it super fluffy. There's usually a wait here so I recommend getting in line before 10am.
author: Young Y.

description: If you just got here and are wondering about the line - it moves quickly. I loved the food and sunshine.
author: Claire L.

description: Love me some MyMy....breakfast with lovie. Waiting for doors to open at 8a and got in right away. Fast and friendly service. Order The Challah Bread French Toast and the Frisco Omelette. Both were awesome and a half. Stop reading and GO.....
author: Bryan B.

description: Pretty good breakfast food served quickly. Scrambled egg dishes are very tasty, serve with very crunchy potatoes. Pricing is moderate, but it's excellent quality food.
author: Jessie M.

description: The food is delicious. The portions are massive. The pancakes are so fluffy. The hash browns are super crispy. The service is good. What more can you ask for? (Maybe cheaper prices andshort lines but I think that's asking too much in SF.)
author: Kelly Z.

description:
My brunch experiences in San Francisco have been a bit hit or miss as of late, and while I enjoyed the service, atmosphere, and menu breadth at Mymy, the meal itself left a tad bit to be desired. 

Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?

Like I mentioned in the intro, the service and atmosphere at Mymy are a refreshingly homely contrast to the hustle and bustle outside. Like anywhere else in the city, be prepared to wait, but likely not longer than half an hour or so depending on the time of day and the day. There's limited seating that's a bit cramped once you're inside, but the staff run a fluid operation and are willing to pick the waitlist to optimally seat everyone comfortably. Star Granted. 

Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?

Brunch commands a premium these days, but Mymy does a good job of keeping things reasonable even in Nob Hill. While I honestly don't remember the exact price, my depicted Corned Beef Hash was roughly $13.00, which is fair given common brunch prices. Other menu items were priced accordingly. Star Granted. 

Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?

I should probably start off by saying that Corned Beef Hash is one of my favorite breakfast dishes, and as a result I've set the bar pretty darn high. 

Whether it be the result of a high bar, an expectation that all things San Francisco are excellent, or what have you, I was a bit underwhelmed by this dish for a few reasons.

First and foremost, unlike other hash dishes, nothing here really felt combined, and it seemed as though some corned beef was chopped up and put on a plate, some potatoes, peppers and onions were chopped up and put on a plate, and an egg was thrown on top: the end. The result was flavors that didn't at all come together, which was pretty disappointing. 

As for the quality of the dish - the corned beef was dry and bit overcooked, the potatoes flavorless, and the peppers are onions nothing to write home about, making the hash browns by and large the best part of the meal. Corned beef hash is great when done right, and to cook everything together here would have felt quite a bit more right. No Stars Granted. 

Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?

I'm not sure I'll be back to Mymy, although my experience could have been an odd one. No Star Granted.
author: Paul V.

description: So we stumbled into MyMys when we were in the neighborhood and it was a pleasant surprise! We didn't find it on Yelp but so glad to see all the good reviews. Well deserved. The place is small and cozy and the Service is exceptional and fast. Coffee was always refilled. Food came out in a timely fashion. I rushed myself to order something since their kitchen was closing so I got a salmon tartine while my boyfriend got the dungenous crab Benedict (Baha). Amazing food! It's probably one of the more fulfilling brunches we've had in SF. Heavy and hearty. Can't wait to try other things on this menu. Totally recommend this place !
author: Felicia C.

description: Had breakfast here yesterday and ordered the banana soufflé pancakes. Probably the best pancakes I've ever had. Good coffee drinks too!
author: Annie E.

description: Loved this place! Came on Sunday at 8:30 and there was no line yet. Definitely think this is the best spot for eggs Benedict in the city, the Norwegian Benedict was AMAZING, salmon, capers and spinach. Potatoes were extra crispy which is always a plus. Will definitely be coming back. A great easy walk from the fairmont.
author: Brielle W.

description:
The food is a 5 stars for me every time I go. The line wasn't too bad for brunch at noon so don't let the long lines deceive you. It was about a 15 minute wait for a table for 4. They are really efficient at getting people seated.

I tried the Norwegian eggs benedict with hashbrowns (~$16). This dish was amazing! I loved the perfectly poached eggs and the generous amounts of salmon they give you. The hashbrowns were thin and crispy but not too heavy. Highly recommend getting this.

My only issue was service was really rushing us to order. We sat down at the table and almost immediately (as we were setting our bags down and picking up the menu) the server asked if we were ready to order. Then in ~15 second intervals after that had 2 servers alternate checking on us if we were ready to order a couple times each. It was almost comical to my table but made our choices a little rushed. But I definitely prefer this to the servers ignoring you!
author: Linda X.

description: I don't recommend anyone to eat here. Very bad service and nerves waters. The food was ok but not wow. The dining place is very small and noisy. I wouldn't come back again to this restaurant since there are many other better choices in the city.
author: Fahad A.

description: Outstanding! I went here for breakfast and had the challah French toast. It was delicious and beautifully presented. The staff was friendly and helpful. I will definitely eat here again the next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Shelley J.

description:
I loved my first time at MyMy! 
We did not have to wait to get seated, we preferred to sit outside since it was a nice day with good weather. Came in for brunch so I ordered a Caesar   salad with avocado and my fiancé had the banana blueberry pancakes! I loved my salad will be coming for more whenever I'm in SF again.
author: Paulina C.

description:
My oh my was brunch yummy here or what? Came here on Sunday at 10am for 2 and waited in line for probably 20 minutes tops? Not bad. With this place keep in mind you can't write your name down and come back, you literally have to wait in line.

Lemon Dill Crab Cake is definitely their star! What a unique spin on eggs benedict. The crab cake alone was good but the yummy sauce complimented so well.

Lemon Ricotta Souffle Pancakes were good but not sure how we felt about the abundance of egg white in this dish. I guess this isn't meant to taste like a traditional pancake but something was off for me personally.

Also, Mr. Holmes Bakehouse is a couple block away if someone from your group wants to go there to grab pastries as one of you waits in line.
author: Kathy L.

description: Apparently a local's favorite. Packed as every time we visit. The chefs cooking is superb. From crab cake benedict to egg and pancake. However, the sitting space can be intrusive if your neighbor next table tends to cut into your private conversation or need you to know any drama in her household. :)
author: Stan L.

description: Mymy, you wonderful little Nob Hill gem. Ok, so you're likely going to be sitting outside on some sort of incline, while your plate slides toward you the whole time, but the food is well worth it. I ordered a cappuccino and the BLT eggs benedict -- what, you say? A marriage between bacon and hollandaise sauce? What food angel just fell on earth and cooked up this apparition? It came perfectly plated, with the crunchiest hash browns in the shape of a gigantic crunchy pancake. This place is a solid 5-star for brunch, and definitely on my list for a return visit next time I'm in town:)
author: Ellie W.

description: The water is disgusting because probably stands in for ages in the same bottles. The service could be better. The food is delicious. So take your choice fellas. For me is a 3 stars.
author: Riccardo S.

description: My friend and I stumbled upon this restaurant back in 2017, and had such a delicious experience. It gets quite busy, but luckily there were a few outdoor seating options. You do dine on a bit of an incline, but it's that big of a deal from what i remember. The service was also quite lovely.
author: Stacy W.

description:
A wonderful brunch option! A menu with two pages of delicious modern updates to classic breakfast fare (read: eight or so delicious benedicts and half a page of scrumptious scrambles). We ordered the MOT sausage burger and the 6hr corned beef hash. The sausage burger had these mushrooms (I'm guessing MOT stands for mushrooms on top??) that were just so delicious. The corned beef hash came with two poached eggs and lemon dill hollandaise. That hollandaise was divine. 

The only thing I didn't like as much was that both dishes came with a lot of potatoes (makes sense for the hash). Good for people who like more food (read: LARGE portions), but not so great for people like me and my friend who don't too much like breakfast potatoes.

Great coffee too! Would highly recommend. I'll return the next time I'm in town for one of the benedicts.
author: Weian W.

description: There is always a wait but it moves fast! This is the place for Sunday brunch hands down in the city. I had the lemon ricotta soufflé pancakes a MUST try. You've never had anything like it!!
author: Christy S.

description:
I used to come here all the time for the Marscapone French toast.. the yummiest brunch! Then they got rid of it as they change their menus every now and then.. the new French toast is good, too, and so are all of the scrambles I've had.. 

PS, if they have the zucchini pancakes -- you MUST try those!
author: Alyssa H.

description: First time here while visiting San Fran and I wish they would open a location back In mass, for the Baja benny and it was amazing, the crab/shrimp combo is out of this world!!
author: Lenny M.

description:
My group loved it here! It took a bit to be seated but that's only because we had a party of 6. 

Easily the best eggs benedict we've found in SF, plus they serve awesome hash browns.
author: Mandi W.

description:
I finally went here for brunch after walking past every day for over a year. 

I was blown away! 

Their service was amazing. They do not take reservations, nor do they have a waiting list. Instead, they have a line. Somehow, these hostesses/waiters are quick and smart enough to manage it all. It felt fair, and I was served very quickly. I was first in line, but my party wasn't there yet. One waitress came up multiple times letting me know to flag her down when my party arrived. She also gave me regular updates on how long "my" table would take. Bless her heart! 

The food was AMAZING and delivered piping hot and promptly (didn't even wait ten minutes!) I had the brussels and bacon tartine. The portions were perfect and the brussels were nice and crispy. I honestly would have paid way more for that service and meal! 

I will totally be back!
author: Randa A.

description:
Oh yes....the best breakfast at a tiny nothing looking restaurant....the Best!
I cannot wait to go back to SF to eat here again!!!
author: Rosanne B.

description: I have to say this one the best breakfast place I've ever eaten at and I'm from Vegas. I had the Parma eggs Benedict and my son had the blueberry/banana pancakes. Omg it was amazing!!! So much flavor! Pancakes were huge! Mimosas were amazing as well. Will definitely visit again on my next trip.
author: Kathy M.

description:
This brunch place has a great balance between sweet and savory dishes.  I came on a weekday a noon to avoid the wait associated with weekend brunching in the city, and surprisingly found that 80% of the tables were full.  Service was a bit slow (taking our orders, food arriving, and bringing our check), but we weren't in much of a hurry.  I imagine the service on the weekend would be even more sluggish and impersonal with big crowds and a line out the door. Overall, good cozy family-owned ambiance on a nice street corner with indoor and outdoor seating. 

BLT Benedict 5/5: YUM! Super impressed with this.  The crispy paper thin hash brown covered the entire plate, and it made the perfect crunch to potato ratio.  The ham over sourdough was juicy and runny with egg, and really savory and rich without being super salty.  This was a great plate because it's pretty unique and doesn't feel like something you could cook at home for breakfast.  

Banana Blueberry Souffle Pancake 3.5/5:  I'm glad I tried this, but I would pass on it next time.  This pancake literally feels like you're eating a fluffy (but bland) egg sandwiched thinly by normal pancake batter.  The blueberries were few and far between, and I didn't really taste any banana.  It was an interesting attempt at combining the traditional dessert souffle into a dish to make it relevant for brunch, but I would have preferred a regular stack of fruity pancakes instead.

Would I come back? Yup, but preemptively knowing to expect a wait.  Maybe I'll spring for weekday brunches instead of the weekend to avoid the rush. I would definitely go again just to get their different types of Benedicts.
author: Kathy T.

description: I just have to say this was probably my favorite stop in San Francisco.  This is a small spot and luckily wasn't busy when we got there. My girlfriend had a salmon eggs Benedict and I ordered the chorizo jalapeño Tartine.  Boy, did I enjoy this breakfast! I cleaned my plate. It was not too spicy at all and the potatoes are delicious.  Since I'm allergic to fish, the most I can say is that she really enjoyed her food.  Also there was a table of 5 next to us that all ordered the salmon eggs Benedict so I guess I'm missing out. Table next to us was talking about how good the lemon ricotta pancakes were so I'll certainly come back. Service was quick.  Food didn't take long at all. Staff was friendly and are apparently Thai since my girlfriend can understand it. I guess that's a fun fact. Anyway, I'd highly recommend this place to anyone.
author: Francis N.

description: Wow I love this place. The salmon fortine the best breakfast in the city. I'm highly recommend this place
author: Denys V.

description:
This place was soooo gooooood!! Had this bookmarked in forever but never got around to it esp with a kid. But since we had court that morning (don't ask) without our kid, I suggested trying out Mymy. We got here around 11 and luckily there was no wait. 

I order the salmon tartine and my husband ordered the crab/shrimp benedict. Love the fact that they give you cups and a carrafe for water do you don't have to keep bothering them for a refill.

Food came shortly after and OMG. My smoked salmon tartine was absolutely delicious! The salmon was super soft and buttery, easy to break off and super awesome with the light fluffy omelette. Bonus was the avocado. I love avocado so I might be a little biased there. But it compliments it well.

Tried my husband's lemon dill crab/shrimp cake Benedict. Out of this world! Lol. Super flavorful and omg lol. The yolk was perfect! The yolk was runny enough so that the crab/shrimp cake soaks it up. *Drool*

At first I thought the plates were small but we couldn't even finish out food. The potatoes that came with our dishes was super crispy and really good. I couldn't finish my plate at all.

If we're ever in the area... Not the wkend.. we will definitely come back. It's a small restaurant but service is quick and friendly and food is A++++++++
author: Fiona T.

description:
Note: They won't seat you until your whole party is there. 

Came on MLK at 12 with a group of 4, and the line went fairly quickly. Food was great, as well as the service. 

Ordered: 

Salmon Tartine - Basically avocado, smoked salmon, eggs, and cream cheese over an english muffin with a side of potato wedges. Potatoes were crisp and meaty, and the salmon was good. Perhaps a bit too much of cream cheese for me, but otherwise the ingredients were fresh and prepared with care.

Corned Beef - Chunks of actual tender beef (not that ground up canned shit) with two poached eggs and a side of potato wedges and toast. Delicious. I would order this next time! 

Blueberry Banana Pancakes - The husband only ate the inside of these pancakes. The inside was stuffed with an egg white souffle and portions were pretty generous. Definitely for those with a sweet tooth and an appetite. Texture-wise, everything was a bit to mushy for me and too sweet. Not to say there was anything wrong with the food or the taste, just wasn't for us. 

Overall, yes I'd come back. There's enough on the menu to keep me coming back for more! They also had no problems with us bringing in Contraband Coffee from next door.
author: Michelle C.

description: Wow! Great brunch! I thought we were walking into a divey diner type place and was a little concerned. The food stood on its own merits. Everything was so fresh and fucking delicious. Especially the breakfast potatoes. And also especially the homemade hollandaise. And also especially the bread. Oh and the coffee! and... and... and... you get the picture. Would totally eat here again.
author: Sara H.

description:
One of the best brunch/breakfast spots I've been to in San Francisco. We were a group of 5 and every one of our brunch dishes was fabulous. Highly recommend the Tex mex eggs and the harvest omelette. You can taste the freshness of their ingredients. Also love that they serve carafes of mimosas (choose from orange juice or grapefruit).
And their hash browns are awesome so definitely get them! Can't wait to go back here again!!
author: Trips R.

description:
What can I say that hasn't already been said before, this place is the BOMB. Tiny little restaurant, focus on great food, huge proportions, and fast service. You will definitely see a line out the door on a weekend but its WORTH IT and this is coming from a girl who has zero patience and gets from hunger to hangry in a matter of seconds. 

One of my girlfriends ordered the spicy pop pork scramble and put it DOWN. I ordered the tex-mex scramble without chorizo or cheese and it was SOOOOO good. Everything you dream about and want in breakfast, this was it: hearty, flavorful, and fast. 

I don't think you should come here on a weekend if you're trying to sit at the table for a long time and enjoy each other's company. I think you come here if you are hungry for some amazing food, you want your food fast, and you're willing to get up and get moving fast. I would recommend going for a nice walk through the city afterwards to digest the meal.

Yum, would come here again, and again, and again, and again.
author: Nadia R.

description:
Brunch review. 

Blt benedict - 2/5
Lemon ricotta pancake - 2/5 - Not a fan of this fluffy style. Griddle fresh does the same thing. Too light and airy. Much prefer the plow style. 

They did have very good, attentive service though.

Overall, "I've experienced better."
author: Mark O.

description: The eggs Benedict with crab cake and lemon dill sauce are superb.  The crab cakes are perfectly breaded and fried, enhancing the crab flavor to where it's perhaps the best crab I've ever tasted.  The accompanying potatoes are delicious; they seem to come with every dish and they are spectacularly unique.  The pistachio latte is so creamy and rich it tastes like gelato.  The service is prompt, polite and friendly.  There is always a line, but it moves fast.  I will come back when I'm in the area.
author: Zeus M.

description:
We got here and we're told we'd have to wait an hour but we actually didn't have to wait that long because most people on the waiting list ended up leaving. 

I got the lemon ricotta soufflé pancakes and they were so good. The lemon flavor balances out the sweetness and the pancakes were so fluffy. I wish there was a bit more lemon flavor though.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
The next time I come to San Francisco, I would seek this place out. I'd pretty much plan my trip around having brunch there. 

After a failed attempt to go to the "Red Door Cafe", which I think somewhat epitomizes San Francisco, we ended up this place right around the corner. 

Well, they got the name right! MY MY "MYMY"! 

1. I got the: Baja California Benedict garlic sautéed shrimp, pickled red onion, avocado, roasted bell pepper jalapeno hollandaise.  It was CLIGGIDY CLUTCH CLUTCH CLUTCH. Shrimp cooked perfectly. Red pepper hollandaise was fantastic. The balance of the whole dish was like the crazy guy who walked tight rope across the Grand Canyon. 

Also, can we talk about their hash browns? Their hash browns are the thickness of 4 credit cards stacked together.  They are thin! Which allows them to be super crispy throughout the entire... brown? Both sides! SO GOOD! 

2. Chorizo Jalapeno Tartine pepper jack scramble, chorizo and roasted jalapeno relish, chipotle aioli and toasted boule. with crispy wedges. This was fantastic. A really nice vibrant dish that I would probably order the second time I go there. 

4. 6 Hours Corned Beef Hash big chunk juicy corned beef brisket, onion, bell pepper, red potatoes, lemon dill, two eggs poach with toast. with crispy wedges. I have to be honest here.  I thought the corned beef tasted a little.. off. I'm not sure what it was... but it just wasn't what I think of to be corned beef. 

5. Lemon Ricotta Pancake: All of my patrons were rejoicing at how light and fluffy it was.  Again, I have to be honest- I'd rather it be a little bit denser.  It resembled more of a souffle to me than a pancake.  And I didn't really taste a heavy ricotta or lemon flavor.  I wanted it to be a little bit more of both.  

All proteins were cooked very well.  All dishes were flavorful and well presented. I can't wait to go back, they certainly know what they're doing.
author: Mike B.

description: The crab eggs Benedict was great. All the potatoes were well done (as all potatoes should be) and bacon was crispy. I was with someone that got the zucchini ricotta pancakes. She was skeptical but she loves them.
author: Joshua S.

description:
This looks like a spot where you would get a discount if you showed them your AARP card but do not let that deter you from putting your name on the clipboard up front. This place is breakfast times 100.

+ Lemon Ricotta Pancakes - Stacks on Stacks on Stacks. I've never had a fluffier or lighter pancake. The ricotta is actually stuffed inside the pancake and has a slightly tangy citrus taste that complements the berry compote well. Totally worth throwing your paleo diet out of the window.

+ 6 Hours Corned Beef Hash - Eat your heart out Hormel! Made with huge, juicy chunks of beef brisket this is nothing like the mushy canned stuff you've had your entire life. The best part is it's served with potato chunks, fried potato wedges, AND toast. To top it off? Two poached eggs. Life literally does not get better than this.

Prices were in the IHOP range but the food quality was very high. Service was quick and efficient. Don't miss out on this sleeper!
author: Kimberly S.

description: Awesome food!! I had the crab and shrimp Benedict and they gave plenty of shrimp and crab. It was real crab too. Tasted delicious. I wasn't a big fan of the pickled onions and the hollandaise was just ok. Great and fast service.
author: Kalkidan A.

description: Such a yummy breakfast spot. It's a bit small inside but they get you your food fast. Nice service, but the food is where they win. Try the lemon dill crab cake Benedict. Skip the avocado toast. 10/10 would go again!
author: Scarlette T.

description:
Wow this place is yummy... Come early cuz it get pack..!! Street parking only !! Right locate on cable car line too..
I ordered the BLT benediction with side order of avocado.. Which I had to remind them.. Hmmm
And corn beef hash..6 hours cooked corn beef nice n chunky ... 
But must come back  n try other items on the mouth watering menu lol.. And bring $$$$$. Cuz the way I order with group of friends...would be a expensive breakfast lol...
author: Crisy G.

description: The BEST brunch I've had. Worth the 45 minute wait. Specifically the Baja California Benedict: Fresh dungeons Crab, garlic sautéed shrimp, poached eggs, pickled red onion, avocado, roasted jalapeño & red bell pepper hollandaise + substitute fresh fruit (no crispy potatoes) + #GrapeFruitMimosa  #GirlsWeekend #sanfrancisco #mymy  Group Also ordered: French Toast,  Frisch Scramble, Pulled Pork Scramble, Tex Mex Chorizo, & Crab Cake Benedict and recommend them, too!
author: Leslie S.

description:
My sister and I visited mymy during our stay in SF. It was a quick walk from our hotel and located near all sorts of transportation stops. We went one morning during the week and had no wait. The staff was supremely pleasant and attentive. We ordered the lemon souffle pancakes, corned beef hash, match tea latte and some other latte that is escaping my mind. Anyway, here's what we thought:

Lemon Souffle Pancakes: Super unique! It had good flavor, but at times tasted a bit like lemon eggs - likely because it's an egg heavy batter. 

Corned Beef Hash: Delicious. I cleaned my plate. I would definitely recommend this. 

Lattes: Both were quite tasty even though i can't remember the one I had. My sister really enjoyed her green tea. 

Overall: Nice experience and reasonably priced.
author: Danielle W.

description:
Came here on a Sunday for brunch, expected wait of an hour, but ended up getting seated in less than 20 minutes. 

I wanted to try a different brunch place in the city, and found this place!
Food selection is very typical of any cafe, but their portions are decently sized and tasted pretty good. 

I ordered the chive pancakes with egg, interesting combination but overall good. Would recommend the benedicts next time. Staff is really kind too, though they do have some sass and attitude if you listen carefully. 

I'm giving it 3 stars because there are better places in the city, Griddle Fresh's hashbrowns are superior. Give it a shot, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come back here.
author: Brian L.

description: I got the lemon soufflé pancakes and was very excited to try them.... very disappointed. They would of been better just as a regular lemon pancake minus the soufflé. It tasted like a giant bite of egg whites every bite I took. We also got the egg breakfast, the potatoes were really good and the bacon we asked for extra crispy was also very good. I tried a matcha latte which are my favorite everywhere I go and this one was sooo sweet it wasn't very enjoyable and the cup was half filled. I had high hopes for this place and it was definitely a let down. Won't be coming back.
author: Lauren F.

description: What a find! One of the bestt meals we had during our long weekend in SF. I ordered the banana souffle pancakes with mascarpone and creme anglais, topped with a grilled banana and toasted walnuts....need I say more? It was delicious! My husband and son both ordered one of the scrambles which they thoroughly enjoyed. My son's girlfriend ordered the BLT Benedict and she said it was just perfect.Now let's talk about those potatoes...OMG! The potatoes were crunchy on the inside and cooked nicely on the inside. They were so good. Wish we had a place like this in So. California. This place is a gem.
author: Prizilla C.

description:
Ehh it was alright, nothing wrong with the food, but noting that memorable or wow-factor involved about it either.

Customer service here seems efficient here. As the line starts up outside, the lady keeps track of you and your party pretty well, you won't be forgotten. I recommend coming in a party of two and you'll be seated pretty quickly. It's not in the order of the line, it's all based on your party size and if all of your party is there.

I ordered the 6 hr. corn beef hash which came with two pieces of toast, some fried potato wedges, two poached eggs with  a basil dill sauce over a corned beef hash. The toast had burnt sides and I could taste it even with a good amount of raspberry jam. The eggs were poached nicely but my friend said the whites tasted like plastic to her or just lacked flavor. The sauce was really light but I'm not a big fan of dill. The corn beef hash consisted of shredded meat, red bell peppers, and onions with a bit of a pickled flavor to it. The potatoes were very over fried so there wasn't enough potato. It felt like pure crunch of oil which is not pleasant. It definitely had that good crunch texture though.

My friend order the blueberry banana pancakes. It comes as a short stack and the to one was just dark enough to have a burnt aftertaste. The walnuts were sticky but they could have used some more candying. I really liked their maple syrup and the lemon curd sauce but there just wasn't enough of it. It seemed like it was more for presentation but I would have loved a whole cup to pour over the pancakes like a syrup.

For the lines that are always out the door, I expected more. Not sure if I'll try something else from here.
author: Laura Y.

description: Absolutely delicious best place I've eaten so far in San Francisco not expensive I recommend the Mambo Italiano scramble
author: Ross L.

description: I decided to walk to this place from my hotel.  The doorman at our hotel was surprised I was going to walk.  It was a chilly morning, however the sun was out and I had my sweater and scarf.  The distance was about one mile away.  The only downside I forgot to consider was all the hills in SF.  Once I got to Mymy, I was a little sweaty, but I had earned the calories I was going to consume.  I usually go for sweets, but decided to try the lemon dill crab/shrimp cake benedict.  The dish was very large, two slices of english muffins with spinach, the cakes, nicely poached eggs and a lemony dill hollandaise sauce.  It came with a layer of hash browns, toasted very thinly, it was almost like a cracker.  I wanted to try the lemon ricotta pancakes, but they don't offer a single one.  I guess I have to come back another time.  Service was prompt and friendly.  This place is worth the walk.
author: Marisa S.

description:
Hearty breakfast choices and and diverse brunch menu contribute to the high rating here. Can't say much that hasn't been mentioned already. 

The do lose a star for service, I'm not sure if the staff was complacent because we were sitting outside or because the restaurant was slow that morning but they messed up our order a couple times and forgot about our table for 15-20 mins after we ate.
author: Sam C.

description: Grab a coffee (or spiced mocha) at Contraband next door while you wait in line and ogle at the incredible dishes. The Baja California Benedict is out of this world - fresh crab, avocado, and shrimp. Great service and food. Will be back!
author: Sarah U.

description:
Scrumptious! So lucky (maybe not so much for my bank account) that this spot is just around the corner from me. The only reason I took off a star is because it literally always has a line - ALWAYS. Even today, on a Tuesday morning (regular work day) at 11.30 am when I swung by to pick up some coffee to-go, somehow there are STILL people lining up outside for brunch. (Side note: who are you people and how do I sign up for your jobs?)

I've tried a bunch of the stuff here that are all great - Spicy Pork Scramble (think this one is new to the menu), Parma Flavor Benedict, Crab Cake Benedict, Tex-Mex Scramble, Banana Souffle Pancakes (you've GOTTA try this if you have a sweet tooth like I do), and last but not least, my favorite, the Pistachio Latte. It might just be my favorite coffee ever. Smooth, mildly flavored with roasted pistachios and hella delicious.

Disclaimer: I got the Red Velvet Latte to-go today, and while it wasn't bad, I didn't really love it. The pistachio one is still my fave!
author: ND S.

description:
This is the BEST breakfast place ever!!!!! There were four of us at 9:30am and we waited only ten minutes before we were seated. Coffee and carafe of mimosas delivered promptly. Order taken and food arrived really fast. French toast and side of crispy breakfast potatoes were the best I have ever had. We all loved our food... egg dishes looked amazing. Service is very good. We will definitely be back. 
Went back today, New Year's Day and it was great again! Bloody Mary's and blt Benedict's and Baja Benedict. Super good. Excellent service and 100% consistent with their food.
author: Veronica L.

description:
Atmosphere is great, especially when outside on a warm day. Food wise -- benediction is the way to go. I got the smoked salmon eggs benedict and loved it. The boyfriend got benedict with prosciutto i believe which was also delicious. the hash browns are really unique!

Wait times are a bit long since the place is popular. Even by 2pm there are still giant crowds. We decided to give it a go and put our name down around 11am. We walked around for 45m and came back, and with some very lucky timing were called to our table shortly.

Even though I live nearby I don't see myself going too often simply because of the wait. Olea across the street is another great option as the lines tend to be shorter there.
author: Elisa L.

description:
Mymy is a super-tiny restaurant.  The seating area is in an L-shape, and everything is crammed pretty tight.

I visited for brunch and had the French toast.  It was definitely light and fluffy, but it didn't blow my mind.

I struggle with rating brunch places because every brunch item tastes exactly the same to me in 85% of restaurants.  But whatever.  The French toast was pretty good.

Staff seemed surly.
author: Ben B.

description:
Came here for our last breakfast in San Fran. Being an eggs benedict fan, I wanted to see how different the ones in San Fran were compared to Hawaii. I was not impressed with the ones here at Mymy. 

We got the Parma which is the one with prociutto cuz oh I love prociutto! Another one was the Norwegian which is the one with smoked salmon. The smoked salmon itself was tasty and good. Overall both benedict were not something I'd come back here for again. The yolk was over cooked, there wasn't enough hollandaise sauce, and the English muffins were so soggy that it was hard to cut through. I don't know why the English muffins were so soggy when there was such little hollandaise. It was just really hard to eat. We didn't even finish them. 

The service on the other hand was pretty good, considering how busy they were. We waited about 15 min in line, but after we got in the line got even longer. They did periodically check on us and all of them seemed pretty friendly.
author: Ann S.

description:
This place has great food and really friendly service! My friend and I stopped by before leaving San Francisco. We had our giant suitcases with us and they were amazing about accommodating us, sitting us near the front so we could be near our bags! I don't know about you, but above and beyond service like that on top of delicious food deserves 5 stars. The wait wasn't that long either! 

I ordered a mocha and the cornbeef hash. They mixed up my drink order and brought me a latte, but they noticed and offered to make me a new drink (I declined just because the latte was good and I'm not picky with my drinks). The cornbeef hash was very good! 
My friend ordered a cappuccino and the lemon pancakes. The pancakes are a must if you go! I had some of hers, and they were absolutely amazing! Just the right amount of sweet! 

Between the service and the food I would recommend going here for brunch if you're in San Francisco.
author: Lisa H.

description: SO GOOD. My friend and I came on Memorial Day at around 11:45. We waited in a long line, and to our surprise got seated after making it only halfway through the line! I guess it was because we only had a party of two, and the other people in line had bigger parties, but t was a nice surprise to be seated so fast. The service was very good and speedy. The food was absolutely amazing. I had the salmon rotolone tartine and it was probably one of the best breakfasts I've ever had. Ever. There were so many flavors to it and it was just so delicious. My friend got the lemon ricotta pancakes which were also amazing. They tasted like lemon bars, but they were fluffy and not overly sweet! Definitely will be back.
author: H K.

description:
I came with two other people on a Saturday morning around 10 AM and surprisingly the wait was really short ~20 minutes. We ordered three plates to share: a tex mex scramble, a crab cake benedict, and a banana blueberry souffle pancake. The tex mex scramble was my favorite. It had a little spice to it, which I really enjoyed. The crab cake benedict was really good too. I thought it was quite unique because I've never seen it on a brunch menu before! The pancakes were a little too sweet for me, hence it was perfect as a sharing item. 

-Kristen

4 stars for Kristen. Edmund wasn't here to rate.
author: Kristen L.

description:
TL;DR - Better than a diner, but I wouldn't wait more than 15 minutes in line.

Been here twice and the food has always been decent. Price to portion, its a good amount of food for what you pay. 

Its not like foreign cinema or bar tartine for brunch, but its a more comfort food kinda place.
author: Crystal Z.

description:
This place was very delicious and the wait was definitely manageable. I recently moved back to the Bay and I've notices that it's normal to stand in line for over an hour for good brunch on the weekend, like when did that happen? So to find a really good place that has a much shorter wait I consider a win and it definitely deserves 5 stars for that reason. 

It's a small place inside with some outside seating. The decorations are very homey and their menu has lots of eggs benedicts. I got a tex mex, which was a super delicious omelette with sooo much avocado on top. Oh how much i missed california for it's abundance of avocados. Te only thing I would critique is their coffee, but I came for the food and not the drinks and was very satisfied.
author: Dasha K.

description: Hands down to one of the best brunches I had in life. Waiting line was a bit too big, but food wise every second was worth it.
author: Isadora K.

description: This place did not disappoint! Don't be intimidated by the line, we were about 20 people back in line and were a party of 4, we were sat within 20-30 minutes. And the food is worth the wait! Once seated, food came out fast! The employees here have a great system and are extremely effective in getting the food out fast and hot. Will definitely be returning in the future!
author: Jasmine M.

description: Seriously amazingly delicious breakfast food. The fluffiest pancakes EVER. Delicious crispy on the outside and extremely tender on the inside potatoes. What else did we have (me plus 3 of my friends).. a delicious breakfast burger, homemade (! that's important, not store bought!) tortillas that came with very delicious carnitas. Basically, everything we got was very good and had it's own interesting twist to it. Highly recommend! Also, come early for breakfast, otherwise you'll have to wait in a long line.
author: Halyna H.

description:
In standard San Francisco fashion, be ready for a long wait! I went with a large group of ~9 and we were seated in around 1-1.5 hours on a Saturday morning. Would say this is definitely one of my favorite brunch spots in the city

Ambiance: Surrounding area is pretty nice (Contraband coffee next door, Olea across the street, Trader Joes a block away) and there's some outdoor seating as well. I didn't see the inside but if it's a sunny day would recommend the outdoor area!
Service: The wait is long but servers are pretty quick and accommodating for large parties
Food: We had a few pitchers of the mimosas and I would definitely recommend as some of the freshest in town. I ordered the florentine benedict and the eggs were perfect!
author: Taryn Q.

description: Came here for brunch today and the food was so delicious! At about 12:45 we waited in line for probably 20 minutes until a table became available outside so I never ended up stepping foot in the actual restaurant. Cute seating along California street to see people passing by. To start, my friend and I ordered the carafe of mimosas, grapefruit juice, for $19. Pretty light on the actual juice but it's the way to go as a single mimosa is $8 and the carafe gives you probably 2.5 mimosas each. For my meal, I ordered the Norwegian benedict and my friend ordered the Texas scramble. My benedict was $15 and came and they did not skimp on the salmon. Also, the hollandaise sauce (ordered the one side) was super tasty. However what I will be dreaming about are the breakfast potatoes which is not something I've ever said... they are to absolutely die for. I'm not sure if they are double-fried or what they did from potato to plate but they were so crispy and delicious. If you sub the fruit for $2 you are making a huge mistake. I'll 100% be coming back here again soon to try some of their other tasty-look brunch dishes.
author: Aryn C.

description:
Came here with my friend after receiving a raving recommendation from my friend Connie B. regarding how awesome their pancakes were. 

Located on the corner of California street, parking is mainly meters. Came here on a weekday for brunch and the place was pretty packed. Although we didn't really have to wait long.

I'm not a big pancake eater, but saw lots of people order their ricotta/soufflé pancake? It looked delicious. So did their omelettes

 I ended up ordering their corn beef hash with crispy potatoes and two poach eggs. Overall I was very happy with my choice. The potatoes were crispy, nicely seasoned, very tasty. The eggs were perfectly poach and provided that awesome egg yolk porn that some people look for. The corn beef could've used more a little more pizzaz, but flavors were rich and deep. Only wished that there were more corn beef and less potato.

I would definitely recommend coming back here. My friend raved about their benedicts and for SF standards, prices are totally reasonable and the wait not too long. Also, contraband coffee is literally around the corner, so score!
author: Diane T.

description:
Five star pancakes.  This is coming from someone who usually opt for the protein or fruit in the morning.  The soufflé pancakes are amazing and do not leave you feeling as if you ate a plate of batter.

Minus 1 star for the scramble which was merely average.  Go early for immediate seating or late to line up and enjoy waving at the people passing by on the cable cars.
author: Amy J.

description:
OMG! OMG! I love this place so much. The Pistachio Latte is on point and taste exactly like pistachio. So delicious!

The first time I came here, I ordered the Lemon Ricotta Soufflé pancakes and boy was it what everyone hyped it up to be. A pretty generous portion with some fresh fruit. Drooling just thinking about it. Boyfriend ordered the omelette with some type of cheese and bacon, and that was delicious, too!

The second time, I ordered the Lemon Dill Crab Cake Benedict and my oh my (pun intended) was it delicious. The egg was perfectly cooked and oozed right out when I dove into my benedict. The potatoes are soooooo good! Boyfriend kept picking at mine; I don't blame him, it's the best I've ever had! 

They don't take reservations and you do have to wait in line. Both times, we didn't wait too long and both were on a Sunday morning when good breakfast is mandatory after a long crazy night! Ha.
author: Shela D.

description: Best brunch place in the city!! All of their food is so good! I wish they would move to a bigger location!!! The Tex mex scramble is the best!!!! And the soufflé pancake!
author: Danielle B.

description: Came here for brunch with some friends. There was a line out the door, which is typical for San Francisco, but it moved pretty quickly. This is a solid brunch place with great portions, especially for SF, and reasonable prices.
