Our group ordered the crab cake benny, tex mex scramble, dungeness crab benny, banana souffle pancakes, and a build your own egg white scramble. All were delicious, but our favorites were the tex mex scramble and banana souffle pancakes by far.
author: Adriane L.

description: I've been wanting to check this place out. I'll start by saying I was beyond annoyed that they didn't do regular pancakes. They make either zucchini or fancy banana but no plain. It was weird. Server suggested I order the Mymy special: two eggs, bacon, potatoes and TWO zucchini pancakes. OMG!!!! It was amazing. Best pancakes I'v had in a long time.  They were delicious! And I'll add that I'm usually down to try new things, however, this was Injust wanted plain stuff. Glad it turned out completely opposite. Go eat here. It's amazing AND good good, damn good coffee.
author: Eva B.

description:
Oh MyMy God! The hype does not justify the food nor the experience. I understand San Francisco is over saturated and lines are inevitable, thus we waited in one. After about a 45 min wait, we were seated at the speed of light and were expected to order instantly. The server was extremely rude (maybe she had a bad day), but after a 45 min wait, it's the last thing a customer wants. 

Besides all of that, they were not accommodating on some very simple requests 
Me: "May I have the bacon on my bacon burger on the side?"
Answer: "No"

Not to be picky, but our food finally arrives and it is DRENCHED in oil. We paid the bill and actually walked out of there without even touching our food.

There are far too many friendly, tasty and accommodating spots than to deal with such service.
author: Tarun P.

description:
Sunday brunch for 2- 10am- 35 minute wait

Parma-Flavored Eggs Benedict ($14) comes with prosciutto, poached eggs, roasted tomatoes, grilled asparagus, and crispy hash browns. Love the saltyness of the prosciutto and the perfectly poached egg makes every bite taste smooth and creamy. FYI- the benedict bread is not an English muffin

Service is friendly but they are sticklers for not seating you until your entire party is present which is completely fair considering there are many other present parties eagerly waiting to be seated.
author: Lauren K.

description:
Like most brunch spots in San Francisco, you'll probably have to wait, but this one is among the best. As several signs outside will remind you, there is no physical waitlist here. Customers line up along the curb to be seated. Every time I've gone has been a bit past the rush and the wait has never been crazy.

Everything is super well done and tastes really fresh. Their eggs benedict are some of the best I've had. The potatoes are the perfect kind of crispy and not oily. I highly recommend the freshly squeezed juices.

If you're a smaller party, don't shy away from the bar seats along the window. They're really cozy and roomy, with the added bonus of people watching.
author: Allison F.

description: Banana pancakes were SO poofy, hearty, and delicious! Speedy service, everyone's dish was inta-worthy, and the red velvet latte was basically cake in a cup. Would definitely go back!!
author: Nicole S.

description:
Yummy. I understand why this place gets high reviews... It's good grub. It's always busy so plan on waiting for a table and try to sit outside in a warm day, it's beautiful and quant. 

Lemon pancakes were good and the standard bacon, eggs and hash browns were very good. I really liked the crispy hash browns. 

We will return.
author: Deano G.

description: This brunch spot is a go-to for anyone with a savory or sweet craving. We arrived to a full restaurant but we only had to wait 5-10 minutes for a table to open up for our party of three. Luckily for us, we were waiting with a lovely family with an adorable bulldog ...this place has outdoor seating that is dog friendly! Once inside, we ordered iced tea and a dirty chai whilst we looked over the menu. The iced tea wasn't flavorful but the dirty chai was delicious. The ambiance was the perfect level of loud for a friendly diner experience. We ordered zucchini pancakes, Tex Mex and the corned beef hash. The serving sizes were hearty and the food delicious. We LOVE a crispy bacon and potatoes! Plus it came quickly to boot! Overall a wonderful dining experience. The service was friendly and relatively attentive. It took a couple hand waves to get the waiter to give us our check, but we won't hold that against him. Cheers!
author: Sarah V.

description:
The HIGHLIGHT of our SF visit! Totally worth the (20-30 min) wait for brunch. Just a simple, casual space with amazing food.

Lemon dill crab shrimp eggs benedict was delicious! Love the green sauce in place of hollandaise. It was light, creamy, tangy. Hash browns were so crispy. One of the eggs was over poached and I wish the muffins were a tiny bit less chewy but the rest of it was really good. Presentation was also beautiful!

Banana blueberry souffle pancakes were incredibly tasty as well. The combination of the fluffy pancakes, crunchy walnuts, sweet velvety syrup was amazing.

Go get in the line :)
author: Vanessa N.

description:
Ordered
-Lemon Dill crab cake benedict: Came with potatoes that were fried (not hash browns). Great flavor. Egg yolk was runny enough for a snapchat but not too runny if that makes sense.
-hot coffee: fair
-Bloody Mary: strong, def felt tipsy 

Service
-long line wraps around the corner but it moves fast.
-service was great, we got our food fast and the coffee was always filled to the top

The only reason I'm not giving it five stars is because I didn't feel good afterwards. Most likely because the crab cakes were fried as well as the potatoes
author: Joy M.

description:
Wow, this place is ridiculously delicious. My friends and I came here Sunday for brunch. Our party of 6 only had to wait 30 mins. The turn around time here was pretty quick so I can appreciate that. The place is small but has both indoor and outdoor seating. Service was friendly and efficient. 

The food left our tummies full and happy. They truly have something for everyone. Whether you're craving a sweet or savory breakfast, this restaurant does not disappoint. We ordered a big variety of dishes but my favorites were the soufflé pancakes. Blueberry and lemon were amazing. It was light and fluffy and the soufflé in the middle of each pancake was a pleasant surprise. The soufflé pancakes are an absolute must!! I loved it sooooooo much! Their benedictions were very good and I had the smoked salmon Benedict with capers. Loved that their hash browns were thin and extra crispy :) 

Each dish was $15 on average. Big portions and good quality. I can't wait to come back and try the other items on their menu.
author: Lynn V.

description: Amazing! The wait is well worth it. Everything on the menu is great. The pancakes are to die for. A must try.
author: Leila H.

description:
DO NOT believe the hype of this place. Will never go back. First off, want to preface with saying that I give everyone a fair chance and do not write or give bad reviews for "no good" reason without careful thought or out of spite. Second, I was in the restaurant business for 15 years, as a server and manager, so I totally get it that it is extremely hard to pull off and implement an establishment with care and ease with great service, good value, and decent ambiance - this place does none of these.

We came at about 2pm about 30 min before they closed and waited in line for about 15 minutes, which was fine. Once seated the servers all walk around and are not assigned specific tables. It's haphazard and disorganized. They are not friendly and are borderline rude. My biggest complaint overall is that the whole experience was extremely RUSHED - from beginning to end. 

The food was mediocre, at best. The Baja Benedict was cold. The eggs must have been pre-cooked and they were awful. The potatoes were hard, cold, and had probably been cooked hours before. For $20 I would expect care would be given to this dish. It tasted bland. The blueberry souffle pancakes tasted like something from a bulk box - and the syrup tasted the same - something you buy in bulk from Costco. 

Ordered a cappuccino, and she said "wait", came back and said "NO" we already cleaned it. What kind of establishment cleans their machine before they close down? Ordered a house coffee and again, it was cold and tasted burnt, like it had been sitting on the burner. The server who I informed this to, rudely grabbed the cup from me, grunted, and did not apologize. Brought another cup again and it tasted like it had been nuked. Bad. 

During service, the food was auctioned off. Any decent establishment will assign each seat as a number, so that whomever is delivering food, will know whom it belongs too. Not good. During service, also no one checked back with us to see if our meal was satisfactory. Not once were we checked back upon - only to drop the check - BEFORE we were done. 

We were one of the last tables to leave and the servers were rushing around trying to get everyone to sign their checks and one server checked several times to see if we had signed. They closed the blinds and started sweeping the floors around us. Rushing, rushing, rushing - to get everyone out of there. 

Overall experience. Rushed. Impersonal. Mediocre. Unpolished.
author: Paul O.

description: Best pancakes ever! I had the banana soufflé pancakes and they were delicious. The crispy potatoes were fantastic too. I only wish I could have shared my breakfast with someone. It was too much for one person,but I really wanted to try both the pancakes and the potatoes. No regrets! They were both worth it. Nice little seating section outside for a beautiful San Francisco day!
author: J A.

description: Very very good! The dishes were unexpectedly delicious. By the looks and the presentation of the restaurant I didn't expect the food to be so tasty. Food tastes as if it came out of a fancy brunch spot. Their scrambled egg meddled perfectly with all the ingredients. Their zucchini ricotta pancakes were so amazing. And the salad was perfect
author: Joling S.

description:
Came here on a rainy Friday afternoon and there was no line (yay). My experience was meh. If I knew "soufflé" pancakes really just meant thin pancakes with a crapload of egg whites in the middle, I wouldn't have ordered the popular lemon ricotta soufflé pancakes. The plate I received looked nothing like the other photos that were posted here about year ago. Also didn't appreciated them putting the butter on top of the fruit. Why not put it on top of the pancakes? I couldn't eat more than 1/4 of it because it was too overwhelming - I have to boycott egg for awhile now. Good thing my husband inhales anything and finished it for me while I ate his potatoes. He had the MOT burger, which was much better but nothing to write home about. 

Tried it, not impressed, over it. I think I would have enjoyed the french toast more, but I couldn't justify paying $13 for a single slice of thick toast. What a shame!
author: Mei H.

description: Not the same as it use to be. We come here for the soufflé but it was dense and not light and fluffy anymore. They use to serve flat crispy hash browns but that's no longer an option. Sad that I'll have to let this place go as my brunch spot when I'm in the city. Back to griddle fresh instead.
author: Kora T.

description:
A friend that lives in San Francisco suggested we try this location for brunch when we were out here on vacation. I'm SO glad I remembered the name because it was the BEST brunch I've ever had.

I ordered the Lemon Dill Crab Shrimp Cake Benediction and it was TO DIE for. The serving was huge!!!! My boyfriend ordered the Tex-Mex Scrabble and couldn't stop raving about it.

The location itself is very small and I can only imagine the wait there must be on a weekend.....but trust me when I say the wait is worth it!!

Staff is friendly. Service is great! They were on top of refills and checking in to see how we were doing.

If you're in San Francisco and looking for a great little spot to enjoy a delicious meal, this is for sure the place!!

Will be back the next time we are in San Francisco!
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
Banana blueberry soufflé pancakes are so airy and fluffy, especially the center.  The pancakes didn't really have a hint or sign of bananas in them, but there were quite a bit of blueberries.  Overall, this is something I would get again and again.  My sister really liked her salmon tartine.  She gave me a bite and it was delicious. 

Service was fast and friendly but my only gripe was our wait, especially since there were empty tables.
author: Samantha C.

description:
Located in the middle of a busy California Street, this place is quite charming! On a sunny late San Francisco morning, it's not a bad idea to put your name on the list, grab a cup of Contraband around the corner and wait for your name to be called.

First of all, the Bloody Marys are the bomb! Love the spicy kick and the fresh cracked pepper, it really makes a difference! I could drink this all day, everyday!

I ordered the Parma Flavor Eggs Benedict with prosciutto, poached eggs, roasted tomatoes, grilled asparagus, and crispy hash browns. So delicious and hits the spot! Not too heavy and you'll have enough room for some dessert! Just wish the hash browns were thicker because who doesn't love hash browns! 

I got the French toast with fresh fruit and maple syrup to share and that was delightful! Perfect way to finish a late brunch!
author: Janny S.

description:
YUMM. Really great breakfast/brunch spot! Hands down one of the best pancakes and benedicts. I came here on a random Tuesday so the wait wasn't long but usually on the weekends it would be about 40-60 mins wait and they don't do reservations. Business hours: 8AM - 2:30PM everyday. 

Things I ordered:
- Norwegian Benedict w/ garlic sauteed spinach, smoked salmon, caper and chive hollandaise
- Banana Blueberry Souffle Pancake w/ house made mascarpone cheese pancake with vanilla curd and candied walnut. served with vermont maple syrup

We also ordered the corn beef hash which was recommonded but it wasn't as great so I wouldn't order that. I would just stick with the pancakes and the benedicts. Hope that helped!
author: Jenn L.

description: Though it's small, it has a warm "mom's kitchen" vibe which I adored. I ordered the French toast which was absolutely wonderful. No hint of an eggy taste on the toast. For the price I figured you'd get three pieces of toast but they gave two which was fine given it was scrumptious. The workers were a bit pushy to eat and go which I wasn't a fan of since I like to take my time eating.
author: Sophia H.

description:
I write this review with mixed emotions. Part of me wants to be selfish and keep this hidden gem for myself because in a city of foodies, any place that earns the label of a top notch brunch spot will have a wait time of 1+ hours any day of the week. However, in the spirit of Yelp and to reward a restaurant that does a job well done, I have to rave about this place. I randomly found it after searching places to take a visiting friend for brunch. I was initially tempted to visit Mama's, but there is almost always a wait of 45+ minutes even on weekday mornings. Here's the breakdown:

Service: Efficient and friendly. We walked in at around 9:30AM on a Tuesday morning. There were a few empty tables so we were seated immediately. They promptly took our drink orders and returned shortly thereafter to get our brunch orders.

Ambiance: Fairly small and quaint, but still welcoming and definitely well maintained.

Food: Luckily there were three of us, so we chose three different items and shared -- Otherwise, I would have been tempted to be a fatty and just order a lot to try it all. To be honest, the pancake pictures sold me in the first place, so my friend ordered the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes. I ordered the Crab Cake Benedict, and my bf ordered the Frisco Scramble. The Crab Cake Benedict consists of two crunch crab cakes served atop a thin slice of sourdough bread, each topped with a perfectly poached egg and a dill sauce. Accompanied by a thin layer of hash browns, this entree was spot on. My bf's scramble was pretty good also and was accompanied by toast and hash browns. The Lemon Ricotta Pancakes are amazing. Light and fluffy, these pancakes are unique. There's a layer that just puffs up like a cloud. It's amazing.

Drinks: Since it was brunch, we ordered coffees all around and got free refills accordingly.

Cost: Reasonable prices especially considering this is SF!

Would I return? YES, please!
author: Leana L.

description:
After coming across horrendous wait times at some other brunch spots, and changing our minds multiple times about the kind of cuisine we wanted, my friend and I eventually settled on the traditional-ish brunch fare at Mymy. After something like a 30-45min wait, we nabbed a seat outside, and ordered their:

* Vanilla Sponge French Toast - While I was definitely craving something more savory than sweet, it's always hard to resist the more "typical" carby brunch items. Ordered this with a side of bacon to try and balance the scales a bit, to little avail. Their French toast, while light, fluffy, and tasty, was on the too-sweet side due to the butterscotch drizzle: and that's even WITH the bacon. Take out the butterscotch though, and it was pretty solid.

* Parma-Flavored Eggs Benedict - This is what I wish I HAD ordered instead. Perfect poached eggs (the ones where the yolks are more gooey than runny), fantastic flavor, and just all around delicious. I actually tried a bite of this with my French toast, and it went surprisingly well together!

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - I can't speak to the inside of the venue, since we opted to sit outside, but outdoor seating wasn't the best option given that it's situated on a hill, so you'll be fighting against gravity, either upwards or downwards.

Bathroom - No comment, since I didn't try them.
author: Johnny W.

description:
I have to go with two stars for this place. The food is alright for the price. I had a build your own scramble and it was quite good I would say worth the fifteen dollars. The decor of the place is not half bad and gives the place a nice feel. 

Now where it goes downhill is mostly the service. The staff here because of a slight english fluency problem come across quite rude which was easy for me to get over but during my meal the waitress wiping the table next to mine basically wiped all the food debris onto my lap without even batting an eye shortly after walking away. Then to top it off they tack on an automatic fifteen percent tip onto the bill. I am fine paying fifteen percent even for mediocre service but it seems they implement this automatic tip since they are not competent enough to earn a tip themselves. 

Not being from San Fransisco I am pretty sure it is illegal to require a tip without posting it clearly but being from out of town what the hell do I know. I payed it and enjoyed the city. I am not to sure if they had anything posted but I am sure I will never be returning to this place again.
author: Michael S.

description:
My husband, son and I were in the area on a Weekday morning.  I always drive by this place and see a long line of people on the weekends.   I hate waiting for food so I took the first chance I could get with no wait to check this place out.  

We were seated immediately upon entering the restaurant which was awesome!  I perused the menu and checked out my yelp app and it looked like a ton of folks on yelp recommend the lemon ricotta pancakes.  I ordered the crab Benedict, my husband ordered the corn beef hash and we ordered the lemon ricotta pancake for my son.  

My crab benedict was good and my husband loved his hash.  But the lemon ricotta pancakes were just OK.  It looked a little bit undercooked because it seemed a bit soggy.  Anyway, I will definitely come by to try it again because maybe we visited on an off day for the pancakes.
author: Christine P.

description: Two years ago this was my favorite under-the-radar breakfast joint. Food was great, service was acceptable, but the last two times I went with friends or family, the service was terrible. The second time we left while waiting in line because the server was so rude to us. Obviously they don't seem to care much about repeat customers or their customers in general. Haven't been back in a year and I live a couple blocks away. Couldn't believe my eyes when they started getting lines around the block. This area is so in need of a decent breakfast spot with good service! It shouldn't be so hard.
author: Naomi W.

description: Food is really good and filling the only thing about this place is there is a line however, that means that people really like the food. It is fast service too definitely would recommend! I got the banana pancakes they were good it was filled with mascarpone it was delicious and fluffy. We also had the French toast definitely recommended that it's moist and really filling!
author: Valeria F.

description: My boyfriend lives near Mymy, so it's our go-to brunch spot. I literally get the Tex-mex scramble every time I come-- yes... it's THAT good. Service is always great as well! If you come on the weekends, prepare to wait.
author: Natalie M.

description:
YAY another brunch place in SF for me to try and review! Mymy did not disappoint at all! Minus the long wait (to be expected for brunch in SF on a weekend), I was happy with my overall experience.

The food- We ordered BLT benedict, Frisco scramble, and lemon ricotta souffle pancakes. The benedict was absolutely amazing! I liked that they served both benedicts on a slice of baguette! It was very unique and I really liked it compared to the traditional english muffin base. The bacon was perfectly chewy and fatty! They also cut up the bacon into smaller pieces so you don't have to cut through it yourself! It makes the dining process a bit more elegant :P Loved the benedict overall, 10/10 would order again. 

We also got the frisco scramble. Most importantly, it has apple sausage and avocado, so of course it was delicious! Both of these dishes came with a perfectly crispy hash brown that is just like the one they serve at griddle fresh! It compliments the dish really well and is just the right amount. 

Lastly, we ordered the lemon ricotta souffle pancakes as well! Yes.. 3 dishes for 2 people :P It was definitely more than enough! The pancakes were good, but nothing special in my opinion. Maybe I'm just not that big of a pancake person? But they were fluffy (hence souffle!) and lightly lemon-y and was a nice sweet dish to have with our savory dishes. Try using the blackberry jam they provide on the table with the pancakes! I thought it made it have more flavor and I liked it better than the maple syrup. 

Overall, Mymy definitely hit the spot and satisfied my brunch cravings! Come here prepared to wait a bit but you will be rewarded with yummy food :)
author: Sandy Y.

description: Super delicious breakfast! Service is super fast when you get in. If you're looking for a relaxing brunch spot this may not be it because they need to get the next table in. But the food is really good and the service is also good. Get there early and get in line!
author: Samantha S.

description: Pretty good. I would say top 2 brunch spits I've had in sf. Just like all the other brunches it can be a bit pricey. The blueberry souffle pancake is amazing but a bit hard to finish by yourself due to its richness so it's better to share.
author: Edward H.

description: Excellent little brunch spot with very fresh cocktails and great food. Service is also fairly quick but that's because there's always a line. Expect to wait unless you go at an off hour.
author: Sonya G.

description: First stop in San Francisco and it definitely wasn't a mistake ! Loved the food and the atmosphere. Their breakfast potatoes are to die for! But so is the rest of the menu!
author: Alejandra H.

description:
I NEEDED ME SOME PANCAKES.

I have been to a number of brunch joints in San Francisco and I know the good ones always have a long wait and a long line. I put my name down anticipating for an hour wait but I was called within 30 minutes, when there were about 15 people before me! Mind you, the host will only call your name three times. If you are not running to her claiming your place, she will cross you off and move you to the end of the line when you return.

We sat at the bar seating next to the kitchen. This place is small, really small. I had to really test my patience. But I kept my eyes out the window and remembered I was here for one thing: Pancakes! But I eyed the menu and I became confused. My goals have been fogged and my friend said she had tried everything and thought they were all delicious. I couldn't help but eye every dish that was leaving the kitchen but I kept my word and decided on the Blueberry Walnut Souffle Pancake with a side of hash browns.

It was egg white heaven jam-packed in two rounds of fluffy goodness. They were thick and very light with blueberries sprinkled within inches of each other. I normally do not like butter on my pancakes but the butter was amazing for this dish. I wished that the walnuts were located inside the pancake too but they were on the side, and roasted with honey and sugar. There was a white sauce on the side that was sweet and a delicious addition to the pancake as well. I would rather have that than the maple syrup! The maple syrup in my opinion ruined it a bit. It was thick and a tad too sweet. It made my pancakes taste like sugar overload. The hash browns were as thin as paper. Not too oily and extremely crunchy. They eventually became soft and chewy as it started to cool down. It was a large portion as well.

I feel like it was worth the wait. I look forward to trying their benedicts!
author: Linda K.

description: Cute little place in downtown San Francisco to grab breakfast in the morning. It is a CASH ONLY restaurant and theres plenty of street parking depending what time you are there. There is outdoor seating and indoors. We ordered the two side of eggs sunny-side up with bacon, toast, hash brown and with coffee. The food was delicious everything was made fresh and not overcooked. The server was very friendly and refilled our coffee when it was empty. There was already large crowds of people coming in once they open the door in the morning. There is plenty to chose from on the menu.
author: Cindy W.

description: Fluffly eggs and delicious coffee.  I walked in without expectations but was wowed by the flavorful food and never empty cup of coffee.  I'll go back in a heartbeat.
author: Anastacio D.

description: Awesome little tiny breakfast joint (that happens to be in the location of a old dive bar I frequented). Service is good, food is great. I love a good poached egg, and this one was done perfectly. The challah French toast was amazing.
author: Gwen M.

description: Great portions for a great price! The employees were nice and very fast. You not only had one person helping you but any employee that walked by offered to help with anything. It was a busy and packed place so you could tell people enjoy coming here.
author: Amrita P.

description: Came here for brunch on a Sunday at 1 PM. The line took about 30 minutes but seemed to move quickly. The place wasn't overly crowded and food took about average amount of time to come out once we ordered. Staff was very attentive though In checking if we were ready to order or not. At one point we had four different servers come in less than a minute to ask. I'm A hit or miss kind of person with bloody Mary's but the one here is awesome! I tried one of the house favorites, Salmon Rotolone Tartine, and the mambo Italiano scramble. All of the food was fantastic.  I didn't try my friends stuffed banana pancakes for fear of stealing the rest of them when he wasn't looking, but fair to say anyone would drool over them!
author: Beth B.

description:
Definitely a decent brunch to try! I came here with my sisters about a week ago and it turned out to be better than what we expected. The wait wasn't too horrendous considering we walked a few blocks down to mr Holmes and back then we were seated. 

Frisco scramble: 4/5: decent scramble. Loved the combo of sausage, cheese and ingredients but it felt small for a scramble. The hash browns were delicious. I'm normally not a fan of hash browns but they were crispy and good! Probably would get this again!

Lemon ricotta soufflé pancakes: 4/5: fluffy and delicious with a good amount of ricotta. My only gripe was the fact that I didn't taste any lemon with these pancakes but I did taste the ricotta. Decent pancakes but could use a bit more lemon flavor! 

Total for 3: $50 
Definitely worth another try! I can comment on the things my sisters tried but they said their dishes were delicious!
author: Stella J.

description:
TLDR: Was (originally) denied mimosas even though everyone was 21+ , our pancakes had less stacks than shown by everyone else here on yelp, overcooked poached eggs, but good corned beef & egg scrambles.

I came here with my friends on my birthday for brunch. I been excited to come here after seeing so many instagram pictures of this place (which lead me drooling on the yelp page.) First of all, I want to say, my expectations have not been met. If you compare the pictures seen via Yelp, my food was not comparable to the food that we got. The service was also pretty annoying. Here is a list of the Pros and the Cons of this place. 

Cons (yes, we are starting with this first)
- Being my birthday, we decided to order a jug of mimosas. Thought everything was going well and fine. They checked our IDs.. yada yada then the waitress comes back and tells us that most of us can not drink it. Why? I still don't know. We ensured them that we were all 21+ . "Yes you are 21 but you still can't (drink alcohol)" Wait.. WHAT? Asked for the manager-- and the same thing happened. Either they can't do math or they just didn't realize that it was 2015 now. Very annoyed... how can you deny the birthday girl and her friends (of legal drinking age) alcohol?!  They were very rude when they found out their mistake and the service sucked throughout the whole meal...they probably figured that we had to pay gratuity anyways.  

- we ordered the blueberry walnut souffle pancakes (to share between our party of 6) which is clearly shown on several photos that it comes with 3 stacks. We only had 2. I can't help but to feel that we were ripped off. 

- Both of my friends who ordered egg benedicts mentioned that their eggs were overcooked and not runny. In addition, the crab cake benedict was dry. 

- the hashbrowns were like ricecrackers. It was soo thin and overcooked that everything was fried. there was no "potato meat." Likewise-- in comparison to the photos here on Yelp, everyone else had a more "potato meat-er" hashbrowns (sorry I just made up a word.) 

- the toast had an annoying overwhelming "burnt" taste to it. 

Pros
- corned beef was very good 
- the italiano scramble was delicious
author: Jenny N.

description:
Decent brunch place in Nob Hill. Each main dish is about $12 which I think is standard for brunch places. They have sweet and savory pancakes which is different.

I got the vanilla sponge French toast. It was pretty good. They had a side of some fruit. The syrup was actually not syrup but rather honey which I thought was odd. They actually charged $1 for a side of syrup which I thought was nickel and diming at this point. Syrup is pretty standard for pancakes and French toast....

The hash browns were large but not much in volume. It was mostly a crispy skin.

The service I found a bit lacking. After the initial order and delivery they don't refill your water since there's a carafe on the table. But we quickly finished the carafe and they never came back until the very end to refill it.

Also sitting in the outdoor seating is a bit awkward since the side street is slanted so it always feels like you're just fighting gravity to eat.
author: Danielle C.

description:
I met up with two girl friends for brunch here. There was a good 30-40 minutes wait but I was busy catching up with my friends that the wait wasn't bad at all.

I wish the water they served had ice in it. Aside from that, the food was yummy! I had the crab cake benedict ($14). I seriously loved their hashbrowns. It's so thin but makes it so crispy and browned. It's definitely a must here. I also tasted my friend's blueberry pancake and it's so fluffy. I would recommend that as well, yum.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
We were here two weeks ago and enjoyed our Sunday Brunch here.  We were staying at the Westin St. Francis in Union Square and took a quick cab ride here to only be greeted by a swelling crowd of other hungry customers waiting for a table.  

You basically list your name on the clipboard hanging by the front door and thoroughly study the menu so you know exactly what you want to order by the time you get seated.  A gal that worked there made sure those standing around had a few minutes to view the menu.

After waiting for about 50 minutes I was pretty excited to hear the gal shout out "JOANNE- PARTY OF TWO!!!'  Woo hoo, that was us!  We ended up dining outside on their patio, but there was sufficient heaters hanging on the awning that kept us warm.

I had plenty of time to review other Yelp reviews and view pics of their dishes to see what I wanted and opted for the 6-hour cooked corned beef hash topped with poached eggs and accompanied with potatoes and two slices of sourdough toast.  My hubby had a heartier appetite and got the banana blueberry pancakes along with the shrimp cakes(?) and the mixed hash brown (both were ordered as side orders).  

The wait for our food didn't take too long, they definitely hustle with bringing your drink orders out and a big plus for having a water carafe at each table (I drink lots of water and probably drank the whole carafe full of it).

Our food not only looked pretty, but our dishes were pretty awesome.  I loved the flavors and tenderness of the corned beef, it was cooked nicely and would certainly order it again if we find ourselves back at Mymy.  My husband loved all his dishes, so much that he cleaned his plates of it, lol.

After brunch, we decided to cross the street and hop on a cable car back to our hotel as we giggled about the guy and girl sitting arm's distance away from us.  They were obviously on a date and listening to them get to know one another better was kind of awkward at times.  Hopefully it works out between the two of them, but we couldn't help but listen to their conversation and think that he just wasn't into her. Oh well, on to the next guy!

If you were like me on this particular Sunday and searched high and low on the Yelp app for a great Sunday brunch spot, look no more because Mymy will satisfy your sweet and savory cravings.  Just make sure your phone is fully charged or bring the paper to read since you might be waiting a while for a table.
author: Joanne B.

description:
Heard this was the sister restaurant of Griddle Fresh (my favorite brunch place in SF) - went there with high hopes that Mymy would not disappoint. There was a line outside as expected, you just have to wait in line cus there's no wait list. The wait was actually not that bad, we got seated in like 30 minutes for a party of 4.

The menu was quite similar to Griddle Fresh, with a couple tweaks. I always order the veggie scramble, and this one was subpar. I asked if I can have substitute my toast for English muffin, and they said they didn't have English muffins... what???

I'd probably give this place another chance some day, but it's not even comparable to Griddle Fresh.
author: Carmen G.

description: This place responded by calling cooking their potatoes on the griddle with oil instead of butter a "major substitution." If this is a major substitution, then what is a minor substitution? I go to breakfast places all the time and it is never an issue. Also, that doesn't negate their poor customer service.
author: Ken K.

description: Busy breakfast spot on California cable car line. Try the homemade corn beef hash! Yum!
author: Donna C.

description:
I came here with my boyfriend on valentine's day and overall, we had a good breakfast experience. 

Mymy cafe is a bit different than other breakfast!brunch places. They do not have a wait list, instead customers stand in line outside of the restaurant. I didn't mind this at all because I was able to see how far I am from getting seated. I was the 4th or 5th party in line and got seated along with a bunch of others in line after 10 minutes of waiting. 

What I found strange is that the restaurant doesn't seat customers immediately. Their strategy is to seat everyone at once. Then clean tables that finish earlier and leave those tables vacant until enough tables are open to allow a new set of customers in. Very strange.. 

My boyfriend and I ordered:
* Lemon ricotta pancake - well, it didn't look as cute as I hoped with the designs I saw with the dishes from yelp photos. My pancake actually came out BURNT (as seen in photo). I thought maybe it was still edible so I won't have to be rude and send it back.. it was pretty bitter and I really didn't want to eat it if I was paying like $12 or so for pancakes. I sent it back (FIRST TIME EVER). Felt really bad but the servers were actually very nice about it.
* Norwegian benedict - it was very good except the salmon was a bit too salty. Plus side is that they were very generous with the amount of salmon there were :) I don't like hash brown but their hash brown is so delicious and just enough crunch! 

The tables were a bit close to one another and restaurant was quite small. Overall utensils were clean and customer service was excellent.
author: Sarah T.

description:
I've had Mymy on my bookmarks for a few months and after my workout at Core40 down the street Saturday morning I decided to see how long the wait was.  I signed my name on the clipboard (all the names prior were crossed off) and asked one lady who walked over to me.  She said if I wanted to sit outside then she could seat us right now.  I told her okay, but that my fiance will be here in just a second.  He finally came (because I made him check the wait at Olea too).  I told her that he was here and we could be seated.  And she told me to wait for a hostess.  So many of the waitresses saw me and another group waiting however they didn't check in with us til maybe 5 minutes later.  We were actually seated inside by the window.  Throughout the meal it doesn't seem we were checked on either but luckily they gave us a carafe of water to share.  

It was a hard decision, but I ordered the Parma Flavor Benedict and he got the Peasant Lorraine Flat Omelette.  The Parma benny had proscuitto, tomato, aspsaragus, mozzarella and chive hollandaise ontop of toast and served with crispy hashbrowns.  I like how they included asparagus in it and proscuitto always hits the spot.  But it was average at most.  There was nothing spectacular about it, and I felt that it was a little flat.  The hashbrowns were nice and crispy but had no seasoning whatsoever.  His omeltte was a lot more flavorful.  Liked how it was so fluffy too.  His omelette came with gruyere, swiss, bacon, leeks and grilled tomatoes.  Side of toast and crispy hashbrowns as well.  

Not sure if I should have ordered something else, but the hype and the not so great customer service put a little damper on this brunch as well.  The food isn't bad, but it's average at best.  I've had a proscuitto benedict at Zazie's and I thought that was much better than here.  I saw someone mention that Mymy is under the same ownership as Griddle Fresh.  If so, then it's like night and day, because we love GF!  Their food is never bland.  I can say I've crossed Mymy off my list and it's conveniently across the street from my workout spot, but I wouldn't come back.
author: Cat C.

description: Delicious. Sat outside and watched the cable car go by. Packed... sat down with no wait for two people on a Saturday at 8:30. Banana pancakes were great. Couldn't finish the plate. Also got the Tex mex scramble. Will definitely be back  favorite part was being able to have breakfast and see the city views
author: Rachael S.

description: This was a wonderful little breakfast place just down the street from our Airbnb. No wait to get in and the food was delicious. It has a nice Asian atmosphere to it without overdoing it and the staff was very nice. I personally had the French toast with a side of eggs and sausage and my girlfriend had a specialty kind of eggs Benedict. It was a bit on the pricy side and also the mimosas we had were a bit too strong for the morning. Would definitely come back and highly recommend you stop in for a good breakfast.
author: Peter M.

description: I absolutely loved the food here! If Mymy was in LA, I'd make it my go-to brunch spot. I had the lemon ricotta souffle pancakes and crab benedict. The pancakes were light, fluffy and not too heavy. The crab benedict was one of the best I've had and the hash browns were out of this world! Will be back!
author: Christine D.

description:
Hmph! The nerve of these people!
Mixed swavoreeyt* pancakes.
Workers were really nice.
Some of my favorite jazz songs.
Impressionist art on the walls.
Put me at the live chef's counter.
Just who do they think they are!!!

*simultaneously savory & sweet
author: Dan B.

description: As much as I want to write a positive review for this place as the food is quite tasty, but part of an establishment is the service. I ordered and asked for one moderation which i would say was not a big deal, (put the cheese on the side) but apparently another server or someone who makes all decisions in this place said this was not possible (which by the way is possible because they have done it before). So the food is great but the service just doesn't scream come back.
author: Joanna F.

description: The Tuscan Benedict period Benedict... you're welcome. Some of the best crispy potatoes I can remember having.
author: Marta A.

description:
Food was great! Wanted to catch up  w/ old friends through brunch, so we decided to come here to try it out. 


[Food]  3 stars

For sweets, we got a Banana Blueberry pancake, & a Lemon Ricotta pancake. For the savorys, we got a Flourentine & Norwegian Benedict. Pancakes were super delicious, though I would prefer the Blueberry over the Lemon. As for the Bennys, Flourentine is the way to go! 

[Service] 1 star

As for service, it wasn't too great of an experience tbh. After we finished our brunch, my friends & I asked if it was possible to split the check two ways. The waiter responded "You should've asked to split the check before you ordered your meal."  Making it sound like we should've known that in the beginning. Besides the fact that we "should've known", we then were told that their machine was unable to split the bill. Def not the best impressions for a first time brunch. 


Overall, the food the great. My friends & I had a great time catching up! Though service could def have been better. Service was def not impressive at all.
author: Joanne D.

description:
If George Takei ever ate here, I'm sure his reaction would be along the lines of "Oh myyy"

Great little cafe in Nob Hill. The place gets packed quick so be sure to arrive timely. There's no sign in list or anything like that. You stand in line outside their store which I think is actually much more efficient. No one is crowding around the entrance or anything like that. The service as quick and the food was fantastic!

Downsides: The tree we were standing by smelled like poop? And there was literally tables about 3-5 feet away from that tree. Not sure if that's a pleasant smell to have while eating. Also, the food was great but IMO I felt like they used more oil than they should have. I felt like scrambled eggs were sitting in oil. 

Overall, great brunch spot for the weekend!
author: Robbie P.

description:
I don't understand why it's taken me so long to write a review for Mymy. This place is definitely one of my top destinations breakfast/brunch in the city. Not only does this place make hash browns that are ridiculously crunch and just oh soo good... They have many options to satisfy any brunch lovers craving. My personal favorite is their homemade corned beef hash with poached eggs.They also offer mimosas to the person trying to spike up their meal. 

Employees are always very welcoming and friendly. Expect to be greeted with a warm hello and many questions to ensure you're getting the best experience possible. I always appreciate the workers attentiveness to my table when I need more water, or when I have finished my meal and they clear my plate quickly. 

As you can tell from the other reviews, this place is pretty popular... So expect to wait in line awhile for an open table. But don't fret.. This place is worth the wait. Normally, when we get here, my friends and I will take an adventure to the coffee shop around the corner to grab a pick me up. Once we're finished with our drinks, it's usually time to go to our table. So if you have some time on your hands and want a delicious brunch time meal, head over the Mymy's... You won't be disappointed!
author: Jayme N.

description: We waited for like 30 minutes but came after 1 o'clock. I ordered Norwegian bennies and French toasts. Food was delicious and good quality! I would definitely come back
author: Anuta B.

description: We had the zucchini Parmesan pancakes and the crab cake eggs Benedict and both were delicious. I want to come back to try more items!
author: Kristy F.

description:
Can't say much about the food. Only the service. Long story short: even if they have plenty of tables they may just not seat you.


We (party of 2) arrived, and the only table they would offer us was by the kitchen. There was a bulk delivery going on at that table so I suggested we sit somewhere else. There were three 4-seaters available and yet they made us wait for 15 minutes for someone reading his paper at a 2 person table to leave. He didn't, so I asked many times for us to be able to sit at one of the unoccupied tables -- (no line, no rush, weekday mind you) -- the waitress kept referring to the owner, who kept waving her away and saying no -- the busboy joined in on our behalf and a heated discussion ensued. Entertainment for all the restaurant but unfortunately no table. The newspaper reader never left. We did.

The Crepery (a few blocks away) had plenty of seating.
author: Adam L.

description:
Came early (9:00am) on a Saturday and were seated right away-- I believe this was luck, as we tried to come the weekend before and were deterred by the long line. Seating is limited inside, and there are tables on each side of the building. We sat outside on the far side. I think I would have been disappointed sitting on the other side of the building, as the line forms right in front of your table. We were so excited to be seated, we forgave the fact that our table was at an angle and hardly fit boyfriend's knees.

I ordered corned beef hash, potatoes, and bacon. All were wonderful! The corned beef hash came with an unexpected sauce that I scraped off-- I wish the menu had been more explicit. But the potatoes totally made up for it. Crisp and awesome!

Boyfriend got two egg breakfast and was pleasantly surprised. We'll be back!
author: Chloe M.

description: We absolutely loved this place. Quaint and local with an awesome menu, friendly staff and just good eats. We will be back anytime we're in the city for breakfast or brunch.
author: Tim A.

description:
Omg I am still drooling over the mascarpone filled French toast. I don't even really like French toast...

We got lucky as a party of two and was seated at the bar immediately. Can't say it's always a breeze to get in. Everything is streamlined and very efficient in here. You get in and order and get your food in no time. 

Would definitely come back for more French toast and eggs benedicts. Yummo!
author: Stine H.

description: Mymy is the best breakfast/brunch spot in the city.  It's one of those places where I could close my eyes while ordering and randomly point at a menu item and trust that anything I landed on would be good. That being said, my super favorites here are the Parmesan crusted zucchini pancakes (served with two bacon strips) and the Peasant Lorraine scramble (eggs with grilled asparagus, bacon, leeks, shallots, Swiss cheese, grilled tomatoes; served with some of the best potatoes I've had in my life, and I am not a potato fan). The servers here are attentive and efficient. I love the unpretentious feel of the place.
author: Andrea O.

description: First time here, enjoyed the food. A little on the pricey side and the menu wasn't very extensive but I'd say it was worth it. We left full, thus happy!
author: Tiff K.

description:
One of the staff lady was extremely rude! 
We asked her politely if we could move to another table next to the window and she snapped back at us.

The food is alright, it's no different than other brunch places. I wouldn't come back here.

The management needs to teach their staff a thing or two about customer service.
author: Aditi S.

description:
Omg!!!!! Yummy is all I have to say!  Looking for a place close to our hotel and this is what came across our path. The line was out the door, and we were glad we waited. Wasn't as long as anticipated which was a blessing. As we were waiting we watch others get served and got even more excited. We had the corn beef hash, crab eggs Benedict, and lemon curd pancakes!!  
Their hash brown were so crispy and good. Good service, good people. Need to return for the lunch menu. It's on our list!!! Enjoy!
author: Thuan F.

description: These zucchini pancakes look basic but taste like breakfast of champions. It's crispy like hashbrowns done right and sweet like paleo food gone wrong.
author: Tan H.

description: I love the corn beef hash here!!! Unfortunately they don't have the crispy hash browns anymore :( those were amazing.
author: Sophia L.

description:
Mymy was highly rated on my Yelp app and right across the street from another popular brunch place.  Both do not take reservations and utilize a first come, first serve seating system.  Your entire party must be present in order for you to be seated.  Originally we intended to meet a friend but they bailed on us at the last minute.  I put in my name and 3 down but after waiting about 15 minutes and he didn't show up, Sean C. and I decided to change our party size to 2 instead.  Five minutes later, our table was called to be seated.  I was pretty stoked to because we were seated at a 2-person table.  Three in our party would have required a larger table and they didn't seem to have any of those when we were seated.  

Starving, I ordered the spicy pork scramble while Sean had the blueberry, banana soufflé pancakes.  We also ordered a glass of OJ and a cappuccino.  The food took some time but we were happy to be seated, eagerly anticipating the food to come.  The portions are huge!  I was really happy with what we ordered because we got to share.  For my pork scramble it came with the crispiest hash browns I've ever had!  The pork was tender and delicious.  The eggs were perfect.  The salsa was kind of bland though.  It could have used more spice to it.  It also came with grilled toast which I chose wheat instead of sourdough.  The pancakes were fluffy and so good!  I loved the fresh blueberries and bananas.  The nuts were a nice add of texture too.  There was a lot of food and we were happy to consume it.  I can see why this place is popular with the locals.  Great food with reasonable prices, you can't beat it.
author: Trina D.

description: This was my first time visiting San Francisco and this was one of the places that was rated high on my list! As far as the food was concerned it was extremely good with a pretty original menu. My only issue was the wait to actually get in which shows it's a popular place but we had to sit outside with the sun beaming on us which made for a pretty annoying situation. My take, food 5 Stars, venue at 4 and service at 4. I would definitely recommend it to others just get there early!
author: Lance P.

description:
At Mymy everything has a special touch.  No, really, EVERYTHING!  

First of all, the menu has so many delicious and unique options that my dining partner and I couldn't pick just one dish each.  We decided to split a sweet dish and order two savory dishes for ourselves.  All three were heavenly!  I recommend all three:
-Vanilla Sponge Pain Perdue With Butterscotch Drizzle:  this thick-cut bread was absolutely delicious!  It was sweet, but not "omg, I can't eat this" sweet.  The bananas accompanied it were a perfect accent -- and special touch
-Chive Potato Pancake With Crispy Crumbled Bacon & Gorgonzola:  this dish is rich, savory perfection.  A drizzle of honey adds a special touch
-BLT Benediction:  I'm sure you can't go wrong with any of the "benedictions"  This dish really hit the spot!  The crispy bacon perfection added a special touch! 

Now, back tot he special touches-- each dish has a special something on the plate. Everything on the menu is truly well thought out and plated in such a pretty way. Not a common thing for a short-order diner!  Also, we watched a table of three order a round of hot cocoa.  Even the hot cocoa was special- each mug was garnished with a jumbo marshmallow--special touch.  

I have bookmarked Mymy for future brunch outings.  I plan on taking my out of town guests here next week!
author: Andrea H.

description: We came here for breakfast around 9am on a weekday. Our hotel was located nearby. Food was tasty, service was fast. Nothing special but also a very nice experience. Quite popular, seemed like only one table was free. I recommend it!
author: Sanna K.

description: I'm kind of an eggs Benedict snob. I ordered the eggs Benedict with smoked salmon. One of my poached eggs was cooked perfectly. The other one was a little overdone, which is a big pet peeve of mine. However, one bite of this dish and all was forgiven!! Deeeeeliciousness!!!
author: Nancy M.

description: I had a lovely laid back weekday brunch here with my mom. There was a small line around 12:00 but we were seated pretty quickly. We enjoyed the bossa nova tunes playing in the restaurant and appreciated the friendly and prompt service. We were both in the mood for salmon and each of our dishes was delicious. My smoked salmon tartine was really tasty and was topped with a good portion of avocado. I also liked the crispy potatoes that came with the dish. We each ordered a latte and it was pretty solid. I would definitely return for brunch as there were many other choices on the menu that looked tasty.
author: Michelle R.

description: Had the texmex scramble it was amazing husband had the corned beef hash and he was very pleased
author: Karissa C.

description:
If you've ever been to Griddle Fresh, this place will seem very familiar to you: long lines that move surprisingly quickly, creative brunch dishes with even more creative presentations, and expertly efficient if not particularly warm service.  

Like their sibling in Noe, MyMy has their craft down to a science, they've got the gourmet brunch thing nailed.  Their Tex-Mex scramble with decadent chorizo and spicy jalapeño (and also garlic, onion, roma tomato, pepper jack, chipotle aioli, pico de gallo, and avocado!) is amazing, my mouth waters just thinking about it!  Their hash browns are a must-try, too, they come in the same thin and crispy variety as Griddle Fresh.

Highly recommended.
author: Saminda W.

description: Nothing extraordinary, always a huge line, if you manage to get a table, they're super close to each other, you will be rushed to eat since there's a line to eat here specially on weekends and is not like it is inexpensive. Just meh
author: Annel K.

description: A small place but plenty to offer. They have a nice brunch menu. The food is good and even slightly creative. Quick and friendly service once you do get seated.
author: Saige B.

description:
I feel like too many restaurants in SF have policies that force patrons to stand in line rather than write their names down and come back some time later. I get why they do it, but it's annoying.

Anyway, I don't do lines, so I ordered a Baja California Benedict to go so I could eat it at my hotel. The guy quoted me 30 minutes and I felt like he was encouraging me to cancel... I came back 15 minutes later and it was ready. Not sure why he said 30.

The food was meh. The english muffins were extremely thick and overpowering. I tried to get bites with a bit of everything, but the muffins just overpowered everything else. And they weren't good. So I just ate the top of the benedict and left the english muffins behind.

The shrimp tasted very good on its own. The crab was also good but there were lots of shells that I had to remove from my mouth. The hash browns were delicious but a little a greasy. Separately, the items were good. But the flavors just didn't go well together, which is how an eggs benedict should be. 

Finally, $21 for a sub-par eggs benedict is just silly. Would have been fine if it tasted as good as it sounded, but it didn't.
author: Omar A.

description: Food is delicious! I got Lemon Dill Crab Shrimp Cake Benedict with hash brown and I was happy for the rest of the day. The price is moderate but for what I got, it was reasonable. Service was prompt and they let us be, which I love. Will be back to try something else.
author: Nicharee S.

description: Great service, friendly staff. The lemon souffle pancakes were ok, more eggy than light and fluffy. Hubs enjoyed his lemon dill crab shrimp benedict. Coffee was good, had 3 cups. Solid food, would come back of I was in the neighborhood, but not for the lemon pancakes.
author: elizabeth c.

description:
This place always has a decently long line outside its door (no waiting/signup list), and it's half the yelp hype and half the good food. 

There are nice seating options outside and some inside as well, and due to the high volume of customers, the service isn't quite friendly, attentive, or sweet. (But it wasn't rude, either)

My friend and I ordered the parma eggs benedict and the norwegian eggs benedict. They both come with a large and thin hashbrown that covers your whole plate. The eggs benedict themselves are pretty quality. Perfect eggs, and they don't skimp out on the meat/salmon either. Now they are $15 ish per dish, and a bit expensive for what I got, I would say.
P good, but not gonna be my go-to brunch place.
author: Grace P.

description: AMAZiNG Breakfast! Although there was a long wait to be seated it was worth the wait. Had the Baja California eggs Benedict and cappuccino! Was a great treat to start the day in the city! Will come again to try the lemon pancakes!
author: Bg G.

description:
My only complaint here is we found hair not in just one but both of our plates, tucked away underneath our food. The wait here moves pretty quickly, but you have to make sure you are standing there when you are called or they will move down the list without hesitation. This happened to us about 4 times - they have no remorse moving right past your name. 

We ordered the Parma Benedict with side of hash browns and the Corned Beef hash with a side of fruit. I am a big fan of their corned beef hash, it's cut in chunks of meat instead of minced but they are so soft and flavorful. Service here was a bit slow but regardless, I would say to come check this place out, I am not going to knock a restaurant down for some hair.
author: Karen C.

description: I'm not big on breakfast, but my sister wanted to grab food before starting the day. It's a medium size place and there were people already lining up the door before it even opened. It has to be good! I didn't want any typical omelettes, eggs Benedict, or corn beef hash. I wanted to try something new, that's when I saw Lemon Ricotta soufflé pancakes. That definitely sounds interesting! It's no easy task to soufflé something inside a pancake. I ordered that and I was not disappointed! It was light, airy, and doesn't have that dry pancake taste since the lemon ricotta was inside. I thoroughly enjoyed it, but could only manage to eat one pancake, and had to save the other one for another time. Great place and great food! My sister also really enjoys their coffee!
author: Minette C.

description: Solid brunch place. We went around 10:30 am on a Saturday with a group of 3 and only had to wait around 15 minutes for a table. I got the breakfast sandwich and it was very tasty. I don't go out to brunch often, but I will likely be back here next time I'm looking for a solid brunch.
author: Scoot S.

description: Anywhere I go that serves crab Benedict - will be a place that I go and order crab Benedict. My crab Benedict was perfect and I've had a LOT of crab Benedict.
author: Janelle D.

description: Always good. My fav is their amazing pancakes. Super fluffy and tasty. Their Benedict are good too but a bit rich and heavy. I used to love their latte but the last time I had it was so-so. I would prob go with cappuccino or just an expresso.
author: Roger P.

description:
The line is long. Yes, but they run this joint like a military operation. Even if you have 20 parties ahead of you, they will get you seated within 30 minutes.

I'd come here once before, and had one of the tartine dishes. Meh, wasn't impressed. All of the sweet dishes looked pretty epic though, so I vowed to return.

Today was the day.

I had the blueberry banana soufflé pancakes. Layers of souffléd greatness, sprinkled with blueberries, and drizzled with syrup and butter to top off a dessert-for-breakfast kinda dish. 

I've only had better soufflé pancakes at their sister restaurant, Griddle Fresh, where I had banana mascarpone pancakes.

Imma keep hittin' both of these spots up for their soufflé action. So good. Amazing.
author: Gabriela W.

description:
I can't believe I've never heard of this place before - it's delicious!

The food:

Crab cake Benedict - It's served over thin and crispy hash brown and the green sauce goes perfectly with the crab cake. The Benedict was not too runny, which makes it easier to eat with the cake. This is a must.

Lemon ricotta soufflé pancake - this soufflé pancake is definitely fluffy! It's not like some restaurants that advertise as "soufflé" but comes out flat and dry. The lemon flavor is very mild, and not too overwhelming. 5 stars for the fluffiness!

Went at 12.30pm and didn't have to wait in line (got a place at the bar but it's all good).
author: Whan T.

description:
Oh Mymy oh hell yes!

Worth the wait or even worth an immediate sunny-seating for 1 on the outdoor patio if you get here early enough. I always opt for simplicity, but their my complex dishes (spicy pop pork scramble, peasant lorraine, lemon ricotta soufflé pancakes...) really showcase pure yumminess. 

My go to: 2 eggs any style - skip the toast, get grilled asparagus and make it a poach. 
They must have a mile long plancha solely dedicated to making the paper thin -crispy part only-hash Browns (where every is the rest of the potato!?). Dowse those babies up in cholula and you have a very pleasant morning.

Itytakimas y'all
author: Sloane T.

description:
There were so many great things on the menu here but I went for the corned beef hash with poached eggs. It was delicious. 

The restaurant was very busy, clearly a popular place in the neighborhood. I'm glad I was on my own because I was seated immediately but there was a long line for two or more people. 

Either way, worth the wait.
author: Mike T.

description:
Food is not that good, stomachaches ensued with all of our guests. We ordered benedicts and the sauce had an unusual after taste. Odd lingering cramping as the day went on. Returned two dishes because meat found in both vegetarian requests, we should of left.  We had three different servers, confusing.

Spraying cleaning chemicals 30 minutes before closing so get prepared to inhale ammonia while eating.  They can't wait to get you out.  The whole breakfast experience was not enjoyable.

comment from Sang Hyuk L. of Mymy 
Business Owner
8/30/2016  Thank you for giving us a try, Robert. We are sorry to hear your guests weren't feeling well but we had no other such notices from other guests. As you may know, food sickness can take up to 36 hours for the symptoms to manifest themselves...so the culprit was probably further back in your groups' eating history. We are disappointed you did not enjoy your dining experience with us and we hope you are feeling better. Read less

 Here Sang, please take a look for yourself http://www.fda.gov/food/resourcesforyou/consumers/ucm103263.htm

 We didn't end up in the hospital but I recommend that you eat a couple of your cook's dishes and see how you feel all day. 

If you're OK with your staff rushing and spraying chemicals to clean sections of your restaurant 30 minutes before closing while people are eating brunch in such close proximity then I'm fine not returning. Your comment pretty much sums up the sentiment of your establishment.
author: Robert M.

description: Fantastic place love the location and great service, the grapefruit mimosa was perfect and the eggs benedicts were great I love the potatoes and the sauce that came with it
author: Michelle M.

description:
Oh the wait! My first visit was months ago and the wait wasn't terrible but this time the wait was 45mins! Typical SF brunching wait time at any good place I guess. 
We ordered the blueberry pancakes (ehhh not as good as the soufflé pancakes from Griddle fresh) and the shrimp and crab Benedict (good I'd get again).
author: Liz N.

description:
I have probably reviewed this place before but it is AWESOME! It is my go-to MUST when I am in SF and the benedicts knock my socks off. I have tried different ones and I love the smoked salmon one the best. So light and tender with incredible mouth bursting taste sensations with every bite. Even the capers blow my mind. CAPERS! How do they do it?
They have a number of sweet yummy things on the menu that I have seen other people ordering. I settle on the savory every time it seems but I am always tempted to ask somebody for a bite ( even if I don't know them..LOL).
I wish I knew the story behind the owners/chef. Such wonderful fresh and tasty ingredients. I think the high quality and expertise in preparation is what makes it here. 
The line is always out the door. I got lucky last time and it was pretty short considering. The dining space is small and intimate ( a bit cramped) but the food makes up for it.
author: Mamo R.

description:
The food is ok but people who are serving food are so rude. Honestly I didn't like the way they treated to us and another couple next table. 
I asked for hash brown as a side instead of something else and the waiter got angry and said why you are saying that now, we can not change the order. I told him, it's ok, please bring the hash brown as a new order and add it to our check. He didn't reply and left. When he came back, he gave us the hash brown and told me: Here is your hash brown but remember, this is the last time that we accept this. 
I truly didn't understand why he spoke like that for just a side hash brown.
author: Ashk F.

description:
While on vacation in San Francisco, we found this place 2 blocks from our hotel. My wife and I each had one of their scrambles, and everything about them was great, from the presentation to the potato sides. We were with our boys (10 and 8) each had French toast and hot chocolate. They both agreed that it was the best they have ever had.
The service was attentive and friendly. If you are considering this for breakfast, go.
author: Carl P.

description: Great brunch place in SF! There was a bit of a line, but it wasn't too bad because we had a party of 2 and they were able to seat us at a counter near the window. My gf had the baja eggs benedict and it was really good! The shrimp was tasty and the eggs were poached perfectly. The crispy potatoes that came with her dish were well seasoned and truly crispy. I ordered the salmon rotolone tartine and was not disappointed. The sauce worked well with the smoked salmon, eggs, and avocado. The bread underneath was toasted well too and was not soggy from the ingredients. Definitely would like to come back and have brunch at Mymy again!
author: Alvin T.

description:
It was a long wait for brunch on a Saturday (there aren't a ton of tables for groups of 3 or 4) but it was worth it in the end. 

I was starting to get jaded by restaurants in San Francisco with long waits and highly inflated prices that just didn't seem worth your time or effort. Mymy definitely had high quality food reasonable prices (by SF standards).

The hardest thing about waiting for your table is standing outside and watching them march plate after plate of delicious food right past you.
author: Rob P.

description:
Very tasty breakfast place.  The staff is super friendly and nice, and the place is comfortable (though small).

We had the french toast, pancakes, and Norwegian benedict.  The benedict and the pancakes were both solid, but not exceptional.  The french toast was really good!

All-in-all it's a very comfortable local breakfast place with some delicious options and friendly staff!  Would recommend!
author: Alex W.

description:
This is an amazing breakfast/brunch spot! The food was so amazing, it was exactly what I needed after a long night shift. A perfectly poached egg on top of a clever crab cake that contained bits of shrimp which gave it more texture and a little bite that is a pleasant change from the usual softness of a crab cake. There was a lemon dill sauce on top that brought the whole thing together. The plate full of crispy, crunchy potatoes helped as well. The coffee was great and they even offered me a cup to go. This meal was worth every penny!

On the weekends, you will find it incredibly busy and feel a rush to clear your seats. This venue is small and usually has a line out the door so I can hardly blame them. So this might not be the best choice for a long drawn out meal!
author: Charlotte A.

description: This is a small little restaurant and they cram you in there. The food was very good and came out quickly. The coffee was good--essential for a breakfast restaurant. Prices were a bit too steep to give this place five stars.
author: Portia H.

description: Great place for breakfast but was sad that they no longer serve the blueberry pancakes. Those were the reason I came back.
author: Julia W.

description: Fun breakfast but alittle too busy. Had a blueberry soufflé and zucchini pancake with two eggs. I'm full.
author: Nancy F.

description: Very good spot for breakfast. We brought a stroller in and it was a tight fit. However, the waitstaff quickly rearranged several tables to make room for us.
author: Mehmood R.

description: We stumbled on this gem while visiting San Francisco for our anniversary. I can't say nothing but great things about this place. This is our 2nd year and we are planning to visit. You can't go wrong with this place.
author: Nicole G.

description:
Sooo gooood. There is no host/hostess here so just stand in line outside. The wait wasn't too bad for 3 people on a Sunday around 11am. Probably waited about 45mins which is normal. 

The French Toast is to DIE for here! Definitely highly recommended. Had the blueberry pancakes as well and it was just mediocre-nothing special.
Also had the crab cake benedict which was really good! The hashbrown here is very crunchy and crispy which is the way I like em :)

Will definitely come by again!
author: Michelle C.

description: I'm not sure why the line or the reviews.  I didn't really see some of these items on the menu either.  Maybe it's a weekend brunch thing?  The potatoes were very crispy, but I didn't note anything to write home about.
author: Soo Jin M.

description:
I can't decide whether the food, or the service is better here. I love it all! I have always had great food, the hash browns are so good. Prices are reasonable considering you're in SF. 

You will wait though especially on the weekends. I've waited in the rain and it was well worth it!
author: Thomas R.

description: I came here twice. The first time I came the service was horrible. The host that sat us was rude and seemed annoyed. The food was great though, the sauce on the "lemon dill crab shrimp cake beneditcion" was heavenly, the crab cake was also very tasty and cooked perfectly and the hash browns that came with the eggs benedict were thin, crispy and well seasoned. My friend got the "salmon rotolone tartine" which was also very good. My brother got the "lemon ricotta souffle pancake" which were huge, very fluffy and scrumptious. I would also recommend the "matcha latte". The second time we came was 2-3 months after the first visit and the service was SO much better. The servers were nice and did not rush us at all. This time I tried the "florentine" which had delicious oyster mushrooms in it. I asked for a side of the lemon dill sauce because I remember really enjoying it. The lemon dill and the hash browns were both as good as I remembered.
author: Cynthia L.

description: This place gets worse by the year. I'm not sure why you'd go here now. The staff becomes ruder every year and the food more mediocre. You  people in California with all this money and San Francisco especially and this is the  place you rave about?  It's crazy.
author: Devon S.

description:
This place was amazing! Great place for brunch! My friend and I went there for brunch on a Thursday, so it wasn't terribly busy and we were seated after a few minutes. 

I decided to get the fresh-squeezed orange juice (it's pricey) but SO DELICIOUS! No regrets, but would I spend that much money for a small glass of OJ? Depends on my mood. I ordered the Salmon Eggs Benedict on top of a bed of hash browns. It was great. The hash browns were crispy and the eggs were cooked perfectly! 

My friend ordered Salmon Egg Omelette with fried potatoes. Her dish was very delicious. Unfortunately, the kitchen staff forgot to completely take out the paper lining (from the package, I'm assuming). She accidentally consumed some of the paper. She didn't notice because of the amount of egg that covered over it. After she realized a few bites in, she notified the waiter and they apologized profusely and made her a brand new dish. It was a bit of set back, but they were very nice about it and even took it off the bill. 

Overall, the experience was great. They were extremely nice about the mistake and I don't blame them. Mistakes happened! I don't think it should deter anybody  from going there and trying their delicious food! 

We sat outside, and it's a bit tight in sitting areas, so it's best to go with one other person, rather than three people or more.
author: Leta K.

description: I took a recommendation from a friend to check out Mymy in the city for brunch. There was a long line around 1pm when we arrived. We were only a party of two and it only took at 10-15 for them to find us a seat. Not bad at all. We ordered the BLT eggs Benedict and the Shrimp cake eggs Benedict. I thought the BLT was okay, and the shrimp cake was outstanding. The eggs were cooked perfectly, and the English muffins were big and thick. The dill sauce was a little strong, but I literally destroyed that dish. The guy next to me ordered the crab cake eggs Benedict, and I almost asked for a bite because it looked so good! I traded the hash browns for a fruit bowl, and it was outstanding as well. The waitresses were fast and friendly, the food was amazing and came out quick, and I highly recommend Mymy if you're looking for breakfast or brunch! 4.5 stars, will visit again.
author: Bryan C.

description: Wait time can be extensive when you're with a group since reservations aren't allowed and it doesn't accommodate strollers/car seats very well but the food is excellent. Very well priced As well
author: Vanae U.

description: Good breakfast! The wait was about 30 minutes and you stand outside, but it was pretty worth it. I enjoyed my food and would certainly come back.
author: K G.

description:
Great brunch restaurant with flavor packed dishes! 

There is a bit of a wait, first come first serve, but my fiancé and I waited for about half an hour when we arrived at 1045am. Not that bad. The inside is a bit small but it works. Service is a bit abrupt but they don't hurry you to kick you out, more so to be efficient given how many people are waiting. 

I had the BLT benediction and fiancé had the two eggs any style with bacon and side of Italian sausage. The hash browns are crispy and thin, right up his alley. The benediction was flavor packed but large, so I could only eat half of the plate. 

Would come back again to try other popular dishes!
author: Jen H.

description: Solid.  The food is really good.  The menu has all the standard stuff done well.  We both got the scrambled eggs with pesto, pine nuts, veggies etc. so yum! The staff is sweet and friendly and they have a good amount of outdoor seating with heat lamps! (A huge plus in my book). I avoid weekends because there are always lines which I will never wait in considering Olea is next door with a really delicious interesting menu.  If this weren't SF I'd rate it 5 but with all the great brunch spots I don't think it's at top.
author: Kristi R.

description: First time and I was amazed with their food. Had the corned beef hash breakfast, Potatoes were a great addition and the eggs were fluffy. If should ever visit the area I will definitely go again.
author: Stephanie R.

description:
Wish I had found this breakfast place earlier. It's delicious but I would imagine very busy over the weekends. 
Unusually attentive staff, they were all working the entire restaurant. If my iced tea was low, someone filled it. I used my napkin up, someone placed a couple more on my table. I had difficulty deciding on what to eat, three separate people had asked if I was ready to order before I had decided. 
Everything sounded delicious and the dish I had was great. Wish I had more people so I could have tried more things. 
Definitely loved this place.
author: Steffen G.

description: The food was great, the portion was huge. Quick and friendly service once you do get seated. The presentation of the food is awesome right down.
author: Elyse T.

description: Pros: Great food and quick service. Cons: Cozy restaurant and long lines (due to the great food). The menu is full of familiar breakfast staples so you can't go wrong. We ordered a couple of the scrambles and they were all delicious. I'll be back. Enjoy!
author: Ken C.

description:
I ordered the vanilla french toast and it's honestly one of the best I've ever had in my life! 

It has a perfect hint of vanilla and the bread is so fluffy. I like that they adorned it with fresh fruit - bananas, strawberries, and blueberries. I devoured the whole thing!

I stayed at an AirBnB a couple houses down and one of the locals recommended this place to us. She said it's one of the most famous brunch spots in the city. I have to say, if I ever moved to SF I'd be coming here every Sunday!
author: Lily K.
