description: We've been twice now, and it's worth both getting up early and waiting for a table. When I go to a restaurant, I sometimes get anxiety about ordering the 'best' thing on the menu, in case it's the only time I get to eat there. Mymy amplifies that by 1000. Everything on the menu looks incredible. Savory and sweet, they've got it covered. We never stay overnight in the neighborhood because it's too posh and spendy, but we get a ride to Mymy because it's THAT good. Get up early, and go :)
author: Andrea Z.

description:
We finally found a time when we could make it to Mymy and it wasn't jam packed.  Hint, go first thing in the morning on a weekday.  The spot is pretty tiny hence the long lines.  The staff was great and very accommodating.  We had Tex Mex scamble and I believe I had the Italian scramble.  Both were very large portions.  We were thinking about the pancakes as they sounded amazing.  We didn't get them and I'm glad we didn't because they were the size of a large frisbee.  Although they did look great.

Great breakfast spot in the city if you're either willing to wait in line or go super early.
author: Blake B.

description: This place is tiny but they are very fast and we were seated quickly.  We ordered the lemon ricotta soufflé pancakes and the crab cakes Benedict.   The pancakes were a perfect blend of sweet, creamy, and lemony.   The poached eggs were expertly done.  The crab cakes and the sauce on top were a great combination.
author: Dianne W.

description: I came here on a Saturday morning around 8:45 - 9 am. There was no wait, but we had to sit outside and the heaters weren't that strong on this windy San Franciscan "summer" (i.e., cold and foggy) morning. I got eggs over medium, toast, potatoes, and fruit. The eggs were cooked pretty well and the potatoes were nice and crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. I was satisfied with the variety and flavor of the fruit, as well, although it wasn't anything amazing. My breakfast mates seemed happy with their food -- French toast, Tex Mex scramble, and scrambled eggs. I wouldn't put this on the same level as Plow or fancier brunch places, but I would probably come back. Also, the food and service were *so much better* than Oleo across the street.
author: Claire K.

description: Delicious food and very tasty pistachio latte I would recommend this place to friends . Very warm inside so we sat outside overall experience was good I would go back
author: Steve M.

description:
They add gratuity to the original check as an item alongside food and drinks, and then they also put a second tip field on the second check to sign. Pretty sketchy and also against the law, since the mandatory tip is listed as "gratuity" and not "service charge", and it's not mentioned on the menu, see California Board of Equalization Regulation 1603, Section (g)(2) and IRS Bulletin 2012-26.

The food and service are just ok. Dubious hygiene practices since the cutlery and glasses had food residue.
author: Jacob W.

description: Today I and my wife went for breakfast to this place for the first time. I had chorizo scramble Tartine and my wife had italiano scramble Tartine. Food was very mediocre. But worst was, this evening my wife had very bad food poisoning. No last 48 hours we did not eat anything out of our routine food, only having breakfast at this place. Upon searching the reviews I discovered that other reviewers had food poisoning after eating italiano scramble. Certainly not going there ever. So do your due diligence before having any meal at this place
author: Ruben C.

description: Yummy brunch/lunch options. Line moves fairly quickly and the staff really try to keep things moving. Restaurant is small and service is good.
author: cindy n.

description: I had the crab benedict with lemon dill sauce and country crispy potatoes (they no longer offer the hash browns according to the waitress-which is why i came), but the crab cakes were really good. My husband had the mymy breakfast...nothing special for an $18 plate...also coffee (again nothing special) was charged at $3.50 that to me was highly expensive. Would i come back? Maybe not.
author: Natalie S.

description:
I love Mymy! The wait can get long on weekends, we've waited anywhere from 15-45 minutes for 2 people. Usually the earlier you get there (between 9-10am) the shorter the wait is. 

Still, the wait seems to go by quickly. Outside seating is nice although there's a good chance you'll be in the straight sun (be prepared). Inside is small but there are a decent number of tables. 

The wait staff isn't super friendly but they are diligent and polite. They don't waste any time taking your order and bringing food out - you can tell they're trying to get you in and out quickly since many people are waiting. This could be a con to some people but I don't mind it. 

My favorite dish is the farmers market scramble - SO GOOD! They definitely know how to cook eggs.
author: Hailey H.

description: If your in the mood for a twist on a classic Eggs Benedict & a solid cup of coffee than this is the place for you! Tiny location so get ready to become good friends with the table next to you... was able to snag a table right away since it was a random Monday but definitely could see wait time being an issue on the weekend. Staff works fast to get you in and out quickly but never felt rushed. Definitely would recommend to anyone traveling to SF.
author: Jessica W.

description: This place is awesome, had the Norwegian eggs Benedict with potatoes and it was definitely the best I've ever had!! The food is delicious and very reasonably priced for SF--go check it for breakfast
author: Paul A.

description: We came here based on Yelp reviews and were so pleased! The service was great and the food was phenomenal! I got the BLT Benedict and my boyfriend got the French toast....both were amazing! Oh and you have to try the pistachio latte! We will go back every time we visit San Fran!
author: Elise B.

description:
"A" and I wanted to try a new brunch spot.  He decided to give Mymy a try after viewing some Yelp photos and reading reviews.  We arrived around 11am on Saturday and there were groups of people waiting for their names to be called.  We probably waited 30 minutes before we got seated, which isn't too bad.

Looking at the photos, I had a couple of items I was debating over as the menu was very extensive.  Unfortunately, their weekend menu is limited with only a few options to choose from. 

We ordered:

Vanilla Sponge French Toast - The name doesn't lie!  The French toast had the perfect level of sweetness, fluffy and soft like a sponge, and melted in my mouth.  The vanilla was very faint, but I'm glad as after finishing one of the french toast, it got to be a little too heavy.  It also came with slices of bananas, strawberry, and blueberry.  

French Toast - I can't remember what the name of this one was, but I believed they used a baguette as it was crispy.  There were also corn flake like pieces sprinkled on top and a blueberry cream sauce along the side.  "A" liked his order more than my vanilla French toast as he thought it was too doughy.

Side of Hash Brown and Bacon - I'm so glad "A" decided to order this as it balanced out our meal.  I normally don't care for hash browns, but this was incredible.  It was paper thin and crispy.  The bacon was mediocre.

Hot Chocolate - way too sweet!

Overall, the food was okay.  Service was non-existent.  "A" ordered coffee and wasn't asked if he wanted a refill until we asked for the bill.  I wouldn't make a trip out to Mymy, but would give it another chance if I'm in the area.
author: Candice H.

description: Came here for brunch on Saturday, and even without reservations, we got seated pretty quickly (outdoors too!). My friends got a few of the different omelets, one of which was Mexican style and a mix between a classic omelet with a Mexican twist (complete with beans, salsa, and lots of cheese) - I forgot exactly what this one was called but it's pretty obvious in the menu, and it was pretty good! I got the lemon ricotta pancake, which was one of the best I've had!! I thought it would just have a hint of lemon/ricotta flavor, but I was surprised to find a thick pancake with ricotta filling inside - a must try!!
author: Hana C.

description:
Great little spot! In from out of town and was looking for, of course, some good eats.  And based off the pictures and reviews,their pancakes were calling my name. Ended up with the Zucchini pancakes w 2 sunny side up eggs and it was perfection. 
One note: if you get weirded out w raw egg, make sure you ask for over easy/medium. A little to raw for me but was still delicious! 

Outdoor seating is a plus! Got to watch the trolleys go by just as the sun was coming up over the buildings--not a bad Thursday morning!
author: Laurel K.

description: I was going back and forth between wanting to try their savory or sweet brunch items. Thank goodness I saw this item on the menu. The banana soufflé pancakes were well portioned (huge) and it was a perfect bite of Fluffy pancake, maple syrup, and bananas. Probably one of my favorite pancakes I've ever had. The line is a bit tricky, there no wait list but it goes fairly quickly if you come early. We didn't, but this meal was totally worth the wait.
author: Faye C.

description: Great Sunday breakfast in the Nob/Russian Hill part of the City.  Long line out front but went fast.
author: Jeff A.

description: What a delicious breakfast!! A group of us went and we all were very impressed with our food! We had pancakes, hash, salmon, and eggs Benedict between us all and none of us were disappointed! We will all definitely be back for more!
author: Taylor A.

description: This place was great! Very fresh food.  Little bit of a wait on the weekends but well worth it
author: Peter T.

description:
oh my gosh this place is amazing! My dad and I yelped brunch places near nob hill because that's where we happened to be and we found this gem of a place. I have heard that the line gets super long for brunch but we went at noon on a Wednesday and there was absolutely no line - it was a bit stuffy inside so we sat outside - which was perfect. 

The service was very good, very attentive but not intrusive. We we helped about 2 minutes after sitting down AND the food came out very quickly which is always a plus.

We started off with coffee and fresh squeezed grapefruit juice, both great choices. We then split the Harvest Scramble and the Banana Blueberry Souffle pancakes. THIS FOOD WAS INCREDIBLE. The harvest scramble has pesto, veggies, pine nuts, and is perfect for vegetarians (which i am not but this just looked way too good to pass up). The scramble came with sourdough (or wheat) toast and super thin hashbrowns, all of which were delicious. The banana blueberry souffle pankcake was heavenly as well. They are baked with egg whites inside the pancakes, which i had never heard of before but wow were they amazing. 

Definitely a be-backer and I would highly recommend that you all give this place a try as well!
author: Ilana B.

description:
What a gem of a brunch place in San Francisco.  The only drawback to MyMy is its location up on Nob Hill, only because it's inaccessible to me.


---- SAVOURY BRUNCH ----

Frisco Scramble:  5 stars
I wanted to try an omelette but they only had a Peasant Lorraine flat omelette today.  As it turned out, I needn't have worried:  the scramble wrapped around its filling of tender sausage in big soft curds (unlike an average scramble, which is over-mashed into scrawnier curds that get tough and overcooked) and had half an avocado, artfully sliced and fanned across the whole mound.
The hash browns were good and crispy, more fried bits than potato which pleased this potato non-lover, but the grilled Sourdough toast was the sleeper hit -- I couldn't stop eating it.  I simply added regular butter, but it was so fresh and fragrant that plain butter was all it needed.

Shrimp and Longanisa Grits: 5 stars
Some of the most fresh, tasty seasoned shrimp I've had. Also beautifully blistered juicy shishito peppers and yummy grits with sweet sausage.

Baja Benedict:  4 stars
My partner got this and loved it.

Peasant Lorraine Flat Omelette: 4.5 stars


---- SWEET BRUNCH ----

Lemon Ricotta Pancakes: 5 stars

Lemon Soufflé Pancake: 4 stars
A bit dry.


They also had Zucchini Pancakes and Blueberry Soufflé pancakes which I would love to try next time...
author: Letitia L.

description:
Let's be real. If you don't want to wait for 30+ mins at Mymy to be seated, you can always cross the street and head over to Olea, where the wait is a lot shorter. But man Mymy is worth it! I've been here a couple of times and both times I go with my sweet tongue in terms of dishes ordered.

Sponge French Toast - This is layered with mascarapone and butterscotch. Covered in fruit and served with Vermont Maple Syrup. Best French Toast in the city hands down.

Lemon Ricotta Souffle Pancake - A million times better than your standard lemon tart. Try it!!!

Both dishes are 14 dollars but they fill you up. 

If I wanted to wait every weekend at this place for brunch, I would, but I'm too goddamn lazy.

Cheers!
author: Ray H.

description:
I had three breakfasts in San Francisco. I ordered some version of Eggs Benedict at each meal. Mymy was my favorite by far, and honestly one of the best breakfasts I have had anywhere.

We arrived around 9. There is a clipboard on the wall where you write your name and party size, and then you step out to the street to wait. Even though we only had two people ahead of us on the list, we ended up waiting 40 minutes. They kept calling all the parties of 2, and since we were a party of 3, I guess it was harder to find us a table. This place is super duper small, so definitely expect a wait. My friend said she has seen the line halfway around the block before.

I am not usually one for waiting, but it was actually worth it!

Service - Great! Very nice employees who were cheerful and polite.

Ambiance - Like I said, it's very small, but the table was a decent size and we didn't feel cramped once we were seated. The place is decorated with paintings of flowers and old men (??) and little tiny jewelry boxes. Random, but sort of charming. 

Food - I had the BLT Benedict. In lieu of an English Muffin, the poached eggs are on top of a piece of toast, covered in garlic spinach, diced tomatoes, bacon and a delicious hollandaise. And you are served hash browns. They appear to be a massive portion, and they are served as a large rectangle. Kind off odd. But they are super thin and very crisp, not greasy at all. It was like just eating the outside layer of a tater tot. So good.

BF had the Chive Pancakes with Gorgonzola and Bacon Crumbles. I need to learn how to make this, ASAP! Delicious savory pancakes, with baked on gorgonzola cheese that is perfectly crisp, you know how awesome cheese gets right before it starts to burn...well, they have mastered that. The pancakes were served with honey to drizzle on and it was pure heaven. I think I liked his food more than mine, and I really liked my food.

My friend also had a version of Benedict, which she was very happy with. Total was $45 for three breakfasts and three drinks. Very reasonable. Loved this place, I hope when I visit my friend is SF again, we can come here for breakfast!
author: Randi B.

description:
I've been here a handful of times, and every time I visit home, I now make it a point to have brunch here. I have made it a "tradition" to get one of the soufflé pancakes. It is melt in your mouth delicious! I can't remember all that I've had, but I know they never disappointed. A few of my favorites are (clearly) the pancakes, Baja California Benny, big papa burger, and the frisco scramble. 

Oh, and just a tip - they can get pretty busy and the waits can be a bit long, so don't come starving. And most importantly, be patient! It's worth the wait!
author: Janine S.

description: OMG this place is amazing!! I don't really tell myself I'll come back to many restaurants but I'm definitely coming back. There is always a line so definitely come early and no groups if you want to get seated faster. We came on a saturday at 11am and got seated in about half an hour. My girlfriend and I shared the crab cake benedict and the blueberry soufflé pancakes! Both delicious but I was blown away by the pancakes. There's cream in between the pancakes making it so soft and you won't regret ordering it.
author: Christine T.

description: Great brunch! Food, drinks, and service were all awesome. Line outside was pretty long, but as a party of two, only waited approximately 10 minutes for a table inside. Would recommend and will definitely return!
author: Holly H.

description:
Oh mymy... I'm so glad I was feeling adventurous one day and went on a mission to explore new food places around the Nob Hill area. My bf and I were in the mood for a hearty brunch. He loves benedicts so I went on Yelp and found this place! There was about 8 parties of 2 ahead of us on a Saturday around 12:00. I thought it was going to be a long wait but my bf said let's give it a shot and so glad that we did. There's a coffee place right around the corner from Mymy and you can grab something to drink while waiting :) 

After 20 minutes of waiting, my bf and I ended up sitting on the counter. To my surprise, the spot wasn't so tight that the person next to me is all up in my bubble. The menu has sandwiches, burger and benedicts. I ordered the florentine benedict and my bf got the Benedict with bacon and prosciutto. Let me say.... I've had lots of benedicts before and this one is so far THE best I've ever had. The egg was done in perfection that the yolk spills out as soon as you cut it in half. Other places I've tried where the benedicts were overcooked. The benedicts come with a side of hash brown and a slice of orange. The mimosa we got was also very sweet and delicious! Must try if you're in the Nob Hill area :)
author: Anny W.

description:
I really liked this place! We waited for a bit, but food was pretty good. Their pancake was soooo fluffy and tasty. I wish I found here earlier!

I highly recommened this place:)
author: Satoka O.

description:
Ok. I want to ask people who have been to this place. Have you had a bill with gratuity automatically added even though you are not in a large party? 

I've been there twice. When I went there for the first time, a few months ago, I was with my mom and a friend. We enjoyed our meal, but after I got the check with 15% (mandatory) gratuity, I got so confused. We asked them why. And one server said they ALWAYS put auto gratuity. My mom was visiting me from my country so my friend and I didn't want to argue with that, so we just paid and left. 

My second visit here ended with same disappointment. This time, the server said they charge the auto gratuity because there are a lot of tourists. But even though I said I'm not a tourist, she seemed she didn't care about it. I understand the tipping culture doesn't exist in some counturies and some tourists don't really understand how it works or how much they should pay. But I think, in that case, I think the servers should let people know how it works and why, NOT JUST PUT AUTO GRATUITY WITHOUT A WORD.

I don't think I am the only one who thinks this is wrong. I really enjoyed my brunch and had a good time with my friends, BUT EVERYTHING HAPPENED AFTER THE MEAL WAS NOT PLEASANT AT ALL. I hope them to think about this one more time for future customers who might get the same experience to pay auto gratuity without knowing.
author: Sumin H.

description:
I came in on a weekday and was immediately seater though the place was full. I cant imagine how packed it might be on a weekend.

I ordered the Tex-mex and it was quite delicious. A little fattier, and same goes for the fresco chicken sausage steak. Both were laid on a thin hash bed, which was crispy and I think cooked in coconut oil. I thoroughly enjoyed it.

The cappuccino was mediocre, foamy and weak, with cinnamon (??!). I am sure they meant well but why? As a side note, there was festive Christmas music which was weird. I still haven't had any turkey this month, so hold your horses.
author: Martin G.

description:
Since moving out of SF, one of the things I've missed is brunch in SF.  I missed places that could make pancakes, scrambles, and omelettes sound sexy by listing a myriad of ingredients.  What?  Two kinds of tomatoes?  Sundried and Roma?  I'm in heaven.  No, but seriously, once you move away from here, most breakfast places will list their dishes as "eggs, ham" and that's if you're lucky.  

Mymy is a darling establishment with some unique art pieces on the wall.  I must have stared at the deer with tube socks for at least 5 minutes.  I got the Peasant Lorraine Flat Omelette, and it was served with toast and flat crispy hash brown.  It was delicious.  Service was prompt and I have no complaints.
author: Debra C.

description: Went here because of all the great reviews. Was looking for a normal place to eat for breakfast. You know eggs, bacon, hash browns, biscuits and gravy etc. the normal stuff a Texas boy eats. It is listed as American food but it is Asian owned and operated and our server barley spoke English. About a 15 minute wait before we were seated. They don't do a list just stand in line down the sidewalk. No issue with the wait but nothing was great. I could have passed on this. Never seen an American breakfast That serves shrimp and eggs. Bacon was not crispy, don't know what was up with my over medium eggs, not sure what kind of bread it was and the potatoes, well let's say I've never had fried potatoes that were no good until this place. I can say I tried it and disliked it. The coffee was good so I gave them the 2nd star.
author: Sydney H.

description:
A wonderful brunch spot in Nob Hill.

The wait time wasn't any where near as bad as the reviews here might lead one to believe - I waited about 20 minutes in line on Saturday at 11am (they no longer do the signup sheet).

The cafe mocha was solid but nothing to write home about.

The French toast was the real star of the show. Warm, fluffy, and decadently buttery, it pairs excellently with the maple syrup and selection of fresh fruits for a brunch treat that'll fill you up but leaving you wanting to come back for more every weekend.
author: Ananya M.

description: This little restaurant does not look like much from the street, with a few outside tables and a small sign it would be easy to pass right by.  Although the interior is cramped and only seats a few at a time, the food was well worth it. The French toast and Tex-mex scramble were delicious and filling, with a good portion size on the plate. The food was certainly overpriced, even by San Francisco standards. You can probably find a cheaper brunch somewhere else in the area, but the quality of the food balances that out. Check it out if you are in the area!
author: Jacob W.

description:
Good food- blt with tasty bacon and avocado -
Could have used choice in salad dressing- 
Service was careless--ordered H20 which never appeared, never offered a refill on ice tea. 
Restaurant should encourage waiters to be proactive about seeing if guests have what they need-
author: Fran H.

description:
Mymy is a little place at the intersection of California street and Larkin street. Bustling with activity, this little place had its line out the door on a Sunday noon. I had a 30 minute wait for a party of 2 - though sometimes a wait is an indication of good food.

Trusting yelp with my food choice, I decided on the Tex mex scramble. The generous dish was full of chorizo, paired with a tangy chipotle aioli, complete with avocado. It was oh so delicious, especially with the side of hash browns and corn tortillas. My friend had the corned beef hash. He seemed to enjoy it, though the corned beef was closer to chunks of meat rather than the mince he was hoping for. 

Overall, mymy is a solid brunch choice with a ton of choices! I would definitely come back and try something else. Don't let the line deter you!
author: Julia N.

description:
Best eggs Benedict I've ever had hands down and they offer pitcher sized mimosas?! 
Only downside that the place is small and you have to wait outside in a line. 
Service is fast and the food comes out freshly made to order.

Yum! Always headed here for brunch, this is definitely the spot to go!
author: V V.

description:
First... We got lucky and were seated right away even though it was packed. The service was average but very friendly and attentive.
But the important part is... The food was Amazing!!!!!
author: Lamaris L.

description:
Dropped by for a quick breakfast on a Wednesday morning before work. We were pleased to see that the brunch menu was still in full force at that time. It seems to be run by some Asians, and they've "rebranded" the outside to look more like a classic brunch joint rather than a cutsy coffee shop. 

:: Sausage Burger - Interesting patty made from sausage. Had a nice pink color, and was reminiscent of hot dog, but better. Not their specialty though. Stick with the classic brunch dishes.
:: Frisco scramble - hash browns were the best part. Loved that it came with half an avocado spread out on the top. Also, forget about the foiled butter they give and slather your toast with the homemade jam sitting on the table!

Very casual atmosphere, and would be good for families or even singles. Clientele all seem to be very down to earth, locals from the neighborhood.
author: Audrey L.

description:
Backstory: People used to be obsessed with Olea's french toast across the street, it was definitely the most happenin' brunch spot in Nob Hill. People were eventually like wtf let's just go to Mymy instead of waiting like 45 minutes for eggy toast. The rest is history, and now you can pretty much walk into Olea and eat within 5 minutes because everyone's in line for Mymy. Classic SF. 

Jokes aside I'm honestly a huge fan of Mymy, there's something for everyone and everything there is delicious. It's really impossible to have a bad meal there.There are no reservations and there's always a line on the weekend but I've never waited more than 25 or 30 minutes even at peak hours (11-1 on Sat/Sun). 

I always have a hard time deciding between sweet and savory at brunch; I'm always drawn to the pancakes and french toast but end up deciding on an egg dish to avoid that "I've eaten 700 calories but I'll be hungry in an hour because it was just flour and sugar" feeling. ENTER SOUFFLE PANCAKES!! 

These babies are really the ticket if you're a pancake lover but want a filling and protein filled meal that won't leave you feeling crappy. They are fluggy and egg white filled and pretty much divine. The lemon ricotta are top notch and just have the most delightful hint of citrus, not overpowering at all. 

The Benedicts always tempt me and are really delicious, especially the Norwegian with smoked salmon. The hash dishes and scrambles are also good. If you're not a fan of flat crispy hash browns I would stay away from them here, and opt for crispy breakfast potatoes instead - the hash browns are a little too greasy and hard for my taste. 

They churn out a crazy amount of food here and it's all delicious, definitely worth checking out!  Walk over to Grace Cathedral/Hunington park afterward to relax on a sunny day!
author: Hailey H.

description:
Really quaint spot for brunch in SF. I ate here when I stayed at my brother's place near Nob Hill. He said there's usually about a half hour wait, but we went a little early (10 am) and we got right in.

The service was quick and efficient and the food is pretty good. It's a good compromise to waiting for hours at a more popular brunch spot. It's clean and pretty simple, but worth trying at least once.
author: Ashley M.

description:
If you want to eat the FLUFFIEST pancakes in the world, you have got to come here. 

My friends & I ordered the:

- Tex Mex Scramble (9/10)
The sauce on the eggs is AMAZING. Definitely a good place to order if you're on the savory side. 

- BLT Benedict (8.5/10)
You can never really go wrong with an eggs Benedict anywhere.. The eggs were poached well and the bacon was extemeeh tasty.

- Lemon Ricotta Pancakes (8.5/10)
THESE WERE SO FLUFFY I COULD DIE!! These were probably the softest, pancakes I've every had but sadly, the taste of the lemon wasn't really there. It would've been perfect if the taste was a bit stronger tho. 

Overall, an awesome place for breakfast & there was no wait for a party of 3 on a Friday morning!
author: Rachel Y.

description:
a nob hill staple. try everything here, honestly. I've been here about 5 times and I've yet to have something I don't like.

must tries:
-hash browns. the thin variety. extra crispy. no soft smush to distract from the yum
-souffle pancakes
-the potato wedges that come as a side to the tartines
-the eggs. scrambles, on a tartine, anything! soo fluffy!
-the chorizo anything. yum!

the good to knows:
- the line is usually out the door (and by usually I mean always), but if you're not there during peak hours, I would say this is around 10am? the wait is actually really, really good for san francisco. a lot of people leave for other options, so names get crossed off the list sometimes by threes
-if you order coffee at the end, they will give it to you in a to go cup. partially to get you out the door sooner, but hey, I like the extra cup of coffee to sip on while walking around nob hill

the bottom line:
what makes mymy different? it serves up a small, but creative menu that doesn't get old. you'll crave the items you've ordered before and will want to try the rest of the menu that include all your brunch staples with a creative twist to make it interesting. think lemon souffle pancakes, chive pancakes, and stuffed french toast.
author: Patricia K.

description:
Glad we found this breakfast place. Thanks Yelpers! Husband had the eggs tartine- perfectly scrambled eggs. My BLT Benedict was was light and tasty. Hash browns resembled more like a potato chip  than potatoes but overall was good. Staff super friendly and great breakfast menu. Worth the wait, the list moves quickly.

Only complaint was they sat us outside in the sun and when we asked to move to the table next to us in the shade that came available, we were denied. Considering we just sat down and placed our order, I didn't think it was a big deal to make us happy. It would have only taken is only 3 minutes to move. We ate so fast since it was so unusually hot for SF. Poor Husband's forehead was literally sunburned by the time we were done. Made the whole experience only 4 stars. If we ever go back, will probably request to sit in shade or inside. Would try again.
author: Alice C.

description: So sad when a really great place loses its mojo. We discover what was a gem 4 years ago. Best hash browns bar none in the city, maybe the world, fantastic variety, immaculate service. That is all gone. They now serve boring flavorless "crispy potatoes" only one type of bread for toast, and although the waitstaff is pleasant, extremely slow. When this place was making its name, was my favorite breakfast spot, now that it's popular with the in crowd, sadly it sucks.
author: SCOTT L.

description: How often can you get a savory  AND healthy breakfast?   Marscapone French Toast  with a healthy dose of baby banana,  assorted  berries  and orange slice,  drizzled  with butterscotch... MMMMM.  Fast,  helpful  service by Thai employees  and ever so hard working Mexican guys in the kitchen!  The best.
author: Rick S.

description:
I ate at Mymy on Monday afternoon just before taking in the guilty pleasure of "Magic Mike XXL" at Sundance Kabuki Cinema.

Moral of the story: the Parma Eggs Benedict is the best breakfast I've had the pleasure to eat. Get it if you value your tastebuds.

I subbed out fruit for the hashbrowns, trying to be healthy-ish; fruit was tasty but I remain tempted by the mongo potato goodness. Also added in the Italian sausage patty, which was good but a bit too salty for me. The Grapefruit Mimosa was delicious -- and Cappucinno (which comes with a sprinkle of cinnamon) was excellent. Quick and friendly service gets my thumbs-up too.

Mymy = My fav for breakfast after also trying Kitchen Story, Mission Beach Cafe, Chow and Griddle Fresh. I live in Duboce Triangle/the Castro, and Mymy in Nob Hill is a journey, but very worth the trip.
author: Sarah J.

description:
Really solid brunch place! I shared a frisco scramble & florentine benedict with a friend, and both dishes were very good. The hash browns are amazing (crispy and yummy), and the eggs were perfect. 

I also like how fast the turnaround is here. I'm not waiting hours in line for brunch. It was probably a 10 minute wait for two people at 10AM on a Saturday morning. The place is small, but people seem to be quick here which is great!
author: Jeanette S.

description:
Oh Mymy, you have set the bar for brunch! 

Annabelle P. and I came here on April 1st, and loved every part of our experience here! We waited less than 10 minutes for a spot to open up, which I thought was super fast considering how small and popular this spot seemed. Although I wish we could have sat outside, it was nice to see the interior and people watch through the window. 

Food:
BLT Benediction was probably one of the best bennys I have ever had. I love eggs benedicts, but the Hollandaise sauce was everything on this one! The eggs were perfect as well - not grossly undercooked and runny, yet not super well done that the yolk still dripped. I really like that the hashbrowns were shredded thin and crispy. 

Lemon Ricotta Soufflé pancakes = dessert for breakfast. So fluffy, creamy, delicious, and huge, we had to take a pancake home! The table jam really complemented the pancake when the syrup wasn't enough. The fruits were a nice garnish and really added to the dish.

The service was excellent despite a packed house. The server was super sweet and very attentive. We were really happy with the food and experience at Mymy's.
author: Hannah P.

description: Perfect brunch spot! The poached eggs and crispy potatoes were incredible. My favorite breakfast on my vacation! Staff was very friendly and attentive, a bit pricey, but expected in California, and also great coffee selection. I love that they have an outside section!
author: Megan K.

description: Wow! Wonderful experience.  My husband never raves about food. He ordered the scramble with chicken apple sausage. Wonderful. What can I say about the pancakes? The lightest I have ever had.  Presentation was amazing. Very short wait.  Will definitely visit when in town again.
author: Tanya K.

description: MyMy is one of my favorite brunch spots in the city! There is sometimes a small line, but I have never waited more than 15 minutes or so. Want something sweet? Order the banana blueberry soufflé pancakes. Savory? Get the Tex-Amex scramble. If you can't decide between sweet or savory just get both like I once did. I was pregnant, so don't judge me! My waiter was highly impressed.
author: Julianne G.

description:
Let's start positive. The two stars you see here are for the Parma Benediction. Very tasty...all of it goes very well together. 

Service was lousy. They were prompt in seating us, but after our order was taken and served, it was impossible to flag anyone down until they were ready for us to pay the check. 

Finally: the worst part of our experience were the lemon ricotta pancakes. Most places add a dash of ricotta to the pancake batter, which results in a wonderful fluffy cloud of pancakey goodness. Instead we were met with a thin layer of pancake cooked around a brick of ricotta cheese (see my picture). We were starving, but we couldn't bring ourselves to eat it.
author: Nathan S.

description:
Been here twice during a week stay in SF. Food was that good :) Five stars for the food, but four for the service. The second time we were here, the server was not the friendliest, and kept looking at my friend and I as he would talk with the other staff in their native language. Gratuity is automatically added to the check.

I definitely recommend the egg benedicts. I have gotten the Norwegian salmon and the lemon dill crab cake. The Norwegian one is amazing, a must try!! The crab cake was good, but I was not particularly fond of the sauce on it. Both were served with super crispy hash browns.
author: Helen L.

description:
This Place Is Great... glad we found it on our walking tour
The Hash Browns were thin and crispy just the way we like them. I had 
the Crab Benedict with Shrimp and it was amazing my wife had one of the scrambles I thought the prices here were Fair especially walking down from Nob Hill
well be back...
author: Phillip J.

description: Came here again for another visit and it was just as great as last time. This time the wait went so quickly and the food was much faster than I was expecting. Definitely worth a visit!
author: Abby S.

description:
Mymy... one day later and I'm still thinking about the food that I ordered for brunch. 
I ordered the Chives Pancake with Crumbled Bacon and Gorgonzola Cheese and let me say, It was so delicious!!!! The dish came with two pancakes and two sunny side eggs. After I had initially ordered I was scared that I wouldn't like the gorgonzola cheese in the  pancake, but that was a false alarm. The pancake was made so nicely that I could taste some crispy cheese on some of the edges of my pancake. Mmmm. It also came with some honey glaze on the side to add a bit of sweetness to this otherwise savory pancake. This was definitely a nice change to the brunch items that I usually order.

My boyfriend ordered the Tex Mex Omelette/Scramble. It looked very good and tasted good as well but I probably wouldn't order it myself since the sauce they use in this dish is spicy (Reminds me of the Orange Sauce from La Vics hehe..)

I will definitely be back to try the other things on the menu!
author: Michelle C.

description:
Overall, there was nothing horrible-- but absolutely nothing great. I've no idea who wrote these insane 5 star reviews, but think hard if you are coming from somewhere other than around the corner or across the street. 

Staff was nice, and quick, when you can get their attention. 

The food was at best mediocre: we had lemon ricotta pancakes and florentine Benedict. 
-The pancakes didn't have the ricotta mixed in, but instead was a layer added to the top of the pancake- reminded me of places that premake plain omelets and then cook the additions (vegetables, meat) separately and serve it like a soft taco (plain egg omelet with stuff spooned into the middle but not cooked into the omelet); 
- the Florentine Benedict was ok-   the vegetables were overcooked and soggy; we had to add salt and pepper to give the benedict taste, and even the muffin was disappointing- way too doughy and disappointed in not having the expected and desired  flaky crunchy English muffin.
Unfortunately the drinks were also mediocre- the Mimosa didn't seem like it was made with fresh-squeezed orange juice, and my husband's beer was very very foamy. 

We trekked across the city to the place- once was too much.
author: S R.

description: This place is amazing! You have to try the soufflé pancakes they are out of this world. The blueberry cream sauce that comes with it just brings it over the top. I was so into my food that I can't even remember what my hubby orders but I believe it was a burger of some sort with home fries and let me tell you the home fries are probably the best we've ever had. I am giving this place 4 stars as the Arnold Palmers were more bitter than sweet and 45.00 for brunch is pretty steep, at least where I am from!
author: Samantha L.

description:
Seriously have to love a place that has so many rules about the waiting list.  I went on a Sunday while hungover in SF.  But when am I in SF and not hung over.   

Mymy is down the street from my friends and we've been wanting to go so we finally waited out the line and got our seats.

Word to the newbies - don't leave after putting your name in.  She will call it once or maybe twice and then your done.  You will be super sad.  I saw a few people miss their spots and the lady has no problem telling you too bad.  

I feel bad even saying that I don't remember what eggs benny I ordered but it was so good.  I will totally go back again and again.  

Just be prepared to wait it out.
author: Jennifer F.

description: Very good Baja and Crab Cake Benny. You can't go wrong here and if you have to wait.....its worth it.  Potatoes cooked crunchy on the outside but nice and soft in the middle.
author: Jason M.

description: Their service was great. The French toast was perfect! My husband ordered the two egg scrambled. It was generous order of eggs and the potatoes were delicious, very crispy.
author: Hilla T.

description: After walking around enjoying our Saturday morning, my husband and I stumbled upon the line at Mymy and decided to give it a try for brunch. Not only were we pleasantly surprised with how quickly the line moved, but the food (and coffee) was AWESOME. I got the frisco scramble, which was a ton of food and my husband got the spicy pop pork scramble w/ salsa verde, which was even more food. We will definitely be coming back here.
author: Hillary M.

description:
Happy to have checked Mymy off my list. I'm one of those people that hate hate hate waiting in long lines... so Mymy was another one of those that I opted to visit during a weekday during a weekend.

The food here at this neighborhood gem really is delicious and I liked the flavors- they were more unique and exciting than the typical brunch fare. We shared the Baja California Eggs Benedict ($14) and the Hash ($13) - my goodness they were both so good. I loved the eggs benedict with shrimp and delicious toasted bread instead of english muffins. I also though the hash topped with poached eggs was exploding in flavor! I only wish the hash was a dash more tender..but nonetheless, still amazing.

The wait on weekdays is short! But on weekends it's easily 1+ hours, depending if you come during 8-10AM, or 10AM-noon... good luck!

Service is fast and stupendous!
author: Veronica S.

description: The soufflé pancakes are pretty gross.  The center of the pancake is nothing more than tasteless fluffy egg white.  It was so unappetizing I could only eat the outsides of the pancake, which contained just the normal pancake batter.   Potatoes were nice and crispy, and the food is presented nicely...but be forewarned the soufflé pancakes are disgusting unlike what every other review claims.
author: Jamie B.

description: I've been wanting to try this place forever and I love it! Big Brunch meal of Benedict and french toast was amazing. I've never had English muffins like that, maybe they make them? The wait wasn't too bad on a Saturday at 11am. Line was only 15 minutes long. We left full and happy
author: Karen T.

description: I had the Parma Benedict. Fresh tomatoes and prosciutto and fresh mozzarella with a perfectly poached egg and creamy Hollandaise sauce. Mixing all this together with the perfectly cooked crunchy hash was a flavor explosion. The service was great and extremely fast! A must try if your in SF.
author: Juan M.

description: Definitely worth the 30 minute wait in line. My husband had the zucchini pancakes and he absolutely loved them! My kids had the French toast, yum! Food came out faster than expected, which was a pleasant surprise for being so busy. Orange juice was freshly squeezed and delicious, coffee was also very good. I would definitely recommend this restaurant!
author: Ruby C.

description:
Oh mymy goodness. This restaurant was so DELICIOUS!!! Would definitely put this on my recommended brunch list. Savory or sweet, whichever you choose, the food here is good. 

Taste-
Banana Blueberry Soufflé Pancake: Ugh. The soufflé part of the pancake makes it the fluffiest airiest most decadent pancake. First of all, when it comes out it just looks like something you'd want to dive into. Criss-cross drizzled in syrup with a ball of butter melting into a pool along the top, this two stack pancake plate was edible for the eyes. The syrup they give for the pancakes is light and thin so it really doesn't over power the actual flavor of the pancake. Once you cut into the middle, you'll find a swirl of light yummy egg whites. The candied walnuts on the side of the plate added a nice crunch to the fluffy pancakes. Everything meshes together so well on this plate! 

Parma Flavor: Honestly one of my favorite eggs benedict. Upon putting the first bite in my mouth, I wanted to order another plate of it before I was even done. A perfectly poached egg covered in a chive hollandaise sauce sits atop an English muffin bed with prosciutto, tomato, and fresh melted mozzarella. The asparagus were perfectly seasoned, and I liked that it was kept to the side of the Benedict just so I didn't have more to cut through. The Benedict also has basil leaves and is sprinkled with grana padano (tastes like Parmesan cheese) which gives the Benedict as a whole a more fresh and deeper flavor. If anything, I would've liked a little more hollandaise sauce because it was a little drier than I was used to, but the flavor was there all the same. The side of hash browns that come along with it are extremely thin and crispy. There's not really any potato texture, just a crisp bite of hash brown. So if you're looking for something with a little more substance, I'd say substitute it for their country style potatoes because those looked pretty yummy too!! 

Service-
You can tell they do quick turn over here. Everything is really fast paced. Quick to take your order, and they bring your food out to you fairly quickly as well. As soon as we finished our pitcher of water, they were quick to bring us a new one in a matter of seconds. We asked for an extra pancake syrup and they brought it out in a matter of seconds as well. The reason I give this place a 4 and not a 5 is because I didn't feel quite relaxed and leisurely as I enjoyed my brunch. As soon as I was done I felt rushed that I had to leave so that the next party could come and take my place. But I mean, the food was so delicious so who can complain. 

Restaurant Atmosphere-
Like I said, they try to be fast here to get their waiting customers into the restaurant as quick as possible. Because of that it may come across to their customers to feel rushed but it's not so bad, just enjoy your food. Two of us came on a Sunday around 11:15am and they sat us within 10 minutes because surprisingly all the parties ahead of us were a party of 3+. 

Highly recommend this place to anyone looking for some yummy brunch! Will definitely be back here again sometime soon.
author: Tori W.

description:
Sadly this is one of those places that the food is really good and worth waiting for but the service needs to be revamped. 
When there are nothing but empty tables inside and your still refuse to seat the party unless all four are there it seems a little stupid. 
Hands down one of the best corn beef hash breakfasts I've had in a while, with the eggs poached and real corn beef (not the dog food looking one from a can) and perfect hash browns this is how this dish is meant to be made. 
The lemon ricotta pancakes are super light and fluffy (ours came burnt) and definitely worth trying. 
I will end up going back hopefully to better service and want to try the French toast, it looked amazing on the table next to us.
author: Blake R.

description:
The perfect brunch. 

A friend and I decided to share quite a few things just because everything sounded so good. We had the shrimp and crab cakes, banana blueberry pancakes (so fluffy!), mambo Italiano egg scramble (nice combo of flavors), sponge French toast and a side of bacon (the best bacon ever). 

They deserve each and every star I've given. The wait wasn't long for either a table or the food. The lattes were good. Everything was good! My favorite was definitely the shrimp and crab cakes.
author: Felicia D.

description: The Seafood Salad was fantastic! Fresh and delicious!! My husband and I were famished after a long plane ride and then a walk. The concierge recommended MyMy. It was great!
author: Dakisha W.

description:
We waited an hour for 4 people on a Sunday morning at about 11 a.m.  

It is hard to write a review after waiting that long.  If we broke into two tables of two, we would have probably been seated after half an hour.  

Did I love the food?  Yes.  Did I enjoy the Nob Hill atmosphere?  Yes.  Would I come back again?  Probably not.  And the only reason is I'm scarred by that wait time.  I'm not a native San Franciscan, heck I don't even live here, so maybe that wait time is normal.  But I just don't enjoy standing around wasting my time for an hour.  Even the possibility of that happening again will keep me away.  (Then again, I might come back again in a pair after trying tons of other brunch places.  I'm fickle like that).

But on to the good part.  The food was delicious.  My perfect brunch there would consist of the corned beef and a pancake.  Obviously, I picked at everyone's plate.  I got the soufflé banana pancake.  The soufflé part is because it is eggy in the middle.  They brought me out two huge pancakes.  Did I eat the whole thing?  Yes, but I wasn't even hungry for dinner.  I basically stuffed myself.  I also tried my sister's corned beef and it was amazing!  I had food envy while scarfing down my own food!  It was so tender.  I also tried my husband's fries and they were very good too.  

This is a small place so a wait time like that isn't out of the ordinary.  I would suggest either come as a pair or get here a lot earlier than we did.  Then you will enjoy the delicious food.
author: Christina G.

description: We were in line to have crepes at another restaurant close to our hotel, but the line was put the door and around the corner, so we called MyMy to see what the wait was and they said restaurant is packed with no line. So we walked 15 mins. to get here and the joy began. The Lorraine  omelette with asparagus, bacon, Gruyere and onions was AMAZING! I also really liked the thin and crunchy hash browns that came with it. Hubby had a "make your own scramble" that he really enjoyed as well. We are sitting outside on a lovely sunny morning eating spectacular food. Service was spot on as well. We were given a glass that had lipstick on it and once we alerted them they immediately replaced it with an apology! We will be back to visit this place again.
author: Zandra P.

description: This wonderful little coffee shop has. Pancakes with soufflé in the middle of this with be happy with crispy.
author: Gary T.

description: My girlfriend and I split the Lemon Dill Crab Shrimp Benedict and Lemon Ricotta Souffle Pancake. The sweet/savory combo was amazing, and I got really sad when I was full. Just want to keep eating!
author: Darren S.

description: There seems to almost be a pattern here in San Francisco with these popular brunch places. They're run by a Thai staff. There's always a line waiting out front every weekend. Their dishes all tend to be on the sweeter side. Mymy reminds me a lot of: Kitchen Story, Blackwood, Sweet Maple.
author: Yad L.

description: Great brunch spot! Tex mex was delicious and challah French toast did not disappoint. The line was pretty long but went by relatively fast. Service was good and food came out fast.
author: Pauline L.

description:
My new favorite brunch place in the city.  Came at about 1pm, perfect timing because I read that this place is always packed. Lucky enough to get seated right away.  Love that they have so much choices for Eggs Benedict.  Tried to be adventurous and got the BLT Benedict, it was divine. The bacon gave it that smoky meaty flavor while the garlic spinach gave it that delectable taste.  Scrumptious!!! So many choices of pancakes and french toast but I tried the Lemon Ricotta Meringue Pancake topped with a strawberry coulis the mixture of lemon which was zesty and the strawberry which was sweet was a distinct fluffy party in my mouth.  

The only thing I can say is I wish the staff were friendlier... when I asked between two menu items I was thinking about the server said oh everything is good on the menu. Yes I know but a little more explanation on the menu or a more enthusiastic attitude would be better.  For most part the staff was polite but I didn't feel to welcome, like they were just waiting for me to finish eating so they could seat the next customers. I would have given it 5 stars but needs a little improvement on service. Can't wait to come back here again and try the other things on the menu!
author: Maria M.

description: In SF for the weekend and we decided to try Mymy for brunch. This place is great!  We arrived about noon on a Saturday, and waited for 30 minutes to be seated. The place is small but the servers are very efficient and quickly turn over tables.  I had the dill crab cake eggs benedict, and the hubs had an egg, chorizo and aioli dish. (Can't remember exact  name of the dish).  Both were excellent, and the potatoes were some of the best we've ever had. Worth the wait!
author: Jennifer S.

description: Got directed here by our Bellman at our hotel. What a great find. Quick service and terrific breakfast. I had the Tex Mex Scramble and it was great. Wifey had the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes and loved those.
author: Karl S.

description:
Best. Breakfast. Ever.

We were in the neighborhood to get our rental car from City Rent-A-Car and arrived here right at 8 AM on a Thursday. There were already a few people waiting!

We got the Vanilla Sponge French Toast which was the best breakfast food I have ever eaten. The Blueberry Ricotta pancakes were very good as well. We got a side of potato wedges and a side of sourdough toast (because, San Francisco), all of it was great. We decided to go ahead and get our daily lattes here as well and they were excellent, too! My husband got a mocha - delicious. 

Can't recommend this place enough. Great service and excellent food.
author: Robin B.

description: Great breakfast/brunch place.  The menu looked very enticing, popped in for brunch with two friends on a holiday.  I ordered the Tex-mex scramble without the chorizo and fellow diners ordered Tex-Mex and another ordered an egg dish with pesto.  All enjoyed our food immensely.  I ordered a chai latte but when it came it was actually a dirty chai.  I don't care for coffee so although it looked beautiful I couldn't drink it.  Other than that the meal with perfect.  We walked up shortly after they opened and were seated quickly and the place filled up promptly, with a line out the door towards the end of our meal.  Small tables in a small space, great petite diner vibe.  I'd go back again for sure! Delicious.
author: Pam G.

description:
This place is my spot. The line is always ridiculous, but I try and avoid it by dining solo (still enjoyable) at the counter, or going early mid-week for a solid work-day breakfast to start my day. 

My personal favorite is the Sponge French Toast with butterscotch drizzle and mascarpone (add a side of bacon). I have previously gotten the Lemon Ricotta Souffle pancakes, but the egg white was not fully folded in, so I got bites of straight egg white and I am not an egg white omelette kind of chick. That said, I will stick to my tried and true french toast fix.
author: Jenna G.

description: My family and I are visiting from NYC. Yelped this restaurant for a local eat, which had good reviews. However this place was very mediocre for what the hype was. I figure given the prices, the food should be somewhat good. I thought a 4-star rated restaurant would know how to make a decent Egg Benedict. But no. I ordered the Baja California egg Benedict which was $20 and I got one that was over cooked.. (See picture). Very disappointed.
author: Lily H.

description:
The soufflé pancake is amazing!! Sooo fluffy and soft, wow! Good and fast service, but when we were finished our meal we felt like we had to go to make room for other guests.
I recommend this place
author: Nienke S.

description:
Rude and terrible costumer service!
Too pushy in making you pay and leave the place ASAP! They asked us to leave in less than 30 min so that they may have more people inside! How cheap could you be!
author: Nathan M.

description: Terrible customer service. Their items are not clearly priced. I was upcharged on a side item without being told beforehand. When I got the bill I disputed it. One waiter understood where I was coming from and gave me the small amount back. I came with $20 planning to spend around $17 (after looking at the menu online) and use the remaining balance for bus money to get home. However, his coworker (the one in the photo posted) cursed at me, demanded the $2, locked me inside their cafe, said I couldn't leave until I gave her the $2. Her other coworkers just passively sat there and didn't intervene. I asked for her name and a manager I could contact. She wouldn't tell me either. She physically trapped me in their cafe. She literally told me "I'm locking you in here." So much drama for $2! It was their mistake for not clearly listing an upcharge underneath the side items section or understanding that their customer planned to use the $2 to get home. I clearly wouldn't recommend going to this cafe. The most psychotic customer "service" I've experienced in my life.
author: Jo S.

description:
I try to limit my 5* reviews to only best in class experiences and services, and I'm dishing this one out without hesitation. 

We were on an overnight getaway in the city and out for a morning stroll without a fixed plan for breakfast. Our legs were burning after the steep climb up to the Nob Hill area and I'd hoped to find something before the big lines started to form at the notable brunch spots in the area. Mymy was nearby and seemed to have a decent reputation. We walked up at about 8:30a this Saturday morning and were able to get a table for 2 inside without a wait.

The breakfast menu is relatively extensive for such a small place. Two pages of options, including a variety of sweet and savory takes on typical breakfast fare. I originally had eggs and bacon on my mind, but found myself tugged towards some of the interesting pancake options.  I split the difference on a spur of the moment and got the zucchini pancakes....couldn't have been happier!  My wife went the sweet route with the lemon ricotta pancakes and we split an order of the chicken apple sausage.

The entire breakfast was outstanding, including the coffee which was always kept full by the helpful and friendly wait staff. The zucchini pancakes were perfectly cooked, not a bit sweet, but paired well with the orange infused honey served on the side.

By the time we were ready to leave, a bit of a wait was starting to form, but it didn't appear to be too long.  Have to assume this place is still flying a bit under the radar, but probably not for long!

If I'm ever back in this hood, I'd be back for sure!
author: Shawn W.

description:
Located just a couple of doors from Contraband Coffee Bar, Mymy Coffee Shop is an interesting spot for brunch.  It doesn't look like much on the outside nor on the inside, and the menu isn't particularly extensive, but offers enough standard brunch items.  What caught me were all the positive reviews and pics on Yelp, plus the fact that it's Asian-owned.

We got here at a decent time on a Sunday morning, put our name on the list and didn't have to wait too long.  It's a small space and the crowd waiting definitely got much larger by the time we were done.  Anyhow, the service was efficient which is all I expect from an Asian-owned business.  We don't really do warm.  :-)

I had the FRISCO OMELETTE.  It's made with three eggs, chicken apple sausage, green onion, tomato and avocado.  I opted for no cheddar cheese.  The sausage has lots of large chunks of sweet apple and they are also super generous with the avocado.  No 2-3 slices here...it looks like they use an entire avocado!  All omelettes are served with hash browns and a choice of toast, but for extra $ you can sub in fruit for the hash browns and also ask for egg whites.  My friend ordered an omelette too (forget which one) and asked for egg whites and also three extra egg whites.  They came through with his request though I'm not sure what they charged for that since my friend treated and snatched the bill before I could take a look.  But good to know they can do that.  I asked for a 1/2 OJ AND 1/2 GRAPEFRUIT JUICE and they did that too.

We didn't have coffee here though.  That called for a repeat trip to Contraband.
author: Carol L.

description: Not bad not bad. I came here with 2 girl friends for the first time. The souffle pancake was pretty light and fluffy. Very neat indeed. Food portions were generous. Tex Mex was yummy! The eggs benny was ok, we were not really a big fan of the bread part. I ordered a matcha latte and it tastes a little bit like bubble tea matcha powder drink but hot version - too sweet in my opinion. Great friendly staff!
author: Brenda T.

description:
So amazing I definitely consider myself a brunch kind of girl and this one is one of the best I've had. However I didn't have the wait issue I hear about since we came on a Monday. 
This is what we ordered: 
Banana Blueberry Souffle Pancake 
Special Hash Brown & Poached Eggs
Chicken Gruyere Mornay With Poached Eggs (Amazing)
So yummy!
author: Talia H.

description:
What a great brunch place! The place has small indoor seating and some tables outdoors, but for a Monday morning, it was packed! You can write your name down at the waiting list outside next to the door.

My friend and I tried the Crab and Shrimp Cake Benedict, and the Jalapeno and Sausage Hash. The hash brown side was great- more thinly prepared than usual, but very crispy! Both dishes were very flavorful and filling. Coffee was refilled promptly. We sat awhile, and did not feel rushed during our stay.
author: Angie K.

description:
rush you in and really rush you out.  not relaxing in the slightest.  the servers roll their eyes for the simplest requests.  i had to ask for a different water glass twice b/c of stuck egg and bits of food inside the cup.

 food has a good presentation until you eat the overly greasy hash browns.  a filmy odd taste lingered -  almost lotion like.  rest of the food had a synthetic taste to it. 

 every time a see a line now i just don't understand how one can eat this stuff but then again most of the crowd seemed to be hungover bros and gals in the neighborhood.
author: Noel J.

description:
Ever popular Olea across the street was closed on a Sunday during the holidays and this place was PACKED!  what gives?

The delicious potato and rosemary Irish pancakes, son!!! Where do I begin? the combination of savory and sweet really called to me that morning. I love that they serve this with three slices of bacon, which I polished off like a professional fatty. 

Every table orders a version of their eggs benedict. You can go Florentine style with spinach and bacon, Southern which has chorizo and jalapeno or original with thick cut ham.  The eggs come out perfectly poached and the hollandaise sauce is spot on.  I also tried their Harvest omelette, an all veggie omelette which is a healthy brekkie especially if you get it with egg whites.  You know, to offset that huge serving of hash browns they give you. 

Service can be attentive one day and forgetful the next.  Either way, the food is good and the kitchen turns out the dishes fast!  You'll be fueled up and ready to go while those poor people at Olea across the street are still waiting to be seated.  

Is it Brunch o' clock yet?
author: Janice C.

description: Great service and friendly staff:) Food was good but not great...I had a lemon souffle pancake and cafe latte. My husband had an egg benedict. Pancake had a little spongey texture with so much meringue. Egg benedict came with very crispy potatoes, which we both loved.
author: Topanga S.

description: Came here for brunch on Sunday around noon. We were lucky with parking and the wait was probably about twenty minutes. Overheard that they used clipboard sign up for their wait list before, but now it's just a line. We took whatever was available first, which we got out door seating. It was a bit weird because it was right next to the line where everyone just stares at you and the hot sun, but that wasn't a big deal. The service was fine even though there are some reviews about terrible service, so I came here not expecting much. I had the Tex Mex like most people recommended and the boyfriend had the baja. The baja was alright and the Tex Mex was good. The reason for my one star is because I'm positive that I just got food poisoning. I had the worst cramps and spent the longest time in the restroom, which is exactly what another review mentioned (the review is a lot older)...ironically with the same dish. Overall, I was satisfied until it all went downhill and I'm sure it wasn't anything else because I didn't consume anything else.
author: Maggie W.

description:
My fiance and I just walked by (we wanted breakfast, but from no particular place).  The place looked busy at 9:30 AM, with about 7 people waiting in line outside.  Glad we decided to wait and try it!

I ordered the Sponge French Toast and she ordered the Peasant Lorraine Flat Omelette.  Both orders had an elegant simplicity to it.  

The French Toast came out looking like normal french toast, surrounded by slices of banana, strawberry, and raspberry.  But, the ingredients tasted so fresh!  It was cooked to a light golden crisp on the outside.

The Omelette's fillings gave a beautifully blended texture of fluff and crunch with the sliced bacon bits and, to my pleasant surprise, asparagus!  I enjoyed the after-taste left by the blend.

With those 2 plates and a mocha, my total came to about $33.00.  By the time we were out the door, it was 10:30ish and that line outside had tripled!  So glad we arrived when we did.  Worth trying.
author: John F.

description: Awesome food.  You do have to wait for brunch on Sunday, but you have to do that everywhere!  We had the banana, blueberry pancakes and Baja California.  Absolutely the freshest food.  The coffee is amazing.  The service was fine.  The girls work hard in there, but our waiter came twice.  One to get our order and one to run the check.  I find that a lot in hat area.  Anyway fantastic brunch and can't wait to go back!!!
author: Joy O.

description:
I decided to give my my another try. I had a really bad experience in which the server didn't understand how to properly take an order. This time I decided to go back and after trying to make an order they refused to serve me because I didn't meet the "minimum requirement. My order was gonna be around $12. That wasn't enough for them for serving one person. I highly recommend you go to Toast @ Polk & Sacramento a few blocks away. It's more affordable and it's much better treatment. I hope they leave the neighborhood soon.

The response by the restaurant is false. I actually did wait and I heard directly from the woman at the cashier that they don't take orders of sides despite the fact it would amount to $12.
author: Sharon M.

description: Quick, delicious, great spot...not one bad thing about this place. Very tasty breakfast . Thx guys
author: Donnie B.

description:
BRUNCH:

After the disappointed long wait and mediocre food at Mama's the day before, we wanted something that didn't have a 2 hour wait... stumble across Mymy's. We got seated right away and received prompt service. The place is small and cozy, and it looks like it's owned and run by Chinese people (we think???), which we were a little wary of since their brunch food is really Americanized. But we were totally surprised!

We ordered the Ultimate benedict, Pulled pork scramble and the French toast. The ultimate benedict had all the deli meats you can think of! It sure was filling. It got a bit salty at the end, but the portions were really good on the deli meats. The pulled pork scramble was very interesting! It had good flavors and I don't think I ever had a pulled pork scramble with some green salsa on the top, again portions were big and we got to save some for later. And the French toast, now that's what I'm talking about! Mymy's serve you a REAL French toast, not 3 pathetic little soggy flat wonder bread French toast (Mama's). These 2 thick French toast, soft in the middle and crunchy on outside, with fresh fruit, cinnamon and cream. It was really good! 

When we were done, the line was starting to build up! A small cute place that serves good brunch, I would come back and try their Swedish pancakes.
author: Lisa W.

description: Ordered a scramble with bacon, gruyere cheese, tomato and garlic sauce on top. The crunchy bread really topped it off w the potatoes. Best potatoes I've ever had... also the service was great. One of the top breakfast places in SF
author: Quintin M.

description:
You know a place is good when you see a line around the corner waiting to get in and this is the case with MyMy. 

If you get second thoughts about eating here when you see the line just grab a menu or view the pictures posted on trip advisor of some of the dishes on the menu and you will definitely wait anxiously for your opportunity to taste the great food.

Everything looked so good so my friends all ordered different items so we could share and some of us ordered two meals because it was just so hard to choose. 

I chose a basic 2 egg breakfast with fluffy scrambled eggs, chicken apople sausage, sourdough toast on thick cut sourdough bread and the best hash browns I have ever had. Hash browns that are crisp on both sides!

My other dish was the banana blueberry pancakes. Just one word: Amazing!
author: Chris T.

description: Awful service. So rude. I've come here for years and there's a guy there (stocky short guy) who you do NOT want to wait on you. He is the worst worst worst server ever. I have to eat here a lot because of my coworkers. The food is fine. The chefs are nice. But waiters so not customer friendly. Just be nice! It's not that hard. Especially to your regular customers. Just fake it if you're not capable. Or get OUT of the service industry.
author: Marie A.

description:
This place is great for breakfast. They have the crispiest hash browns and their smoked salmon benedict was to die for! Also, the corned beef was so meaty! Instead of little small pieces of beef, like most place, there were huge shreds. Definitely a filling dish.

It is a very small place, so be prepared to wait if its busy. I would definitely say that it was worth the wait though. 

I think this place is a tad overpriced. There food was a little expensive for what you got.
author: Alyssa K.

description:
Egg scramble was way too oily and had so much cheese in it that I had a hard time finding a bite of eggs that wasn't mostly cheese. 

The pictures of the hashbrowns are deceiving. They are paper thin and - similar to the eggs - were way too greasy. 

If you like grease, you'll love this place. But make sure to arrive before 9 or you'll have to endure a long wait.
author: Cheryl S.

description:
Hauled my lazy ass here on a Sunday morning at 8:15: seated right away (score!)
Beware there's always a line by mid-morning on weekends. Service was prompt, polite, and efficient. The place is pretty adorable and clean. We had a delicious chive&bacon ricotta pancake dish (2 eggs come with) and a peasant loraine scramble (comes with hashbrown). Loved the pancakes -- very light, fluffy, and the perfect blend of sweet and savory (came with a light honey drizzle). Coffee was hot and frequently refilled (a must for a breakfast joint!).  
Conclusion: definitely coming again soon for pancakes!
author: Ray H.

description: Cozy place and might take some time to get a seat but worth the wait! The crab cakes and blueberry/banana pancakes souffle were delicious and I highly rec them. The entire menu looks good but depends on whether you're craving a savory or sweet meal.  A stellar place to have brunch:)
author: Noor S.

description: 5 stars for the food. Amazing eggs benny and idk wtf they do to their homestyle potatoes but they are AH-MAH-ZING. No AC inside and a lot of pigeons outside. The bloody marys were perfect as well.
author: Mike C.

description: Great brunch food and fast service. You must try the mimosa carafe... they are extremely generous with the champagne. Outdoor and indoor seating. If there is a wait be prepared to stand in line rather than sign in. Good thing there is a great coffee shop next door to aid in the waiting.
author: Maria L.

description:
Absolutely loved the food at Mymy for brunch. There is no waiting list-- you just stand in line on the sidewalk (so be prepared).

Ordered the banana blueberry souffle pancakes and the Tex Mex scramble. Both were delicious and I'll definitely order again!
author: K. D.

description: You can always depend on MyMy to serve you delicious meals prepared and served by very nice and hardworking people. We have been loyal customers for over 3 years now. Still love it.
author: Sunny H.

description: Horrible service. We were seated at a small table and after ordering a lot of food, we told the waiter that we were going to move to the next table where there was more room. He nodded. So we moved over.  Then,  some other guy, not the waiter, came over and said "Did you get permission to move? You can not just move tables without permission. "  We felt we were not  customers  but more of a nuisance to them so we got up and left.
author: Jennifer A.

description: The food here is just OK.  I don't think it's worth the 40min wait though.  I ordered the Crab Cake Benedict and my boyfriend ordered the Tex-Mex scramble.  Both of these dishes were just average in taste and the service seemed like they were trying to rush people to finish their meal to make room for the next groups. Next!
author: Jane H.

description: Mymy is my favorite breakfast and brunch spot in the city. The food is delicious and the space is cozy. There are lines every weekend, but they move quickly. To avoid the crowds, head over during the week.
author: Beth W.

description:
been there two more times aaaand.....nothing changed, amazing as always!!! been trying different things, ohhhhh, what a dilemma! I can't decide what is my favorite thing in menu, I love them all!!!
mmmmm, can't wait to try their blueberry pancakes!!!! mnom
author: Asiyat T.

description:
This is my third time here, so the food is obviously decent. It's not the greatest, but its not bad either. I usually get the tex mex scramble, which is tasty enough to bring me back since I live in the neighborhood. However, the service I received on my last visit was beyond rude and I will never go to this establishment again. 

I orderer the tex mex scramble without cheese because I am lactose intolerant. When I sat down and ordered, I told this to waitress #1. When I got my food, there was a sprinkling of cheese on it so I told waitress #2. Waitress #2 took my dish and said they would make me another one. Waitress #1 came back with my plate in less than a minute and exclaimed that I never told her I didn't want cheese because if I had told her, she would've written it down. I went back and forth with her a bit and explained that I cannot eat cheese so I am very careful about placing my orders at restaurants. She didnt care, gave me back my dish and walked away.

I ended up scrapping off as much cheese as I could and ate my breakfast feeling like an errant child that was scolded by their parent. The whole situation was embarrassing and completely unnecessary. What kind of customer service was that? The food is not good enough for me to have to put up with that kind of service.
author: Sarah H.

description: Great little spot with a very thoughtful menu!  Takes diner breakfasts to the next level.  If you like corned beef hash, do not miss it!!  Its cooked for 6 hours and has this amazing lemon dill sauce.  Gracious service, too.  You will leave very full!  Will be back every time I'm back in San Fran!
author: Adam W.

description: Very solid breakfast place.  Small but no line on a Thursday morning, though the place filled up fairly quickly.  I had a delicious egg/spinach/cheese sandwich served with great roasted potatoes.  I noticed a number of orders of challah French toast coming out.  They looked good but maybe a little sweet for me for breakfast.  They also have an entire section of the menu called "benedictions" which are variations on eggs Benedict.  They looked like good portions, especially the crab.  Fast service as well.  I would definitely revisit Mymy for breakfast or brunch.
author: Shieldmaiden P.

description: Ultra RUDE, Yelling lady should take a few  anger management classes and possibly a few pills before starting a CS related job. Sis, relax, it's OK, you'll get paid either way. You don't have to be a BlackWidow spider in your territory.
author: Husan M.

description:
Not really sure why this place has such great reviews. To start the waiters and maybe owner are beyond rude about where you would like to sit. I get it on the weekends I hear it has a line which boggles my mind as to why but on a Wednesday at 9:30am. I don't see a problem with 2 people sitting at a table for 4. I witnessed another 2 people that came in. She stated they had 3 and the other was coming. He would not let them sit until they all arrived. Even went as far as saying "if you do not
like our policy,  you can leave" Mean while we sat for 45 minutes and the 3, 4 top tables that we could see sat vacant the whole time. The big issue is the rudeness of mainly the one gentlemen.

Food: I give it two stars because the scramble we ordered was good. The hash browns are unlike others I have had. They are basically fried flat patties. Not much potato. Look at the other pictures. You can see how paper thin they are. Fruit plate was fresh as well. 

Bottom line the rudeness of there table policy and the way they deliver the message is a big turn off. Remember this is a service industry. So many other other great places to choose in the city. Also if you notice I do not post many reviews but this place put me over the edge.
author: V L.

description: Delicious Sunday brunch. Corn beef hash was spectacular and side of fresh fruit was fresh and delicious. Long wait to be seated but it was worth the wait.
author: Sarah P.

description: I have never seen such a rude waiters with the attitude. We were in the line for 30-40 mins and as soon as we got in waiter started to push and yell that we are short for the place that we said. We got in lit fight and she kicked us out!!!! Because of my friend was looking for parking and could not step in on time (2-3 mins late) Vietnamese girl with the short blonde hair was really rude!!! I would never come back if I am gonna meet her again!!!
author: Khusan A.

description: I had the stuffed pancakes and they were really good. Although we had to wait a little longer than other tables that came after us with larger parties , the food made up for it. Small venue so the wait for others that came after us was long .
author: Nora E.

description: Eggs looked like they are pre made, the corned beef hash was good but over all not worth the wait.
