When we asked for the bill we noticed they pre add gratuity for all bills and do not tell you. There was 2 of us and they did this. When we asked they said let me check and then came back and said oh ya it is. Don't end up double tipping...they don't give you the original receipt once they run your card so you don't see it says it's already included. Not a cool move. Also they don't have the same hash browns anymore :(
author: Angus H.

description: Holy smokes, this place is amazing! After years of walking by and laughing at the line outside, we finally buckled down and decided to wait for brunch one Sunday morning. We lucked out and the wait was only about twenty-five minutes. Service was fast, and it seems like a well-oiled machine. The food was unbelievable. Huge portions, everything was cooked perfectly. We couldn't actually finish either of our meals because there was so much food. Super cute brunch spot for two.
author: Jen H.

description: Y-U-M! I've tried two egg benedicts (the Norweigan and the crab cake) and both were delicious. Cons-- There is normally a substantial wait (which is a physical line outside), the space is small, and the space isn't very unique. Mymy is a yummy, casual, non-pretentious brunch spot and I'm looking forward to my next meal here!
author: Nicole W.

description: The food is good, but you do have to wait to be seated! Service was decent; they are very busy so they aren't super-attentive.
author: Rhonda R.

description:
Mymy is a pretty solid brunch place; I've had the chance to go a few times since it's in my area. 

The menu has a large selection of both savory and sweet options so everyone will find something they like. I'd say the coffee is average. This place does not skimp on the avocado which is always a bonus to me. The portions are pretty filling. 

Especially during warm times, the outside seating option is fabulous. You do have to be a little careful though since it's on an incline; I've seen a couple people's food take a tumble because of it! 

It's not too big so there is a bit of a wait but nothing out of the ordinary as fellow brunchers can attest to. I recommend coming with no more than 4 people. 
Since Mymy allows you to put your name down while Olea (across the street) does not, the list can sometimes be artificially long with many people waiting at both locations to see where they get seated first.
author: Tasmin S.

description:
We decided to come back for another try because breakfast was so delicious last time. This time the wait was much longer. Over an hour and something so we walked to the nearby Starbucks for to go. Today's service wasn't as attentive. We asked for hot water and they forgot about it. As for food, the egg on the Benedict was a little over cooked and not runny.

Today I had to try their pancake soufflé in addition to the French toast even though I didn't have room to eat. I feel like it wasn't comparable to the French toast we had. It was super fluffy but I feel like I'm the type of person that prefers a little bit of texture. But I still feel like you should try it if you haven't.

We'll still come back for their French toast because it was so yummy, but it'll be awhile so we can try other places.
author: Kevin L.

description: Best breakfast of our trip!  Eggs prepared to order and the Miss MyMy pancakes were fantastic!  Worth your wait in line!
author: Sandy D.

description:
Hipster like joint that delivers good food and attentive service.
Small busy (had to wait for 20 minutes for a table during breakfast time) and cool place.
It's a go.
author: Joe C.

description: My boyfriend and I came for lunch on a Monday around 1 and there was a short line. We might've waited about 15 min and then grabbed at seat at the bar. I really really wanted to try everything, their French toast, savory pancakes and blueberry pancakes, but we weren't that hungry so I decided to save the sweets for another time. My boyfriend ordered the bay shrimp Benedict which was really good and I got the Italiano scramble that had sausage, oyster mushrooms, olives, tomatoes, spinach, mozzarella, and tomato sauce. The scramble was good but it barely had any spinach in it, I might've seen one or two leaves but that was it. Portions are a little stingy for the price but it was definitely tasty.  Both dishes came with thin crispy hash browns and an orange slice. Everything on the menu sounded good and I can't wait to come back for those blueberry soufflé pancakes.
author: Linz C.

description: I had the French toast, best French toast I've eaten. The fruit was fresh and delicious. My mom had the crab cake Benedict, also extremely delicious and fresh tasting. Super cute breakfast spot and there's outdoor seating for the nice mornings. Definitely recommend!
author: Sabrina S.

description: Order the peasant Lorraine...bacon, leeks, asparagus, gruyere cheese, spices all cooked up to make the perfect omelette. The fried potatoes are so crisp and almost have a hint of sweetness to them. Comes with sliced wheat bread as well. DELICIOUS! Tiny little place so be prepared to wait. We went around 945 am and had no wait on a Wednesday morning.
author: Anne L.

description: Friendly service and excellent food! The smoked salmon in the Norwegian dish was fresh and delicious. The poached eggs were perfect and paired with their crispy potatoes it was the best breakfast meal I've had in recent memory. Really superb!
author: Allen S.

description: Fantastic zucchini ricotta pancakes! My husband loved the banana walnut pancakes, also. A little pricy, but such is San Francisco. I would definitely come again.
author: Kimberly M.

description: Great crab cake benedict. Obviously popular and for a good reason. Great coffee too.
author: W R.

description: Had breakfast here this morning.   We sat outside because the sun was shining which may contribute to my 5 star rating.  The waitstaff was friendly and responsive.  The coffee had real cream.  The food we ordered came quickly and was delicious.   Frisco scramble, the shrimp and crab cakes and the Parma Benedict were all worth eating.  We tried with lemon ricotta souffle pancake was good, but not as spectacular as the other dishes.
author: Emily W.

description:
After trying griddle fresh, I found out that it had the same owners as mymy and really wanted to try this place out. I loved the hashbrowns at griddle fresh so I was sooo happy that they had the same kind here!

I ended up ordering the parma benedict, which was a poached egg atop of proscuitto, mozzarella, roma tomatoes, and basil, all covered with a chive hollandaise with a side of broccoli. I was happy to see that they have a couple different types of benedicts because those are probably my favorite type of breakfast food!!! I was actually deciding between that and the smoked salmon tartine because I absolutely loooved it at griddle fresh, but I figured I should have something different haha. The parma benedict was really good though, the mozzarella really balanced out the saltiness of the proscuitto and the egg was perfectly poached and runny! I personally hate when poached eggs are overdone because I love dat #yolkporn. I did wish there was more of the hollandaise though! The hashbrowns were delicious of course!!! I love how they're basically like chips because they're so crunchy. Also noteworthy--the lemon fill shrimp and crab cake Benedict!  


The service was good and my water cup was never empty. Also fortunately there was no wait around noon on a weekday!
author: Tara A.

description:
I was dreaming of brunch throughout my entire run at Nike Women's Half Marathon. And this place made my dream come true. Talk about motivation, eh?

This restaurant is cozy, so there will be a wait. Your entire party must be present to be seated.

Eggs dominate the menu, which I don't mind. Eggs = happiness. That's universal knowledge. But for you unbelievers out there, do not fret - there are pancakes, burgers and salads too.

I got the Norwegian Benediction because I can't say no to salmon. It was a tad too salty and was getting cold, but I didn't bother sending it back. The hashbrowns were the game changer for me. Thin, crispy perfection.

I also tried some of of my bf's Big Papa Burger, which was tasty. He fell completely in looove with the Vanilla Sponge French Toast. So much so that I got a tad jealous. And I'm not even the jealous type. I'd recommend it if you like your french toast in thick slices.

Service was good. It's nice that they provide a water jug at each table. I would come again.
author: Ashley L.

description: Great service beautiful presentation. Fresh made wonderful tasting OJ! Ordered the BLT Benedict and was so excited, it looked beautiful but was very let down on delivery. Ingredients were fresh but the dish lacked any flavor or seasoning. I am always on the hunt for a great Benedict sadly this wasn't it.
author: Tina S.

description:
Came here on a thursday morning around 11! I was surprised to see a line considering it was a weekday! I can't believe I've never heard of this place. It seems like a lot of tourists come here. 

Although my friend was 15 minutes away, I put my name down on the wait list because of the wait. The line went by pretty quickly. About 10 minutes in, one of the waiters called my name and asked if my party was here. I told him that she was going to arrive in about 5 minutes. He rudely said "well I'm going to seat other people first". Yes I understand that many places have the same policy, but he did NOT have to be so rude about it! Homegirl just put her name down cause she was hungry! Luckily, he wasn't our server. 

The place is pretty small. If available, you get the option of indoor or outdoor seating. 

This place has a unique menu! I got the banana blueberry soufflé pancakes and my friend got the lemon dill shrimp crab cake benedict. MmmMmmMm both were delicious!! I'm definitely coming back to try other items on the menu!
author: Fanny H.

description:
At first glance, this little spot is unassuming until you see the number of people outside waiting to be seated. Thankfully, my husband and I were not among the large crowd as we happened to dine at Mymy on a weekday afternoon. Still, we had to put our party of 2 on the waiting list posted against the wall. After scrolling through their menu and waiting about five minutes, we were seated to the left of the restaurant. We noticed the wait staff moving quickly yet still well aware of all patrons dining.

The restaurant is small, cozy, and intimate. The walls are painted with calm and inviting colors and decorated with cute, framed portraits.

Our waitress set down water served in a glass carafe and two glasses (one of which still had lipstick on it). I quickly flagged down the waitress and she apologized and returned with two new glasses. We were ready to order and I was starving so I ordered coffee, a side of fries, and Lemon Ricotta Soufflé Pancakes while my husband ordered their Norwegian Benedict. The fries arrived first, which I was hoping would happen, and they were fresh, hot, and crispy. Shortly after, our meals were served. The pancakes came with a side of fresh strawberries and blueberries, butter, and syrup. They were simply divine, fluffy, and moist; however, the taste of lemon was almost nonexistent. The Norwegian Benedict was presented on a bed of hash browns and toast.  All items in this dish were fresh, so delicious, and full of flavor. 

During the course of our meal however, our waitress did not check up on us. The only time she stopped by was to top off my coffee, which was a plus, but I hoped she would have taken more notice at that point. 

Ultimately, Mymy is a real treat and I wouldn't mind dining here again.
author: Heather R.

description:
I was looking for a delicious brunch option before my flight and this peeked my interest. It was almost a mile walk, but so worth it. When I arrived I found a cute little shop on a sunny corner. I was immediately greeted and offered a stool at their 3 seat counter. I was super happy to find myself in front of a sunny window. The menu is full of great food with a twist, everything is a little special. I am admittedly a pancake girl so I couldn't pass up the lemon ricotta souffle pancakes, that's right SOUFFLE pancakes! What?!

When the pancakes arrived they were super fluffy, like regular fluffy pancakes on steroids. I dug in and quickly realized that they didn't really even need syrup. The lemon flavor was subtle, but I could definitely taste it. The middle of the pancakes had a fluffy egg white center, so cool! There was a small pile of macerated strawberries and blueberries that went perfectly with the pancakes, I only wish there was more. My only regret is not getting a side of crab and shrimp cakes, but I knew I would be too full to eat them (and I was). 

This is an adorable and delicious little brunch spot in Knob Hill. If you are looking for some menu items with some flair that are a little out of the ordinary, this is your spot!
author: Jessica P.

description: Wait is a bit long, but the service is pretty fast. The crab and shrimp Benedict was delicious. We also tried the lemon ricotta soufflé pancake, which is just a trendy item that most brunch places have on their menu now. It was so so - thicker then you would expect for a soufflé.
author: SCSR L.

description:
Mymy where to begin.

At the end of the day, the only thing to say is that this is in such close proximity to the glory that is Olea and yet it is so, so far from the quality of food, service, coffee, everything of the place across the street -- yet seems to somehow leverage the proximity to raise prices. 

If there is one thing I hate in a restaurant experience, it is being made to feel like a rube being taken for all they're worth while they eat low-quality and under thought-out food. I left Mymy feeling like this. Sadness.
author: Maya L.

description:
Zucchini pancake - with bacon bits, bleu cheese, etc, was AMAZING. So unique and delicious. I will be back for this, and maybe to try something new.

Lemon ricotta pancakes were okay. Not very lemony. They were good pancakes! But the zucchini were better ;)
author: Victoria C.

description:
Came for an early brunch and I had the Norwegian Benediction. It was a eggs benedict over sauteed spinach, smoked salmon and toast covered in a delicious chive hollandaise with a side of hasbrown and some capers. The eggs were perfection as was the sauce. But I think the salmon and capers gave the overall dish too much salty flavors. But the hashbrowns were thin and perfectly crunchy. It was the perfect portion size for me. And I also had the earl grey which came in its own little pot, which I thought was delightful. 

The overall atmosphere is very quaint and very small. There were 3 serving staff so you will only see them when they take your orders, pass by to refill your coffee or when they want to pick up your plates and checks. Great place for breakfast, and brunch but be ready to wait.

Food: 4 stars
Service: 3.5 stars
author: Liliana P.

description: I have been here at least 6 times, and i have  never been disappointed! Unfortunately, they do not take reservations. So sometimes it takes a little while to be seated, but the wait is so worth it! The portions are always great and it doesn't take long for the food to arrive .
author: Angelica D.

description:
Came back again, this time around 9:30.
Had a short wait, about 5 mins.
Had the Tex mex scramble and it was just as good as I remembered. Can't get enough.
But for some reason had the potato wedges instead of the hash browns. And you can't go wrong with either decision. Wedges were perfectly crispy.
Girlfriend had the smoked salmon and that was super good too. 

And to give another 5 stars for this visit as well.
author: Bryant C.

description: Solid brunch place. Lots of good food on this menu. The side potatoes are crispy. Their Benedict varieties are all good, and mascarpone pancakes are delish. The coffee is average. Expect a line on the weekend, but it moves quickly.
author: Jack B.

description: This is by far my favorite brunch restaurant in San Francisco!! Small place but worth the wait on a busy day. Everything I've had is so delicious and fresh!
author: Sarai D.

description: Fantastic breakfast! Quality, innovative take on breakfast staples. Honestly was the best breakfast I've had in a long time. Recommend the lemon pancakes!
author: Caitlin H.

description: Italian pesto egg omelette is fucking heaven!  We also got the stuffed banana pancakes with walnuts and they were pretty bomb except after about half ways it taste too much egg.
author: Gabby M.

description:
I remembered coming here about two years ago and loving the lemon ricotta pancakes, so when I recently came to SF I made it my goal to return.

The wait seemed brutally long with about 8 parties ahead of us but it only took about 25 - 30 minutes til we got a table on a Saturday morning, they're really efficient!

Ordered the blueberry soufflé pancakes and the BLT benedict(ion).

BLT: BACON! Sauteed spinach and tomatoes --- *sings* these are a few of my thiings. Hashbrowns were on point, so thin and crispy.

The pancakes were super fluffy and filled with marscarpone cheese, one of my favorite cheeses! Yuuuum

I had no complaints at all so I would definitely come back, hopefully when it wouldn't be too crowded.
author: Hana S.

description:
Came here on a Sunday morning brunch (9:30am). Waited for about 10 mins and got seated outside for party of 2. They have the heater outside which was nice since it was kind of cold that day. 

Service: Very friendly and nice. 

I got the Norwegian Benedict ($13.50). Hash brown were really crunchy and good but it's like a thin layer spread out almost to the whole entire plate. Would be nice if it's a little thicker. I like to taste the potato more. Salmon with poached eggs on top of bread with hollandaise sauce was perfect. I actually like bread more than muffin.

Cafe Mocha was good. Just a tad bit more on the sweet side.
author: Kei C.

description:
The food was cold. The service was horrible. And we both got sick when we got home.

There is always a huge line and I have no idea why.  The "hashbrowns" were flat and did not appear to have any potato or potato-like product in them. 

The tables are so close together that your neighbor is pretty much in your lap.
author: Stacey R.

description:
Fellow Yelpers did not steer me wrong this time!  Mymy is a quaint corner cafe that can be easily missed if you're not paying attention.  We were seated right away and given water and had our orders taken within 5 minutes.  There was enough variety in the menu to offer a little bit of breakfast and lunch offerings, but not too much that it becomes overwhelming to make a decision.  

Our food come out in less than 15 minutes which was pretty fast, considering the typical wait time I've encountered for brunch is about 30 minutes.  Auntie ordered the Baja California Benediction (eggs benedict), the BF got the 6hr Corned Beef Hash and I got the Chive Pancakes with Crumbled Bacon & Sweet Gorgonzola Cheese.  We each liked our food so much that there was no offering to share our food others.  My Chive Pancakes were the perfect combination of sweet and savory.  

They lost a star from me because their espresso machine was broken and therefore could not serve any coffee/espresso type drink to go with breakfast.  It would have been awesome to have an Americano to drink while eating my Chive Pancakes, but it worked out well with the orange juice in the end.  I will definitely be coming back again to try other menu items.
author: Jiki B.

description:
My bf's family lives nearby here and so I've always passed by this place. I finally got to try it this past weekend and it was pretty awesome! I got here at 12pm and waited for about an hour. I thought the line goes fast according to other yelpers, but it was as long as any other popular brunch place I've been to in SF.

We were seated outside which was fine as it was a nice Saturday afternoon. They do ask you if you're fine with sitting outside or if you want to wait for a table inside, but I was hungry so I didn't mind. 

I ordered the lemon dill shrimp crab cake benedict. It came with hash browns and two slices or oranges. I really loved the sauce on the benedict. It was a green color, light, creamy, and tangy from the lemon. The shrimp crab cakes were flavorful and moist. The hash browns. Omg. The hash browns. The yelpers were right on this one, the hash browns are a must. It was the most crispiest hash browns I've EVER had. And let me tell you, I always order hash browns for breakfast/brunch as it's my go-to breakfast. There was a little saucer of ketchup on the plate so you don't have to ask them for ketchup.The portions were good, I was very full after the meal. The oranges were a great way to end the meal!

Prices were reasonable. My entree was 14.50. 

The reason why I didn't give this place 5 stars was because I thought some of the waitresses were kind of awkward lol. Anyways, I will be coming back to try more things on the menu and to eat their amazing hash browns!
author: Nancy T.

description:
I LOVE coming here! You definitely need to gear up for the wait if you are coming for breakfast on Saturday or Sunday, but it is worth it. The menu is original but also has items that anyone who has had breakfast will recognize.

I wish I lived closer, I would make it a point to come here once a week if I could.
author: Melissa S.

description: The breakfast at Mymy is worth the line outside (which, in my opinion, moves quite fast). I had the French toast, which was fabulous and my husband had the Chroizo Jalapeño Tartine. We also had coffee and a wonderful glass of fresh squeezed OJ, and it was wonderful! The food was fabulous and I love the loud and busy environment of the small restaurant. The price is quite affordable. Highly recommended.
author: Nicole G.

description:
Expensive for such quality.  It was just all right. Too pricy in my opinion. I had the lorraine omelet. My favorite part of the meal was the hot chocolate.  

The  service was good. We came on a Sunday morning at 9am. There was no wait time for us. We were seated right away.
author: Deb M.

description:
Line up outside on a weekend and wait for a meal you won't forget...or will you?

COLD FOOD/BLAND DISHES

Come early so you can beat all the hype-sters, because this place IMO is all hype-you can avoid the growling food pains that will surely come if you have to wait in line. I just despise an eating establishment that puts profit ahead of quality. If your main way of income is food and service of this food, then you should invest in quality and great service to be successful. Here is where this place is successful: HYPE!

The line outside, however long it is, doesn't equal great food. I have waited in line before for amazing food, so I understand the assimilation there, this place just capitalized on it. 

I sat down and was promptly greeted by a nice server. They were knowledgeable and friendly. I asked for her recommendations, which I ordered.
The Baja Benedict and also the lemon ricotta pancakes.  

The food was COLD! I should have sent it back. I ate it anyways because I was hungry from waiting in line. I later to a look around to notice at the hot counter was 10 plates stacked carefully like a pyramid. I get that it was peek breakfast time, but how long does the plate on the bottom of that pyramid sit there for?  How long can the warmth stay on that piece of food? Take a look for your self! The pancakes were of course warm on arrival, but that is the only reason why this place did not get one star. I ate my fill and left. I won't return here simply because I felt the food should be worthy of the price and the wait...all of which I think is missed by the establishments lack of concern for quality over profit. Enjoy your experience.
author: Danny V.

description:
Ok so first things first, we went on a Friday morning when things are obviously gonna be less slammed. I've seen the place on weekends and it's always hella packed. But we walked right up and got a dope seat on the patio on a nice sunny day, it was really awesome.

We really went all out with drinks; coffee, soju bloody marys, and water. The coffee was pretty standard. The bloody Mary's were actually kinda inconsistent. Ma girls drink ended up a bit spicier than mine, which is a bummer cause I like my shit spicy. Not a knock on the drink overall though, it was really well balanced and delicious.

I got the tex mex scramble and it was phenomenal. The avocado was sliced and spread out over the top of the pico de gallo and the presentation of it was aesthetic as fuck. The eggs were cooked just like I like them, but more importantly it had this kind of chipotle aioli spread underneath the pico de gallo. Sounded not the best at first glance but it ended up working really well with everything. The hashbrowns are thin but they're really delicious. Kind of like a blast of starch to your palette after the bombardment of Mexican style spices. Super awesome plate arrangement for a breakfast spot and delicious flavors to boot. I love restaurants that pay attention to all the little details.

Only kinda weird thing was the waiter came back to clarify the tip after we had already put the tip in the original bill, so we tipped a bit more. I'm gonna chalk it up to a general misunderstanding rather than anything malicious or greedy. The service was on point there anyway.
author: Jim B.

description: Certainly not Denny's prices, but food and service are both really good. I got the beef hash with poached eggs and left stuffed. Coffee is also really good and strong. Only issue is the small floor space, meaning potentially long waits during peak hours
author: Alexei S.

description:
Have ordered the eggs tartine and frisco scramble. So much flavor! And the hash browns are so crispy and cooked well. Left fully satisfied each time 


P.s. The garnish orange slices on the plate are super juicy
author: Kelcey P.

description: We got the blueberry banana souffle pancakes and the lemon dill crab cake eggs benedict.  The pancakes were a little weird honestly, not in taste but the texture is very eggy and my 4-year old didn't like them at all and he LOVES pancakes and eggs.  The flavor was overall okay but the texture is what ruined it for us.  The lemon dill crab cake eggs benedict was good - the lemon dill hollandaise sauce was a nice flavor that complimented the eggs and crab cakes well and I wish they added more sauce because once I ran out, I didn't want to finish the rest since the mixture of crab cakes and the muffin were just a little bit dry.  The hash browns and matcha green tea latte were also good.
author: Julie P.

description:
Found Mymy around the block from where we were staying. We got there at 840 (they open at 800) and there was already a wait. By the time we left around 940, it was packed outside. Get there early!

I had the lemon dill crab and shrimp cakes Benedict and my SO had the chorizo jalapeno tartine. We both thoroughly enjoyed our meals and I even went as far as to claim it was one of the best breakfast meals I had had in awhile. The lemon dill sauce went so perfectly with the crab and shrimp cakes. Wasn't too heavy for breakfast, but held us over until 3:30 that afternoon. Like many other reviews, their hash browns were so good. They are really thin, but something about them makes them so good. They're not super heavy, they're the perfect serving size.

It's a small place and I think was family owned? The service was great and very quick. There was a steady flow of people in an out of the restaurant. 

When we come back to SF, we will definitely be returning for a yummy breakfast!
author: Jordan M.

description:
The first couple times was amazing!  If I had written my review then I woulda given it 5 stars.  Today it was really off so giving 4 stars - still good but not perfect.  Spicy Pork scramble was significantly under seasoned and weirdly mushy (the last scramble I had was perfect in every way though).  The soufflé pancake today was good but inconsistent - one of them was flat and burned / overcooked.  

In the past I've had the zucchini pancake with Parmesan crust and I'm obsessed with it!  Love the paper thin hash browns it comes with too.
author: Olivia T.

description:
Wow wow wow, If you ever in San Fransisco you have to have breakfast there.
Hard to impress me but I got to say I was impressed we were 5 people ordered 5 different orders and you just can't go wrong there.. :-)))
author: Dean W.

description: Ever had a breakfast dish that you didn't want to EVER end?  That happens here. Had the Italian scramble with extra crispy hash browns. Perfection on a plate. The coffee service was excellent for diner coffee. Grab an uber up the hill and get an amazing breakfast. Thanks guys you rock.
author: Larry H.

description: The Lemon soufflé pancake is bomb. The place is really small but cozy and cute. It's best to go in a party of 2 maybe 4 at most because there are more chances of you getting seated with a smaller group faster. The food is really amazing! I definitely recommend the lemon soufflé pancake
author: Ysabel B.

description:
I love that this place is just a few blocks away from my house. It never fails to satisfy my brunch cravings, especially when I don't want to wait through the never-ending Mama's line.

The atmosphere feels quiet, home-y, and intimate, as they usually have the blinds slightly closed so that passersby from the street can't see you eating through the window. The times that I've gone have usually been around lunch time on a weekday, and I've never had to wait. It can get pretty crowded on weekends though.

The food here definitely does not disappoint, and the service has always been fantastic. The hash browns are a must! They're thin and crispy and give added presentation style to every dish. My favorites are the Baja California Benediction, Vanilla French Toast with Butterscotch Drizzle, and the Banana Blueberry Souffle Pancakes.
author: Cheryl N.

description: Worst service. The waiters are pushy and impatient. We arrived and not even 3 minutes they wanted to know if we were ready. One of the waitress got annoyed by us and left and sent a guy over to our table to take our orders. Never again. I need some respect! Thank
author: angelica a.

description: Breakfast was absolutely amazing ! Had the blueberry banana pancakes which were wonderful & also had the prosciutto benedict. Very tasty and the service was on point ! Definitely will come back again!
author: Ricardo M.

description: Although it's SF and everything is always so packed and busy, customer service was okay. We were never asked if our food was good (which it was) or if we would like another cup of coffee or mimosa. The wait time was about 25 min., it would be nice if they offered more shade for the summer days. We got the soufflé pancakes and Norwegian Benedict...both very yummy!
author: Darcy M.

description:
The lines here on the weekend is pretty ridiculous- 75 mins for a table for 2 at 11am.
When we were finally seated, we were so hungry that we ordered multiple dishes each.

The lemon ricotta soufflé pancakes were delicious- fluffy, tasty. 
The shrimp and crab cake egg Benedictus were delicious too, esp paired with the hash browns. The lemon dill hollandaise sauce is not very good- thankfully, I had it on the side and barely even touched it.

Reasonable prices but the lines are a put off
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
Came here for lunch on a Saturday at 11:45ish.  This is prime time for lunch and I expected to wait for at least 30-45 minutes.  We were seated at 12:00, phew!

Banana Blueberry Souffle Pancake- 3 fluffy blueberry pancakes topped with butter, side of syrup, and some kind of creamy sauce.  Although these were super fluffy, it tasted eggy.  It wasn't sweet so the syrup helped out a lot.

Crab Cake Benedict- THE BEST CRAB CAKE BENEDICT I've had so far!  I'm not a fan of too much sauce on anything but this was the perfect balance of sauce, egg, crab cake, and bread.  The sauce wasn't overpowering.  The crab cakes were phenomenal--Great texture and flavor.  The bread was different- not the traditional biscuit.  It was flat and a little crispy.  The hash browns were cripsy, just how i like em!  My only issue with the hash browns is that it's too thin.  I would prefer more potatoes....sort of like a potato sandwich--crispy on the top and bottom with a fluffy center.

The 4 stars is for the benedict and service.
author: Linda N.

description:
The coffee was inconsistent - we had two cups of Latte; one of which was an extra order by our server. 
Food was ok, definitely not as good as it looks.
author: Lyn X.

description:
MyMy has become one of our favorites just after two visits. We can here both times for breakfast. The experience can not be described in just one sentence and expanded upon, it almost needs to be a conversation like the following.

"I feel that the menu is creatively well thought out." 

"Any one of the items on the menu could be a daily special at an ordinary dinner."

"Feels like everyone in the front and back of the restaurant has done this before. They have a sense of experience about them, almost like a wisdom about how to execute things."

"You could tell the number one priority of the wait staff is to turn the tables."

"Yeah, the first time we came here I felt a little rush to leave. Today I didn't have that feeling."

"Well there were a lot of people waiting for a table and they have to make the money." 

This conversation shall continue.
author: Bebe L.

description: Amazing. Tried the crabcake egg benedict as well as the lemon ricotta  pancakes. Both dishes were  home run.
author: Vitaliy B.

description:
Can I order the entire brunch menu please?

I can't believe I have walked past this restaurant soo many times and have never come in! Shame on me!!

Came in today with my friend for mother's day and the wait was not bad at all! ( They do try to turn over tables rather quickly here: shorter wait time..but not a brunch spot to lounge and drinks mimosas)

Service: The staff are quick on their feet and polite, but don't expect to be waited on constantly. Which is a pro and a con! Def a place to have a good chit chat without being interrupted every 10 min :P

We ordered:
-Lemon Ricotta Pancakes: OMG. how do they get the ricotta into the pancakes?! blows my mind..I thought it was be a pancake infused with lemon/ricotta flavoring..but nope! There is literally fluffy pockets or ricotta waiting to be devoured.


-Chorizo Tartine + hashbrown: flavor explosion in my mouth. SO good. The hashbrowns were thin and so crispy, just the way I like them. The chorizo and the aioli melted in my mouth 

Awesome brunch + lunch spot. Do NOT go to Olea across the street.


I cannot wait to come back and try everything. I'll even come back by myself, thats how much I'm already craving the food!!
author: Selina W.

description: Seems to be a really popular spot! Me and my bf wanted to have breakfast and found this place on yelp. It was really busy we waited about 20 mins and got seated outside, it was January but wasn't cold at all, because they have the heating system outside! I got pancakes which was very yummy! My boyfriend likes his too:)
author: Sally H.

description: Came here as a party of three on a Saturday around 11am and got seated within half an hour. I really appreciate the efficiency of the staff, though that means you can't sit around and mull over a cup of coffee. Food was good and water was frequently refilled for us. Great variety of egg-based dishes and more. I had some sort of tartine that was great and had a bite of the chive pancake which also tasted amazing.
author: Melissa T.

description:
My friend took me to her neighborhood gem for brunch and I'm so happy she did!

The menu offered traditional items that were jazzed up for a more sophisticated taste.

I highly suggest getting the hash browns if your dish doesn't come with one.

I ordered the gooey french toast with sweet whipped cream. The perfect balance between savory and sweet. The french toast is one of my favorites that I've ordered and it's my to-go.

My friend ordered the chive pancake which was just as tasty!

We went over the holiday weekend and barely waited 20 minutes to get seated. I think we just got lucky because I've heard of much longer wait times.

No matter how long the wait, it's worth it.
author: Nichole K.

description:
Yelp needs a half-star--my experience here was a solid three and a HALF. C'mon, yelp. Help indecisive people like me make indecisive reviews!

I need to be fair: the 3.5 is JUST for the pancakes--I haven't tried anything else here. The place itself is cozy and cute and the waitstaff seem helpful (though somewhat harried)

But the pancakes were lackluster. First off, Pancake-Aficionados, these are SOUFFLE pancakes. Don't expect the usual thick, doughy, spongy kind. These are made in a way that involves carefully folding in whipped egg whites, which often makes pancakes that are lighter and fluffier than the usual kind. 

At least, that's the idea. These, however, had a strange consistency. They were very thin on the edges, and not very flavorful or sweet. They also had zero lemon flavor, so I'm not entirely sure why they were labeled as such. The middle is where you get the ricotta souffle flavor, but it's very odd--it has a sort of foam-like consistency. It tastes very similar to meringue (like the top of lemon meringue pies). The cheese is very hard to taste, primarily because ricotta itself doesn't have a very strong flavor--that's why you need to add salt to it, for savory dishes, and sugar and, say, vanilla or lemon zest for sweeter dishes. 

So: if you like flavorful, somewhat sweet, thick and fluffy pancakes these aren't for you. If you like meringue (and want it smack dab in the middle of your pancake) and prefer pancakes that aren't very sweet and have very subtle flavors, these are for you. If you do NOT like the taste of lemon or ricotta, these are also for you, since I never actually sampled a hint of either.

Listen, MyMy, I'll be back. Your other stuff on your menu sounded intriguing, and surely your pancakes please many customers. I just want to make sure that Pancake Obsessors like myself know what they're getting into here.
author: Ali M.

description: Had an awesome awesome breakfast here! We got lucky and arrived and there was no line. But when we left the line was super long. The service was fast and everyone was super friendly. I had the harvest hash -- so good! Loads of veggies and super buttery hashbrowns. Husband got the hash and loved it. Also, the fries were sooo good. Can't wait to come back!
author: Jen G.

description:
What I ordered : the Parma Benedict

What you must get : anything with their amazingly crispy hash browns

I've seen this place on yelp and Instagram before but finally had a chance this weekend to try it. On a Saturday afternoon, we waited for about an hour to get seated and it was a lovely place to sit outside. Parking here is obviously terrible, be prepared to pay meters!! I ordered the Parma Benedict that had prosciutto and mozzarella over toast with some hash browns. Some of the best hash browns I have ever had!!! It was the perfect amount of thin and crispy and would definitely recommend to anyone who comes here! Although the order looked rather small, I think it was the perfect amount of food for a girl like me! Definitely impressing and would come back! 

Only thing I didn't like about this place was that after we had paid and sat for about ten minutes chatting, the waitress asked us to leave in order to accommodate for the guests waiting still since she said they were closing in 45 minutes. Reasonable but definitely not a customer pleaser. So I guess you can say you should be prepared to eat and leave quick or they'll kick you out!
author: Sharon L.

description:
I wanted to like Mymy. I really did! We saw the reviews on Yelp, it looks cute inside, and the menu is creative and looks delicious. 

I love breakfast. I'm really not that hard to please for breakfast. It was honestly hard to choose what to get on their menu because it looks like it's all fresh & unique.

I tried the Harvest Time Scramble, but debated for a long time between that and the Frisco. The Harvest Time Scramble was TERRIBLE. First, it was cold. Second, it had a long, twisted piece of plastic in it (like Saran Wrap or a processed cheese wrapper, which if it was the latter, I don't even want to think about it...processed cheese is the devil.) Third, it had no flavor. How can a scramble with a host of great vegetables, like eggplant, AND pesto have no flavor? I'm baffled as to how badly this dish was screwed up.

The rest of my party also hated the food. All I remember about theirs was some chicken and sauce breakfast combo (can't remember the name) that was also bland.

The only edible part on my plate was the fruit, which was $1.50 extra but seemed fresh & delicious. At least I paid $1.50 for something good. The hash browns, which come with the scrambles traditionally, were definitely a previously frozen, flat sheet of potatoes (my companion had them).

Bottom line, the menu looked so good and creative that I had high hopes, but my food wasn't even edible. They comped the scramble because of the plastic (again, gross) but I left hungry, and that's never a good thing.
author: Courtney R.

description: Great breakfast/brunch menu. Very unique items. The house made corn beef hash was excellent.
author: Melissa C.

description: Solid 3 stars...the Lorraine Omelette was very good! Unfortunately the Benedict was bland with hardly any seasoning. Italian sausage was pink and greasy, we asked for the chicken apple sausage instead which turned out to be incredibly greasy as well. $19 carafe of mimosa & decent customer service made up for the shortcomings. I'd come back tho
author: Krista S.

description:
Discovered that this place is walking distance from my house and I drag everyone visiting me here for brunch. It's DELICIOUS!! The menu has a lot of variety and they find ways to blend flavors you wouldn't think would go together. 

Their special hash browns and the chive blue cheese pancake dish are probably my favorites but everything here is great!!

There is no waiting area and you'll most likely have to wait on the weekends so if it's a cold SF morning, make sure to bring a jacket!
author: Clarice C.

description: One of the best breakfasts I've had. The food is delicate and delicious. The wait wasn't long and the turnover is fast...so don't plan to linger!
author: Alex B.

description:
Small place and they only have one high chair available, but works out because on a weekday there was no wait. 

I got the crab and shrimp benedict-delicious. Lots of crab meat with whole shrimp on top of butter toast with spinach and poached eggs and dill sauce. Their hash browns are thin and crispy. Most places don't make it like this. I love that they do. Super good. 

Hubby got the corn beef benedict and it came with their dill sauce. Very yummy. 

Their souffle lemon ricotta pancakes are very fluffy. 

After you are done walk 4 blocks down to Mr. Holmes Bakehouse.
author: Karen H.

description: Super delicious and definitely worth a visit. I had the TexMex scrambled eggs and my girlfriend had the benedicts, both were extremely yummy. The people who work there are very nice and do their best to help you with whatever you need. We also ordered a side of bacon (very good) and some assorted fruit. Very happy to know they are not stingy with their fruit, the bowl had a large variety and a good amount that you don't normally see in other breakfast places.
author: Kyle L.

description:
Came for brunch twice now, glad this spot is just a few blocks from me! They don't take reservations so you'll have to put your name down and wait. The line moves fast. If you're not standing there when they call your name, they will cross it off, no mercy!

I've really liked the food here. The portions are big. The first time I got a Lemon dill crab shrimp cake Benedict (17), and the crab shrimp cake was great -- crunchy on the outside too. We also got grilled tomatoes (4), which were fine. pic: https://instagram.com/p/8z95CtjdEA/

And the second time, I got the Salmon rotolone tartine (15.5), which was a giant egg omelette thing wrapped in a very generous amount of smoked salmon, on bread, topped with lots of avocado, and came with awesome potato wedges (crunchy on the outside)! I couldn't finish and had to take the wedges to go -- they crisped back up when I fried them in a pan later.

Overall I think they are great. More casual than Olea across the street, which would make a better first date spot, but IMO this place has better food. Maybe just work on the service a bit (i.e. be nicer, don't mop and clean around people still eating) or else it will start to feel like a diner.
author: Cynthia W.

description: Delicious little place...the zucchini pancakes is a must try!!! Other dishes look delish as well
author: Gina W.

description: Food is delicious and a great service overall. Definitely coming back next time I'm in SF.
author: Daniella S.

description:
The food is delicious. Don't pay attention to the common decor. Pay attention to all the people in line wanting to eat there! 

You put your own name on the waiting list. And listen carefully for them to call your name. They call it out... And make sure that it can be heard... But if you miss it, they wipe you off the list. 

The food is great for breakfast. We all had different "Benedicts" and "Tartines". Evwryo
author: Frankie G.

description: This place is okay! I've been here many times. Food is pretty good, service is average, kind of slow most of the time...But yeah, overall okay!
author: aryan d.

description:
Feeling the need for breakfast, I ventured into San Francisco in search of a place that can satisfy my early morning desires. Enter the Mymy. Upon my arrival I saw that it was a small but cute restaurant. The sign Mymy is small and can be easily missed. A group of people waiting outside is a good sign that you found the place, as it gets crowded from all the people wanting to eat here.

As I'm looking over the menu, they have sweet n savory, eggs specials, burgers, sandwiches etc etc... What caught my eye was the banana blueberry soufflé pancake! Just the name  of the dish rolling of my tongue was already making my mouth drool! I decided to order that. I added a house made sausage patty and hashbrowns as well to give me a salty flavor incase my pancakes were too sweet. 

When the soufflé pancakes came out, it looked divine! Candied walnuts also accompanied the dish to give it texture as your eating it. Well first thing about the dish it surely was not too sweet, it was just right. My first bite into it was like eating a billowy soft fluffy cloud! It was ever so fluffy. Marscapone cream and fresh blueberries and banana lined the interior of the pancake. The walnuts gave it a nice crunch for a harmonious balance. An epic flavor of happiness was just bursting throughout my taste buds.

The fresh House made sausage  and hash browns made my breakfast a true perfect combination of flavors. A definite sweet n savory combination. A most definite return is imminent!
author: Roger P.

description: Excellent service and food was exceptional. I was a bit skeptical to walk from my hotel stay to MYMY coffee shop only because of the slope streets but 5 blocks wasn't bad at all. We arrived at 7:55am and waited exactly 5 minutes. Their doors actually open exactly at 8am. I ordered the crab shrimp cakes with a side of over medium eggs. I completely fell in love with these crab shrimp cakes. They were the main talk of my day. I couldn't stop thinking how amazing these lil cakes were. Would recommend to stop by if you will be in San Francisco.
author: Elisa Q.

description:
have been here countless times. More like a sunday ritual! Love the food here, especially the light and fluffy lemon ricotta cheese pancakes. To die for!

NOTHING here is not good. I've tried multiple different things (and so have my friends) and everything is always just so awesome!

It's totally worth the wait :)
So glad they got some extra seating space, though.

Also, i love their paintings :)
author: Namrata J.

description:
Mymy has a nice small cafe feel that is perfect for brunch.  If you want to get together with your girlfriends like I did, it gives you the space and decor to feel comfortable to do that.

BUT do take note that you will have to wait...and depending on what time you get there I would recommend taking out half an hour to just wait. 

I ordered the Chive Pancake with a side of sausage patty.  
  -The sausage patty was soooo salty. I could not eat it by myself or without  something to wash down that salt. 
  -The chive pancake was super fluffy and I could not even finish 1 by myself. I also love gorgonzola, but I wasn't a huge fan of it in my pancake because it tasted a bit funky with syrup.
  - Got my eggs scrambled and haha I don't think anyone can mess up eggs.

My friends really enjoyed their foods, and maybe this just wasn't my cup of tea.  If I go there then, I will probably just eat something else.
author: Alisa S.

description:
BEST BRUNCH EVER.
Mostly because they have the best pancakes ever. Theyre soufflé pancakes....meaning the fluffiest lightest tastiest pancakes youve ever had.
Lemon ricotta on top of that & that is the most amazing combination of experiences in a brunch.

Dill crabcake eggs benedict. Holy lord. I usually think these types of brunch items are way too creamy and heavy. This plate however was the best egg anything i have ever had. Life changing, as Lulu says.

I want to try everything on the menu now!!!!
author: Lisa K.

description:
Really great food.
must go early to get a seat and not wait an hour for brunch
author: Fran M.

description:
I liked MyMy before liking MyMy was cool.
That means I'm sad now when I can't get a table for brunch...
They experimented on the menu a few years ago and really honed in on some delicious items (except they need to bring back the veggie omelette they used to have). 

The food here is solid, although you'll be surprised how quickly you can drop over $20 on breakfast. The portion sizes are good, and service is always prompt and friendly.
author: Mike M.

description:
The most amazing scramble I've ever had. I got the Frisco and everyone else got another variety. We got a plate of the banana blueberry soufflé pancakes for the table. My scramble was so good, I wasn't even interested in the pancakes, which is definitely out of the ordinary for me.

The fruit cup is definitely better than the average with a ton of fruit, including my favorite, mango! 

I hear the wait can be long and they don't take reservations or call aheads but we didn't have a very long wait at all (Friday morning). 

We will definitely be coming back here.
author: Joie H.

description: Annoyed that the waiter gave us the wrong check, we paid and then another waitress came back and pointed out that we had been given a check from a group that had been in 2 hours before we even got there.  That's a $10 mistake you should have eaten Mymy!
author: Meghan W.

description: The food and coffee were wonderful! Great atmosphere, cozy and friendly. The staff is very friendly too.
author: Owen C.

description:
Although the list was very long... It went by very quickly! I was surprised because I put my name on the list after 15 other people and I decided to get some coffee at Contraband. I came back and they already called my name ! I asked if she could put us in but we ended up putting our name down again after 5 people. In 15 extra minutes we were in so don't leave your post or let a friend stay while you go off somewhere, like for coffee like me ;)

I ordered banana blueberry souffle pancakes and my bf got the crab Benedict. The pancakes were so soft and pillowy... Loved it. The crab Benedict was also delish. I think they nailed it for me as I feel that I should definitely come back.
author: Lyra C.

description:
Places that only serve breakfast end up tasting the same to me. Not sure why. Eggs, some kind of "scramble" that is supposed to be interesting and unique, twelve types of pancakes or French toast or eggs Benedict. 

Been there done that. 

We only went here because every time we drove past on a weekend the line outside was crazy long.   Now I know San Francisco loves to wait in line for brunch...with mixed results...but we figured we'd give it a try. 

Tex-mix scramble was the choice. And it was ok. Coffee was ok. Nothing was more than ok.   Well, the service was excellent. Much better than ok. Super attentive and quick. 

But back to the food...Ok isn't bad at all. It's just not great.  It felt like any other breakfast only place in town. 

We didn't have a wait as we got to the restaurant early.  I was glad for that!

So...wait if you want!  At least they have outdoor seating.
author: Tobin S.

description: Hair in my food. They couldn't cook my eggs, well, as I asked. I never return food, but I had to return my food twice here, and then ended up just not wanting the food... Disappointing and a waste of time. Left starving and frustrated.
author: Jessie A.

description:
Pros
The food!
The service

Cons
Long wait, and you can't put your name down.
Kind of old look and feel (but that's a pro for some)
author: Captain B.

description:
Found this place on yelp and decided to give it a try! So glad I did because the food was amazing!!! When we arrived we put our name on the list (which I liked better than telling a host) it took about 15-20 minutes to get seated and we sat extremely close to the people next to us. I didn't mind though, we ordered mimosas which were yummy. We wanted to order the Baja California Benedict but they were out:( so my bf got the blueberry pancakes soufflé. They were pretty good but I wasn't feeling pancakes. I got the lemon dill crab shrimp cake Benedict and omg it was amazing!!! So
Happy I found this place on yelp because I will definitely be coming back!
author: Claudia R.

description:
It's been 2 days since I ate here and all I remember was that it was hella good and I want to go back. Soo good. I really wanted pancakes but what they offered I really didn't want to try. I got the French toast and sausage patty....BOMB DOT COM!!!!!!  Damn sooooo delicious! Quite possibly the best French toast I have ever had. Cooked perfectly. Not to sweet. Toasty, and a lot of butter. The fresh fruit was perfect! I loved the grilled charred sausage. All the flavors just melted soo well. 

The ambience was great. Very small and quaint. There weren't too many people but it was a weekday. I'm really looking forward to going again. Soo yummy!
author: Ashley H.

description:
I think in my experience alone is what may have damaged my thoughts on MYMY.

I came here in Nee Years Day (Jan 1st) to eat for brunch. The line took about 30-40 minutes in order to be seated. That's pretty long but I totally understand considering what day it was and the ratings of the restaurant. 

I ordered corn beef hash which is usually my go-to brunch meal. I did not like the plate at all. The eggs were runny even when I asked for a scramble. The corned beef was cut in really thick dices which took forever to chew. I wish I had hash browns with the meal instead of this mini potato wedges. The best part of my meal was the toasted wheat bread. Toasted wheat bread tastes the same everywhere!! 

Overall I think my experience just didn't play out well. The food wasn't worth the wait, nor the price.
author: Brandon F.

description:
Soooooooo good! Could not have had a better brunch experience here after the disaster that is olea across the street. The servers at mymy are delightful, gracious, and manage a hectic brunch time w/ great attitudes. The food is delicious! We couldn't decide what to get because everything looked amazing. I've decided I'll just have to go back again and again to try everything. 

We split the French toast and Frisco scramble. The hash browns were so crispy and the French toast was perfectly fluffy. The corned beef hash also got rave reviews. The food came out really quickly too. We all loved everything and cleaned our plates. 

Love this place!
author: Semuteh F.

description:
Tried this place while I was visiting San Francisco a couple months ago.  Yes, I'm just now writing a review, but it just shows that the food is that memorable.  By far the most creative breakfast I've ever had, and definitely the most beautiful plating!

I had the souffle pancake and my bf had the chive pancakes, and we shared a side of the hash browns.  My dish was good, but my bf's was amazing!  The chive pancakes were savory and sweet all at the same time.  And the hash browns were perfectly crunchy with veggies on top that gave it so much flavor.  Also, loved the fact that they serve homemade jam and real maple syrup.

My only criticism is that our waitress had a bit of an attitude.  When I asked for extra maple syrup and a refill of coffee she was pretty unfriendly.

However, I still think about this place and I can't wait to go back next time I'm in San Fran.  I have yet to find a breakfast place as good near where I live, which is probably good for my waistline, but totally sucks for my taste buds.
author: Mallory G.

description:
Absolutely delicious. We happened upon this place when visiting SF from DC. We shared the banana blueberry souffle pancake and the corned beef hash. It was the perfect combination of savory and sweet. 

The waiters were pleasant and the service was fast. 

The food was so good we came back again the next day! We re-ordered the corned beef hash and this time tried the French toast. Delicious again. 

I love breakfast food, but my husband generally prefers lunch. Mymy was good enough to convince him to go out for breakfast 2 days in a row!
author: Kari S.

description: Good food but extremely rude service would not come back.
author: Lynn J.

description:
Solid four star meal. 

The folks in the back of the house are doing an amazing job and both our meals were top quality, expertly prepared with not only perfect proportion, plating presentation and an exciting flavor profile but an original spin on eggs Benedict, yum.  Our breakfast was great.

The service is lacking and was at best two stars. 

Pro tip: Always acknowledge the existence of ($) your customers before anything else. When you ignore people as their first impression they don't come back, as we won't.
author: Justin S.

description: Hits the spot when it comes to brunch. I went for the frisco scramble (chicken apple sausage, leeks, shallot, roma tomato, avocado, and cheddar) and banana blueberry soufflé pancake (a bit dry on its own, but with butter / syrup / homemade jam, yum!)
author: Catherine H.

description:
It was that time of day again - brunch! Both of my girlfriends really like this place so we decided to go this morning. I can't say that I was super impressed, but the food wasn't bad either. The portions are a reasonable size and I would definitely recommend getting the hash browns as your side. I was taking the healthy route today so I only got to mooch off a few bites, but it was delicious - not too oily and very crispy. As fellow benedict addicts we each ordered a different benediction:

Parma Flavor prosciutto, melted fresh mozzarella, roma tomato, basil, grilled asparagus, chive hollandaise, grana padano sprinkle

Norwegian garlic sauteed spinach, smoked salmon, caper, chive hollandaise

Baja California avocado, shrimp, roasted red peppers hollandaise

All three tasted fine but I guess I prefer food that incorporates unexpected ingredients rather than plain vanilla dishes.
author: Charlotte Z.

description: All the Yelp reviews warned of a long line and they weren't wrong. However, we did go at optimal brunch time so we figured as much anyway. They are incredibly efficient at seating and the line goes very fast. The food is good and the waitstaff continue with their efficient work! It's small so if you're claustrophobic or you want to be an ass about being seated in an order not always conducive to a line then this isn't for you. If you aren't those things eat here! It's very good.
author: Dajsa F.

description:
Great spot for brunch!

I got the parma benedict and it was really well made. full of flavor. my favorite part was the prosciutto. (i love prosciutto)
The hash brown (singular) was great too. it's flat and very large. like a sheet of hash brown. but it was crispy and delicious.

my friends also did unlimited mimosa. They kinda were stingy about it though. They had a time limit. But i didn't have any so i had no worries. 

Outside seating is nice!

Overall, really good brunch food! Recommend!
author: Yong K.

description: Stopped by Mymy for breakfast last Monday morning. We arrived around 8:30am and were seating right away. I had seen the pictures of the crabcake benedict on Yelp so I already knew that is what I would be ordering and it didn't disappoint! The sauce was great and that thin layer of hashbrowns was probably my favorite part, it was like a giant potato chip! My cappuccino was delish as well. My husband got the breakfast sausage burger and enjoyed it as well, then crispy potatoes that came with his were out of this world!
author: Melissa B.

description: We had an amazing breakfast! 10/10 would eat here again too bad we don't live in San Fran
author: Shannon M.

description:
The flavor of the dishes we had were great! I had the Norwegian eggs Benedict: included salmon spinach and the Benedict sauce... It was delicious! My co-worker had the TexMex scramble with egg whites... Be forewarned... The salsa on this is SPICY... If you are unsure you can handle it just ask for the salsa on the side, it will still taste yummy with out being overwhelmed by spicyness like she was. Both of us had the hash browns and those were good, nothing amazing, very little compared to what we thought the dishes came with, but just right for both of us. 
We will definitely go back to try other dishes like the other egg Benedict's and the french toast and pancake flavors!! So excited!
We will definitely be going back!
author: Mary W.

description: Great brunch!  I highly recommend the Baja California Benedict.
author: Rick G.

description: Visited this place while in San Fran for a wedding on a Sunday morning.  The weather was very pleasant and people were out in force and had to wait a good 25 minutes.  The place is small but the service is fast and therefore the food comes out quick.  I had the lemon ricotta soufflé pancakes which were delicious.  I like tart tastes and wish the lemon flavor was a bit stronger; however, the pancakes were still very tasty.  The wife is on a gluten free diet and had the fruit cup, side of bacon and grilled asparagus.  What can you say about these items except the wife said the asparagus was cooked perfectly.  Also, since this seems to be run by Asians, there was mango in the fruit cup which the wife loved.
author: Jon Y.

description:
They have the best French toast and the best hash browns I've ever had! If you like your hash browns not crispy and with lots of potatoes that it's kind of mushy, this isn't he hash brown for you.

I've had many of their dishes, the chive and bacon pancake, vanilla soufflé French toast, lemon ricotta pancake, Parma flavor Benedict, and the crab cake Benedict. All very good! When some of the dishes don't come with hash brown, I order it on the side. Their oj is from fresh oranges not that concentrated stuff!

Parking is a bit of a pain (meter parking) but coming on Sunday before noon, the meters are free. There's usually a wait, before 9 the wait is super short but after that something like an 30 mins to an hour.

Overall delicious brunch and I come back almost once a month, if not every other month. Need my mymy fix!
author: Avita S.

description:
Best brunch ever!! I was so impressed with how delicious this cute little cafés food was, and extra impressed with the price! not bad at all! I ordered the 2 eggs any style with bacon, and this bacon isn't your average bacon, it's gourmet style, and super delicious! the eggs were perfectly cooked and the hash-browns were both soft and crispy. I also got to try the Vanilla Sponge French Toast. one word. INCREDIBLE. melt in your mouth delicious! with the perfect touch of sweetness, it almost tastes like a pastry. if you're visiting or if you live in the area, the cable cars will drop you off right in front of the restaurant. We took the Powell/Hyde cable car, and jumped off at California st then jumped onto the California cable car towards Van Ness and then all you need to do is jump off at California at Larkin. Voila! 

try this place out! you won't regret it!
author: Alicia C.

description:
Maybe my expectations were just too high, but this place just seems really average for a not cheap breakfast place with a long line. 

In my experience, the food looks delicious and then doesn't have the flavor to support the looks. I've tried the Banana-Blueberry Souffle Pancakes, The Norwegian Benedict, and the Baja California Benedict. Out of these, the only one I liked was the Norwegian; everything else, wasn't bad, but was disappointingly lacking in flavor. My garlic shrimp Baja meal barely tasted like anything. While the Souffle Pancake had a wonderful texture, I could taste only whispers of banana and blueberry. I'm not really down to pay $14 for food I wish tasted as described on the menu. Their coffee isn't very good either but they charge artisanal coffee prices for that too.

The service inside has been fast but very friendly. The people taking the names down are usually pretty mean. They also will overestimate the wait time, which is isn't bad per se, except  if you miss your name being called, they cross you off and you have to start over. We were told we had an hour wait, wandered away and came back in 40 minutes, and our name had already been called. When we tried to ask if we could be seated next, the lady brusquely told us, too bad, start over on the list, so we had to wait another 30 minutes.

So far, I've tried twice and that's probably it for me. It's a fine place, and, if you're in the area, it's not a bad option, but you will for sure be overcharged for the quality you're getting.
author: Christina R.

description:
Brunch, a simple meal enjoyed predominantly by yuppies, typically prefaced by lots of waiting. Oftentimes, it consists of supposedly grand renditions of simple ingredients like eggs, potatoes, and more eggs. I'm not the biggest fan because these supposed grand renditions usually end up quite frustratingly basic, and I'm left wondering why I paid $14 for pancakes or eggs. 

So it comes as a surprise that I thoroughly enjoyed the MOT Sausage Burger at Mymy's. Its soft and sweet bun, tasty and well-seasoned sausage, and overall quite balanced plate of sweet, savory, and salty made me really happy I got up at 11am on a weekend. There are the usual egg and hash brown constructions, but Mymy's has enough unique and complex dishes to tide over the most picky brunch eaters.
author: Jason T.

description: My oh my!  This place was recommended by our hotel concierge for breakfast and it was the best breakfast of our visit to SF.  From the coffee to our meals everything was so fresh.  It was a Monday so it wasn't crowded.  Service was very quick.  Hubby and I shared the Frisco Scramble and the French toast.  Both were excellent!  I would definitely come back on my next visit to SF.
author: Brini R.

description: Amazing restaurant! Incredible food, fast and courteous service...everything you could hope for! Such a great find!
author: Mike S.

description: Visiting from los angeles, we wanted to try a local favorite. Food was delicious!  I was  pleasantly  surprised  by the taste and quality of the food. Had the french toast and stole some of my boyfriends  crunchy  potatoes from his chorizo  plate. We loved our food. Will definitely  tell our friends  about this place of they visit san francisco.
author: Bekah Cow ..

description: Uber tasty breakfast! We ordered zucchini pancakes to split, not my favorite but still good. I ordered the Tex mex scramble and it was delicious! My husband ordered the MOT burger and he says "phenomenal!" Overall a very tasty find in the city!
author: Jennier S.

description: First time having zucchini pancakes, excellent! Everything my family order tasted great. You want to get there before 9am to avoid a wait time.  Outside seating was very nice.
author: Phillip C.

description: One of the best brunches I've ever had. Everything was full of flavor and incredible! Corn beef hash was amazing! Staff was incredibly friendly
author: Kyan S.

description:
My friend recommended Olea to me, pre-stating that she's not a brunch person (What?? How?? Anyways...), I found stumbled upon Mymy on Yelp and was instantly sold by their hashbrowns! Shredded hashbrowns rarely, if even, exist in Hong Kong and I love eating it so. They're not just any shredded hashbrowns, but they looked like real good hashbrowns, so I was immediately sold and set on going to Mymy. Mymy is just right across the street from Olea. If I don't like Mymy, then heck, I'll just hop over to Olea! The line was long and I waited 30+ minutes before finally getting seated for a table of 2. There was no line at Olea so I figured I probably made the better choice to come here. :)

I ordered fresh orange juice and eggs florentine with added avocado. The fresh orange juice was good, except half way through with it there was a piece of hair (not mine) buried in the drink... Kinda gross... I told them about it and they gave me a new one. I would have preferred them taking it off the ~$4 orange juice off my bill rather than getting a new one. After drinking OJ with hair in it, do I really want another one? =\

As opposed to using English muffins, the Eggs Florentine was on sourdough bread. It tasted fine except the overall Egg Florentine fish was just okay. I love eating Eggs Florentine so I like to try them all! The hollandaise sauce and the overall dish was on the heavy and non-tasty side - to the point where I couldn't finish it and didn't even bother bringing home (and that rarely happens!). Ah wells. Though I'd have to say, this place makes some bomb ass hashbrowns. I love that they make it super golden and crispy. I've never had such crispy hashbrowns in my life - they were dddddddelicious, and I wanted more. Speaking of which, I still want some more, right now!
author: Jade F.

description:
My husband and I have been eyeing this place for a while, as we live super close and walk by it almost daily.  We finally ventured to Mymy this past rainy, Sunday for an uncomplicated hearty brunch.

My husband and I both were in a "benedict" mood, so I opted for the Baja California, and my husband selected the crab cake benedict option (which always seems to call his name!).  

I preferred my dish to my husband's - his seems a bit to "fishy" tasting for me.  The crab cake texture was a bit "mushy" for my taste - wasn't horrible, but I didn't feel it necessary to grab a second bite.   My Baja California benedict was very tasty - the shrimp was cooked perfectly and the sauce had great flavor.  

I substituted the hash browns for french fries, and my husband stuck with the hash browns.  The fries were "meh" - but that hash brown was the star of the meal.  So crisp on the outside, while soft on the inside, mmm... 

Don't let the 3 stars let you think we didn't enjoy ourselves - we left feeling satisfied.  However, given the other fantastic brunch experiences we've had in SF thus far, this place doesn't warrant a 4 or 5 in my opinion.  If you're in the neighborhood looking for brunch, I suggest heading accross the street to Olea for some very tasty brunch.  A stand-out there is the french toast - you will not be disappointed (except for when your plate's empty!).
author: Rachael S.

description:
One of my favorite brunch places in the city.

Food: love their hash browns!!

Service: casual & friendly.

Price: $40 for two including food & drinks.
author: Nawei C.

description:
Mymy came highly recommended by my roommate so one weekend, I decided to try go after a night if heavy drinking. It was 12:30 on a Sunday so there was about a 30 min wait, but it was sooo worth it. 

The atmosphere is small, cozy, and diner-like. I usually think diners feel slightly dirty but Mymy just felt really clean and cozy! 

The food was also really good! It was so hard to decide, because everyone else's food that came out all looked so good (read avocado on everything)! In the end I ordered the smoked salmon benedict. The eggs were perfectly poached, the hollandaise was perfect for me (not too creamy or heavy), and the side of hash browns were golden and crispy. 

My friends ordered the tex mex scramble, Frisch scramble and a pulled pork scramble. Let's just say we didn't talk for a good 10 mins :) and it wasn't because we were in our phones!

They also provide this amazing raspberry jam!! (I thought it was hot chili sauce....don't ask, it was Sunday after a long night at my holiday party, and the jam came in the same containers that the chili hot sauce comes in at Chinese restaurants...) Anyways, my friend decides to lather the jam in his corn tortilla, after he inhaled his dish and realized he'd forgotten about them, and rolled it up. He said, and I quote, "it tastes like a crepe!" Yup, that happened. 

The only reason it doesn't get a 5 star is the lack of a proper Bloody Mary :( They make theirs with soju, which is just a faux-pas in my book.
author: Emmie Y.

description: Holy moly. That shit is delicious. I got the florentine. Best breakfast I've had in a long time. Perfect poached eggs and super garlicky. I didn't even use the hollandaise. The zucchini pancakes and texmex scramble were also amazing according to my ladies. I will definitely be back next time I'm in SF!
author: Miranda N.

description:
Must try:

Chorizo jalapeno tartine - It's a travesty that I had to scroll through as many reviews as I did to find someone describing the eggs on this tartine as "fluffy." Am I eating at the same restaurant as everyone else?  This is one of my favorite brunch dishes in this brunch-crazy town.   The eggs are ridiculously light and airy, which is a good counter the heartiness of the chorizo.  The aioli serves as a nice counter to the spiciness of the jalapenos.  In all, just a really well balanced dish - and that's before we even mention the hash browns on the side...

Note: I've tried the regular egg tartine and didn't find the eggs quite as delicious - could have just been natural variation or a different technique used for that tartine. 

Special hash - My gf typically eschews a traditional meal and goes directly for the special hash.  The potatoes are golden brown and delicious, but the peppers, onions, and bacon really put it over the top.  Don't think - just order it.
author: Yi Z.

description: Consistency is key to any good thing in life.  Mymy weekend brunch is consistent.  There are healthy and indulgent options on the menu for the fitness oriented and for those a little more lenient.   I say flexible options for flexible dieting!  Somethings that I recommend : pancakes (any of them)... The spicy scrambles (make if egg white for $2 extra) , throw in a side of Bacon (please)  and wash it down with a mimosa (score!!!!).   Service is pleasant,  but there can be long lines... Be prepared to wait!
author: Hiromi N.

description:
Went for breakfast in March and again in our visit in September. This place has not dipped one iota. It's exceptional!my fiance and I love the fresh squeezed grapefruit juice and fresh squeezed grapefruit Mimosa ;)
The food is fantastic. I consider myself a bacon connoisseur and this is fantastic bacon. Not too thick cut, crisp around the outside with that melt in you mouth fat that has a burst of flavor.
The meats are perfectly cooked I had braised pork pop scramble was delicious and fork pull tender. The sauce was like a chimchurri but not as oily and just a magnificent compliment to the scramble. The toast was not buttered but they keep the butter packet over it so it's nice and melted and easy to spread as much or as little as you want.
My fiancé has the Franciscan scramble (I may have these names wrong but something like that...).
Again amazing.
Thanks mymy you're our go to spot for SFO breakfast and brunch!
author: Neil V.

description: Nothing that blew my mind here. Typical brunch options (the benedicts were the popular choices here). Since SF is a city that loves its brunch, you really have to stand out, which this place does not. The plus side: huge portions and quick and efficient service
author: Derrick W.

description:
OH MY GAWWWWDDDD I LOVE THIS PLACE AND ITS HEAVENLY EGG BENEDICT &  HASH BROWNS.

Im sorry. That was rude to do all caps but that's  how much I love this place. 

BENEDICTIONS MUSTS;

*Norwegian
*Lemon Crab
*Baja California:  this is the "WHAT IS WRONG WITH THIS WORLD" ultimate favorite.  (i know i makes no sense but i say that every time I'm having a food orgasm) 

The french toast is delish too.

Do not get the mexican scramble!!!! Its super spicy and the flavors do not blend well. 

HANDS DOWN the best hash browns ever. Thin, crispy on top, fluffly on the bottom. 

If you are deciding between Olea and Mymy,  go to mymy. Trust me. 

They serve really different types of food, and mymy is more of a brunch place. Props to Olea for serving the fluffiest french toast though, everything else mymy does best. 

Happy Brunch :)

Xoxo,
Le petite asiatique
author: Mily W.

description:
I LOVED THIS PLACE! It was our first time visiting San Francisco, back in August, and this was a very super far walk from the hotel but we were super excited for brunch and it was definitely worth it!

 The staff are very friendly and fast! Being from Texas, everything in SF seems close together but I liked the intimacy of the seating. We ended up getting a pitcher of Orange Juice Mimosas (they asked us if we wanted Oranges or Grapefruit)  because it was really affordable and it was very refreshing! I ordered the Crab Cakes Eggs Benedict and my gosh it was MORE THAN GOOD! My boyfriend ordered the Surf and Turf burger. I'm a seafood fan so the crab cakes were one of the BEST I had and I loved the way everything was seasoned! Of all the places we ate at in SF this place was definitely my favorite! I would come back again and again! :)
author: Mereen J.

description:
If you're a fan of gooey eggs benedict and crispy hash browns, you'll love Mymy. It's only open from 8am-2:30pm, a testament to their commitment to the art of brunching. If only they were open all day.

The food is by no means gourmet, but it's simple, consistent and good. Seafood fans will be pleased to learn there are lots of shrimp and crab dishes in the menu. As for me, I stuck with the parma ham eggs benedict. The eggs were cooked perfectly, oozing out beautiful yolk all over my hash browns -- just the way I like it! My only complaint is that the English muffin could've been toasted better; it got a bit soggy under all the spinach and artichoke bits.
