One of my friends got the Texas scramble, topped with avocado and warm tortillas -- she seemed to enjoy it a lot. My other friend who got the blackberry and tiger shrimp salad was singing praises, and scraped her bowl clean.

So grateful for this delicious brunch option right in my neighborhood!

Tip: It's a small but bustling space on the weekends; if you're ravenous around noon, expect at least a 45-min wait! If you want to avoid the lines, I suggest stopping by around 1:30pm -- I noticed the tables emptying out around then.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
Love the food!
Any chance you would be willing to sell the deer picture? The one with the socks on the deer? I am obsessed with it! Thank you!!
author: Charles B.

description:
Loved breakfast! They have some unique interpretations on breakfast classics. Some places just do this to be different without delivering on flavor balance and taste, but MyMy's offerings were great.

Two of us split sweet potato pancakes and parma benedict. After trying the has browns that came with the benedict, I had to order a second order because neither of us wanted to share. The pancakes weren't overly sweet, and the benedict was tasty and cooked well. The coffee was just okay, but everything else was pretty perfect.
author: Kate F.

description:
Honestly my favorite brunch place in SF! Which is saying a lot, because there are manyyyy places to pick from. 

The food is amazing. Where do I even start!? They have a whole benedicts section (!) with a delicious sauce, served at the correct temperature. The hash browns are perfectly crispy and thin like no other types I've experienced. But the SWEETS are where it's at. If you could believe that it gets better! The French toast and the souffle pancakes are fluffy, decadent, and overall melt in your mouth flavors. There's an option for everyone. 

Service is very attentive. They always refill waters, check in with you, bring extra sauces/condiments. There is usually a wait if you go at normal brunch time (where in SF *doesn't* have a wait?!) but it's definitely worth it. Designate one person in your party to hop in line and eagerly await your amazing brunch!!
author: Mary N.

description:
Wait time could be long peak hours or party of more than 2. We waited 20 min Sunday morning at 10 party of 2. 

We split Crab cakes eggs Benedict with grapefruit juice $22 plus tip. 

The crowd was mainly 30s 20s some 40+ and a number of Europeans. 

Once seated service was prompt they move people through. 

If the wait is too long There's other good places nearby but we were 6th down the list and seated in 20 or so minutes. 

I hear the corned beef hash and pancakes are also good. Juice was fresh we elected that over Bloody Mary or mimosa.
author: Chris W.

description:
I tried to go to three other brunch places on a Sunday, but this is the only one with no wait. This is why...

-The service is soooo slow. Waited a while to order, then a really looooong time just to get our food. 

-I didn't see any alcohol on the menu, not even mimosas.

-My $14 dungenous crab eggs bene was just okay. They put so much stuff in it - peppers, onions, etc etc, that it takes away from the crab. I recommend Zazie's if you want a good crab eggs bene. 

-It literally felt like a sauna in there too! Hence, it was nice & sunny outside, but idk, this place had NO circulation. 

Probs wouldn't be back. Sorry!
author: Alysha K.

description:
Wanted to go to Griddle Fresh but decided to give their sister restaurant a try.

I got the lemon ricotta souffle pancakes while my sister got the banana blueberry souffle pancakes with a side of hash browns to share.

The presentation was sloppier than the pictures of Griddle Fresh which was kind of disappointing but they still tasted pretty good overall which is what is most important.

I preferred the souffle pancakes here versus that at Bette's in Berkeley. It's a little more eggy which I like. Still not completely sold on the souffle pancakes though, I felt the flavor needed a little more work...would taste better with some fruit inside but they told me they couldn't do it.

The hash browns were a disappointment. I knew it was supposed to be crispy, but not literally just a sliver off the top of normal hash...which would have been fine but at that price it should have been at least twice as long. I'm not exaggerating when I say it's just a single layer of flaky/crispy potato. Yummy but a rip off in my opinion. 

This place overall is pretty good but i would probably rather try Griddle Fresh next time. More of a 3.5 stars which is not bad.
author: Melissa C.

description: Had the French toast ... It was amazing ! The portions are big and fill you up . My boyfriend had the pop pulled spicy scramble. He loved it !!! We will return and highly recommend.
author: Nikki B.

description:
I went here for lunch with the bf when were apartment hunting. It was pretty decent and filling and made us happy in the midst of a San Francisco apartment search which is always a good thing!

However going back for breakfast was a really good idea. They have a wide selection of nice breakfast choices. I got an omelette. It was fresh and so delicious and I ate too much. Would definitely recommend the lunch/brunch option. Be forewarned that there will be a wait if you go during weekend breakfast times unless you're an early riser.
author: Rebecca M.

description: Best breakfast ever! Baja benediction.  Truth is I've been coming here for years, and while we don't need this place to become more popular, I'm all about rewarding quality and they deserve a 5 star review! This place is my favorite brunch place in the city and I've been to all the good ones. A+
author: Brandon V.

description: Had the banana blueberry soulffe pancake it was light and fluffy with real blueberry inside
author: Raymond G.

description:
All in all, I would come back to this place, even though it is somewhat of a trek from where I live.

I came for brunch/lunch today. And boy was the line long!!!!! I think I arrived around 1pm and put my name down. There were 6-7 tables for two ahead of me. I definitely waited outside in the cold for more than an hour, but it the end, I think it was worth it. 

Between the two of us, we ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes, the frisco scramble (with italian sausage), and then baja california. I really loved how the hash browns were thin and very well-done. The taste of everything was really good. I would definitely do the lemon ricotta pancakes again. I also stole a little bit of the baja california, and it was solid.

The service was good, but I think the food came out slower than it should have (or maybe by then, I was dying of hunger after watching all the delicious food pass by). They close at 2pm, and we were one of the last people to get seated, so that could be why the food came out so slow.
author: Carolyn Z.

description:
came here w/my boyfriend for my birthday brunch! we came here around 11am? and we got seated maybe after a 10-15 min wait which wasn't too bad. I'm not a big fan of the location of this place just because it's in such a busy area and next to California. the place is quite small and vintage looking. the atmosphere was welcoming. 

before coming here, I had my eye on the banana blueberry soufflé pancakes... because soufflé pancakes are TO DIE FOR. but, unfortunately I felt like getting an actual meal would've been more efficient. I ended up getting. the Baja California benediction. I was somewhat disappointed of the fact that one of my eggs were not runny, also I did not know it had onions. so, I spent a good minute picking them out. BUT, the shrimp was very flavorful and pretty big. normally when I go to brunch places, they use fake tiny packaged shrimp. but at mymy, they don't. so that was a plus! although the bread that the benedicts were placed on was not the easiest to cut into and I had a hard time. my boyfriend got the tex-mex without the jalapeños and a side order of bacon. he pretty much liked what he ordered and he actually ate my hashbrowns too. 

I would probably say that I'd come back again in the future, but to try their pancakes!
author: Audrey K.

description:
Really impressed with this place. 

We walked into a small unassuming breakfast diner that seats possible two dozen people tops. That being said, everything that came out of the kitchen was extremely well made, fresh ingredients and delicious. 

The presentations, portion plating and execution of these dishes looked more at home at a white tablecloth restaurant than where we were sitting. (Thats a compliment. The place is nice enough, but their food is nicer) Best of all the prices are nothing compared to what you get! 

Service was prompt fast and very friendly and our wait for a table was on a couple minutes. We were a party of two though, and we saw problems arise for larger groups. (Again this place maybe has ten tables)

Excellent breakfast plates for anyone in the area looking for a really delicious start to their day.
author: Drew K.

description:
Just ate brunch here. The wait was about 20-30 minutes for 10:00 am on a Saturday. It went by quickly. We were seated outside directly in the sunlight. 

The food was decently good for the abundance of brunch places in the area, however the staff here is extremely rude and unaccommodating. When we asked to change tables to the open one right next to us because we had been melting in the sun, they blatantly said no. We tried to reason with them but they had an incredible amount of attitude and sass. If I'm going to dish out $20 for a plate of food, I would really like to take my time and enjoy it. Which unfortunately was not possible under the glare of the heat. They also messed up my friends order and then charged her extra for it. For these reasons I will not be going back.
author: Isabel B.

description: This place is a hidden gem!  The mambo Italiano eggs and challah French toast is delicious!  Highly recommend this place.  Great, friendly staff and attentive service.  A must breakfast stop!
author: Len Z.

description: Originally planned on eating across the street at Olea. However, due to repulsive service, my party decided to eat in MyMy instead. I could not be more satisfied with my decision! Possibly the best orange juice I've ever had, very nifty interior, comfortable outdoor heat lamps, and amazing food. The service was very sweet and we felt welcome. I had the banana and blueberry pancakes and tasted the French toast. Everything looked delicious and I could easily try everything on the menu. A must-do for anyone who is in the area and likes brunch!
author: Christa B.

description:
Same owners as Griddle Fresh over in Noe Valley MEANING...same amazing fresh light-textured hash browns. Also, you can't go wrong with the soufflé pancakes and eggs benedict...but I would pass on the french toast.

Service at Mymy is attentive...albeit a bit hasty. No wait if you come in early enough on a weekday, but of course....it's the opposite on weekends and you'll see a good crowd of people gathering around the curb outside waiting after having putting their names down.

Good for small parties up to four people and solo diners. The small indoor dining space is L-shaped. There's indoor counter seating by the window, and probably no more than ten indoor tables. there's outdoor seating too.
author: Kaitlin G.

description:
The best breakfast in town, and the prices aren't too bad.  Menu highlights include the French toast, Tex-mex scramble, and zucchini pancakes.  I cannot recommend this place enough, it is my partner and I's favorite place to grab breakfast.  

There are often waits for a table (justifiably so) so don't come starving!  Get there a few minutes early.
author: Lars T.

description:
Food was really good, but the service was such a turn off. Ordered lemon ricotta pancakes, blt
Benedict, tex mex, and zucchini pancakes. Everything was satisfactory, in fact above average - and I am a breakfast person! When we got there, they said they couldn't seat us until our party was complete. Pretty standard, until the guy told us it was because the server can't take orders more than once. Huh? So irritating that there were 2 other tables had people JUST join them! Next, there was 18% gratuity added to our bill. Pretty standard too - unless 2 of your party are kiddos! We dine out in SF at least 2 x a week and we've been charged 18% only TWICE ever for our group. And this was nowhere in their menu. All in all, We should've just waited the long line at Mama's!
author: C C.

description: Came here for brunch at 1pm and this place was pretty crowded. More than 15 groups were ahead and 8 were 3-4 people so I thought the wait would be an hour. I walked over to Mr Holmes just to peek at the cruffin but every pastry was sold out. I walked back while others got coffee and we were already up! Thank goodness they gave us 5 minutes to have everyone here. Seriously that was the quickest wait for brunch..prolly 30 minutes. We came here just for the hash because we saw how flat and fried this thing was. I also got to try the salmon egg bread dish, chive pancake, and banana+blueberry souffle pancake. I really enjoyed the hash and that was my favorite. My pancake was fluffy but I prefer a regular pancake rather than souffle. I liked the salmon and egg and they could have done less of that creamy thing. The chive pancake was aite. I would say this is a solid brunch place in SF and the wait is not bad at all.
author: Amy H.

description:
AMAZING FOOD! I've been here 4, 5 times now and this review is long overdue. 

I've only been on weekdays, so have never had to wait to be seated. I've tried two of their omelettes (one with asparagus/bacon/gruyere, and another with sausage), one of their eggs benedicts (one with shrimp), and their french toast. 

Every time, their food never fails me. I think I liked the omelette with asparagus/gruyere/bacon the most, but the french toast is a very close second. I love their hasbrowns as well - perfectly seasoned, and pan-fried kind of a like a sheet until golden brown and crispy but not burnt. I've yet to try their pancakes, which means another visit is coming up soon! 

Otherwise, service is friendly and fast, and their food comes out quickly. It's friendly for solo-diners as well, since they've got a bar table area next to a good stack of up-to-date magazines (New Yorker, Time, some home magazines) that diners are free to read while eating. While I don't think they'd be happy if you pulled your laptop out and started working, they won't rush you out if you're finished with your meal but still browsing through a magazine and sipping coffee. Their service style is friendly, efficient, but not pushy. 

I'm already looking forward to my next visit!
author: Anna H.

description:
French infused American breakfast food with a Chinese FOH staff & Hispanic Kitchen. Very unique flavors with a flair for aesthetically pleasing dishes. Coming in on Tuesday is really good timing as it's nice and mellow. Our server informed us it gets really busy on Saturdays. Nice atmosphere with impressionistic painting on the walls with an affinity for deer in their decorations. 
     I had a banana blueberry soufflé pancake with maple syrup and my wife had a Norwegian eggs Benedict. Both really good. We were curious about all the cool dishes going to other tables. Definitely going back to explore more of their menu!
author: Christian M.

description:
I'm glad I stumbled on this place via Yelp. I like Mama's a lot, but I wanted to try a different spot for breakfast that didn't require waiting in a line for 30+ minutes. 
Was able to be seated right away in this cute, tiny establishment 'cause there was just me and the boyfriend. Décor is cute with it's French theme going on, which included the background music. 
The service was friendly and fast as well. Don't know if it's because of the size of the place or their staff just work that well together, but it was cool to see another establishment that got you to interact with more than 1 server. They also checked on us several times during our meal, and it wasn't just to make sure that my coffee was topped off/kept warm.
I ordered their Zucchini Pancake, and the boyfriend had their Corned Beef. Oh my gah... I couldn't decide which dish was better. If I didn't use my pancake syrup, it went well just as a savory dish with an over-easy egg. It sounds like an awkward pairing - syrup and zucchini, but it's not! You gotta try it! As for my boyfriend's Corned Beef, it's one of the best interpretations I have ever had of the dish! Definitely not out of the can with more than just seasoned potatoes on the side!
I definitely want to come back here on my next San Francisco trip!
author: Agnes S.

description: Food was very good. Not served hot, but lukewarm. We all still enjoyed it. Had to ask for more drinks, so I gave it 4 stars instead of 5. Corned beef hash and poached eggs were great!
author: Kelly M.

description: I don't believe the hype. I had the crab-cake benedict, only the lack of quality was memorable so I don't remember if it had a ridiculous name or not.. The sauce was terrible and nothing tasted very fresh. The service is impersonal and they don't speak well. I suppose my expectations were high given that this is a popular spot in a city with lots of exquisite dining options, but I'm not sure San Franciscans really know a good brunch when they see one! I prefer Peter D's, which does not use quality ingredients but at least their food tastes good, for example the eggs benedict consistently has a fuller and richer flavor. For whatever reason, restaurants like these can't beat small-town diners owned by provincial couples who settle you in as if it's your relative's home. There are a few similar brunch spots to Mymy's, and it definitely works but personally I'm not a fan of this SF brunch restaurant formula of servers with poor communication skills, somewhat attractive dishes, and mediocre quality. In short, the best reason to come here would be to take an Instagram picture so it seems like you're eating good food!
author: Nan P.

description: We came here on a Tuesday morning.  We were the first ones. I was really excited to try some of the food from the pics that I saw on yelp.  I ordered some hash browns.  Waiter said  they were out. How can you be out of hash browns first thing in the morning?!?! So I ordered the potatoes.  They were really really really crispy.  Burnt most of the potatoes.  They had no flavor.  My wife had the SF scramble.  She was highly disappointed. No flavor as well. Coffee was flavorless too.  The waiter never checked on us. This place is awful!!
author: Eric G.

description:
20-25 minute wait for a table of 2 on a Monday. (Not an issue, restaurant is on the smaller side)

Moments after being seated someone came to place our drink order. 

Another 10+ minutes of waiting and trying to make eye contact before we placed our actual food order & the waitress was about to take the order for the table who was seated after us.

25 minutes until our food arrived & 2 tables of 2 who were seated AFTER us, received their food already. The table of 3 that was seated a couple minutes before us already finished their meal and left. (We actually placed our drink orders at the same time as them)

My friend and I both ordered the Norwegian Benediction. His came with a slice of orange, mine came with hash browns on the rim of my plate and no orange slice. Also, I tried to move the plate closer to me & the bottom of the rim of the plate was super greasy. 

My Norwegian Benedict was not bad. The bread that they use for the Benedict is a little on the harder side so it was difficult to cut with the knife they provided. Hash browns were nice and crispy. However, I really wanted the shrimp crab cake Benedict but they had sold out. 

I did enjoy the fresh-squeezed orange juice. That was refreshing.

Overall, the service here was lack-luster and quite disappointing. While sitting and waiting for our food, I noticed that the waitress and waiters completely ignored a couple tables to my left and right. Towards the end of my meal, there was a table that was seated next to me on the right & they waited a while before they were able to flag anyone down because the waiters and waitress were not looking our way. (Not sure if they are short staffed with 3 people waiting tables or if they are just unaware) 

We did receive our check fairly quick though.

The food was not bad, service was basically nonexistent, & the space is small but cozy.
author: Rebecca T.

description:
Food is a four stars.. But service is a dismal two stars.. Loads of attitude.. Maybe because I am Asian.. I see them treating all of the other Caucasians customers with better attitude and service.

Also, we were the only table not given water.  We asked another server if a takeout order of scramble eggs salsa verde sauce could be placed in a container for takeout so it would not be soaked through when we got to the airport. The server said in a sour attitude, "We don't have containers". I mean really, you are a restaurant and you don't have containers for your sauce at 8am in the mornings?

We were very surprised to feel the New York attitude in the sunshine state.

As for the food.. The blueberry soufflé pancake is a very unique and tasty choice. Although my husband feel that it was too mushy. 

Overall, I would not go back there since there are a lot more even better breakfast options within close proximity like Mama's and Dotties true blue Cafe.
author: Min H.

description: Really enjoyed the breakfast we had here. Decent price, great service and moderate waiting time of about 20 minutes on a Sunday at 11am for a group of six. I had the Italian egg benedict with parma ham and fruits and it was fantastic. Definitely recommend going there.
author: Martin K.

description: Very flavorful food! You sign your own name in and wait about 30 mins for 2 on a Sunday at 1130. Lots of eggs Benedict choices. Avacado on anything is fresh and delicious. Small inside but worth it. Very good brunch!
author: Dane D.

description:
Ahh brunch. I love it yet I am so lazy most weekends to deal with getting up early and waiting for an insanely long time.
 
Yes, this place still has a wait and is a tinier space than some other brunch places, but it is so worth it. Obviously if you're in a group of four or more the wait is gonna be a while (standard), but with two people you're seated relatively quickly. We waited about 15 minutes before being seated. They also took our orders and came out with them very quickly. 

Both times I've been here I've ordered one of their benedicts. They are so delicious! I've tried their original which you can't go wrong with. It comes with a side of hash browns or you can substitute it with fresh fruit for $1.50. This time I decided to try the parma benedict which consists of prosciutto, mozzarella, asparagus, basil, and tomato. I was afraid it might be too salty, but that wasn't the case. It was so good! Definitely recommend trying this one if you're a fan of eggs benedict. 

What I also love about this place is that on top of the hash browns being a good side choice the fresh fruit is a LEGIT fruit side. It comes in a bowl filled with oranges, melon, strawberries, blueberries, grapes, blackberries, and bananas. See what I mean? I hate when you get a side of fruit and it's just a lackluster cup of melons and grapes. So being the type of person that likes to eat a little bit of everything I usually order the eggs benedict with the regular side of hash browns and then just get a bowl of fruit also. 

So the food is amazing + service is friendly + orders come out fairly quickly + wait time isn't horrible even on weekends = 5 stars all around!
author: Jenny C.

description: Tried Mymy for brunch on Sunday.  We signed in at the clipboard they have hanging right outside the door and in about 10 minutes were seated at the counter.  It's tiny inside and by the time we left, there were a lot of people waiting to get seated.  The corned beef hash was good, but a little too salty.  It took a little while to get our meal, but all in all, not too bad.  Service was very good considering how busy it was/can get.  So 4 stars because I just don't think it's worth the wait.
author: Susie K.

description: Solid breakfast spot. Line was 15 mins. Get the Norwegian and some coffee, can't go wrong.
author: Noah P.

description:
Mr. Chow is in San Francisco and works at MyMy. You get "special yell treatment" for such infractions as: being confused by the menu, asking questions, not being completely ready to order when Mr Chow decrees you should be. One violation that commonly incurs the wrath of Chow is crossing the threshold before admission is granted. 

 The rules are simple and if you abide by them, Chow will unleash to your palate all earthly delights. 

Chow is the only person (aside from my good, lady wife) who can prepare eggs the way I enjoy them.
author: Alex B.

description: We walked in and the place was busy but not slammed. We ordered breakfast... Now we do have food limitations and that is a challenge for eating out... Not sure I agree with how this was handled. Ordered the basic breakfast just omitting eggs... Not allowed to do that so for being allergic to eggs we need to pay extra per person because they have to "make" it ala carte. I know it is common, but it still makes no sense. Also the "hash browns" were paper thin... Like you could hold them up and they were one layer thin. Almost translucent.
author: E O.

description: I was excited to try their lemon souffle pancakes but sorely disappointed. This is basically a thin layer of egg white omlette on the bottom while they spooned the pancake on the top. Kinda gross in fact. Souffle meant that they should've incorporated the egg whites beaten to a peak into the pancake batter and then cooked them. This definitely was disappointing. Good thing I ordered their side of hash browns and bacon. The has browns were amazinnngggg and exactly how hash browns should always be. Crispy and buttery and oh so goooooodddd. My mom loved their crab cake benedict.
author: Eling H.

description: Brunch is really important to start a good relaxing weekend that's why we decided to try MYMY! We had some Italian Benedict and BLT. The food was ok, nothing special but the service was bad! The waitress were rude and rushing us to order, even when we had to leave, they didn't let us finish our meal, there are definitely better places around there!
author: Irina P.

description:
So worth the long wait for 2. Make sure you sign up!

The service was just stellar. Even though the place a hoppin busy, the staff are still smiling and cheery. This adds nicely to a Father's Day brekkie. 

We ordered benes, so so yum!!!

Make sure you keep your jacket on, the doors are left open and can be breezy. If you're close to the door, wolf down your brekkie before it gets cold. 

I don't think they had endless mimosas cuz we left as soon as we were done.
author: Spooky E.

description: Really enjoyed the breakfast. Good sized portions. Nice neighborhood find , but very small space. Long wait if you don't go early.
author: Andrea F.

description:
I'm sorry Mymy Coffee shop, I really wanted to like you, I swear.

If you're going to have a brunch spot right across another brunch spot you have to differentiate yourself from it. 

i.e. if your shop is going to serve banana pancakes, please don't have bananas on top of the pancakes but rather inside the pancake itself- trust me, this brings it to another level!
author: C M.

description:
I have many bizarre ways of deciding what to eat on my meals. While listening to and shuffling my music on my Pandora's Radio, I was listening the R & B smooth sounds of Johnny Gill. And that tune has got me saying: 

"My, My, My, My, My, My...sure sounds good today" (for lunch)!

Only been open for a few months, the corner café took over the Front Room pizzeria. And for some apparent reason the café looks smaller with limited seating and longer wait than the old pizzeria. 

Amazingly, the wait wasn't long and I was seated within minutes, I ordered the Teriyaki Chicken Sandwich. For $9.00, I get a grilled chicken breast covered in a teriyaki sauce, melted cheese, and mixed vegetables and condiments in a toasted roll. I also get a small batch of fries with my sandwich. The sandwich tasted good with the tangy sauce and a unique taste. 

The service was good. I get what I needed without any delay. I used my Visa for my lunch!

As I was leaving (turning on my Ipod Touch);

"You got me saying, My, My, My, My, My, My...sure looks good tonight"

"And I'm sure damn fine!"
author: Matt G.

description: Very good brunch food! Crab cake and salmon egg Benedict and soufflé pancakes are my favorites!
author: Monnikka M.

description: Got the Tex Mex Scramble and the Lemon Ricotta Soufflé Pancakes and both were absolutely divine! I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a wonderful brunch! We wrote our names on a list and walked around for a bit, then came back about 30 min later and were seated. Definitely recommended!
author: Diana F.

description:
This was the third time I went to mymy, and differently from the first two times, this one was really bad.
I ordered the smoked salmon egg Benedict, and it was so salty that it was almost impossible to eat. My boyfriend ordered the Italian omelet, and the tomato sauce was super souer. I don't know if the cook was different, but it was a bad experience.
author: Ana Carolina J.

description: The waitress brought me the wrong dish and then criticized me publicly as if I had made the mistake.  She did this not once, but twice.  First she insisted that I ordered the first dish.  I told her I had not, but did not even request replacement, simply bringing me a side dish with the ingredients that were missing from my dish (specifically lox).  Eventually she brought me two small pieces of lox, but when she did, she again criticized me saying that I have to be sure to accept what I was given next time.  She did this loudly in front of the entire restaurant.  Certainly not what I consider quality or even reasonable service.
author: Marc M.

description:
The most difficult decision on my Saturday morning was choosing between sweet and savory. Luckily, I had a good while to decide since there's quite a robust line in front of Mymy at all times.

People tend to give up after seeing the 8 other names before theirs so if you're resilient, you should be be seated within half an hour. 

I've heard the hashbrowns are somethin' special but after a week of carbscarbscarbs, I went with a side of fruit and was pleasantly surprised! It was a sizable bowl with berries, oranges, and other fun, fresh fruits not typically seen in a "side of fruit" 

I went with the benedict served on a sweet potato mash and MY GAWD, the flavors worked together SO well! I can still recall the eggs running over the perfectly grilled zucchini and eggplant...

The coffee was also JUST right and the mimosa quality depended on who made it for you (one of the servers was noticeably stingy with the alcohol part of the mimosa).

I think I'm coming back tomorrow.
author: Furai X.

description:
I luv this l'il café in Nob Hill. The food is great. Beautiful presentation. Cozy atmosphere. 

Try the bottomless mimosa (orange/grapefruit) & bloody mary's. The only problem I've encountered so far is product consistency. Don't advertise a product and can't consistently deliver it!!!!!!  ... ijs
author: hans simon f.

description: My husband and I came into Mymy's for breakfast on a Monday morning about 9am. We had no wait and were seated at a nice window 2-top right away. The menu has so cool options including a Soju Bloody Mary (we didn't try this time) I chose the Harvest Scramble and my husband went with the Tex Mex Scramble. Both our meals came out super fast and steaming hot! No cold eggs or chilled toast. My scramble was delicious with awesome flavor (no hot sauce needed) and my husbands scramble was the same topped with fresh avocado, yummy sauce and accompanied with warm corn tortillas. All in all service was awesome, food was delicious and atmosphere was pleasant. Thank you Mymy's for a wonderful meal!
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Another place that I haven't reviewed the first couple of times I've gone, but luckily, I've come back this morning for another heavenly brunch. Take note - while Olea is closed, Mymy will tend to have an even longer wait. However, we got in at around 9am and were seated right away. Probably too early for the normal brunch crowd. Eh. If you have a large party, expect to wait no less than 30 minutes, because the place is tiny. The waitresses are very efficient and excellent - I love this place because it is absolutely *not* a sit-down-and-talk-for-hours place, meaning you will be able to get in, get out, and have the next party seated with no problem. They know what's up.

Every time I come here, I think, "Okay, so can I get away with ordering two entrees?" And the thing is, I can, but it would be the worst idea in the world, because one platter is absolutely enough to make you full, happy, and not overly regretful. We brought our friends over for this one - one of them had been before, and the other did not know what joy and beauty to expect.

The thing is, my go-to here is the 6hr corned beef hash. Bless this plate. I get that bad boy with hashbrowns, sourdough toast, and my eggs scrambled, because I am allergic to uncooked egg yolk minus the lemon dill sauce (which sadly invalidates their whole gorgeous "benediction" menu for me). I unfortunately found out the thing that made me sick was the lemon dill sauce, because the reason it's so creamy and delicious and wonderful is because it's a mayo-based product. Damn you, allergies, keeping me away from delicious food! As usual, it was delicious. No other corned beef hash compares to theirs, and their normal hashbrowns are just perfect. Crispy all around and the corned beef isn't overly salted like most others. I don't usually like my corned beef in actual beef-and-not-ground form, but if it's done right, none of that matters. None of it. Because I'm too lost in happy corned beef goodness.

It's also a plus that this is the one restaurant that doesn't accidentally think and assume that my boyfriend ordered the corned beef hash. He always gets the sweet stuff, like French toast, and inevitably a waitress will think I'm too ~feminine~ to have corned beef. Or something. I don't know. But Mymy doesn't do that, bless them.

Our friends ordered a standard egg plate and the lemon ricotta pancakes. Once I cleared my plate of heavenly corned beef, I was able to say, "All right, y'all. Who needs help?" which netted me some ridiculously tasty lemon ricotta pancakes. The thing about having perfect corned beef hash is that I am hesitant to order anything else on the menu. But, having morsels of everyone else's dish with permission, I can definitely say that everything is straight up tasty and well worth your time.

Mymy, I will come back to you when I feel like I can wake up early enough again. Folks eating there - do everyone else a favor and don't dawdle after your bill is paid. Give someone else their shining beacon of brunch perfection. Contraband Coffee is just around the corner, which is a good place to stop - or you can meander through You Say Tomato, the little store that sells UK imported foods like UK Milky Ways, Ribena, and other delicious things.
author: Robbin A.

description:
We came here for the first time. we loved the place. the food was fabulous and Nice staff 

A bit expensive but Perfect breakfast !!
author: Marie P.

description:
Just amazing. 

We're visiting from London and looking for a great breakfast place. We'd been to few good places, but Mymy was exactly what we were after; great food, service, nice decor and background music. We didn't have to wait too long even at 10am on a Sunday. Hoping to go back tmw for more Benedicts and French Toast.
author: Ian C.

description:
Walked by here yesterday and noticed the menu. Decided to check Yelp & now that I've eaten here, I'll have to agree with the majority of the other reviews; great food!
I had the Spicy pop Pork scramble, and it was delish! Will definitely eat here again next time I'm in town. Can't wait to try other items on the menu!
author: Paul C.

description:
Oh MyMy. Oh, so good. 
Staying at the Fairmont, this is super close. We just grabbed breakfast here and must come back tomorrow because everything looked so good! 

I got the pop pork scramble (pulled pork, eggs, salsa verde). So fresh and d'lish. The corned beef hash was equally good.

Coffee was solid and fair prices. Service on a weekday morning was right on.
author: R C.

description: I had the crab cakes benedict and the meal was served ice cold. The hash browns were very greasy and hard as a rock. The service was bad so I could not find a server to send it back to have it reheated. Hours later I became very ill with symptoms one gets from food poisoning. I will not be returning.
author: Linda B.

description: Food was delicious! Serving size was generous! Found this place based on the yelp reviews and was happy we came!! We had the tex-mex scramble which had a slight kick but was awesome! I'd def. have it again!! We also had the French toast which was equally as delicious!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
MyMy is definitely a friendly place to take your significant other. If you have one.  But on the other hand, the coffee is so so.  I put four packets of sugar in my coffee.  No wonder the refills were free.  


The food I ordered sounded good.  Tex mex scramble and French toast baby!!! Let's goooooo! I needed this breakfast as you can see!
author: Brent M.

description: I came here for lunch, and I'm so glad you can still order breakfast food at this time! I went for the 6 hours corned beef hash and fresh squeezed orange juice. The corned beef wasn't really a hash. It was more like chunks of corned beef with potato cubes. It was good, but it's something my mom makes every St. Patrick's Day. The potatoes were very hard, though. My meal came with potato wedges and toast, which were good. And the orange juice was really fresh and delicious.
author: Rachel H.

description:
Big Tip to everyone who's reading this: any party bigger than 2 will be delayed a lot more (about 10-30 minutes more delay)

For those who are concerned about water... It's tap water

Even after the 1 hour wait, the food was absolutely fantastic. My family got the Florentine Benedict, egg tartine, lemon dill crab shrimp cake, salmon rotolone tartine

Except for the egg tartine (which was so-so), everything else were beyond what we expected. The hash browns were crisp and warm, the sauce on lemon crab cake was amazing, and the salmon tartine was flavorful. 

4/5 since the wait time and the subpar service (they seem to be busy and preoccupied rather than serving the customers) but hey, the food still tastes great.
author: ShungHeon C.

description: Best corn beef hash ever!  Italian mambo scramble was awesome. The crispy potatoes are a nice change from normal breakfast potatoes. Get there early as it fills up fast.
author: Bill B.

description:
My boyfriend and I were looking for somewhere to have brunch before my commencement, we decided to check this place out after looking at yelp pics! They have you write your own name down, which I think a lot of people miss. The place is quite small, we were running short on time and were nervous we wouldn't get seated. Luckily, we did! There were so many great options to choose from I couldn't decide! 

I can't remember exactly the name of what I got but I think it is the lemon dill shrimp crab cakes benedict. It was just perfect and sooo delicious! It was like little expensive, but understandable for crab cakes. I also loved the hashbrowns are the side, just perfectly cooked, not too crispy. My boyfriend got an omelet that had these really good sausages in it. I also got a guava mimosa to enjoy. Extremely satisfied with our meal and the service. 

I can't wait to come back, I look forward to trying the potato and rosemary Irish pancakes with bacon. YUMMM
author: Nisouri S.

description: Food came out quick and was pretty good. Service was poor -- servers did not check in with us, and they were unable to provide separate checks to each member of our party of four, instead forcing us to split it evenly.
author: Kia E.

description:
Teeny tiny spot that is easy to miss If I wasn't specifically hunting for it, I would have probably missed it. It wasn't fantastic but it wasn't too bad either.

I was craving some hashbrowns and found this place on yelp and had to try it. It was pretty good but what the 3 stars is really for is their fresh squeezed orange juice. I love orange juice and was super stoked for it but it was so bitter I couldn't even drink it. I'm not one to speak up when it comes to bad food and just won't eat it but I also expect the waiter to kind of notice that it's untouched...
author: Leina K.

description: Cozy little place in Nob Hill. Busy on a Saturday morning, which is always a good sign. Lots to like here with various breakfast and brunch options that look and taste delicious. Worth a visit. Bring your appetite!
author: Dane R.

description: food was pretty average.  typical pancakes and breakfast. what turn me off is their auto included tips and the lack of information in their receipts.  Almost everything was listed as just "item". Also the waiters seem to be rushing you out the restaurant with their constant tries of taking away your plates.
author: P W.

description: My wife just broke her gluten free diet by having the challah French toast here. Absolutely divine! Best brunch we've had in a long time!
author: Eric K.

description:
We stopped here when Dottie's True Blue Cafe was unexpectedly closed due to an unforeseen emergency . A quick yelp search lead us here.

Wait: well they run a tight ship here. You right your name down on a wait list. There are rules and instructions posted to the left. 1 write your name down and whether or not your entire party is present. If your name is called and you aren't there, you are skipped and the list starts again from the beginning. Cold world. This does happen so don't go far. She yells your name twice and moves on. Interesting thing after asking a multiple of times, the hostess/ servers will not give you an approximation of the wait time. They answered identically. This may be a good business trick or very frustrating. Either way arriving around 10am on a Sunday, I'd estimate a 45 minute wait. It did move relatively fast as there were many parties of 2. Our food took forever to come. One patron told us to hang in there and couldn't believe we hadn't ate yet, clearly we sat down at the same time and he and his guest finished  and paid their bill. It took 30 minutes to get our food!! Not cool. 

Food: nothing to rave about in my opinion maybe it's what we ordered. Vanilla sponge  French toast was ok and nothing special. My lemon ricotta soufflé pancakes didn't really have a hint of lemon. It's more like a meringue inside a pancake. I definitely tasted the egg whites. It did create a very light pancake but it wasn't that good. Unimpressed. The crab cake was very good how wee. I wished I had more  and it was larger. Is try the crab Benedict next time. We ended up spending $40. 

Verdict: not worth the wait
author: Devin T.

description: Their 2 egg breakfast is the best.  I get it with chicken apple sausage (best I've had).  Their hash browns are super thin and crispy and taste delicious.  Not greasy at all.  Service is quick too.
author: David S.

description: They nicely sat us right 10 mins b4 closing.  I had the chicken club & my mom had the eggs Benedict florentine and both dishes were excellent. Thin, crispy hash browns Yummm!!
author: Hannah B.

description: Great small brunch place but be prepared for the wait (we waited about an hour on Saturday around 11am). We had the blueberry banana pancakes and the Norwegian eggs Benedict. The pancakes were so fluffy and light! Coffee drinks were great too.
author: Shabnam E.

description:
Double-date brunch on Sunday. There was a wait, probably about 30 minutes - this restaurant is very small. Put your name on the clipboard list and stand around. They are serious about not asking them for timing (just read the sign posted next to the clipboard!) and also they will only call your name twice before they mark you as a no show and move on to the next name.

I ordered the roasty burger which had yummy pesto, roasted red peppers, and my favorite: gruyere cheese. To offset that I got it with a salad instead of fries which was a mistake. Just embrace your inner fatty and get the fries. They are delicious.

Others got the griddle burger, tex mex omelette, and BLT eggs benedict. Everyone was raving about the food. 

We also had mimosas which weren't a steal at $7 but were extremely tasty (I had the grapefruit). 

Service was a bit of a downer - we ran out of water and no one ever came by to refill it. But otherwise a very good experience. Would definitely return.
author: Rachel E.

description: Went here on Wednesday morning around 9:30. The staff was not friendly or accommodating. My friend and I wanted to sit outside with my son who is 1 year old. The servers explained they could not put a high chair outside since the table is too high. So I held my son in my lap through out my meal. The food is mediocre and over priced. We felt rushed since the server kept coming back asking if we were ready to order. We were there not at a busy time yet felt like they just wanted to get rid of us. I pass by this place every weekend and a line is formed on the side walk. DO NOT bother! Totally not worth it. Instead, go to Contraband coffee next door. The food is way better and of course the coffee is too. Shame on you Mymy, you need to accommodate families much better!!! Never again.
author: Nicole W.

description:
Hot diggity dog, this place is delicioso for breakfast. I've been twice and both times myself and my man have walked away comfortably fed and raving about the dishes we ordered. Today it was the Smoked Salmon Rotolone Tartine and the Tex Mex Scramble. Last time it was the Chive Potato Pancake With Crispy Crumbled Bacon & Gorgonzola and the Chorizo Jalapeno Tartine. I mean, how good do these things sound!!!  Next time I'm going sweet - lemon ricotta souffle pancake the whole way! 
Added plus - its cheap for such an amazing brunch and they serve alcohol if you want a breakfast cocktail
author: Sally S.

description: This small cafe has it all! The food was absolutely mouth watering!! I will definitely be back.
author: Jose G.

description:
Delicious food and amazing hash browns! 
Small area so probably not a good idea to go with large groups! The wait is much longer on the weekends
author: meli f.

description:
The Eggs Benedict at this place is legit!

Come early b/c it gets packed quickly in the morning.

Really reasonable price for what you get
author: Alec H.

description:
They're pancakes and eggs are so fluffy that I couldn't shut up about them during my meal.  I tried the lemon ricotta pancakes while my friend had the 2 eggs breakfast.  I might've also sampled the soju bloody mary....

As I mentioned the pancakes and eggs were ridiculously fluffy.  Other than the pancakes we didn't try any signature dishes, so I can't speak for the rest of the menu.  The soju bloody mary wasn't bad and had a spicy kick, but I prefer mine to have a bit more horseradish to them. 

The service was prompt and friendly after the 30+ min wait.  Please note that they have some guidelines (clearly posted about the waitlist) when it comes to waiting for a table to ensure that only parties that are present are seated.  Since the waitlist was fairly long when I arrived I skipped over to Mr. Holmes Bakeshop a couple blocks down to pick up some goodies.
author: Kellyn W.

description: AWESOME RESTAURANT FOR BRUNCH! SERVES WAS GREAT AND THE FOOD WAS AMAZING! I was a little sceptic about the place until I actually ate here and the reviews are not even as good as it is in real life! You have to eat here at least once while visiting our amazing city! You will wish you could cook as good!
author: Victoria S.

description: Shared the lemon ricotta pancakes, parma benedict, and a side of sourdough (so that I could try the homemade jam!). The lemon ricotta pancakes were really good, fluffy, unique. Some of the better pancakes I've had. Definitely stole the show. Parma benedict was slightly disappointing, given how many people talked about it on yelp. It was still good, but a bit unbalanced flavor wise...could have used more salt maybe? (i.e. mozzarella). The toast was a bit burnt, but the homemade strawberry jam was yum. Service was overall good and we went on a Monday morning at 11:00am so we were seated rather quickly. Overall recommend.
author: Will H.

description: Stopped by for breakfast on a trip to SF.  The lines can be a little long, but it moves fast.  Best eggs Benedict I've had in a long time.  Pancakes looked great too.  Service was fast and friendly.  Will definitely go back next time we're in SF.
author: Robert S.

description:
This place is f*cking amazing. All I can say is the Souffle pancakes are so insanely good I shed a tear. 

The line on weekends is terrible but it's there for a reason. 

Pro tip: Go on weekdays for brunch or get there before 9am on weekends.
author: Michelle A.

description:
San Francisco has followed the brunch trend religiously, but the best spots seem to be the more low-key ones that aren't over-hyped. Mymy is located in the heart of Nob Hill, and the line on the weekends is more likely to be locals, rather than the tourists who flock to the usual Dottie's and Mama's. 

I ordered the eggs tartine, which had a fluffy egg whites scrambled with bacon on top of a slice of bread and slathered with a tomato sauce and parmesan. The portion was extremely generous, and although the sauce made the bread slightly soggy, I didn't ind in the least as the flavors came together perfectly. My favorite dish by far were the blueberry banana souffle pancakes. These pancakes are some of the most perfect pancakes I've ever had. The mascarpone added the airiness, but it still kept the doughiness that you look for in a pancake. My boyfriend had the corned beef hash, which was on the smaller side, but everything was perfectly cooked. Not to mention, both the hash browns and the potato wedges are amazing, so be sure to try both. Mymy has set the bar high as my new favorite brunch spot in the city!
author: Ashley T.

description:
Pacifica eggs benedict = one of the best eggs "Benedicts" I've ever had. Though typical eggs benedict comes with canadian bacon, this one had copious amounts of shrimp and was topped with a spicy hollandaise sauce. Once I popped the yolk of my poached egg, swirled everything around, and took a bite, it felt like a party in my mouth. Amazing!!

The spicy pork scramble was a little disappointing. The pork wasn't as flavorful as I would have liked, and was a little on the dry side. That's not to say I didn't enjoy the dish though... just had super high expectations after the benedict!

Come for brunch, brave the wait, and order orange juice and grapefruit juice mimosas. You won't regret it!
author: Michelle L.

description:
Perfect Breakfast and Lunch place. Nice outdoor seating. I recommend the eggs benedict (different styles), they are to die for!

Starts to get really busy around 9:30am.
author: Frank E.

description: I had the best French Toast of my life here. It was so delicious. My partner had the sausage burger and also loved his meal. I loved the fresh fruit with my French toast and the roasted potatoes my partner had. Best breakfast place around.
author: Jenna W.

description: Such a delicious brunch! Absolutely loved it. I had the lemon dill crab shrimp cake Benedict and my husband had the lemon soufflé pancakes. Just awesome. Great hash browns with the Benedict, too. :)
author: Sarah B.

description:
I was here this morning for the 1st time, and the menu and food reminded me of Griddle fresh in Noe Valley - one of my new favs , in common were the souffle pancakes, the super thin has browns, the long cooked corned beef hash -  and yep - sure enoughI googled it after I got home and they ARE related. Fantastic news b/c this place is much closer to my house.

I ordered wrong, I am having a meat-free week, and I was craving meat (of course) I had the pan perdu - it was a little dry, my bf got an omelet with all veggies and pesto and pine nuts and olives - it was too much flavor for me this morning - but man those hash brown were DIVINE.

I want to go back immediately (after the end of meat -free week) and try this place again, I bet I can get them to 5 stars.

Yahoo another great b'fast discovery in SF!
author: Amy W.

description: Came here as recommended by my friend and boy was it BOMB! I was here on a Monday so there was not a wait. Not sure how it is on weekends. I had the banana blueberry souffle pancakes and its one of the best I've had. Super fluffy, moist and made to perfection and I loved that the plate was just as pretty! I love seeing that the looks of my plate was just as bomb as it tasted! Def a must come for brunch!!
author: Ellen C.

description:
Oh My!

   This place is better than it looks from the outside for sure.  The food creations are hip, relevant and delicious.  I recommend their lemon ricotta pancakes.  All of the fruit that came in our dishes was fresh and sweet.

   The interior is modern and nice and the cafe sits along the cable car line.  The only issue I had with the cafe is the staff.  I won't go so far as saying they are not friendly but they really aren't all that friendly.  Let's put it this way, this cafe could be the best in the city of the staff was more personable and out going.  It is the only way I can describe it.  Will I be back?  I will :)
author: Brian S.

description: Amazing!! It was our second time here, and we weren't disappointed! Must try the tex mex scramble, and the banana blueberry pancakes, and the eggs Benedict. Oh and their hot chocolate is so rich and creamy!! Be prepared to wait, but it's so worth it! :)
author: Sarah S.

description: My my my! Breakfast is good here! You'll see the line, but don't worry, it moves pretty fast. And the line is there because it's worth the wait! The pancakes, eggs benedicts, omelettes - everything is GREAT. I'm not even going to spend too much time on this review, because it seems everyone else has said it already. My My is breakfast satisfaction guaranteed!
author: T P.

description: It was my first time visiting San Francisco and I had just flown in in time for brunch. I walked from the financial district to MyMy and I don't regret it one bit. The pancakes were absolutely delicious and the mimosa was great. I ordered lemon ricotta pancakes with a side of eggs over medium. They cooked them perfectly! I can't wait to come here when I come back with family.
author: Monique R.

description: The line was a bit long but moved fast. The service was okay, the server never came back to make sure that I needed more coffee (when I did). The food was delicious, I ordered the Tex mex scramble and it was pretty amazing. The tortillas were okay not the best but they did the job. The coffee was good too.
author: Alejandra M.

description:
I've been wanting to eat here as there is always a long line for breakfast. My friends and I finally were able to try it today. We arrived at 8am and were the first ones there. We ordered OJs, coffees, two Frisco scrambles, Tex next scramble and eggs. The hash browns were a thin layer of shredded potatoes, nice and crispy. Only my friend who ordered the basic egg dish enjoyed her meal. The rest of us barely ate our meals. My Frisco scramble had little pieces of chicken Apple sausage that were not tasty. It seemed to make my entire dish sweet which I didn't like. The stringy onions cooked in the dish was a strange ingr. I always bring home leftovers and didn't even want a to go box. 

My three friends were from out of town and I was embarrassed recommending this place.

I won't be coming back here again.
author: Marianne W.

description:
Had 3 more dishes today:
Spicy chorizo tartine: delicious 
Lemon ricotta pancakes: with fresh fruit! Yummmm
Shrimp benedict: delicious 

Came at 9:30 for 3, and only waited maybe 15 minutes. Pays to get up early!
author: Jeanne C.

description: Surprisingly our wait wasn't too long (we got there around 9:30 am).  This was one of the few options open that early.   I ordered the mambo Italiano egg scramble with hash browns and my boyfriend got some gruyere/cheese/egg dish and we were both happy.  The place seems it could be a dive but the food is actually really good.   Nice to find another good brunch place!
author: Vivian W.

description:
In San Francisco for the weekend and stopped at Mymy. The table order various items on the menu. I had the 6hrs. Corned Beef hash and it was delicious. Great flavor and the sauce was really good. 

We tried Parma Benedict and the BLT Benedict and the Blueberry Banana hot cakes.  All really tasty. 

The service is adequate. They don't go out of their way but who cares when the food is great. 

Will be coming back.
author: Edgar D.

description: We stumbled upon this place and it was amazing! Highly recommended. Service was fast and efficient and the food was incredible! Stop in and enjoy!
author: Courtney K.

description: Fabulous!!! Delicious food, friendly staff, fast service but not rushed. Everyone loved their meal. French toast and homestyle potatoes were exceptional! Grapefruit mimosas were a nice twist. We will definitely be back, maybe tomorrow!!!
author: Kim R.

description:
1. The Asian lady with obviously dyed hair who is in charge is a total b***h. She is rude to the customers outside, waiting in line as well as once they are inside. Avoid talking to her if you can, otherwise you're gonna get a lot of sas.
2. Today we found hair in our food, a long piece of hair that was not even on top, but tucked in between a sausage patty. It was probably hers. We called her over and she was unapologetic, did not offer to take the meal off the bill or to make us a new meal; instead, she plainly asked us what do we want her to do... and then she argued her way out of giving us anything for free. Again, all this without apologizing.
Stay away and if not, make sure to inspect your food when they bring it out!

We will never be going back!!

And to the owner: please let that lady know that there is such a thing as "customer service" and she doesn't belong there if she doesn't know how to deal with customers.
author: D H.

description: Short wait for 2 at 10AM on a Saturday. Great food. Good cappuccino. Had the Norwegian Benedict...highly recommend!
author: Leigh C.

description: Good food but nowhere near as good as Long Beach's Eggs Heaven still good tho go early seemed like lines start getting long after 830
author: Fat H.

description:
The food is AMAZING. The best hash browns EVER. 

My friends and I went in the afternoon on a sunny Friday and encountered a 10 minute wait which wasn't too bad. The hostess seated us outdoors. I highly recommend sitting outdoors for the meal. The indoors felt a bit stuffy the few times I went in for the restroom, given that it's a semi-open kitchen and it's firing at all times.

The waiters and waitresses were super friendly. 

When it came time to eat, I had the BLT Benediction (GREAT!) and the Blueberry Pancakes (FANTASTIC!). The Blueberry Pancakes are a MUST (and I'm fairly picky about my pancakes). They were fluffy, moist, and the right amount of sweet. My mouth is watering just writing about them. If you're going with friends, order them for the table!
author: Kelly Y.

description: I have this review in my draft for close to a year now. So when I decided to finish it today,  I realized I don't remember anything about the restaurant. I just had a single word in my draft review -  "Meh". And after I went back to the page for the restaurant to refresh my memory,  that was again the only word that came to me about my experience here. Not sure why absolutely everything in SF is rated 4 stars. This place is as meh as anything can be. The breakfast here is nothing great,  just a standard American breakfast that you can get if you point your car literally anywhere,  Drive for a hundred miles and pull into the closest breakfast joint,  only this place comes with cool labels like "organic" and "locally sourced" and of course,  great San Francisco prices! So,  to conclude, don't go here unless you're craving an average comfort breakfast.
author: Vineet K.

description:
This is a great little brunch spot in Nob Hill. It's not one of those that SF foodies mainly talk about online but it should be!
The waiting time for us was really short on a Saturday morning - you sign up on a list at the entrance and wait in a waiting area outside. For us not more than 10 minute. 
The food was great - I tried the Norwegian Eggs Benedict (delicious crunchy hash browns) and the lemon soufflé pancakes. The also do amazing drinks - big cups of cappuccinos and freshly squeezed fruit juices. Overall loved it and will be back soon!
One star missing for the not so 5 star cozy atmosphere
author: Larissa S.

description:
I went to this place last Sunday.
It was line but wasn't bad :) and the lady who organize the table, she is very cute!
I ordered pancake and hushed potato.
It was very very very good!!
I don't order very much sweet stuff at restaurant cos American sweets are TOO sweet to me but this place wasn't too sweet and wasn't heavy taste!
100% I back here when I go SF ;)
author: Yuki M.

description: Aside from the 45 minute wait for Sunday brunch, my experience at mymy was good. I had the ricotta pancakes which was tasty. What was really cool was the steal they offer with the carafe mimosa which we got 5 glasses for $18. The mimosa was good too. Again, the food was good, but would I wait 45 minutes again, probably not. Had the place been a little more spacious it would've made for a much better experience.
author: Mike W.

description: Best pancakes of my life- lemon soufflé pancakes Are to die for. The lattes are excellent and the eggs Benedict was so delicious. Nothing on their menu is common and everything we had at our table was insanely delicious. We came in around 8 30 on a Thursday morning- were seated right away and fantastic service. Great spot for breakfast.
author: Holley S.

description:
I don't go to restaurants with lines or long wait, but for Mymy I make an exception.

Been there twice, and was impressed by their food. It might be the best breakfast I've had, a celebration of flavor.

We've tried four different Eggs Benedict, all cooked to perfection: crab cake, Norwegian, Baja Cali, and Parma. The eggs were just right, the toast thin and crisp - delicious, sauces just awesome, and hash browns not like everywhere else, so crispy and flavorful.  

Strawberry and banana French toast was thick and fluffy, to die for. Blueberry soufflé pancakes are also so fluffy, light and just melt in your mouth.

Everything we tried, Mymy makes slightly different from typical breakfast items, just the way it should be. Thus, the line - but the wait is so worth it!
author: Stacy A.

description:
My daughter and I tried out this place twice, while we were visiting San Fran. We decided to try the blueberry soufflé, lemon soufflé, hash browns, eggs, and French toast. First off I can easily say these were the best hash brown I've ever had, that's pretty hard to accomplish because I honestly don't like Hash Browns. They were light and crispy and I can say they made me love hash browns, their hash browns. My daughter got the blueberry soufflé, which I thought was stupid because she hates blueberries with a passion. She ended up absolutely loving them, she didn't even need syrup. I tried them and they were absolutely flawless, they were amazing to say the least. 

The eggs were the best I ever had; they were exceptionally light and fluffy. The lemon soufflé was OK, my daughter got it the second day, and it really had no flavor at all. Just a hint of lemon, which wasn't all that great. You needed their syrup and to be honest their syrup is gross.  The French toast was great to say the least, it was made out of sponge cake which mad it extremely special. It had a light butterscotch drizzle, giving it enough of a sweetness to satisfy anyone's taste buds. It almost beat the Blueberry Soufflé pancakes, almost.

The reason I gave 4 stars is because of service. The service was awful, they were rude, and never came back to see if we needed anything. Customer Service is important in any business, and MyMy fails at that aspect.
author: Ann U.

description: Came here for breakfast for something different. It was great. The staff is really friendly and the food is different and really delicious. If your looking for a twist on the typical breakfast I would recommend this place!
author: Lauren S.

description:
Blah blah blah...AMAZING....blah blah blah....COZY....blah blah blah....Mmmmmmmmm. 

So rather than write a new review saying the same great things, I'll just say GO THERE, order ANYTHING....You're welcome!

What we ordered- Carafe of Mimosas, Lemon Ricotta Pancakes and Lemon Dill Crab/Shrimp Cake Benediction and a side of bacon- FANTASTIC (I wanted to lick my plate and the plate of my neighbors- who was a stranger but it was that good). 

Service felt genuinely warm and friendly...even as the staff was just walking around doing routine things (refilling sugar containers, water, etc) I just wanted to smile at them so I did...and they smiled back. 

I'm a tourist from the East Coast...I felt this west coast love and will be back as soon as I can hopefully on a weekday to avoid this crazy rush that has been mentioned.
author: Paula L.

description:
Pros: food is well crafted and delicious. Portion size is good. Had the crab cake benedict and corned beef hash and would order again. 

Cons: gave us a water glass that had a lip gloss stain on it, customer next to us wasn't provided with utensils when her food arrived, waitress made a fuss when we asked to be reseated from outside to inside (it got windy and cold even with the heat lamps on) even though there were two tables open and no other customers waiting.
author: Mary L.

description: The zucchini pancakes with ricotta cheese is to die for! If you have a sweet and savory craving, this dish is perfect.
author: Hilda A.

description: Vanilla blueberry banana pancakes were the best pancakes i have ever had. The french toast was flavorsome even without syrup.  The bloody Mary i had  was also excellent
author: Sergio T.

description:
Mymy is a quirky little brunch spot in Nob Hill, directly across the street from Olea. The decor inside is well... interesting. I came with two friends on a Saturday and noon and waited about 20-30 minutes. They seem to be strict about their wait list policy (everyone has to be present, you have to be present when your name is called), so read the policies listed in front of the list sheet.

- Spicy Pop Pork Scramble with Salsa Verde ($12): The pulled pork was adequately spiced and quite tender. Don't be afraid of the spice level in this plate.

- Lemon Ricotta Meringue Pancakes ($11.50): These are some of the fluffiest pancakes that I have ever had. The ricotta blends in so well with the pancake. Every bite was full of subtle lemony, soft goodness. This was, by far, my favorite plate.

- Chive Potato Pancake with Bacon & Gorgonzola ($12.50): I was relatively disappointed with these savory pancakes. I expected something quite unique and similar to Dutch-style savory pancakes, but they were actually a bit burnt and the flavors just did not jive well together.
author: Jessica F.

description:
Been here twice and both times have been pretty epic. 

The line/cluster outside always looks more daunting than it really is. I've never waited more than 20mins for a table on a Saturday. 

Lemon ricotta soufflé pancakes are really rather amazing and the crab cake benediction is also great. 

Come hungry (but not hangry). The service here is really great and the coffee is pretty decent too. Food has always been pretty quick to the table and we've never felt rushed out as is often the case at other places with a 9-3 service schedule. 

Oh and the hash browns!! Wow!
author: Nina N.

description: The line up is long and it will take 30-40 mins to get seated. Small place .. Service is just ok. The food was good but nothing to say I want to come back. I live close by so we walked over. Mehh don't know why there is a line.
author: Alison W.

description:
I have lived in San Francisco practically my entire life and am shocked that I have never been / heard of this yummy brunch spot! I came here this past Sunday morning with 2 others around 10AM. We put our names on the list and waited for about 35 minutes. There were tons of people waiting outside with us, so I knew that this place would be amazing (the restaurant across the street - olea - didn't have a wait at all, plus, there are tons of other breakfast/brunch spots around). 

When we were finally seated, we received service right away. Throughout our entire meal, the service was excellent - very friendly and nice staff! I ordered the zucchini pancakes with scrambled eggs and a coffee. I've never had nor heard of zucchini pancakes and absolutely loved them. A little bit of maple syrup was added to the top of the pancakes, giving them a nice sweet touch. My eggs were scrambled to perfection - very fluffy and delicious. 

The place is pretty small so it makes sense why there is a pretty long line. However, if you are not in a hurry and want to have a yummy breakfast / brunch, I would highly recommend coming here! The area is very cute and has tons of parking (metered) so you can easily walk around while waiting for your table!
author: Anastasia N.

description:
Soooo after seeing this in thrillist I was super excited to come here. I checked out the menu online and texted my friend and his sister to tell them we should go. 

We put our name down for 4, but they have a very strict policy for seating parties only when the whole party is here (totally fine). One of our friends was late so we told them we would just be for 3...she argued with us for 10 minutes and said she couldn't do it over and over, but finally gave in after we told her she could kick the 4th person out if he came and sat down. 

A 3 PERSON TABLE AND A 4 PERSON TABLE TAKES UP THE SAME AMOUNT OF SPACE. 

Once we were seated about EVERY 2 MINUTES a different server would come up to us and ask if we were ready to order. 

After being asked 5 times in 10 minutes the second our butts hit the seat the lady who was arguing with us asked "ok, like 5 minutes...10 minutes..." CHILL THE F**K OUT LADY WE JUST SAT DOWN.

Worst customer service I've ever experienced at a restaurant. Food was aight, nbd. Mimosas were average at best. Pancakes were good. 

Customer service is everything though.

1 STAR.

Note: the only redeeming quality was that the lady that took one of my empty plates.

Second note: she just took away our water carafe and we still have food on the table...so disregard the redeeming quality.
author: Steven B.

description: Awesome brunch spot! Food was delicious! I had the Lemon Ricotta Souffle. The pancakes were thick but lights and fluffy at the same time. I went late morning and it wasn't too busy but the service was a little slow. I'd definitely go back!
author: Danielle F.

description: Mymy offers an interesting menu, great food, and pretty but not pretentious presentation. The only possible negative was that they made very little attempt at service. They weren't rude or anything - they just made it clear that their objective is to feed you and then get you on the road, not to make new friends. Lines can get crazy long at peak times on the weekends, but we got a table with no problem around 1pm on a Sunday.
author: Allison P.

description: I really wanted to give this a 5 star BUT. We came in at 1:30, and at 2:10 they were already rushing us to finish because "they were closing" (closing time 2:30) , then we ordered a coffee and without asking, they gave it to us TO GO... beyond rude... This being said, the service was horrible. BUT, the food is really reaaaally good. I really enjoyed the lemon riccotta pancakes. Wish that we've had a better service experience.
author: Maria A.

description: Mind blowingly good. Didn't know what to expect seeing the reviews and pictures but their egg benefits were phenomenal. My number 2 favorite breakfast place ever
author: Kamran M.

description: Excellent breakfast/brunch spot! We had the crab cake eggs Benedict, six hour corned beef hash, and French toast - all of it was amazing!!! I have a sweet tooth so the French toast was probably my fav, but I truly enjoyed everything. The staff are nice, upbeat and quick. Thanks Mymy! :)
author: J T.

description:
This place has amazing food. They have very crispy hash browns. Also, they have the best and the most delicious Banana Blueberry Souffle Pancake - Vanilla Curd, Candied Walnut. these pancakes were so yummy. I was very satisfied with my food. I'm probably going back to eat some more of those pancakes and try something new.
the only negative thing was the wait. I had to  wait almost an hour to be seated and the service was OK I guess they were so busy at that time.
author: Yohana w.

description:
Items Selected:

Banana Blueberry Souffle Pancake - Vanilla Curd, Candied Walnut
Vanilla Sponge French Toast - Butterscotch Drizzle, Bananas, Strawberries, Blueberries

Featuring a surprisingly similar menu to breakfast on day one and interestingly located cattycorner to the awful Olea where I'd dined the year prior it was early Sunday morning when I entered mymy and seated quickly at the wallside counter a familiar order took shape.  Small in size with a semi-open kitchen where a young Asian line cook worked diligently firing plate after plate as the small staff attended to each guest's needs with a cheerful vibe it was seemingly seconds between dinging bells indicating 'order up' and starting with downy-soft pancakes sandwiching rich vanilla curd with decorative berry puree and candied nuts I swooned - a texture even lighter than those from Griddle Fresh with fruit flavors far more poignant enlivening every bite.  Moving next to French toast but this time eschewing the boule it was next the "vanilla sponge" that greeted my palate and although slightly more bready than I'd have preferred at its core the caramelized crackle of the golden exterior proved excellent while butterscotch sauce and fresh berries rendered maple syrup irrelevant.
author: Michael U.

description: Nice little joint, food was good, portions are way too large so prepare to box it. Good for a stopover fuel up in the city. Ambiance was ok, not my favorite but if that's not what you're into, there you have it then!
author: Juls C.

description:
This is my favorite brunch location in San Francisco. The lines are kind of long on the weekends but they do a great job getting everyone in an out efficiently without making you feel like you're being rushed or waiting too long. The wait for 2 is usually about 15 minutes and around 30 minutes if it's a particularly busy hour.

The service is wonderful. Everyone there is very attentive and food comes out fast. My favorite thing to order here are the banana blueberry souffle pancakes. They're so fluffy and filling but not too heavy for the stomach all at the same time! Their potato wedges are some of the best I've ever had! The food is really as good, if not even better, than they look (and these are some Instagram-worthy dishes).
author: Amber C.

description:
I've been meaning to write a review about this place for so long, but I ended up forgetting what this restaurant was called until this second. I LOVE the customer service here, as well as the food. The zucchini crusted pancakes were AMAZING! I forgot this other dish I got, but it had the word chipotle in it. I recommend this place to anyone! The service, food, and atmosphere is great for families/dates/friends :')

Also, remember there's a waiting list inside! You don't want to be standing around for no reason.
author: Trisha L.

description:
We were staying at the Payne Mansion down the street and we decided to walk here for breakfast. BEST DECISION EVER! This place is AMAZING! I haven't had breakfast this delicious in ages. 

Service was superb and everyone was very attentive. 

I got the Salmon Tartine and it was revelational! Fresh, Light and bursting with flavor!

The old man got the Crab Cakes and he absolutely loved them! And the potatoes as well. It's hard to get good crab cakes so if that's what you're into, this is the place for you.

Why aren't you closer to my house MyMy?!
author: Ayumi K.

description: What a great stuff. Really innovative approach to the food, I like the pancakes with ricotta :)
author: Ondrej M.

description:
I AM IN LOVE.

I have had my fair share of brunch spots up and down the California coast. 
This might literally be my new favorite brunch spot ever.  The pancakes, oh god, I will have dream about the banana blueberry souffle pancakes.  I don't know how they do it, but when I cut in, it's as if I'm cutting into a cloud.  The pancake is so light, and the egg whites in the middle are insanely fluffy.  

I also had the chicken morney with the poached eggs. So good, and just the right type of savory.  The potato wedges that came on the side were perfect.  It's crazy, but they do potatoes justice.  Literally the best wedges I've ever had.  The eggs were poached perfectly, and when I cut it open, the yolk was perfectly runny.  

This was a spur of the moment brunch place, but I am so glad I came.  
I will be coming back for more.
author: Sinan W.

description: I had the harvest egg scramble and it was hands down the best eggs I've ever eaten. The hash browns that came with it was were also amazing. The waitress was very friendly.
author: Sameen Q.

description: OMG the souffle pancakes! *drools* They were so delicious! I don't usually like pancakes all that much. More of a waffle person really. But these souffle pancakes were really unique. We got a banana blueberry and a lemon souffle pancake, and they were both heavenly. The wait was a bit long, but it was totally worth it. I really recommend this place to anyone that happen to find themselves in the vicinity!
author: Qianyi L.

description:
We moved around the corner from this place and with all the great reviews, I was SO excited to try it. Since we regularly getting coffee at contraband, I wanted to make this a new great breakfast spot for the weekend.

I had the veggie florentine. It was fine, nothing great. I found an egg shell in my meal. Not wanting to make a big deal, I put it in my napkin and kept going. No other issues with it.

I paid extra for my fruit salad on the side. I started to eat it after finishing my eggs, and the fruit was clearly frozen, so that was a bit uncomfortable to eat. But it gets worse - I go for a strawberry and it was MOLDY. Actual mold growing on a strawberry. So I called over the server, who looked horrified and apologized. And then brought me a fresh one.
