But when we got the bill, there was nothing at all removed, not even the $1.50 for the fruit salad to replace the potato side dish!  I don't expect a free meal or anything, and of course I hadn't made a big deal out of the egg shell which also affected my meal...but the $1.50 would have been a small gesture to show they cared.

Besides all of that, overall atmosphere was very loud: lots of street and kitchen noise.

Anyhow, I don't think we'll be coming back. There are other places I'd rather pay $30 for 2 brunches and coffees.
author: Carina E.

description:
I had a great breakfast, beautiful and eye-tempting-attracting food decor. The 45min-wait was worth it!!!
The service was incredibly abrupt and obnoxious. We're west coaster people!! As soon as we got seated, they immediately asked what we wanted for drinks. We haven't read the menu at all, so they left. A minute later they rushed at us and asked again, then hurried us to order. We already felt overwhelming and forceful; alight so we ordered. The food - we had vanilla French toast and Norwegian Benedict, was amazing, Bloody Mary was ok. As soon as we finished our meal. One of the servers just grabbed our dishes and slammed at us the bill. No one even bothered to ask if we wanted anything else or how the good was to us. They didn't even ask if we're ready for the bill. I MEANT LITERALLY SLAMMED THE BILL AT US! Regardless of how much we enjoyed the food, we detested and felt insulted by the service. So overall, it's not worthy and joyful. It is a diarrhea service-GET-EATEN-GET-SLAMMED-GET-OUT-/service. No thanks for me to this place. My friends and I go out to enjoy the food and service, not to be treated like this.
author: Ely T.

description: I recommend the banana blueberry soufflé pancakes and the Tex-mex scramble. The pancakes have large fresh blueberries and creamy filling. The Tex-Mex scramble is topped with a chipotle cream sauce and has a good size serving of hashbrowns to mix in. It's a small restaurant and is noisy if you sit by the kitchen, but the food is great! I give it a four only because of the noise and the bacon (slightly undercooked) but otherwise it was fantastic.
author: Andrea G.

description:
Were it not for how good my friends' brunch orders looked, probably would have given this place 2 stars based on my entree. 

Got one of the sweet and savory specials which sounded really tasty unique - zucchini pancakes with Parmesan and eggs? Sounded like savory goodness. Instead my pancakes were really weird - had Parmesan caked on top and the pancakes tasted underdone and were drowning in syrup or honey that they had poured on top. My eggs (supposed to be poached) were soggy and sour, in a little dish on the side. The presentation was terrible, and I was starving so I finished it, but regretted my entree the whole time. 

However, the Benedict my friend ordered looked amazing and she seemed happy. Would try that next time if I were coming back, but I don't think I will be.
author: Angelica Z.

description: In the need for some serious grub, I randomly found this place on Yelp and was curious to check it out since it is one of the lesser known brunch places in SF. Though the wait was way over an hour, the breakfast here is totally worth it. Even though the inside is really cramped with only a couple of tables (hence the ridiculously long wait), the food makes all of that irrelevant. Everyone in our party ordered a different breakfast dish. I went for the chorizo scramble and it was the most amazing scramble I ever had! I loved how the chorizo wasn't super greasy and had tons of veggies and cheese incorporated with the eggs. This dish came with corn tortillas which were perfectly warmed up and soft. The most surprisingly amazing part of this dish were their hash browns. I swear I think they put crack in those hash browns, because they were perfectly seasoned, crisp, and made me want more after I finished them. Overall, if you don't mind a ridiculously long wait, then definitely treat yourself to some incredible breakfast or brunch at Mymy!
author: Cristal C.

description: I had the Norwegian Benedict. It was amazing! I have been craving it since I went two weeks ago. I have been telling all my friends about this fantastic place!
author: Laura L.

description:
Had a craving for eggs benedict and saw they had at least 5 different kinds to choose from.  I ordered the parma benedict: prosciutto, mozzerella, fresh basil leaves, tomato, on top of english muffin with hollandaise.  It's as if a caprése salad and an eggs benedict had a baby and wrapped it in fancy ham.  über yum.  $14-ish.  Regular benedict is $12.

I was in a major hurry and they were SUPER awesome about it.  They couldn't guarantee it would be fast, but it was!  Servers were nice and efficient.
author: Alice L.

description: Decided to try this place again - word breakfast ever - eggs lousy hashbrowns horrible don't bother
author: Marilyn H.

description: Wow, great breakfast!  The blueberry pancake dish was  delicious, and it was arranged in an artistic way. The scrambled eggs were the best I've ever had!  Great food, great service, nice cheerful atmosphere, and only a 20 min wait to be seated.
author: Kevin T.

description: Best breakfast in town. Staff was friendly and the food was delicious. You get plenty to fill you up! I wasn't sure I'd like the zucchini parm pancakes but they were to die for!!! The corn beef hash was good too! Plan to go again!
author: Megan S.

description: Went around 12:30 and waited for about 30 minutes to seat 3 people. It wasn't too bad, and the food was worth it. Service is quick! It's a perfect go to brunch spot if you live in the neighborhood.
author: Courtney M.

description: Great food ! Excellent pancakes.  Everything was fresh tasting and served in quick timing. The downside of this place is the capacity size it fits people. It can get packed and feel squished.  It also can be very loud.
author: Andrea R.

description: The best brunch I've ever had!!! I am salivating just thinking about it... The vanilla french toast was so delicious... cooked perfectly and not at all soggy.  The hash browns were perfectly browned and crispy and was flavorful enough that I didn't even need the ketchup.  The pictures on this yelp page are beautiful... YUM! I would fly back to San Fran just to try other dishes from here. We went on a Monday for brunch and there was a bit of a wait... but it is SO WORTH IT!!!
author: Priscilla P.

description: The wait is long so get there early but the food is really good. I like their veggie scramble with pesto sauce. Big portion and pretty fast service. Too bad the store is small, but nice brunch place in the city.
author: Amy T.

description:
We came for the bottomless mimosas but...we got stuck with a carafe of grapefruit juice mimosas, not the worst, let me tell you. Still feeling a lil tips while we write this now, so it's great for 2 people at $18 a pop. 

We'd call it mocha. Some places are vanilla, like Applebee's, some places are creamy French vanilla, like Stack's, some places are chocolate like the Red Door Cafe, and this is just a swirl. Mocha. 

Side note - they only offer 2 substitutions/special requests per meal, so if you're allergic to everything or health conscious make sure to take note. Also show up before 9 on a Sunday if you're not down to wait more than 15 minutes. Touché Mymy, I am full and happy.
author: Molly B.

description: Went on a Tuesday morning and there was no wait. Everyone in our group liked their food. The lemon ricotta pancakes were outstanding.
author: Andrew R.

description: Good food, terrible service. Was asked to leave as soon as we were done eating so they could seat another table. We were there for 40-45 mins. I understand that it's a busy place with a line, but being asked to leave the second you put your fork down and haven't finished your coffee is totally unacceptable. There are too many other places in this city with good food and better service to ever go back here again.
author: Sarah L.

description:
1 for service, 3 for the food.

After waiting in the hot sun for 45 mins, we were seated. Within 1 minute the "server" comes up to us and says the only four words she will speak to us for the duration of our meal: "what do you want?" Feeling rather shocked, we told her we literally just sat down and haven't even looked at the menu yet. Then she just walked away. If I were ordering from a food cart, I would expect the same sort of impersonal, uninterested service, but not at a hyped up, top rated brunch spot in a nice area of San Fran. 

After quickly deciding on something to order, our server vanished, never to be seen again. The 2 meals came out at different times and we were not once asked if we needed anything, or how everything was. 

The food was ok-nothing to write home about or wait any length of time in the baking sun. Save your $$ or go somewhere that's worth your time and dollars.

The server successfully prodded the cattle car along. We scarfed it down and were out the door as soon as she had asked "what do you want?" the moment we sat down.
author: James O.

description: Seated outside at a 70 degree angle, so I had my food sliding off the plate. Mr duc and his boyfriend had this really strangers rude  energy to them so the service was shit too.
author: Yonus A.

description:
Loved it! Fast service, clean and so delicious!!!! 
Had the Texas scramble and the lemon ricotta pancakes, of course. 
Best breakfast place, little gem this place is :)
author: Marlene S.

description:
I had a vision: sitting by a window enjoying the rain outside and my amazing friend and amazing food inside. I knew Mymy would fit the bill and lucky us, after a few minutes waiting at 9ish on a Saturday, we got our window seat.

Everything on the menu is phenomenal. The pancakes, the eggs, the hashbrown! My friend had their homemade sausage burger and he could not stop raving about it! I had the chive with Gorgonzola dolce pancakes. OMG! Incredible! And where else would I get one of those?!?!

We stayed for two hours and we were gently reminded that there were people in line and we should go. What can I say? When you are having a deep and fun convo with one your best friends time flies! :-)

Service is not super amazing and the ambiance is really simple coffee shop, by for a casual brunch with amazing food and to impress your out of town friends, give Mymu a chance.
author: Simone W.

description:
My fiance and I came here on a Friday morning around 10am. We waited for about 30-40 minutes and it was well worth the wait. 

Zucchini pancakes were definitely worth a try. We also got the Farmers market omlete which good. The crispy thin hash browns were amazing.

Tip: go around the corner for a coffee while waiting.
author: Ramin M.

description: Great breakfast spot.  Weekends have a long wait but during the week you get seated right away.  I always get the 2 egg breakfast with hashbrowns and chicken apple sausage.  The hashbrowns the are the best i have ever had.  Service is good too.
author: Afshin S.

description: Best damn Corn Beef Hash I have ever had!  The Mimosas were great as well. Glad I found this small little gem in San Francisco!
author: Sandra H.

description:
Anyone who has read my Yelp profile knows i HATE brunch. I owed the little ham a brunch date so this was it. Lucky for me she volunteered to go wait. The line was incredibly short for sat at 1pm. 25 mins? That's it? We're in. I had the tex mex and she had the pancakes. I thought the eggs were really operating at a high level. 

Side note: there was a horrible table next to us that left shortly after we arrived (thank god) one girl had a cackle and terrible weave!
author: Ben K.

description: This spot was pretty good! Long wait but not so bad! I had the Florentine which was delicious!
author: Arman A.

description: Wow, wow, wow. This place is worth the wait!!! Delicious food with a nice spin on ingredients. I had the chive, bacon and Gorgonzola pancakes - they were heavenly! Also had a side of bacon that was cooked to perfection. My SO had the eggs tartine with hash browns. Equally has amazing (yes, I stole bites)! Order yourself a mimosa, sit back and ENJOY.
author: Pamela S.

description: Oh my gosh! I had the Bly Benedict, it was so good. It tastes fresh with the diced tomatoes. My fiancé had the Chorizo that was to die for & the wedges were tasty too. Definitely recommend this place & the pitcher of mimosa is a $6 saver. Will come here again.
author: Danielle S.

description: The go to brunch place in SF, MyMy offers a great variety of exeptionally tasting dishes. Highly recommended the Salmon Rotolone with a side of asparagus!
author: Victor A.

description:
My my my what a great little breakfast spot!

As long as you can stand waiting a few extra minutes, you'll get treated with a great meal in an "intimate" (that's the word realators use to describe REALLY EFFIN' SMALL, right?) setting with fast-churning comfort breakfast food served up in moments.

I can't even talk about the rest of the food because all I want to tell you is that they serve their omelettes, eggs benedict, scrambles, whatever on a hashbrown so big it literally covers the plate. Yes, I'm talking about a hashbrown plate. It just makes perfect sense. Instead of serving you a heaping mound of raw shreds of potatoes, they, instead, spread the hash across a really thin layer and brown them into a perfect plate-sized portion of epic-crispiness and crunch.

I literally want to go back right now just thinking about it.

Maybe the omlette on top wasn't overwhelming, but I simply can't think of anything else but the  cracker-like texture of the most amazing hashbrown I've ever had.

Seriously though, it's a fun little place. Pretty good food. But, like any place in the city with over a 2.5-star review, it's packed and it's small.

If you can bear it, I strongly recommend you try this quaint little breakfast place out. And if you don't get a hashbrown, you've wasted a table and should appologize to everyone waiting in the doorway as you leave.
author: Michael S.

description: Ok so maybe when I wrote this post I was super hangry. This is the best brunch spot in all of San Francisco. So don't go away from the front or you may miss your name and they will not care. The food however is amazing. Totally worth kt
author: Yana K.

description:
The food here is so, so good. 

+  Lemon Dill Crab Shrimp Cake Benedict (served with hash browns): Amazing. Perfectly poached eggs with yolk that just spills over the crab cake, muffin, and sauteed spinach. Hash browns were great too -- very thin and very crispy. 

+ Lemon Ricotta Souffle Pancake (served with fresh fruit): Aahhh, so fluffy. Loved the strong lemon flavor and the layer of ricotta on the bottom.

+ Wait time: My friend and I lucked out here today. We came before 10am, and since the groups in front of us were larger and there was a small table available, we were seated almost immediately. We did see the line grow nearing 10:30am or so though, but the wait is absolutely worth it.
author: Linda Y.

description:
Great Place to get a nice weekend brunch 
The Tex mex was very good ! Preferred seating is outside watching the California street in action. 

Park in the trader joes parking just 2 mins walking
author: Sudeep J.

description: After all of the great reviews I was surprised (and a little concerned) that there was no wait. Came with my wife and 3 kids. Zero flexibility on menu items. Kids wanted plain pancakes - nope. We wanted kids/smaller portions for the kids - nope. Food and service were average. Also, I was surprised that they added 18% gratuity to a place like this for a party of 5. There are better places to have breakfast in the city.
author: Anthony O.

description: I ordered the french toast and an egg scramble. The french toast itself was pretty good though the fruits were not fresh and some pieces of strawberry and blueberries were mushy and inedible. The scramble was weird since they put a lot of butter; the eggs were literally dripping in butter. I personally don't like butter in my eggs and this was the first time I tasted it at a brunch place. Not worth going as there are many better brunch places in the area.
author: C M.

description:
First time at Mymy, not my last! 

- coffee was strong, decent
- friendly and quick service by staff
- counter seating was spacious, bag/coat hooks underneath and accessible
- decent menu, excited about the savory pancake options!
- it looks like they only have two sweet pancake options available (both souffle with all the bells and whistles) would have liked to have plain buttermilk option
- tried the chive and bacon pancakes with gorgonzola and potatoes inside, sunny side up eggs, seasoned wedge fries, honey drizzle on the side. I like the flavor, but because of the gorgonzola, it made it a little sweet and I'm not sure if I like that and that was without the honey drizzle. Flavors were good though. If you like sweet and savory, this is your dream breakfast. will probably try the zucchini pancakes next time. 
- cute and clean space
- good location, easy to get to (47,49, 19, 1, cable car)
author: Maureen B.

description: Oh my goodness!  Divine!  The neighborhood was a little sketchy for is suberbia type but the food made the journey so worth it. I liked lemon pancakes fluffy and the egg whites just pumped those babies up!!
author: Megan B.

description: This is one of my go-to breakfast/brunch spots in the neighborhood. Yes, Olea gets all the attention but honestly MyMy has some great fresh omelettes and fast service. Additionally, it's pretty easy to bypass the line/grab a seat if you're a party of 2. Would definitely recommend.
author: Shirley L.

description: Omg omg omg this place is super good, the food is off the chain, and the staff is awesome and super friendly....
author: Art D.

description: Sadly, I did not have the wonderful experience that other diners had with their lemon ricotta pancakes. The first batch came out burned, the second batch came out less burned. I gave up and just ate part of the second round. When the server asked if the replacement set of pancakes was better,  and I showed her they were not, all she said was "well next time, try the French toast"  which was even more disappointing instead of offering to comp my coffee or something. The 3 stars are for hubby's eggs and bacon. Those came out good. We paid $13 for burned pancakes.
author: ibby m.

description: Had brunch with my family. Although there was a line outside when we arrived it moved really fast (not even 15mins). Norwegian Benedicts were very good and we also enjoyed the crab cakes Benedicts. The portions were very large. I really recommend it for brunch.
author: Anwar A.

description:
I finnnnally tried this place after only living a few blocks away for years. Why did it take so long you ask? Because there is always a line because it's that freakin good (and I am usually walking my dog in the AM). 

The best thing is their hash browns, it's unlike anything I've had. So thin, crunchy, plenty and not greasy. I rave about them now. SOO good. 

I'm waiting for them to get their outdoor seating permit and I imagine this place will become a weekly thing since I can bring the pup with me to enjoy.
author: Donna H.

description: Yummy breakfast spot! Gourmet grub that won't break the bank. Friendly service and pretty fast food service too. Kind of a tight squeeze so I wouldn't go with more than a party of 3 or 4. Highly recommend trying the selection of eggs Benedict in the "benediction" menu. My friend loves the French toast!
author: Syber G.

description:
Breakfast until closed, great prices for San Francisco, and delicious food. I went here twice during a three day visit and thoroughly enjoyed each time.

I had both the Frisco Scramble and the Peasant Omelet. The scramble was good, but the omelet was amazing. Fresh, rustic vegetables with classic hearty spices. A great way to start the morning with a little coffee, included hash browns, and a water carafe.

The ambience is very comfortable. Highly recommend if you're passing through or if you want a place to be a regular.
author: Andy K.

description:
Never have I experienced such a short wait for Sunday brunch in this city. At 1pm, it was a 10-minute wait for 3 of us to be seated. Amazing.

The food is solid; we ordered the salmon tartine, corned beef hash, and a stack of the lemon ricotta pancakes. The tartine was easily the star of the show, but the pancakes were a close second. I just wish there was more lemon flavor! But that tartine... I'd go back just for that. The potato wedges were also really, really good.

The one downside: we ended up ordering a plate of chive pancakes after finishing all the food because the portions were small and we were still hungry after wolfing it all down. I don't know if it was a fluke or if this is a consistent "problem" here or if maybe my friends and I were extra-hungry that morning.

I also enjoyed the proximity to Contraband Coffee next door, where we picked up some fancy espresso and sat outdoors for a while after eating at Mymy.
author: Sharon L.

description: Corn beef hash!! So so good! It was incredibly flavorful and it paired so well with the eggs and potatoes. Whatever sauce they added on top of the perfectly cooked eggs was phenomenal! definitely a brunch spot I would not mind coming back to!
author: Samantha S.

description: The food was incredible!! The wait was about 45mins-1hr for 2 people on a Sunday morning. Overall this place is wonderful, just very popular so you must be willing to wait!
author: A Z.

description:
4.5!

Found this place by accident.  I had originally wanted to try Olea, which is just across the street, but as we were approaching it, we saw a huge crowd in front of it, and Mymy had a shorter line, so we decided to try it instead.  No regrets!!

We had wait for about 15 minutes, which isn't too bad for San Francisco breakfast/brunch.  When looking at the Yelp app, I was surprised it hadn't come up, especially with its good ratings.  Our seat was in a corner with a great view of the street.  I loved all the natural lighting!

My boyfriend's mom ordered the Hangtown Fry (fried oysters with a scramble), my boyfriend ordered the Tex Mex Omelet, and I ordered the Frisco Omelet.  All of our orders came with a side of hash browns and two slices of toast.  My bf's mom also ordered a cup of coffee, which arrived with its own little creamer mug.  The portions were huge!  I managed to only finish half of my meal.  I had a sample of my bf's dish, and it was a burst of flavor.  Their pico de gallo was fresh and finished the dish perfectly.  My omelet was yummy as well, topped with avocado (you can never go wrong with avocado).  The hash browns were a thin layer and crispy, just how I like it.  

Our waiter was very attentive, filling up water and coffee whenever we were about halfway through.  Props for that!  There are so many items I want to try on their menu, and after this great first experience, I will be returning multiple times!  What a lucky find.
author: Can C.

description: Food is amazing. I've had their ricotta pancakes and their BLT Benedict, and both were great. The wait is worth it.  However, they try to turn tables quickly due to the lines, which makes it a bit uneasy to take your time eating/chatting.  Multiple servers asked us if we were finished eating, despite still having a substantial portion of food left on our plate.
author: Annie M.

description:
One of the best brunch places I've ever been to.

It is located on the corner of California and Larkin. We took the cable car which leaves you right outside of the restaurant. We went on a Monday afternoon and did not have to wait for a table at all which was surprising as I heard that most brunch places have huge lines.

The blueberry and banana pancakes were amazing. They were fluffy and not too sweet. It comes with fresh blueberries as well as blueberries inside with a banana/blueberry sauce. Best pancakes I've ever had. The only negative thing I have to say about it is that they only give you two pancakes, but that just means I will have to order more for next time.

We also got the Norwegian and California Benedict which were both great. The french toast was very light and fluffy.

Definitely one of the places to go to when I visit San Francisco again.
author: Wayne L.

description:
I liked it here, don't get me wrong, but I don't think it's very spectacular. I ordered the banana blueberry soufflé pancakes and it was pretty damn good, but I didn't get any bananas in mine. Also, the marscopone that it came with was nearly tasteless, I needed a huge glob just to get even a hint of it ): The candied walnuts it came with was just placed under all the pancakes very oddly, too. The pancake itself though was pretty good. My friends got the french toast and the italiano scramble and the french toast was average. They used like hawaiian/dinner rolls so they were super soft, but nothing I couldn't make myself. The scramble was pretty good. The hashbrown were super crispy and I loved all the sausage inside the scramble. 

Overall, Mymy has some pretty smackin' food, just don't expect more than a 4-star meal
author: Holly P.

description:
I wouldn't change a thing!!

We had our final SF trip meal here -- brunch on a Saturday morning.  The wait for a table was about 25 minutes around 11am.  

I savored the Harvest Time Scramble and my husband had the 6 Hours Corned Beef with poached eggs.  Both were excellent meals.  Great service, food that offers a sensation to your palate, clean pleasant surroundings and a clean bathroom too!  

I'll be back!!
author: Willanne W.

description: Incredible! Right off the cable car route. Line moved quickly for just the two of us with less than a 10 minute wait during peak breakfast rush on a Saturday. Wifey had the Frisco Scramble and I had the banana-blueberry pancakes. Both were amazing! Definitely worth the trip to popular areas and had great service. What a gem!
author: Seaner S.

description: The food was so yummy. No complaints. My French toast was fluffy and sweet. His Benedict looked so pretty with the fruit on the plate. The server however, meh. I took off a star because of her. Not friendly. Just took our order and never came back.
author: Flor C.

description: This place is adorable. Try the Vanilla Sponge French Toast with Butterscotch Drizzle. It was amazing. Even the hash browns were tasty. Also tried the chicken apple sausage. You'll thank me!!
author: Meki L.

description: Chive pancake = most delicious savory pancake I've ever put in my mouth. The chicken gruyere mornay was also incredible. Perfect brunch place for food that's high quality without being pretentious:)
author: Carly Y.

description: Not only was the service terrible, when my Italiano scramble (sausage, eggs, etc.) was brought out, the sausage was raw.  I would never recommend this establishment to anyone else in fear that they would get food poisoning.
author: Melissa M.

description:
We were tired of eating in Redwood City so we decided to just Yelp pancakes in 
SF and MyMy came up first so we decided to just go!  So many places in The City to get breakfast it's too overwhelming to make a decision.  

No reservations.  First come first serve.  Tiny place so don't be surprised ifya haveta wait outside on the corner.  But.....

I will say in their defense that it's totally worth't!

Tiny wooden indoor seating that's nice an neat.  Glass water carafe w glasses on the table for you to server yourself that are replaced w a new one when it's emptied.  

SF gals love the oversized framed spectacles.  Cute I might add.  

Very casual and welcoming.  The server gals don't bother you too much.  In fact, coming from my line of food serving, it was a shock as I always engage my tables when it's warranted.  But the only interaction we received from our gal was jus takin our order.  No tour guiding after I told her it was our first time there or suggestions.  
Prolly college gals jus tryinta get by.  But I tipped them decently.  

We ordered the Santa Fe chorizo and eggs(modified egg whites only) with steak fries which didn't look as amazing as the guest next to us's plate of the delish lookin TexMex egg platter.  Nonetheless, we were a lil un-wowed by the presentation, but the flavor of the chorizo was marvelous.  

I ordered my kid a basic cheddar burger which was awesome and delicious. I know cuz I took a bite of't.  

We also ordered the butterscotch Texas sized French toast w berries and bananas.  Amazing!  

I ended up ordering crab cakes cuz I saw the couple next to us eatin crab cake Benedict.  But I didn't make myself clear and got a side instead of the whole breakfast entrée.  Oh well, all were scrumptious.  

Fresh squeezed ruby red grape fruit and oj.  

Mimosas ifya like, but no tap beers.  Drake's is served by the bottle in Amber, Hefeweizen, IPA, and another brew.  Not a fan of Drake's Hefe, it's like a Pilsner, too light to be a Hefe.  

Next time we go, we'll get the TexMex and the crab Benedict for sure!  

Parkin's a bitch, but free on Sundays.  Understand that this is Nob Hill and so....
when driving, expect HILLS!!!!  STEEP HILLS!  So if your driver's not experienced then you better drive.  We were lucky to find a spot on the same side of the street of the same block from MyMy.  

A must try and "Why not!?" to add to your list of tiny corner places in SF that you can say you've been to.  

I hope you'll enjoy as much as we did and as the faces of satisfaction from those around us displayed.  I always look around to observe how people react to their food.  Not a single dissatisfied expression.  All who walked out were full and satisfied.  

$60 for 2 freshly squeezed ruby red grapefruit juices, a bottle of beer, coffee, 3 entrees and a crab cake side for mom, dad, son, and nephew of 9 and 10.

In SF, it's a lottery w food.  some are bad, ok, and some excellent.  MyMy's excellent!
author: Aureliano C.

description: So we gave this place another try cause it sucked last time we were here. And again disappointed a year later, I almost threw up !! The the eggs were flavorless and bland also crispy on the edges. I cook better eggs. ., the plate not very presentable. Not to mention they served the mimosas in a plastic beer cup with a fucking handle!!! That is tacky and you are supposed to put mimosas in a Champagne glass not a plastic BEER MUG. Are you shitting Me ! I rather go to Olea Across the street. Very disappointed. The "chefs" need some cooking lessons. I cook better than this..! Very disappointing :( won't be going back.
author: Sophia H.

description:
olea's is right across the street, but it was closed the thursday i went! and my sister also reccommended mymy coffee shop so we went! but honestly, i was happy with this place! its on the corner so its hard to miss. i bet parking would be hard to get here but it's walkable from downtown (a little bit of a hill though) got there around 10:30, and no wait! a saw an old couple sitting there each reading the newspaper drinking coffee, and i thought 'oh how cute!' definitely a local thing and very chill there. the service was good too so no complaints. 

i felt like french toast with seasonal berries (because i always do...!) and my bf got the eggs benedict with some coffee. i posted a picture of my toast and you can see the benedict in the background kind of! i kept stealing the hash browns!! they were yum! and i definitely remember not finishing my french toast so if you are looking for something filling and sweet, definitely try it! just too much food i was getting full but i was happy with it! total was $25 for breakfast! good deal!!
author: Jessica C.

description:
My favorite stop for breakfast or brunch in Pac Heights. However, on weekends I advise you to go elsewhere unless you're happy to wait 30min or more. 

Note for SF visitors: Mymy is a small restaurant with about 10 indoor tables and 4 counter seats. It is uncrowded on most weekdays but if you're looking for brunch without a long wait on Sat/Sun, the Tenderloin neighborhood has many options to choose from. 

The food at MyMy is prepared carefully and thoughtfully. The eggs are fluffy never overlooked, you really can't make a wrong choice in omelettes or benedicts. The cook emulates French-style egg making very well. 

Special hash browns: outstanding. While many brunch places make some kinda hash brown-cheese-bacon-veg plate what you typically get is a plate of mush that's a gut-bomb. MyMy hash browns stay crispy and the sautéed veg and bacon aren't overly greasy. This is under sides on the menu. 

The chipotle chicken sandwich with smoked mozzarella is  very tasty, so is the classic club, because they use really good bacon and fresh avocado. The smoked pulled pork sandwich you can pass up, it's not spicy or particularly good. 

For a lighter meal you need to try their Asian chicken salad, it's perfect. Grilled asparagus! Near perfect balance of sweet and savory. I could eat it every day - and I probably should. 

Sorry, nothing to write about the soufflé pancakes or spongy/gooey French Toast I haven't tried them. 

Service is friendly and attentive, again, don't apply this to weekends that goes for most good brunch places in SF.
author: Ben S.

description:
The tex-mex scramble is probably the best  breakfast I've ever had.
Portions are HUGE, I need a forklift to take me back outside. Lovely service, perfect!
author: Saulo S.

description: OMG!!!! This place blew me off my seat. My gf and I found it on yelp and decided to give it a try. We would not regret it because it has been the best breakfast place we've tried in a long time. I ordered the blueberry banana soufflé pancakes and it was amazing. Best pancakes I've ever had. It was nicely presented and brought at a timely manner. My gf had the lemon dill crab cake eggs Benedict and that was so amazingly good we are still talking about it. We also had mimosas and we enjoyed them. We are glad we have this place a try and we will definitely will be coming here again next time we are in town. The wait might be a little long but it is worth it because this place will not disappoint. It's a little pricey but I don't mind paying a little extra for a good meal. I highly recommend anyone to try this place.
author: Nelson R.

description:
I do love mymy, but it's now literally impossible to get in there.  We have tried going at all times of day and it has at least 20 people waiting.

Today we tried 10am on a Sunday and still the same.

The food there is one of the best brunch spots in the neighborhood, but the situation with the wait has made it too annoying to go.  The wait is longer than olea for crying out loud.

I'm sure there's nothing they can do other than expand.  Until then, bye...
author: Mister G.

description:
Mymy is the best breakfast place I've ever been to.  In four days in S.F. we went here three times because it was near our hotel, and it is so amazing.  Their pancakes (either the lemon or the blueberry banana) are to die for.  The french toast made with cake instead of bread is amazing.  The eggs benny are among the best I've had.  The hash browns and coffee are both real good too, and the service is great.

We were there mid-week, and there was never a wait for a table like there seems to be from many reviewers comments of long waits on the weekend.  Our next trip to S.F. we will definitely be coming again.
author: Edward T.

description: Food was delicious! Small spacing, warm seating area so if your a big person may be a little uncomfortable but if it's the food your after, totally worth a little discomfort!  I'm a Benedict lover and theirs was amazing!  Crispy flattened hash browns, could not stop eating them.  A must for affordable breakfast'
author: Pamela M R.

description:
During our recent trip to SF, we looked to Yelp to find us a breakfast place within walking distance of our hotel.  Mymy fit the bill and off we walked.

We got a table right away, outside...and the weather was cooperating.  My husband had one of the Benedicts and raved about it.  I had a  souffle pancake, which was amazingly light and delicious.  The coffee was excellent and replenished frequently.  Another great Yelp find.
author: Diane C.

description: Really luv it here!!! Amazing fresh breakfast!!! Yummy hash browns!! Yummy French toast. Yummy Tex mex!!!
author: cindy p.

description: Best brunch spot in the city!!! Chorizo jalapeño tartine is AMAZING! Line is always really long but they do a good job of moving it along quickly.
author: Kylie H.

description: Today I ordered a cup of coffee and had one refill. My boyfriend has recently given up coffee but likes an occasional sip. The waitress denied me a third cup of coffee because she saw my boyfriend "sharing my coffee". She then told me it wasn't her rule, but the owners. I'm not sure where the owner was watching from, but if he was actually watching he would have seen my BF take two sips of the coffee and me drink the rest. Maybe it was for the best I was cut off from excessive coffee drinking because I'm now angry and caffeinated and writing this yelp review. I've come here many times in the past and the food is great but the way the situation was handled was incredibly unprofessional. MyMy, you lost a customer over two sips of coffee and I won't be sending any business your way. Don't be so cheap and rude.
author: Lesley E.

description:
Breakfast here was AMAZING! Thankyou fellow Yelpers for pointing me in the right direction! 
After my flight into San Fran, I just wanted something to start my day off right, before tackling Union Square for some Christmas shopping. MyMy was the BEST thing my boyfriend and I experienced all day! Cute little spot, off the corner in a light blue building. We almost walked past it. When we went inside we were just about the only ones there and were told to take a seat wherever we liked.

Bottomless Mimosas - $12-$14? I think. Completely well worth it! Those girls knew how to make mimosas! 
Clay went for the french toast (never adventuring outside his french toast box) and it was like a beautiful work of art. It was crusted and topped with some kind of cereal. And on the sides there was some kind of butter or yogurt with a jam that was just all artsy and beautiful. I would have taken a picture but Clay would have made fun of me. And it tasted like a million bucks!
I went with chicken sausage scramble, topped with avocado and hash-browns. Mine too, was like a delicious work of art. The avocado was sliced so delicately and set on top. And they are super generous with the avocado! (BONUS FOR US AVOCADO LOVERS) I'm pretty sure it was like a whole avocado! The hash-browns were a plenty, crispy and to die for!

Our server was a cute, thin, girl with glasses and two toned hair. She was super attentive to my every need, even when they started to get busy. Plus, even after we paid she asked to make sure I didn't want one last mimosa before leaving. Want-of course! Need-lol probably another story...but I went for another one anyways, it was my vacation after all!

I honestly wish I lived in/near the city just so I could come back to this place every day for breakfast! GO! You will be so happy!
author: Jordan G.

description:
As are many restaurants in SF , this is a cozy little spot that's producing quality eats. Had the crab cake "benediction" and it was yummy. For $14 you get a generous amount (compared to other places that I've tried ) of (real) crab in the two crab cakes, as well as a tasty sheet of hash browns. 
The restaurant is medium/smallish space , but you don't feel cramped and the staff is quite friendly and attentive. Thumbs up!
author: Eddy N.

description: Delicious breakfast - we had eggs Benedict, and are definitely coming back again. Waiters are friendly and atmosphere is relaxing. Well worth the 20min walk from Union Square
author: Dmitry K.

description: The hash browns are thin and crispy - very good brunch place. There's always a long line though.
author: Ryan L.

description: Delicious brunch.   Pancakes and benedicts are the way to go.    My wife said the crab Benedict was one of the best things she's ever eaten.   The Ghiradelli hot chocolate really hit the spot on a wintry San Francisco day.   Staff is super attentive and friendly.
author: B F.

description:
Had the pulled pork scramble, which was okay - nothing too interesting. I didn't like the hash browns at all. It was so thin & since it was fried, all I tasted was a crisp potato thin, instead of any actual potato meat. My friend got the chive pancake, which she was extremely excited for, but was equally as disappointed by once she tried it. 

I had a taste & I could understand why. It was extremely dense and flour-y (think gnocchi consistency, rather than a fluffy pancake). What made it even worse was how they put the maple syrup on the pancake directly, instead of on the side - so even though the sweet/savory tastes didn't mesh well, she could not control how much sweetiness was on her pancakes, which totally ruined her meal!
author: Crystal W.

description:
MyMy is my all time favorite breakfast spot in SF. My husband and I walk here each weekend, though honestly I could go Saturday and Sunday and never get tired of the menu. It was our secret neighborhood spot for about a year and a half, and now it's poppin off. I am a little bummed because the line will be 1+ hrs if you arrive between 9am - 1pm, but happy for them bc the food and service are great. 

My faves are the Tex Mex omelet and the Lemon Ricotta pancakes (real maple sugar is a must!) 

Honestly if I could give them 6 starts I would.
author: Ash S.

description: Now that's how you make breakfast/brunch!!! Excellence is the French vanilla toast, with a side of chicken Apple sausage. Bravo cooks at MYMY, BRAVO! I'll be back.
author: Daynelle P.

description: Came for a late brunch on a Tuesday and loved it! The inside was a bit too warm for us so we opted to eat outside. Two of us ordered the smoked salmon tartine and the third ordered the Norwegian Benedict. We loved the generous helping of smoked salmon on all of the dishes and the tartine had a great amount of avocado. All in all, great flavors and good service! Would definitely come back.
author: Dot M.

description:
Hands down the best pancakes I've had in the city. I ordered the Banana Blueberry Souffle pancakes and was in heaven. It was so light and had almost a marshmallow filling. I never finish my food, but I finished my breakfast this time.

Another plus: I ordered my hashbrowns extra crispy, it came out extra crispy and not burnt. Most places will bring it out slightly crispy on top and and soft on the bottom or burnt. Not this here, it was made to perfection.

Keep in mind this place is small, so come early or be prepared to wait.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
BRUNCH!!!!! I went here with some friends and loved it! I wanted to try everyone's dish and I loved mine, the Crab Benediction. Holy mother. The hashbrowns, the egg, the crab, everything was cooked perfectly with so much flavor. All my friends felt the same. 

Very friendly staff, great casual place to just relax and eat on a sunny day. One of my favorite memories is eating at Mymy for the first time. Love it.
author: Dexter H.

description:
I was confused when my cousin picked this place - I initially thought it was a coffee shop, not a brunch place. I thought she was suggesting we get a bagel or muffin, and I wasn't about to trek 30 min out of my way to come here.

I may have made the mistake of coming here at 1:30 pm on New Year's Day. Everyone was probably nursing a hangover and eating late, but it took an hour to get a table for 3. This place is tiny, so if you have a party greater than 4, you're probably going to be waiting a while for a table. On the flip side, because they can't rearrange any of the tables inside, if you have only 2 people, you should get a seat much faster. We were standing outside forever while they had 4 or 5 open tables for 2. Poor space / table management in my opinion.

I got the Chorizo Tartine, which was $11.50. I thought it was okay. I love spicy food, but I could have made this at home. It was scrambled eggs on a thin, slightly burnt brioche toast, a salsa, and roasted jalapeños (these are very spicy, beware). The hashbrowns that came with it were the saving grace, they were thin, and crisped to perfect. Almost every dish you get will come with hashbrowns, which is a plus.

We wanted something sweet, so my cousins and I split an order of the french toast. This goes on the list as one of the best french toasts I've had at a restaurant (love Zazie's and Sweet Maple's french toasts) The brioche bread was thick and fluffy, it was dipped in an orange vanilla batter that had perfect notes of citrus, spice, and sweet, and the fruit and butter that it came with was plentiful. This was the highlight of the meal.

I probably wouldn't make the trek out here for brunch unless I found myself in the area, or came with people who lived around here. There are a lot better places in the Mission. However, if you're close to this place, come with a small group, and like hashbrowns and french toast, then you'll like this place. My total meal was about $20 including tax and tip (I got an entree and split the french toast 3 ways)
author: Christina L.

description: best place i have ever had breakfast. I have been to many cities but this was muy Bueno. Everyone in the family loves it
author: Jerry G.

description: Got there on a Sunday and had to wait for about 35 mins. Totally worth it!!! Sat outside. Had a mocha to start, very tasty. Everything on the menu looked excellent, so had to try a couple things. Went with the Parm flavor Benediction, and the Lemon ricotta soufflé pancakes! All I can say is WOW!!! The flavors with amazing. The dill Hollandaise sauce was so flavorful and really added to the acid of the tomato and the flavor of the prosciutto. The hash browns were exactly like I like them. A thin layer with a crispy outside on one side. Next was the pancakes. Very different, but SO good. They seem to fold whipped up egg whites to a pancake batter and cook it up. They are surprisingly light! Last was the Peasant Lorraine Flat Omelette. The flavor profile of it all went so well with each other! I wish I had a bigger stomach. Nice size portions as well!
author: Michella F.

description:
As I mentioned in my previous review, MyMy has great food. I especially love their Tex Mex Scramble. When my cousin came in to town to meet me for brunch I jumped at the chance to take him to my favorite breakfast. 

We received decent service. We were helped by pretty much every server who works there. One person brought food, another refilled waters and yet another brought us our bill. 

When it came time to pay I put down my card, the total was around $21, and my cousin put down a $5 bill. The $5 was laid on top of the card and the paper receipts. When my card was returned and I signed for it, I wrote cash on the tip space, because the $5 tip was gone. 

As we gathered our things the male waiter that works there approached me and said "you wrote cash tip on the tip space but there's no cash". I said "no my cousin put down a $5 bill on the tray and it was taken away when you ran my card". He began to argue with me in the middle of the restaurant telling me there was no cash. I reiterated my side of the story and felt humiliated as people started to turn around and stare. I work in the service industry and rely heavily on tips I receive from my clients. I tip generously when it's appropriate, but I also understand that tipping is not a requirement it is a privilege. I reached into my bag and pulled out $10 and handed it to him, I felt like I was going to cry. I left the restaurant.

As I was walking home ( I live nearby) I decided to go back. I was outraged I had been treated like this. My fiance and I go to MyMy at least twice a week. And I couldn't believe how abusive this waiter was to me about a $5 gratuity. I walked in asked to speak to him. I explained again that I was not lying, that I too work in service and would never stiff someone on their tip. I asked him to help me get to the bottom of where the cash had disappeared to. Did it fall down, get stuck in the drawer by accident, did another server pick it up? He was rude and snarky to me. I told him that my fiance and I frequent the restaurant and always tip to which he responded "you tip, not very much though". At that point I was outraged. I couldn't believe his behavior and I walked out.

Later that night I told my fiance what had happened. He couldn't believe it either. He knows that I always treat servers respectfully, I never even send something back if it's wrong! The next day he went down to MyMy to speak to a manager. When he asked for one, apparently no one runs the place. He spoke with two of the female servers who had also served me the day before. He asked them what they would do to remedy the situation, as we are twice weekly patrons of their restaurant. They offered no remedy or apologies. 

We stopped going there. They way they treated me is unacceptable. If you don't get a tip, suck it up and give better service next time. If your tip disappears between my table and the cash register, its probably your fault or one of your coworkers has sticky fingers. As a customer I should have never even known about the missing money. 

BTW...4 months later my fiance and I were craving the tex mex scramble and we decided to let bygones be bygones. We ordered, ate, went home and both of us had horrible cramps and diarrhea. So yeah....that's my sad story.
author: Amanda S.

description: I think the one thing that stands out to me here every time is the thin, crispy hash browns. Most everything I ordered here was pretty tasty.
author: Kyle S.

description:
Nice brunch spot...bottomless mimosas on Weekdays could be dangerous!

Small place so expect a wait around 30 to 50 min. It's worth it for good hearty breakfast food with good flavors and good portions. 

I will be coming back to try more of the sweet breakfast options!
author: Christine W.

description:
Stumbled upon Mymy while on a morning hike around downtown San Francisco while on a long layover. I'm always intrigued when I see lots of people waiting outside. I put my name on a waiting list. After 45 minutes I was seated. Ordered right away and asked for coffee (took a while to get it... think they forgot about it, but that is the only complaint I can muster). I ordered the Parma Benediction. Arrived promptly (less than 10 minutes which was amazing considering how busy the place was and the stellar quality of the food. Coffee was very good as well.

This place will be a regular stop for me. The food is top notch especially for the price. The location is cramped and it's not the place if you want quiet, elbow room or dislike listening to stranger's conversations (like couples squabbling). One additional server to keep up with the coffee would help as well. Asked for a refill and never got it.

Food: Amazing!
Service: Good, but could be better.
author: Dave H.

description:
Oh man, this place is good! It's been probably two months since I went for the first time but I can't stop thinking about it...the lemon ricotta pancakes were so fluffy and perfect, and I almost never order sweet things from the menu. I loved that most, if not all, of the menu items had a unique touch to them, something you wouldn't find at another brunch place (like my lemon and ricotta-filled pancakes).

The only downside was having to wait at least an hour to get a table, but it took me that whole time to decide what to order, everything looked so delicious. 

Cannot wait to go back and try everything else.
author: Lisa A.

description: Fantastic brunch place. The best part is that when we arrived there was no wait. We ordered the crab cake benedict and blueberry souffle pancake. I liked that the crab cake benedict did not have the standard hollandaise sauce. It was actually a pesto sauce that was delicious. The blueberry souffle pancake is something new I haven't tried before. Very impressed.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Oh my oh my the breakfast was amazing
Everything delicious.
Poached egg was perfect (don't normally like them that much) and sauce was wonderful
Real corn beef in small chunks.
Crispy home fries on the outside, soft inside.
The reviews are true and we will be back for another breakfast this week while visiting SF!
author: Marilyn S.

description: Delicious! Love the crispy hash browns and thick bacon! The benediction items aren't too rich to enjoy. Service is very fast and friendly. HUGE portions-so maybe share?
author: Suzanne M.

description: I had the shrimp crab cake Benedict and it was very good. The chive hollandaise sauce was Wonderful and the food was very fresh. We also tried the French toast which was awesome. I would recommend this place.
author: Marissa S.

description: This is some of the best eggs Benedict I ever had... They call them "benediction" for something! Incredibly yummy. The French toast was ok, not bad but nothing to write home about. I will most definitely be back to try the crab cake eggs Benedict since they look amazing though
author: Sara C.

description: Terrible attitude from the server and receptionist. Treated me and my family like crap.
author: Eli S.

description: Went with a friend to get brunch overall good experience. the food was good i order the BLT Benedict i was a little sad that the hash brows wasn't like a whole mess of potatoes but more like a single layer of crispy potato(still really good though). All the staff members were welcoming and super polite. It's a bit noisy if you sit outside though since California get's a bit busy sometimes. I definitely would come back again since everything was pretty darn tasty.
author: Audrey W.

description:
I came here on a Tuesday morning after realizing that Red Door Cafe was closed. While I was disappointed that I would not experience the craziness of Red Door, Mymy completely turned it around. My co-worker had previously recommended this place to me as a great joint for breakfast/brunch and he was right. It was simple diner food, yes, but done so well.

It's a small restaurant, maybe under 15 tables maximum, and not crowded when my party of 2 arrived. We were seated immediately. The menu offers a lot of classic breakfast items like scrambles, benedicts, and pancakes, but also had a decently sized lunch menu. 

I ordered the parma benedict which had prosciutto, basil, mozzarella, and tomatoes and it was divine. So light, even for a benedict, which can be tough sometimes considering a lot of heavy hollandaise sauces out there. We also ordered the seafood benedict with came with shrimp, avocado, and a chipotle hollandaise sauce. Just as delicious and such an interesting twist to the sauce. Eggs were poached well too. And the hashbrowns are great - not greasy but thin and with that perfect crunch for texture.

Overall, a great place for a well-made breakfast.
author: Brittany L.

description:
Most the food was yummy. The hash browns were to thin though. It seemed they were cooked to much and the middle was removed, leaving me with only the crust of the hash browns.  My friend was pissed because they did not make lattes.  
Very cramped seating , exposing the greed of the owners. They always have a line though. 
Olea across the street has much better service , a better layout, and a more straight forward menu.
author: Fat ass g.

description: I decided to try this place instead of suffering the hour wait for Olea across the street, and it's now my favorite brunch place in Nob Hill. The Benedicts and scrambles are excellent, the hash browns are crispy and delicious, and you can sip on a Bloody Mary while waiting for the food to arrive. Nothing ostentatious or groundbreaking, but you'll find something on the menu that hits the spot.
author: tianyu l.

description:
Are you kidding?  I can't believe how good my breakfast was .  I felt like I got hit by a freight train of delicious.  It's hard for me to imagine a better tasting meal.  To make it even better, the cost was very reasonable and I felt right at home despite being a tourist.  

Do it... Don't think twice.
author: Cville G.

description: If you love Benedict then this is definitely the place for you. I have never been to a brunch spot that has so many to choose from. I got the one with crab and shrimp and it was so amazing. There was a line out the door but we got seated and served pretty quickly. I went with a group of four, all of whom got various things on the menu. Everyone enjoyed their breakfast and I can't wait to go back!
author: Amanda M.

description: One of my very favorite  places for breakfast EVER. Their breakfast meals are like a dream becoming reality. Every time I try something different, it turns into a very pleasant surprise.  AMAZING food!!
author: Julio P.

description:
Because of the service was so so and the food was too greasy to me! 
Noting special! (¬_¬)
author: Kelly C.

description:
The food was delicious. I had the Florentine benedict (Florentine garlic sautéed spinach, roma tomato, oyster mushroom, chive hollandaise) with hash browns and every bite of it and the perfectly crispy hash browns was delicious. 
The service was a bit off. I was by myself and was walking home with a tea to go in my hand. I saw this place and decided to check out the menu. They asked me to look at it outside, said it was easier to see, which I did. I asked if it would be okay to come in with my drink, and they said it was fine. Then I said I liked what I saw and was ready to order. The guy working there (seemed to be a manager or owner) took my order and asked me to sit at a bar. I took a seat, but the weather was great outside and I asked if I could move outside. They said that's fine. But then, once I was sitting outside waiting for my order, the waitress came by and she clearly seemed uncomfortable about it, but still told me that in the future they would like me to not move once I take a seat. I found that very odd, but said very nicely "sure, I won't move next time". And that was it. The food came out great, after I was finished I went inside to pay, as I was in a bit of a hurry and didn't want to wait outside, since I was the only one sitting outside. It just seems odd that I was schooled for asking to move to a different spot after I took a seat. I'd still come back for delicious food!
author: Olga A.

description:
it was an awesome breakfast. even 8:30am, there was a lot of people. try the most delicious lemon meringue pancake($11.50)! they put little bit lemon zest(not strong taste), it makes flavor not too sweet. 
i recommend to go here before 9:00am for breakfast. 
if not, you should wait for over 30min.
author: Junghee H.

description: Came in here on a Thursday morning around 10am and my boyfriend and I were seated right away which was a plus because we were starving. I got the French toast and asked for a side of hash brown. The fresh toast was AMAZING! Probably the best French toast I've ever had. The hashbrown on the other hand was such a disappointment. It was literally a thin slice of hashbrown. All the plates seemed to have a good amount of food too.
author: Dara M.

description: When on Nob Hill in SF and you want a great and innovative breakfast you must try MYMY on California Street. The lines begin at opening at 8 am and it's worth any wait. The egg dishes are all unique and so very tasty. Service is warm and attentive. I'll be back soon.
author: Jeff G.

description:
You won't be able to decide quick here, the menu is just too awesome and the food is even better - absolute amazing!
Very charming location
author: Marcel E.

description:
HOLY MOTHER OF GOD!

I haven't brunched for awhile, and Dear God!!! I love love this place !! I was yelping and was browsing through their photos and one of the waitress told me, "our menu has changed, so yelp photos are out-of-date." I had a moment of silence because there was a Monte Carlos sandwich I really wanted. 

After that, me and my undercover fat friend, decided to SHARE items because we just couldn't decide !! I ordered the Lemon Pancakes and she ordered the Baja Benedicts ... (Okay, I lied .. I ordered both of them .. so WHAT!). Of course, my food instinct was on point and the food was AMAZINGGGGGG !!!!

The Baja benedict had a spicy kick it and blended perfectly with avocado, medium poached eggs,onions, and grilled shrimp. (I'm drooling as I type this)

The Lemon fluffy pancakes were PERFECT !!!!!!
author: Brenda C.

description:
Cute and tiny Resturant. Read all the reviews which made me want to come here.

It was packed. When we got there we put our name on the white board. There was about a 10 minute wait. I didn't mind. It was a beautiful day.

As we were seated they handed us the menu. I was overwhelmed at how many options they had for breakfast.. I decided on the Frisco scramble with wheat toast. My husband got the Parma Benedict. The food was amazing.. I highly recommend this place to everyone..

I will definitely be coming back!
author: Nicole V.

description:
So freaking good. There was a line out front and when we peaked our heads in we were mildly concerned about the tiny size inside. They are pretty efficient at getting meals out and cycling people through. Don't let this efficiency send you the wrong message. This is a diner and they operate like a diner. The efficiency is born of this fact.

The food, on the other hand, will ensure you forget the word diner. I had the chive pancakes and my wife had the lemon ricotta. They were both amazing. The slight tang of Gorgonzola with the sweetness of the syrup and the savory chivy-pancake was really just making beautiful music in my mouth.

This will be added to my brunch roster for sure.
author: Thomas C.

description: Came here for breakfast/brunch this morning and absolutely loved it! The scrambled eggs were delicious!! This is a very tiny place, and there is often a long line outside on week ends, but that shouldn't keep you from going there, it's worth waiting ! And the line goes pretty fast, we were seated after 15 minutes. The staff is incredibly efficient and service is not neglected even if they are so busy. We will come back for sure!
author: Amélie C.

description: Have to update this. Probably my 30th visit and the food quality is still the same. I am so hooked on this place. The wait list however keeps on increasing.
author: Prateek G.

description: Food is good.. spicy pulled pork omelet.. and souffle pancakes.. wohoooo... do not share, hehe.. it's good u can't get enough...!!!
author: Kelly B.

description: It is rare for me to take the time to write a review for anything as my nature is to be very fast paced. This place is a rare gem! They don't just have the best egg Benedict I have ever had they have 6 unique ways to serve it. I have traveled extensively and never seen have I seen versions like this. The title of eggsbenidiction on the menu is The Truth! The food is amazing as well as the service. The staff is friendly and on top of it, even when it's packed your food shows up before your 2nd sip of coffee. As a business owner I can appreciate this place even more knowing how hard everyone is working to keep up this quality.
author: David S.

description: So I was not too impressed. The waitress was not very accommodating and almost rude when I explained I could not eat wheat ie. toast and could I keep the potatoes and switch out toast for fruit. I was willing to pay the extra for the fruit. She was adamant that the potatoes came with the toast and it was either fruit only or the potatoes with toast. How hard would it have been for her to ask the chef to skip the toast and give me the fruit since I had a food allergy? Also, I ordered the Frisco scramble (Chicken apple sausage, leeks, shallot, Roma tomato, avocado and cheddar) and was given a mushy mound of scrambled egg. Not only did it look inedible, it was inedible. The sausage tasted bland and the mushy mess turned my stomach. So I ate 3 bites, stopped and ate fruit for breakfast. My husband had a bit better luck with the Harvest time scramble (Eggplant, Roma tomato, fennel, Kalamata olive pesto, grilled asparagus, pine nuts and grana padano sprinkle) so I ate some of his. We also ordered a side of bacon which was not bad. The best part of the breakfast was my cappuccino - good foam, nice sprinkle of cinnamon on top, tasted great. Atmosphere was so so. We won't be returning. Been to much better places back home in Marin - with much more flexible wait staff!
author: V L.

description: Brunch is delicious and worth the wait! The patio area outside is nice but unfortunately you cannot specify whether you want to sit inside or outside because of how busy this place gets.
author: Anita A.

description: Went here based on reviews and the recommendation of a friend.  The wait was pretty short, about 20 minutes on Sunday morning for 2.  The fresh OJ was tasty, and the sausage patty was salt and delicious.  The French toast was very good as were the soufflé pancakes, although they could have used a little more blueberry and banana flavor.  Service was solid and prices decent.  Overall a very tasty option.
author: A. L.

description: Best brunch in the city. Benedictions and scrambled are incredible. You can't go wrong!
author: Mark F.

description: Nice little spot for breakfast/brunch. Ordered some French toast and lemon pancakes and enjoyed every bite. The wait to get seated was not long, maybe 5 minutes. Different servers came to the table to check on us and get our order.
author: Melinda C.

description: Delicious fresh food with quality ingredients prepared with great attention. Fast friendly staff. We arrived at 9am in a Sunday and were seated fairly quickly, though the line was quite long when we were finished. The food is definitely worth the wait. I had an egg scramble, but the pancakes looked divine, so I'll be ordering those next time. Would highly recommend!
author: sara w.

description:
If you're still slightly hungover and/or doing the walk of shame, you don't REALLY need or even want outdoor seating, fancy coffee, more alcohol, and trendy flora/decor/artwork, right?  Well, I lie.  I'd totally still want those things, but sometimes, a place with nothing more than great tasting food with good company works just as well.

Unlike many places that are known for a few must-have specialties, it seems everything they offer is executed pretty well.  The margeruite omelet I had was amazing, and I secretly pined for my friend's vegetarian sandwich as well, but we both got hash browns, so no jealousy there.  Their hash browns are done up super thin for extra crunch; superb.  

My buddy was disappointed that by removing the veggie burger from their menu, Mymy basically slashed his choices in half, but it is his hope that by asking for it every time he goes, they'll bring it back.  So, the selection is limited for vegans which is a bummer, but for the rest of us, their food is mighty fine.
author: Jenn C.

description:
Go here!

Had a yummy brunch on a Sunday morning.  Efficient service, cool art work on the walls and not too long of a wait.

Pancakes and French toast were amazing.  Eggs and chicken sausage also very good.  Hash browns kind of meh.  Fresh juice was delish.

I will be back.
author: Li J.

description: Hands down my favorite brunch spot in SF.  Typically, my friends and I wait 30-50 mins to get a table and it is always worth the wait.  The ricotta pancakes--best in town--are great for sharing and they have delicious benedictions, omelettes and hash browns.  I've never ordered anything I did not like.  Very satisfied customer.
author: Rexi U.

description: Mymy was it good! Worth every minute of the wait. Please, if you haven't tried it before go. Everything is to die for and the hash brown are very very good!!!
author: Lary C.

description:
When I'm paying over $10 for pancakes and $10 for french toast, I want to be dazzled. Reading the menu is intriguing and then what ends up on the plate is just okay. 
The portions are a bit small the hash-browns are flat and crisp, I prefer a bit more potato. 
Not my cup of tea, bummer. If these items where priced less it would be worth it...
author: Josie C.

description:
Had the classic egg breakfast with sourdough bread and hashbrowns. Everything was on point. You can tell that it's a labor of love for the owners: quality ingredients, good cooks (not cheap line cooks), and a simple but fantastic menu. 

This is the best classic breakfast fare I've had in SF. Will definitely be back!
author: Sara B.

description:
It takes 40+ minutes for a phone pick up order to be ready. Their excuse? They have a full house. 

There are more popular brunch places, that are larger, and more crowded, that will have a phone order in 15 - 20 minutes (see: any other hopping brunch spot in the area). When it takes longer to wait for a phone pickup to enjoy on the go than it is to wait in line for a seat, something's off.
author: Raymond L.

description: Didn't even get to eat at this restaurant because they refused to accommodate a friend with severe food restrictions. She simply asked to order things already on the menu but without seasoning, spices or additions (things she cannot eat due to her very limited diet). Twice she asked and explained that she has a very limited diet due to a medical condition and they wouldn't give her avocado, smoked salmon and not even a simple, plain hamburger patty. All items that are on the full menu. She even explained that she would've happily paid full price for a meal if she could just get the items plain. I've never encountered this at any restaurant with anyone with dietary restrictions. It was just so odd and disappointing.
author: M L.

description:
I really love this place. First of all, it's adorable. The staff is friendly and the service is fast. I've been here maybe three or four times now, and all of the dishes I've ordered have been really good. They make the best omelettes... the eggs are so light and fluffy. They also have awesome freshly squeezed orange juice.

The only negative thing I'd say about this place is that it tends to get a little too warm sometimes.
author: Danielle D.

description:
MYMY Coffee Shop serves up fresh, delicious traditional American breakfasts. The presentation is no-frills, but it doesn't need to be because the food really speaks for itself.

We stopped in right before they closed. Although the waiter did let us know that it'd be "last call" for whatever we ordered, the staff didn't try to rush us. 

We ordered the eggs benedict (with fruit) and the 2 eggs any style + hashbrowns. The food came out pretty quick. It both looked and tasted great! The hashbrowns were brown and crispy but not burnt. I appreciated how the meal wasn't greasy at all. The spinach on the eggs benedict looked especially fresh, and there was just a right amount of hollandaise sauce. The fruit side was very generous. It included berries, melons and oranges.

Overall, a great experience! I plan on frequenting MYMY from now on.
author: Alyssa W.

description: Every time my friends are in town I always take them to my my for brunch. I usually get the corn beef hash and it is the bomb.
author: Jasmine T.

description:
I passed MYMY yesterday and the line was out the door--it was such a heartbreaking sight because that means the secret is out! My fave breakfast place in the city is under the radar no more. I have loved every breakfast here and the one foray I made into lunch (pulled chicken with blue cheese and BBQ sauce? Yes please!) was really good and big enough to share.

But back to breakfast. I have fallen in love with their swedish style blueberry pancakes, mostly because you can order just one, enough to satisfy my carb craving without feeling like a pig at the end. With bacon and maybe some hash browns, they make a really filling and tasty meal every time. The coffee here is free flowing and strong enough, the juices are fresh squeezed if you're into that sort of thing, and the service is polite and efficient. This is exactly what I need in a neighborhood breakfast joint. Go MYMY! Geez, I might have to go there for lunch now... yum :)
author: Lesly S.

description: First meal after landing in San Francisco. Oh delicious beginnings... Would recommend getting the smoked salmon Benedict with a side of fresh fruits. Service was a bit delay.
author: Thuy C.

description: Staff is frazzled because they are so busy.  Popular spot, good food (I had the Frisco scramble), but not relaxing to eat here. Waited in line a long time to be seated (no wait list) testimony to their popularity.
author: Diana A.

description:
Mymy...  my oh my oh mymy.

This place is just down the street from where I live, and one could not be a happier, boozy brunch-loving San Franciscan that it is. There were about 5-6 parties before us, so the wait was about 20 minutes, but we had just been to Brenda's the day before, so this wait was a breeze to endure. And it was FAR more worth it.

I got the Salmone rotolone tartine, which is an open face sandwich with all kinds of unique, fresh ingredients: smoke salmon, neufchatel, avocado, red onion, sprouts, thin chieve omelettes, lemon dill, toasted boule, and aioili. Just reading the ingredients made my mouth water. It's served on a toasted, almost bruschetta-like textured piece of bread, which adds a nice crunch. It was served with potato wedges that out whole table felt like outperformed the much-hyped-about hash browns.

We also ordered the blueberry marscapone souffle pancakes, and WOWWWWW. I've NEVER had pancakes this good, and I have to add that I'm a savory breakfast type of girl. These blew me away, and even though our table was full, we devoured every bite. It's beautifully presented and even more beautifully digested... If I had my teenage metabolism back, I'd be here every day eating these pancakes. Do your soul a favor and treat yourself to some of this fluffy, divine goodness.

Great service and cute ambiance. Nothing pretentious or trendy, just a straightforward and amazing brunch place in Nob Hill.
author: Chrystal Z.

description: Great menu. I go here on weekdays for brunch. Eggs with pesto is my favorite along with soufflé pancakes. Interesting breakfast salads with eggs on the menu.
author: Fahmid K.

description:
Food: 4 star, service: 2.5 star, ambiance: 2.5 star.

Came for brunch. It was crowded even on a weekday.

Found the place overrated: The service was meh. The server came by twice within like 5 minutes to try to take our order while my friend and I were barely halfway through the menu. 

Food was alright. Would have been 4 stars on its own. 

Ambiance was no-frill. I probably won't be back, especially given what I read about the line during weekends.
author: Mel L.

description: I am updating my 1 star review of Mymy to 3 stars because they contacted me and apologized for the unpleasant experience I had. Thank you Sang Hyuk L.
author: Anne H.

description: I ordered the Norwegian (poached eggs on salmon, on spinach, on bread with capers) and it came with delicious hash browns that were a very thin layer of delicious shaved potatoes. I got the chive sauce on the side but it tasted amazing. My dining companion ordered the corned beef hash. I tried some and we both loved it. Great food, service and atmosphere!
author: Lydia S.

description: Round Two at Mymy! And five stars again - Woohoo! As good as it gets!! This time around I got the Spicy Pop Pork Scramble With Salsa Verde it has house-braised chipotle pulled pork, onion, roma tomato, pepper jack with a side of a savory Italian sausage patty!! It was so amazing, the blend of flavor from sweet to spicy makes the meal unique.  Mymy rocked my breakfast!! The only downside is I'm headed back to NYC -_-
author: Shaleem J.

description: Quaint spot ,we were seated right away service was good and attentive. Food was delicious ,husband had the TeX Mex scramble and I had the French Toast. We thought it was a little pricey but well worth it,will be back.
author: Sofia C.

description: best neighborhood brunch place. Usally an hr wait on weekends but worth it. Shuffle pancakes are unique. Hash browns are super thin and crispy. Baja benedict is awesome too
author: Dana C.

description: Breakfast was very good here. Service was very amazing, they were always checking on us and food came super quick. I got scrambled eggs with Apple chicken sausage and it was delicious. Would definitely come back again.
author: Lisa P.

description: The food was very good. The hash brown potatoes were perfect BUT, I was there on a busy Saturday morning and the waitress tried 3 times to take my food away from me. My fruit plate was still full, as were my scrambled eggs. I was very unhappy about it and will not go back.
author: Penelope D.

description: This place was so close to our hotel. I found it pricey but the staff was pleasant & the food was good. Our bill for 2 people was over $35.00 - will not eat there again based on the price.
author: Jenn L.

description: My favorite brunch spot in Nob Hill- I take all of my out-of-town visitors here! The line is usually long but if you pop over to contraband next door it's not too bad. The menu has something for everyone. I personally like the chive pancakes or the tex mex scramble. Whatever you order, you can't go wrong!
author: Rachel C.

description: I was on the quest for brunch and didn't feel like going to a place requiring reservations. I visited this place last month and tried out one of their "benedictions." I got the Florentine. It was served up quickly and presented beautifully, but the flavors just weren't there. Hash brown was too thin, nothing substantial. If I'm ever back in SF, I'd give this place another try because they do have a decent menu and good service.
author: Monica B.

description: The pancakes are not the same and the popularity has brought the quality down a bit.  Still good, just not outstanding like it was.
author: R D.

description:
Came here at 9:30 on a Saturday with my dad and waited about 20 minutes for a table. Service was super quick--we had our food in under ten minutes--but not super attentive; don't expect coffee refills.

The food itself was great: I had the blueberry soufflé pancakes and my dad had the pheasant scramble or something? The hash browns are as good as everyone says and the sourdough toast+ jam was delish. I'd recommend if you're in the area, but I don't think it's worth a significant wait.
author: Sydney L.

description: This was one of the best breakfasts I've had! The food was exceptional and the staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. Our table had 3 different eggs benedict dishes and one scramble. his being our first time here and the fact we live 75 miles away we ordered a lemon soufflé pancake plate for the table to try. Each dish was great and the pancake was ridiculously good.
author: Mike P.

description:
Excellent brunch. Bloody marys are delicious. TeX Mex and pop pork are great.

Usually 20 minute wait on the weekend
author: John L.

description:
Came here for Brunch on a Sunday, and yes there was a wait. It wasn't too bad, probably about 15-20 minutes. I ordered the south of the border omelet, and the beau got the traditional benedict.
