My omelet was okay, a little greasy for me. Too heavy with the cheese, and the chorizo where I had to pick out giant portions which were completely congealed. Gross.  The benedict was ok.  Food did come out fast, but there is no "wow" factor for the brunch.  There are a lot of other places in SF that are better: Mama's, Zazie, Mission Beach, and Pork Store just to name a few.

I do have to add that their hashbrowns are really good. They're nice and crispy, and just a thin layer.  I would return just for that.
author: Vanessa K.

description: Great food, fast service. I ordered the Norwegian Benedict and it was loaded with smoked salmon! The eggs where perfectly poached and the hash browns where a thin layer of crispy heaven. I will definitely be back.
author: Rikki R.

description: Great food but their staffs rude service and horrible "policies" completely ruin this restaurant. With this prime location it should be a destination, but I'll definitely be avoiding this place in the future.
author: Perry L.

description:
This spot is an all around quality brunch joint. My fav is the baja california eggs benedict. The service is super efficient and food comes up quickly. 

Weekends are busy (duh, par for the course for getting brunch in SF on a weekend) so be prepared to write your name on the clipboard and wait for a table. I've never tried any non-breakfast item here because frankly their breakfast is too fabby to miss out on!
author: Matthew J M.

description:
3.5 stars for an overall rating. 
4 stars for that Crab Cake Benedict! 

I wake up, and the first thing I say to myself is "I want brunch! My my, where to eat though?" Searched "brunch" on Yelp and the usual list comes up - Olea, Zazie, Mama's, etc. - what catches my eye is Mymy because I've never seen it on my list before! Started looking at the pictures and it got my belly growling and excited. When my bf steps back into the room, I leap out of bed and say "Lets eat brunch!!! This place looks delicious!!"  He looked at me funny and said sure, cause I never get out of bed and I was super happy. That's when you know something is probably good! Haha. Honestly, this picture (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mymy-san-francisco-3?select=IKcqwgu0YSmYDZPfa7_Nyg#IKcqwgu0YSmYDZPfa7_Nyg) got to me but when I got there, it wasn't on the menu -sad face- 

This place has competition cause Olea's is right across the street! When we got there, I had a second thought of going to Olea's cause I couldn't stop thinking about their fluffy french toast; but I fought and held back my urge, so I put my name on the list and waited. Those who thought the wait was long decided to get in line at Olea's. Some that were smart but lazy to wait decided to put their name on the list then run to Olea's across the street and line up in hopes of getting in one faster (cause the hostess would yell out the name at the corner of the block). We came around Sunday noon. The wait wasn't too long for us (party of two), probably 30-45 mins. When I had put my name down, 8 parties were ahead of me. 4 were gone, so we basically skipped ahead. Parking in the area wasn't too bad, I think there are plenty of meter parking open. If you're cheap, you can circle around the neighborhood (1-2 blocks) and if you're lucky, you can find residential parking! 

When the hostess called out for my bf and I, she told us we would be seated outside. We sat on the side of the restaurant where the slope is. Not a really good idea since we're on a slope.. My boyfriend sat on the 'top' whereas I sat on the 'bottom'. When my bf poured me a glass of water, the glass' started to slip downhill and we had to stop it from slipping, using the the little tray of condiments. This was a big problem throughout our brunch (for drinks); what I had to do was put my glass of orange juice on my bf's side of the table. They did kind of warn us after we had sat down though (meh). Other downsides of sitting where we sat was this old man behind me who kept pushing his chair against mine (how annoying, I felt like he just ignored the thought of me sitting there. I had to ask my bf to move the table a little higher up the slope so I can give him 'moving space'. My bf noticed that he moved around A LOT.) There was also the groups of people waiting outside who talked loudly - there were two girls who stood next to our table speaking loudly to each other; and the car next to our table, who's alarm started going off when no one even touched it. Oh, and lets not forget the busy street filled with cars, taxis, and cable cars. 
I don't think I would recommend sitting outside (especially if you're on the slope). 

Now lets talk about the food! The menu offers a variety of brunch - salads, omelettes, benedicts, entrees, pancakes, french toast, etc. There's a smaller menu that they give per table and it has the drinks listed on there - beer, wine, mimosa, OJ, etc. 

Since they didn't have what I wanted, I opted for the Banana-Blueberry Souffle Pancake (~$13). http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mymy-san-francisco-3?select=IKcqwgu0YSmYDZPfa7_Nyg#XIVNTp5mXKbiTaS_6SM7cw
The pancakes come in a stack of four. Drizzle your syrup, spread your butter, slice your pancakes, and dip it into the design-looking-sauce on the side! It makes it 5x better! The pancakes were easy to cut and filled with blueberries inside (sliced it one by one on top of the other pancakes cause I wanted it to get an even amount of butter & syrup on it). Overall, it was okay. I feel like I should've opted for my go-to brunch food - french toast. If there's one thing I learned from this meal, I don't think I should eat souffles again. I'm not sure if it's the way the pancake was made or it's just souffles in general, but because it's so "soft" inside due to the egg whites, it felt under-cooked to me and I ended up with an aching stomach a few hours later. 

Crab Cake Benedict http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mymy-san-francisco-3?select=IKcqwgu0YSmYDZPfa7_Nyg#Qa-t6UpdrJRZEkZgTWrHcw
My bf ordered this dish and he loved it! The crab cakes have shrimp inside and it was delicious! Everything about it is just delicious. I had a bite and I fell in love. I wish I had ordered this! Next time, I'll definitely order it. It came with a side of hash browns and a slice of orange (as pictured). My bf said that this was probably one of the best hash browns he's had because it's not "mushy" like other places. I admit it was good. Highly recommend this dish.
author: Mandy G.

description:
Hands down the best pancake I've ever had was the banana pancake in mymy.
The Mexican egg is also very good and mimosas are strong and yummy.
They don't have espresso which is why I took one star off (and their coffee is meh). It's busy so you may have to wait before you are seated but it's certainly worth it.
author: Farid F.

description: This place was delicious! Blueberry banana marscapone pancakes were fluffy and flavorful and the harvest omelette with hash browns was the perfect way to get in veggies - crunchy and flavored w pesto! I'll definitely be back!
author: Michelle W.

description:
Five stars for food.  Everything has been delicious so far.  I've had:

Baja Benedict
Chives pancake
Blueberry souffle pancake

Their hash browns are super good as everyone has already said.  Bacon is good too.

Minus one star from five for the male waiter (owner?) -- could be friendlier, more pleasant, and smile a bit more please.  He made me feel like I should feel guilty for loving their food.  :(
author: Amanda B.

description:
This place really rates 4-1/2 Stars; however, that is not an option here in yelp*land.

I have eaten here twice now (the latest was yesterday morning for breakfast) and both times I was amazed at how great their food and selections are. 

Yesterday I had the "Grilled Garden Benediction" (zucchini, onion, oyster mushroom, yellow squash, asparagus, Grana Padano sprinkle, on Mascarpone mashed sweet potato, chive hollandaise; served with hashbrowns). This was such a great choice and not your normal Pope Benedict (or Francis, even) style of poached eggs. It was not quite "Knock Your Socks Off", but I was compelled to take off at least one of my shoes in salute (until other diners complained and I was asked to put it back on).

If you care to read a more detailed (read: boring) take on this place, you can check out my stupid breakfastary 'blog by clicking on my profile here. yelp*land doesn't allow any hyperlinks in their reviews (I know, as I have been reprimanded several times in the past already).

Here's hoping youyou enjoy a meal at this friendly neighborhood place!
author: Brian M.

description:
I am ashamed to admit this but... This place is so good that a few bites into my meal I thought to myself, "I've got to yelp this place!" and then quickly had the second thought of, "No, I'd better not so that the wait isn't any longer because I'm going to be here all the time!" These people have bacon and hash browns that turn me selfish, selfish, selfish!

As much as it pains me to do so, I'll be honest and express my love for the BLT Benedict I enjoyed at MyMy Coffee Shop. I would highly recommend this place to a friend because I was drooling over every dish I saw served at other tables. Can't wait to try more!
author: Kristin H.

description: This place has excellent service which only enhances the experience!  The food is totally a food/flavor fantasy!  Pancakes were light as a feather and perfectly prepared.  Crab and shrimp cakes so devine!  Eggs were light and fluffy and delicious!  Bravo!
author: Lisa P.

description: Four of us squeezed into this tiny place after a short wait.  The service was swift, friendly & accurate.  Everything was so good we kept offering fork fulls of wonderful to each other - tasting all four dishes & declaring them all winners.  Blueberry pancakes & BLT Benedict were my favorites but I don't think you can go wrong here.  I will have to return to explore all the menu items.
author: Tammy N.

description:
HASSHHHBROWWNNNSSS
Had the Tex Mex scramble and it was awesome! Also ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes. Tons O' ricotta!
Can't wait to try more yummy items.
author: Alexis S.

description:
I like this place so much! Not too long of wait on the weekends unless you show up around 1130, but even then it's only like 15 minutes. 

Lots of vegetarian options, very good omelets. 
OH MAN, order the orange juice. So fresh and ripe and good!! 

Like other reviewers said, the hash browns here ROCK. I wish I had ordered a double serving of it. I had to add a tad of salt, but every mouthful was glorious. 

The pancakes are thin and fluffy at the same time. Mmmmmm.... 

Big portions, I coudlnt finish mine (read breakfast part 2 in 2 hours).
author: Jessica B.

description: MMM one of my favorite brunch places! Its funny how I came across this places, it was actually because I saw my friend write a bad review about it. I ordered the BLT Benediction and it came with hashbrown. Their hashbrowns are amazing! Thin and cripsy, never had hashbrown like that before. The benedict I had was also up to par. I also shared a lemon ricotta souffle pancake with my friend, but I did not enjoy that very much. Overall, great experience.
author: Lina C.

description: Menu looked so promising but do not be fooled, it could not be worse.  Do yourself a favor and skip the long line, the incompetent staff, and overpriced food and opt instead for Contraband Coffee and brunch at Olea directly across the street!
author: Ashley M.

description: WOW! Unassuming place with incredibly awesome breakfast! the staff is very attentive and friendly... the most awesome pancakes anywhere! I had the florentine benedict - best ever. thanks!
author: Michael Y.

description: Food was excellent. Brunch with mimosas. Short wait but the service was great and the food arrived quickly.
author: Jadda S.

description: This is another favorite brunch spot for me. I always get the Tex-Mex Scramble. I'm sure there are many other good options on the menu, but I can't bring myself to try something else. The staff is very polite and responsive as well.
author: Drew C.

description: This is such a unique place. Food is great. I had the bennediction florentine, diced tomatoes, oyster mushrooms, spinach with poached eggs and chive hollandaise. My husband had goat cheese omelette topped with avocado and smoked salmon. My daughter banana blueberry mascarpone stuffed pancakes. Absolutely delicious.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
We ended up here after trying to go across the street to another breakfast joint that had over an hour wait. Oh boy I'm glad we did!!!

This place is amazzzzing. They have these open face egg dishes and crab shrimp Benedicts. Oh and there hashbrowns are good, there very thin but extra crunchy and buttery.

We sat on the counter which I didn't love but I was so hungry I didn't care. 

Sat-Sun have a wait but not bad...something like 25-30 minutes.
author: Jess O.

description: We both licked our plates. We came on a weekday and got right in for brunch. The menu has so many amazing options - the salmon tartine is delicious! And the portions were huge. Great music and fun artwork as well. On a nice day it would be great to sit outside and people watch.
author: Olivia M.

description:
Small breakfast place in Nob hill area. Loved the food over here. Good service as well.

Ordered the mambo italiano scramble with coffee. Loved it..Hashbrowns are even better!! so yum. Also tried the blueberry / banana pancake from my friend's plate. It was delicious. Overall - Great food and service!
author: Gurinder S.

description: This place has amazing breakfast! Had the Parma eggs Benedict, so yummy. Super fresh. Also had the blueberry French toast. Everything I had was delicious and elegant. Will definitely come back!
author: Veronica S.

description: Food was really good. Got the banana blueberry soufflé pancakes and the eggs Benedict. The orange juice said freshly squeezed but honestly tasted like plastic (and they charge $4.50 for a small cup) and service was slow. I asked to add avocado on my eggs the menu said $1 extra and when the bill came they charged me $3 extra. These are things they do that I don't like but I give them 4 stars because I enjoyed the food.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
My boyfriend orders here almost every morning. 
Tex Mex Scramble!
I've had many different things from their menu and have never been disappointed.
author: Katrina M.

description:
Breakfast review.  I hadn't been here in about a year and was disappointed in how the menu took such a downward turn.

First, no "standard" buttermilk pancakes.  Two specialty pancakes available which had a bunch of stuff on them that I don't need.  That's fine to have them, but at least keep the most classic breakfast food on the menu - the buttermilk pancake.  I specifically asked for them and the server said they couldn't make them.  Lame.

Second, most of the delicious omelets that I used to love are no longer on the menu (e.g., Haas Omelet).  I had their chicken sausage omelet, which was mediocre at best.  Not great quality sausage, for sure.  Hashbrowns are just smashed on the plate.  

So I won't be back.  Service was fine though - refilled my coffee without asking several times.
author: Dane P.

description: He took me here and it was sooooo good - luckily the line wasn't too long before 11 and the food came out really fast - every dish was super colorful, and we split a coffee between us too and they were chill with that. I think everything is good here - can ask for a take out box if you haven't finished
author: Gina H.

description:
MYMY Coffee Shop is a fairly new establishment in the neighborhood. They have a variety of breakfast items including pancakes, omelettes, french toast, benedicts, eggs, sausages, etc... I remember looking at their menu and wanting all of it but finally opted to get the denver omelette. My friend ordered the single pancake with fresh strawberries, bananas, bacon and eggs.

Food took a little bit, but it came out fresh as can be. Service was also really good. We were both very satisfied and will definitely be back!
author: M W.

description:
Love love love this place. It's pretty small and there are no reservations (why sf why?!) so I've never been here without having to wait. Really I think the wait is the only downside.

But now to the important stuff: the food. I'm in love with the food at MyMy. I've really traversed the menu: the Benedicts, omelettes, scrambles, pancakes. I haven't had a thing here I didn't like. The food is well worth the wait!
author: Viktoriya Z.

description:
So amazing ! during our easter weekend getaway we were in need for some good breakfast after the Lana Del Rey concert and man was this the best choice ! 8:45 am Saturday am I think we waited 5 minutes , got there just in time for the 30 min wait time ! 

1. write your name on the list to be seated
2. order the flavored peligrino with your dish all their dishes looked amazing 
( we ordered the custom omlete and Blueberry cream pancake I believe , the hashbrown 
3. Eat, it is NOT greasy it is so decadent ! 
4. tip well and enjoy the rest of the SF views 

I WILL DEFINITELY RETURN !!! total bill was close to 40$ not bad but well worth it 
when your traveling stay away from chain restaurants experience what the town offers
author: Cynthia C.

description:
Jebus. I never realized this place existed until a GF reviewed it. We decided to try it out for brunch and it was awesome. I ordered the pancakes with fruit and a side of sausage. The pancake was swedish style and was so fluffy and delicious. Fruit was fresh and sweet. Sausage was not oily. 

The decor is clean, warm and inviting. Service it top notch. Hardly a wait at all (Saturday at 10am). Highly recommend.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
Food was O-K! The bf and I both ordered a eggs Benedict. I ordered the original and it came with Canadian bacon. Nothing special. I kind of wish I ordered French toast or something sweet instead. 

Service was alright. Waited less than 5 minutes since we came around 2pm on a Saturday. We paid with a $100 bill and the lady gave us an extra $10 with our change. They seemed really confused when we told them what they did. 

Might come back if I'm in the area but I wouldn't make a trip cross town to eat. Sorry Mymy!
author: Mary M.

description: I am such a fan of eggs benedict and so far this was the best ever! clean and great service.
author: Linda B.

description: The Food was good, the Service was fast but our waitress was not friendly at all... It's also somewhat expensive, but that's probably because it is San Fransisco.
author: Afshin K.

description:
We had the tex-mex scramble and smoked salmon roll. Great food. Small local place. 

Try to arrive early otherwise the lines get long especially on the week-ends.
author: Christian J.

description:
The breakfast at Mymy is delightful .  My wife and I had the lemon-ricotta pancakes and loved them, and I don't even like pancakes...at all...but loved these.  Pancakes for the non-pancake lovers out there.  The service was excellent.

We have been here a few times and it's equally delicious and a great experience every time. Highly recommended.
author: Shane R.

description:
It was a Saturday after a holiday work party, and my BF was quickly fading into grump mode.  We needed a good breakfast location stat!  We found Mymy on yelp and skirted our way to hopefully good eats!

Luckily it was good, and the food came out quickly!  I ordered the **Crab Cake Benedict** w/ a lemon aioli twist.  The lemon was a subtle flavor; a great touch.  The crab cakes were good.  There was no fishy taste to them.  It was the perfect portion amount.  Many breakfast locations provide too much food.  This was just right, and the food was plated in a visually nice way as well.  

I stole a bite out of my BF's **Veggie Scamble** and that was also good.  The fruit was fresh as well.  I'm not sure if the orange juice is fresh, but whether is was store bought or fresh I liked it!  I don't care for orange juice that is too tangy.

We wouldn't drive down from the south bay to just eat here--we did have a handful of restaurants where we would do that--, but if we were in town again we would definitely come back here!
author: Roselina R.

description: Absolutely delish. If you're not there when the place opens, expect a wait. Mymy's food is a good reason to get up early on weekends. Redeem the hour you saved not waiting in line on a power nap later.
author: Lisa M.

description: This place has amazing breakfast. The poached eggs are done perfectly, the hash browns are amazingly thin and crispy, the corned beef hash melts in your mouth. Best breakfast I have had in a long time. Would have given this place 5 stars but someone in our party suffers from a dairy allergy, and when some food had dairy on it that wasn't mentioned on the menu they gave some attitude about replacing it. At the end of it all though the problem was handled and they brought the replacement out quickly. Other than that, the food made this place one of my favorite breakfast places.
author: Noam N.

description: Excellent service and great brunch food! We were fortunate to not have to wait for a table as it seems to be a very popular place. I had the chicken gruyere with poached eggs and my friends had the lemon soufflé pancakes, both of which were excellent. My dish in particular was extremely filling and it kept me nourished until dinner time. Service was quick and the coffee was great as well. This is a great brunch spot!
author: Ahmed B.

description: Wow. Delicious food and great service. We got the 6hr corned beef benedict and the banana blueberry souffle pancakes. Don't be put off by the extra charge for maple syrup; you won't need to order it at all. The pancakes are amazingly moist and sweet. Perfectly satisfying brunch.
author: Catherine A.

description: We had breakfast here during our visit to SF and we left with a full stomach and happy faces. The Lemon Ricotta Meringue Pancakes were fluffy and delicious.  My fiancé loves his Breakfast Burger (egg patty not beef).  Service was very friendly and food were delicious. We are definitely adding this place on our favorite list.
author: S N.

description:
After a 6 mile Sunday morning run, this was a perfect neighborhood place to grab breakfast and gain back double the calories I just burned off. 
I had the six hour brisket hash. Delicious, with big, tender chinks of brisket. Mmmmmm. Everyone else in my party raved about their meals as well.
There is a sign in sheet at the door (you sign your name, not the hostess) and our wait was about 20 minutes for a party of four. There is a real neighborhood vibe here and the staff is super friendly. 
The only downside is the coffee, It's kind of blah. I took of a star for that because when you have 'coffee' in your name, and you are in San Francisco, you really should serve stellar coffee. No worries though, I got a fantastic cup around the corner at Contraband,
I shall return.
author: Scott H.

description: Anyone who has tried to do "brunch" in San Francisco is well aware of how much of a joke it is. The lines are long, the service kind of sucks, the food is expensive. Mymy does NOT fall in that camp. Although across the street from one of those long-line, high-price brunch shops, this place is righteously packed with happy customers. The menu has an entire page of egg + pancake/french toast options on one side and salads & sandwiches on the other side. The food is fresh and gourmet, the service is quick and the prices are reasonable. I had the Harvest Time egg scramble with asparagus, eggplant, tomatoes, pine nuts and pesto with a side of thin but crispy hash browns - delicious. If you are looking for a brunch place in San Francisco, I highly recommend the establishment that is on the west side of Larkin - Mymy Coffee Shop.
author: Clarisse S.

description: DO NOT DO NOT DO NOT come here if you have a baby or a toddler...they are not accommodating at allll! They took in 5 parties that signed  in after us because we needed a high chair. This is my first bad review but I really thought other parents should be aware that they completely discriminate and make it almost impossible to get seated with a toddler. Finally... After getting seated 1.5 hours later, they weren't friendly or giving us service! Sad :(
author: Sean B.

description: Great and filling breakfast! Hash browns are so crisp and delicious. I had the spicy pork scramble, which was huge and had great flavors. Got there at 9 am and didn't have to wait.
author: Katy S.

description:
Great breakfast, great burgers.
My favorite sandwich is the bacon caprese.
Try to avoid the annoying 20 something's during peak brunch times.
Owners are a young mom and pop couple, he's on the grill and she runs the front.
Nice people, efficient staff.
author: Isley T.

description: MYMY I love you so much :) Always a significant wait but very worth it. I have been here twice for brunch and everything I have tried is delicious. I have a soft spot for the benedicts, I love their variety here. The eggs are PERFECTLY poached. Service is quick and efficient. French toast was also DELICIOUS, this is really one of the best options for brunch in SF that I have tried so far. Cost is reasonable too! The ONLY suggestion I have for improvement is to take reservations through opentable.
author: Anna J.

description: Why are people waiting in lines for an hour when this place is amazing and you are seated right away? So delicious and the presentation and spot on. The service is the best part of all. The hubs and I are so proud of our good find. Try the whole wheat pesto veggie crepe- it's amazing!
author: Molly J.

description:
Mymy is good for brunch, but there're always a long line. So be prepared. 

The crab cakes and omelets are my favorite. The french toast is good, but a little too sweet, just a little. Their coffee is good as well.
author: X L.

description:
I've been here a few times and have truly loved the food.  Great omelets and a place I have recommended others to go to.  My boyfriend and I went back this morning and put our name in.  We were about the 8th party in line.  After waiting for an hour, we noticed that our name was crossed off the list and noticed there was another party below me with the same name. A nearby customer also waiting in line mentioned he saw another party jump in our place. Rightfully so!  Im sure they thought the waiter was calling their name.  I pointed this out to one of the waitstaff, assuming they would want to address the issue, yet they responded frantically saying they called my name twice and no one came.  Then they went back to work.

I dont know, MyMY..... I dont think this will be the last time I see you, because your food kicks ass, but try practicing some basic customer service
author: Kasey D.

description: We stayed down the street from Mymy so we got to experience the city waking up as we walked to breakfast. Loved being immersed in it! So the bonus was the best pancake I've ever had (Lemon ricotta) and a lovely Bloody Mary to start the day. Thanks SF!
author: J B.

description: Second time. This time I read the menu. Fantastc, fresh food. My new favorite breakfast place when in town.
author: Scott v.

description:
[Second Visit - Downgrading to 2-Stars]
I confirmed that you can get in faster with just two people as we were second on the wait-list (behind a party of two) and only had about a 10-15 minute wait at 1pm. I still maintain that you shouldn't go here (or to Olea's) with more than four people or else you'll be waiting forever; and even a party of four will cost you more than 20 minutes. 

I remembered the food being pretty good my first time around and wanted to give this place a second chance. The Mushroom/Spinach Benedict I ordered was sub-par and definitely not worth the price. My friend got a sandwich and the only thing notable I remember about it was that it was a soggy mess (she ended up not eating the bread). Pretty different dining experience this time around and being a local, I think there are much better places to have breakfast. 

-------------------------------------

[First Visit - Rated 3-Stars]
Nice little place for two people. My Brioche Vanilla French Toast was very "artistic" and pretty good but I felt like I had to wait for literally for EVERYTHING:

I had to wait 10 minutes to sign the wait list.
I had to wait to get a seat for 45 minutes.
I had to wait for 10 minutes to order (after being seated).
I had to wait for my food for 35 minutes.
I had to wait for the check for 10 minutes (after asking)

I can think of much better places to spend two hours of my morning... I'd stick to only going here if you are on a morning breakfast date and definitely don't get here post-10am.
author: Andrew C.

description: I came here for brunch with a friend. I ended up getting the banana blueberry souffle pancake and she got the vanilla sponge french toast. Mmmmmm... they were both really yummy! Be prepared to wait a while, especially on weekends!! Once you're seated though, the service is pretty quick. I would definitely come back.. there's so much more i would love to try!
author: Mertani G.

description: Love this little joint  it's a cute little nice breakfast place I love the eggs benediction so good and perfectly cooked. My boyfriend got the mot burger which he was in love with and the potatoes were delicious  I was surprise that it was Asian own because the food was very American but it was good if you wanna have a nice breakfast try this place out
author: Jessica N.

description: Now I see the reason for the crazy-ass lines over the weekend! For those who don't have a few hours to spare for brunch and have time to go during the week, I highly recommend a late lunch M-Th to where you can get in and out fairly easily. The hubby and I did a savory-sweet combo where he ordered a yummy BLT eggs benny and I got the french toast with a side of hash browns. Oh the hash browns! I have never had paper thin hash browns like that - ever! So delicious, I could eat a couple plates worth and be happy. Seriously though, this is a place where you can order anything off the menu and be happy with it - a sign of a good brunch spot!
author: Lisa G.

description: Holy f$&@%k!!!! Have been many times to their sister restaurant, Griddle Fresh, in Noe Valley. This place doesn't disappoint! Like its sister, easily the best breakfast in SF. Fast, friendly service. Get the soufflé pancakes, six hour hash and good lord, those thin extra crispy hash browns. Weekday wait at lunch was much shorter here than in Noe Valley
author: Ottis M.

description: My my... that sure was yummy!  I had the Parma Benedict with fresh squeezed OJ. Delicious!  The combination of asparagus, tomatoes, mozzarella and basil -- wow!  I'm excited to come back and try more items on the menu.
author: R. B.

description:
MyMy is a super cute eatery. The outside is blue, so I almost missed it. Looks quite different compared to the pictures I've seen. Very cute inside, best for groups of two to four. 
French Toast:
Delicious, two large triangles, light and fluffy, sweet sauce and a good amount of fruit. My friend raved about how light it was. 
Pulled pork scramble:
Also very fluffy, nice chunks of pulled pork, tasty salsa verde. Opted for a side of asparagus instead of bread and potato. The asparagus is wonderfully charred. 
Peasant Lorraine omelet:
Lots of asparagus and delicious bacon. Hashbrowns are very thin and very crispy. Nothing left us with that heavy feeling. 
Coffee was average. 
Three entrees and two coffees costs us about $44.
We happily plan on returning.
author: Heather F.

description:
Fantastic place for breakfast in the neighborhood. Not your usual eggs/omelette-and-home-fries/hash-brown place. They definitely put thought into making a unique menu, which they should really post here to let people see what they're missing out on if they haven't visited yet. 

Also, if you're looking to impress someone with your knowledge of great breakfast places in the city, this is the place to bring them.
author: Ted S.

description:
We came here for brunch on a hot day (say what?) in San Francisco. The place doesn't have AC and stuffed. We all ordered lemonade to cool ourselves down. 

I got the pulled chicken with bbq for $9. YUM! 

Service is nice.
author: Margaret R.

description: I've lived in the area for over 20 years and have tried many great breakfast places, such as Rose's Cafe. This place I've visited several times but never wrote a review. It's cute and charming, and the service I've had has always been attentive. But the food is very average. It's in line with IHOP, Denny's and Mel's Diner. The portions aren't small, average quality food, and decent presentation. I honestly am confused with the 5 stars reviews. This is SF, and you can get much higher quality food at this price. But I've come for the convenience, but after the recent meal of an egg scramble, I'm rethinking. The dish was not good, a big mound of gloppy eggs, portions of it were soft and watery and others very dry. Just big mush with ingredients in there that I couldn't even clearly see. The hash brown was very thin and had a strange bitter taste. I don't know if the potatoes are old or there was some cleaning agent in the frying pan that didn't get washed off.
author: M H.

description:
Best pancakes ever! I had the lemon ricotta pancakes: incredibly light and delicious. Nicely complemented with colorful ripe fresh berries. Cheerful and fast service. No line at 2 pm Sunday.  Our water carafe was kept full. 
Addendum: I went back on a week day and placed the same order. Slow service, indifferent server, undercooked lemon ricotta pancakes.
author: K K.

description: I came here for my birthday breakfast while visiting my favorite city. BEST. BREAKFAST. I'VE. EVER. HAD!!!! While it was expensive, it was no doubt worth EVERY penny. Try the vanilla and orange infused french toast! It's thick, soft, yet lightly crispy. My friend enjoyed the harvest omelette. The coffee is also yummy. GO!!
author: Catalina V.

description:
Finally made it here after trying to for some time now. This place is always packed on the weekends, I'm talking line out the door, hour long wait packed. I finally got a day off where I could experience this place on an off day. I had the corn beef hash and the blueberry pancakes. Definitely an overload of food, but I felt the need to try more than one item seeing I probably won't have time to revisit anytime soon. The corn beef hash was delicious, but I wasn't expecting the eggs to come in a benedict style. That being said the corn beef was absolutely to die for and the fries were crispy and amazing. However, because of the benedict style eggs, the eggs proved a little too rich for my palette. I will probably specialize my order next time for sunny side eggs. The blueberry pancakes were really good and are made with a soufflé technique. These seemed a bit heavy for me, when I think of the concept of a soufflé, I think light and airy. 

All in all great flavor, coffee was surprisingly good but service needs a bit of help being quicker and more in sync with the kitchen (our plates came out 10 minutes apart from each other). I enjoyed this place and will add it to my recommended brunch spots.
author: Alex L.

description:
My food tasted great going down, but dreadful coming up.

Came here with a friend for coffee and shared an omlette. The hasbrowns were crispy and delicious and the omlette was light and fluffy. I thought - what a great find! - until I was ill with food poisoning and puking my guts out later that day. I traced back through everything I had eaten in the past 48 hours and (since I had been travelling with my friend the whole time) the only unique thing I had eaten that my friend hadn't was the cream I poured in my coffee at Mymy. The cream must not have been properly refrigerated...hence my terrible food poisoning. 

Be careful when adding milk/cream to your coffee here. It's risky (pukey) business! 

I hope they see this review and learn to keep everything properly refrigerated.
author: Alicia B.

description: So,  very nice place to sit and have some water,  but if you want that nice traditional tasting bfast, don't come here.  They have the menu the way they want and not much changing that.  My girl friend loved it,  I was okay with it.  I wanted pancakes, eggs and bacon,  they don't have that.  If you are looking for the common breakfast at a good price,  don't come here.  Two breakfasts for $34, are you kidding me.
author: Eric O.

description: The eggs Benedict are just so good. Especially the crab cake kind. The best way to get seated quickly is to go on a day with bad weather and/or try to get there around 9. Otherwise the wait is pretty intolerable. Going as a party of 2 is easiest. More than 4 is pretty impossible most days. Even busy on weekdays.
author: Carly K.

description:
We got there around 12:30 on Sunday and had to wait about 30 minutes for a party of 2.  It's conveniently located next to a coffee shop, so we were able to grab coffee while we waited.
Brunch was fine, but nothing was very memorable.  My friend got the Swedish pancakes, which was basically a crepe with no filling.  I got the Herbi omelette, which was good but nothing breathtaking.
Service was good and the prices were reasonable, I think each of our dishes were less than $10.  
This is a fine brunch spot, but there are so many other options for brunch in this area, so I'm not sure if I'd go back anytime soon.
author: Gloria N.

description: Good service. Pretty good coffee. 'It does exactly what it says on the tin' type food - not at all vegan friendly (other than lots of sides which pumps the bill up)
author: Mat L.

description:
Food was good. Had the Benedict.
Crispy hash browns and the flavors of the Benedict was delicious.

However, service was abysmal. 
The workers just seem to be in their own world, they would treat me as if I was wasn't good enough to eat there. 

While waiting for a table a women was leaving with a walker, I kindly stepped aside, but one of the employees made a huge deal of making me move out of the restaurant in order for this women to leave... Excuse me I'm a customer as well, did she tip you that well that you needed to practically shoo me out of the restaurant? Rude much.

Won't be coming here with such disrespectful service.

Mymy... Sorry not for me!
author: Steph Q.

description: Great food, excellent service and the wait isn't as bad as it may seem. They have a great system in place and turn tables quickly. We probably waited 10 minutes to be seated. It is small but they are efficient. Look forward to another brunch here again soon!
author: Kimberly M.

description: I went here a few weeks ago with my wife at the recommendation of a friend. There were a lot of people in line, but it only took about 20 minutes to get a seat and it was well worth it.  I ordered the Mombo Italian Scramble and I can tell you that it was amazing.  They put a lot of TLC in to their food.  I had a latte with it and that was great as well.  Loved everything about this place and can't wait to return so we can try more items on the menu.  I highly recommend  this place for an incredible breakfast!
author: Rob M.

description: Overrated. It's nice but if you want an extra toast, get ready to add $3.5. Go to Olea next door which is same quality but less posh.
author: Or S.

description: There's not one bad item on the menu. Had the French toast, chorizo tartine, zucchini pancakes, and the 6hours corn beef hash, but the Tex-Mex scramble is the greatest thing in the planet. Be advise, it can get busy, but the wait is so worth it.
author: Gilbert S.

description: I went there this past Sunday, ordered the banana blueberry pancakes totally awesome, however, I also ordered the eggs with bacon scramble and there was something that looked like paper towel/napkin mixed in the scramble , I showed the waitress and she immediately took care of it, really disappointing considering the reviews look good.
author: Darcie D.

description: This is the best breakfast I have had! The zucchini pancakes are delicious! Go early to get a seat!! If this place was open 24, I would eat every meal here!
author: Beth T.

description: I've never been here but I hear it's great. If anyone has any suggestions about what to order let me know. Also, how busy is it there on Sunday mornings? I looooove food yum
author: Peter H.

description:
Decent prices.  Fresh ingredients.  Attentive staff.

I came here for breakfast after finding that Nob Hill Grille is no longer open for breakfast during the week.  =(  

I wanted something different, and was tempted to go with the jalapeno and chorizo omelette, but then the Brunch Burger caught my eye.  It was described as a meatloaf patty topped with one sunny side up egg, onion, lettuce, tomato, and brown sauce on a plain or dutch crunch roll, served with fresh fruit or organic mixed salad.  ($9.25) I went dutch crunch and salad.  I also ordered coffee.

As I waited for my meal, my coffee was topped off constantly. I don't think I ever got lower than half empty.  When my meal did arrive though, I wished I had went with my first instinct and gotten the omelette.  It looked good enough, but it was not at all what I expected.  It was basically a regular hamburger on dutch crunch with an egg.  Although technically a hamburger patty is a meat loaf, it wasn't what made me order the dish.  The brown sauce is what made it taste like meatloaf, it was kinda like a meatloaf gravy sauce.  Boo.

I still ate it and enjoyed it, but if I knew I wouldn't have gotten it.  The salad was fresh, but probably came from one of those plastic organic boxes you get from costco.  

Overall, breakfast was okay.  My bill with tip was bout $15.  Not bad.  But with other breakfast options in the area, I'm not sure if I'll be back anytime soon.
author: Jon B.

description:
Had a wonderful experience here totally by accident. After our famished party couldn't get a table anywhere in 4 blocks, we walked into MyMy out of sheer desperation and would have eaten anything. I was blown away by my burger (the Griddle burger, with oyster mushrooms), and everything I saw on a plate looked equally delicious. 

This place is tiny, given the neighborhood, but they make good use of the space they have with efficiently spaced tables and a bar against the window. Nothing over-the-top decor wise, just very clean and simple and focused on the food. 

Beer options were aplenty (perfect to match their long list of burgers). I didn't really catch the coffee shop aspect of this place -- maybe because it was lunch time -- but for burgers/sandwiches, and beer, I found it a winner.
author: Christy B.

description:
Came to Mymy yesterday after my friend suggested it. Every Sunday night the three of us usually have "family dinner." Since they're both at Outsidelands, we did "family brunch" instead. 

When we arrived at 10:45(ish) we noticed there were 10 tables in front of us on the wait list. My reaction was to bounce, but we waited it out. By 11:15 we'd been seated. 

Mymy is cute and quaint, and the wait staff is attentive. BUT THE FOOD IS AMAZING! My girlfriend went for the sweet potato pancakes, I had the Tex Mex scamble, and my roommate went with the Pop Pork Scramble. His totally was the best, but we both liked ours quite a bit!

Reasonably priced. Not afraid to split checks. You'll leave happy. :)

I'm already craving the Pop Pork Scramble! I'll be back!
author: Annalise F.

description: After going to Mamas and seeing the line we decided to go try a spot called the Red door cafe but then saw on Yelp that they were closed on Wed so we stumbled across this place and I must say it was a great place to eat at. No line, friendly waitress which in my opinion is hard to find in Frisco, and some really good food. The OJ and jam for the toast was super fresh and delicious. The portions and prices were good. I got the San Francisco Omelette, my girlfriend got the Eggs tartine, and we both had the hash browns with our entrees. We were both happy with our selections and the service. Don't let the name fool you, this is not just a coffee shop. I would definitely eat here again.
author: Josh B.

description:
This is a good breakfast/brunch spot. The menu is surprisingly fun, and all the food comes out of the kitchen looking scrumptious. I had the french toast a bourbon sauce and lots of fresh fruit. It was awesome.

Of all the brunch spots I've been to in the area, this one tops my list now. I'd say get there early or you'll wait a while for a table, but it's worth it.
author: Halley S.

description: We had the Tex Mex Scramble and Crab Cake Benedict. Definitely one of the best breakfasts I've had in a long time. Wait staff makes an effort to get people seated as quickly as possible.
author: Kagarakis R.

description: Incredible breakfast. The French toast is phenomenal. The salmon benedict was great too. This is how kings eat.
author: I G.

description:
What a great neighborhood spot!  My boyfriend and I came here for brunch today, and we're always scouting out potential new weekend brunch places.  The inside is pleasant, cozy, and clean.  I even noticed that they keep a fresh pile of magazines at the front to entertain any waiting customers.

I ordered the marguerite omelet, which had sun-dried tomatoes, mushrooms, gruyere, and it was VERY good.  The hash browns were also super crispy and delicious.  The servers were really friendly and overall, we had a great time & were very pleased with the quality of the food.  Hope to be back soon!
author: Mel G.

description:
I love these thin crispy hash browns! 
Get here early to avoid lines because Sunday brunch gets packed.
author: Matt B.

description: I have only tried eggs benedict here, and they were simply epic! The eggs are cooked just right: not too runny but gooey. The toast is damn near perfect, with everything in between being proper as well. I am also a BIG fan of their hashbrowns, they are very crispy, just how I like it. The line outside usually moves faster then it would seem at first, and the wait is worth it in my opinion. One of my favorite breakfast places.
author: Alexander P.

description:
Very nice little place with friendly wait staff and good, filling comfort food.

I had the cheesy croissant scramble with hash browns and my husband had the Florentine Eggs Benedict. We were both very pleased.
author: Jill M.

description:
This place gets a 4.5!

Delicious!  Everything on the menu looked good and everyone in my party enjoyed their plates.  I love how they thinly slice the avocados.  I got an omelet, which was cooked perfectly as well as the hash brown.  The portions were big and worth the price.  

The only that knocks half a star for me is that I wanted an eggs Benedict, but for some reason they ran out of it(?).  I wasn't sure what they meant by that, but it was a little annoying.  It wasn't like I went late in the afternoon...  Like a lot of places in SF, the space is a little small and parking can be a challenge especially when there is construction.

The staff was decent, attentive and checked on us enough times.
author: Sola L.

description:
Thank you yelpers!! Came because of the reviews and was not disappointed. Excellent breakfast. 

Tried two different Eggs Benedicts - both were super yum. Also, a make your own omelet and Tex Mex scramble. Loved everything. The Tex Mex scramble had a lovely avocado sliced on top. So good! 

The hashbrowns were crunchy and wonderful. Service friendly - I will come back here for sure. 

Just a small diner.... But clean and perfect for a quick breakfast.
author: Cindy M.

description: I live close by to Mymy and always see a huge line every weekend.  I've been here twice now and their food is amazing! The service is a bit slow and they always seem understaffed, but the food makes up for it.
author: Kelly R.

description: Good spot but may take a while to get seated. Unique dishes and flavor profiles. Cheers
author: Mo A.

description: This place was great.  My wife and I are in town and chose it as an alternative to another spot closer to our hotel that was more crowded.  I hate a made to order scramble that was delicious.  It wasn't too crowded and our food came quickly.  This is more of a true blue diner type place, so you might be put off a little by the basic set-up, but the food was fantastic.  My wife ordered the Lorraine omelette, loaded with asparagus and bacon and LOVED it.  Worth the 20 minute all uphill walk to get here!
author: Roderick P.

description:
My Order: Lemon ricotta pancakes with a side of bacon and hash browns.  

The Good: Cute little place, friendly service and approachable menu.  Oddly enough I loved the large size of the water glasses, lol.

The Not-So-Good: The hash browns were cold and there was wwwwaaaayyy too much ricotta in the panckes.   

Bottomline: I could have skipped Mymy altogether.
author: Jen W.

description:
Finally tried this place after seeing long lines for the past couple months. 

I wish I hadn't waited!

The wait wasn't too bad by SF standards (30-40min).  Staff was friendly and attentive.  And the food was really good (lemon dill crab benedict).  They have plenty of other tasty options, so I'll definitely be back.
author: jeremy d.

description:
When the guy at the Fairmont says it's good, you figure it's good. Worth the walk down the hill, and back up. Scramble with polled pork, yummy! 
Quick service, nice simple decor, and excellent food. Five stars held back, by less than great coffee.
author: Nathan L.

description: I wanted everything on the menu. It took me awhile to decide. Food was great. Place is clean and quaint. Great service.
author: Lizzy G.

description:
The best omelette I've had in the last century...Anywhere.. Seriously..
Came here on a Saturday morning for a hangover breakfast.  We waited maybe 30 minutes, but considering that it was one of the warm and sunny days in the city, we didn't mind.  
This place is very cute and clean, service is great.
And the food... It was served so beautifully and neat that for the first time in my life I wanted to take a picture of it and post it somewhere.  And, of course, it was absolutely delicious!
This is the new breakfast spot, I will definitely be back.
author: Dasha B.

description: I'm a huge Benny fan and have to say that Parma Benny was F***ing amazing. Up there with one of the best Benny's I've ever eaten anywhere.
author: Matt M.

description: Yummy brunch. I ordered a delicious cup of hot chocolate and the yummy lemon ricotta pancakes! My partner had their mocha and chicken mornay. They were equally yummy! We got lucky with parking. I think we arrived around 10 or 11. Great food!
author: Jessie C.

description: The only place I would ever wait in line for!!! Delicious menu! There are so many choices it's so hard not to want to order one of everything....my favorite is the shrimp crab cake Benedict! So delicious! When you have brunch you want to splurge, this is the perfect dish! I will say, that I wish that they offered a short stack of pancakes or pancakes a la carte so that I could have it on the side of my meal! But maybe im just being greedy! Come here on a weekend with friends (wait is worth it) or come here during the week on a sunny morning! Either way the best breakfast you will have!
author: Christiana C.

description: Had the crab cake benedict from here with the crispy flat hashbrowns and it was bomb. Is it me or does everything here look similar to Griddle Fresh? Same owner perhaps? Bestie had the burger and he liked it too. I've seen pictures of some blueberry pancakes floating around on IG but have yet to try. I wanna go back soon.
author: Laura T.

description: I waited 45 for single seat at the counter near the door. Freezing cold. Waited another 20 minutes for burnt zucchini pancakes and overcooked over medium eggs. Total fail. I admit the other menu items looked good around me. I walked out disappointed. Trying Olea across the street...
author: Nicholas B.

description: I have to say I was disappointed. The hash browns were paper thin. The lemon pancake was not amazing either. Does not warrant spending $15 + tips for average breakfast.
author: Ah M.

description:
It's always difficult to find a brunch/lunch place that is good, but won't have a huge line. While the line looked daunting when we arrived at Mymy, it went by quickly. 

Just as a tip: it was not immediately apparent that you had to sign up on the waiting list inside. So skip standing in line behind people, walk inside to the initial nook area, and put your name and party size down. I'd recommend hanging by close, since they have a fairly quick turnover, and they have no problems with crossing people off as no-shows.

Mimosas were good, although expensive. I ordered the griddle burger and was very happy. I wish they had asked how I wanted it done, since it came more medium-well than the medium/medium-rare that I prefer. No matter, though, since the burger and it's mushroom fixings were great. The accompanying fries were great as well.
author: Bryce K.

description: The full crab shrimp cake benefit is soooo good. This place is a prime spot and so close. We live in the loin and make are way here for the great brunch.
author: Collette H.

description: This place is my fave discovered brunch spot so far. It is tiny in true SF fashion, so I would stick to two people unless its past the brunch rush or you don't mind waiting a half hour. This is breakfast done up just the appropriate amount so it doesn't go overboard into frou frou, which is always a consideration for the hubbs. Lots of good omelets and tartines. My personal fave is the Harvest Scramble. Amazinnng. Asparagus. eggplant, sauteed fennel...super scrumptious. Their hash browns are also super yummy but I always sub out a small bowl of fruit (the good stuff) for only $1.50. Recommend!
author: Nicole Z.

description: Got the Mambo Italian egg delight. Super good. Got in at 8:15 on a Saturday and sat right down. By the time we left at 8:45, there was a line out the door. Sweet vintage decorations with good music and plenty of staff to make your visit more the comfortable. And the hot chocolate was a good substitute for the mocha.
author: Ashley R.

description: Lemon ricotta pancakes are great especially with their jam. It's killer. Also their hot chocolate is out of this world. The best hot chocolate that I've ever had. The use chocolate and fresh steamed milk. Also their chicken Apple sausage and hash browns are great. The hash browns are perfectly golden brown and crispy couldn't ask for better.
author: Megan B.

description:
The rosemary potato pancakes with bacon and honey are really delicious.

The orange juice here is quite good too, even if it is a bit overpriced. Certainly worth a try if you're in the neighborhood and hungry for breakfast.
author: Sara D.

description: The food is delicious and service is super friendly! Would definitely recommend the blueberry meringue pancakes! They're unlike any pancakes I've ever had before. So fluffy and light.. And dreamy.. I also ordered the crab cake benediction. Delicious! I would also recommend coming here early to avoid waiting too long. We got here at around 9:30 on a Sunday and only waited 5 minutes. Can't wait to come back! :)
author: Krizia M.

description: First visit EXCELLENT with eggs bendict.This visit AWFUL with the sausage burger....undercooked sausage patty YUCK!! I will keep trying.
author: Ardyn F.

description:
I got the pancake and the OJ.  The portions were pretty small, and the prices were pretty big.

The service was nice enough, if I remember correctly.

I do remember getting a sick stomach later that day, so I wonder if Alicia B. and I were both plagued by something bad in the food.

Anyway, I might eventually come back here after checking out other brunch spots in the area.
author: Daniel D.

description: I called the restaurant to ask if they could make plain pancakes without the soufflé and the person on the phone said no they could not. When I asked why "she said because we do not serve it okay bye" and hung up the phone. I have been going to My My for over a year and this behavior was so rude I will no longer be going there.
author: Sylk A.

description:
I was really looking forward to swedish pancakes. They were not good, in face it was raw. So I sent it back. The waitress was nice & apologetic, and gave me a small bowl of fruit. While I waited, I sampled the other dish my boyfriend got. The thin hash browns are good. I got the second order, still raw in the middle. I ate the outside and left the raw parts. Lame! It's a super thin pancake. 

Another horrible thing is they garnished there plates with mint and what not, but they all had tiny bugs/larva on them. What's the point in decorating with infested garnish. Gross! 

I think the only reason why they are so busy is cuz of the wait at Olea. Olea is soo good. I will say that there sandwiches looked good, but they probably didn't bake the bread. Oh and they opened the front down some time after we sat down, it was cold & windy. When I asked them to close it, one of the asian dude servers said he couldn't because they need to keep the air circulating,so we had to put are coat & scarves back on.
author: Laurie W.

description: This place employs what has to be magicians that go into this tiny kitchen and make nothing short of a miracle. I tried the Mambo Italiano Scramble, the Sponge French Toast, Shrimp and Crab Cakes and the Banana Blueberry pancakes (my friend and I shared *don't judge*) EVERYTHING tasted incredible! Oh yeah, they have some of the best bacon I've had in years.
author: Chanel D.

description: This restaurant has been our go to brunch spot for years and due to mismanagement we will NEVER come here again. We were told the wait was 40 minutes and waited 2 hrs for a 4 top because the hostess mispronounced our tables name. When we asked what happened to our table she scolded us by placing our name at the bottom of the list bc she 'called our name'. There was no customer service, no apology. Great food, but blonde haired hostess sucked.
author: Stefano D.

description: I gather not many people order scrambled egg whites at this place. Mine were not even edible. It was some sort of thawed egg liquid whipped with a bar of butter.
author: Luc P.

description: Just okay. I had the create your own omelette. They charged $2 to swap fruit for the hash browns and $2 to substitute for egg whites. Disappointed it was $4 extra for healthier options.
author: Annie H.

description: Amazing!  Blueberry soufflé pancakes, tex mex, and hash brown special....one of the best breakfasts I've ever had. Also great, fast service. We'll worth the 30 minute wait. Definitely check it out!
author: Chad H.

description: Had the Tex mex scramble and a latte and it was delicious. Everyone at our table loved their dish. They have heaters above the outside tables, but the wait does take a little while since the restaurant is so small. I will definitely be coming back here.
author: Kelly M.

description: Delicious breakfast spot. Be prepared to wait on weekends, but we had 12 names in front of us and it didn't take more than 30 minutes. I had the salmon tartine and highly recommend! The eggs are so fluffy and the pickled onions and avocado paired with the aoli are the best combo. The salmon was really fresh too. The potatoes are simple but nice and crispy. My boyfriend had the Frisco scramble and it had such good flavor he didn't need any hot sauce or accompaniments. Service was quick and friendly. We had no drinks but our bill was only $27, super reasonable!
author: Megan H.

description: 4.5 stars, even though my pulled pork scramble didn't have much flavor. But both the hash browns and toast were literally the best I've ever had. Friend's ricotta souffle pancakes were amazeballs as well. Reasonable prices, and they come around with free coffee refills old school diner style. Friendly Chinese staff gave me a long explanation of why the bottomless mimosas were limited to an hour on weekends after I mumbled something about it to myself as one walked by.  But...is it better than Olea for brunch? Ask me next week. They'll have a hard act to follow. Edit: much better than Olea.  Bumping these folks to five stars, all things considered.
author: Nick C.

description: Great place for breakfast! Sidewalk dining with views were perfect for first day in SFO. Souffle pancakes were delicious! Hash browns and bacon were crisp and cooked perfectly. Carafe of mimosas just the right amount for two to start the day! Highly recommend!
author: Jonathan B.

description: Best brunch during my stay in San Francisco! I came here on a Sunday morning around 9 am and did not expect to see a crowd of people waiting outside. So glad I waited the 20-25 minutes - the food was well worth the wait. Their menu has many delicious options - it was tough to decide what to get. I ordered the baja eggs benedict (served on a sourdough baguette slice) and a latte. Perfect way to start my day! The sevice was great. The servers, while very friendly, are quick and efficient - their priority is to turn the tables (the restaurant space is quite small) while still making it an enjoyable experience.
author: Sarah V.

description: Yummy choice of my favorite breakfast, eggs Benedict. They had a variety to choose from and all sounded great. I chose Norwegian and it was delish with fresh fruit instead of hash browns. Small and quant atmosphere just the way I like and I was very pleased.
author: B. M.

description: Came here this morning for Sunday brunch and loved it! There is a wait, so we put our name in and then headed next door for coffee at Contraband - but be careful about leaving, because they will not wait for you. Between the three of us, we ordered the Mambo Italiano Scramble (delicious), the Norwegian Benedict (very good), and the Blueberry Banana Soufflé Pancakes (delicious). All three dishes come with these perfect, flat hash browns. Highly recommend this place.
author: Allie H.

description: Disappointed on this visit.  I've eaten here several times before, but quality seems to have greatly declined.  The food is no longer better than I can make myself.  For the first time, my wife did not clean even half her plate.  I wonder what has happened as this used to be our favorite breakfast spot.
author: Z Z.

description: No line if you come around 8:15AM but by the time we left around 8:45AM, the place was almost completely full. Great breakfast/brunch place. Frisco scramble was really generous with the avocado and was just overall really solid. Service is really friendly too.
author: Diana Y.

description: Hands down, best diner in the city and I have a diner addiction. You just have to go. EVERYTHING is FANTASTIC. Do it... Go there right now.
author: Sha L.

description:
This place is small and nice, my group and I came here for breakfast and were first in the door. We took some time to order, the waitress was friendly and brought us over some waters and made some genuine recommendations.
I ordered the corned beef hash chunks (?) with eggs, food came out pretty quick and was nicely presented. The serving size was perfect, and the chunks was a different approach to the dish. This place is ok, I might need to try a different dish next time.
author: Phill E.

description: Small cafe at the corner of California and Larkin Street with out door seating available. There is outdoor heat too for colder days in SF. The lady worked there in the morning I went was welcoming. She basically let customers to choose where to seat. I had the blueberry pancakes and they were amazing!! I will go back to try other dishes.
author: Lianna D.

description:
I got lunch so perhaps that's where I went wrong but I was so really unimpressed.  I ordered a the ruben and there was an upsetting amount of butter (oil?) on the bread, like waaay too much.  What the sandwich had in butter it lacked in meat, there were a few measly slices of corned beef and a ton of coleslaw.  

And is a ruben without rye, 1000 island and sauerkraut really a ruben at all?  just saying.
author: Kim U.

description: This place is great! We stayed at the Fairmont up the hill and didn't want to have the usual hotel breakfast. We stumbled upon this place as we wandered around the neighborhood and it didn't disappoint. I had the Frisco scramble, which was the best scramble I've had, and the service was efficient yet pleasant. I'd recommend it as a really good breakfast/brunch option.
author: Brian C.

description: I met a friend here for brunch and it was great! There was a bit of a line to get in (surprise, it was Labor Day), but it moved quickly and we were seated within a reasonable amount of time. We were served water right away and our order taken soon after. Everything on the menu looked good and I was very happy with my 'Frisco' breakfast! Loved the food and the service, too bad they're not open all day! Definitely worth a visit!!
author: Nikki J.

description: My husband and I were very disappointed today... both french toast and pancake were burnt...   also maybe ingredients were changed also?    Both tasted very different from our memories. ..  we decided not to finish them even though we were still hungry. ..
author: Sam A.

description: Food is good but not worth the 1hr+ wait for a table and then another 40+ min for our food. Maybe they can let you put your order in when you put your name on the list :-)
author: Michael K.

description:
From the first time I went to Mymy, it has been my very favorite breakfast spot in the neighborhood.  But now something has happened...

I went there in early May for some eggs benedict, amazing as usual, just before a 3 week trip out of the country.  The morning after I got back, I made it a point to hit up Mymy for some breakfast goodness...but something horrible happened.

Their amazing "Norwegian Benedict", which I ordered nearly everytime, had been mutilated and raped into a mess that was nearly inedible.  No longer is it served on a nicely toasted English Muffin, but a buttery sweet croissant.  Then they added a layer of carmelized onions, more sweetness.  Then of course the salmon, their groundbreaking hollandaise sauce...but what the, a layer of some type of crumbled feta like cheese and some capers sprinkled on top?  Way to ruin your hollandaise sauce!

Ugh, I was so heartbroken.  I guess they're trying to adapt to the American's sweet tooth, but this is just wrong.  You've ruined my favorite breakfast place!  They said they were able to make it the old way, but the next time I went there, no dice.

I can't even bring myself to come back here, I'm so incredibly sad about it.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
I was very disappointed at this place. For one if you are not their regular customer they won't treat you well. They charge for Honey by the spoon!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
1 spoon of honey= $1.00 you want more??? well pay more!!! 
I have never seen a place charge for honey!!! and BTW they didn't tell me. I saw the bill with all these $1 charges asked what this is they said oh it is for honey!!! 
Second I didn't like the pancake at all it was tasteless. 
Overall not going back!!!
author: Nina Z.

description: Started with a delicious lemonade, no refills :(. With they had a "one refill for half off" policy, or something like that. But it did taste fresh-squeezed. The glass was full of chunky ice. Their veggie harvest scramble is fluffy and flavorful with a hint of basil. Inside is a perfect amount of veggies; nothing is overpowering. I asked for extra avocado, and they sliced an entire half of a huge avocado, laid beautifully on top. They don't short ya on that! I received my order promptly. Light jazz plays over the speakers. Outside, the trolley passes by slowly, with its charming ding. Relaxing and just filling enough.
author: Zena B.

description:
The food was really good and tasty, but the service was absolutely terrible! 

I had the chive gorgonzola pancakes and my fiancé had the tex mex scramble- both delicious! However, from the second we walked in we felt that they wanted us to hurry up. We barely had the chance to sit down before the waitress asked if we were ready to order the food, and when we told her we hadn't had a chance to look at the menu yet she seemed annoyed. When we had finished eating and we're about to pay, she stood right next to our table waiting for us to get the f** out, with her cleaning cloth. We basically felt that we we're chased out of there, we had to bring our coats and get the dressed outside.
author: Anni N.

description: My new favorite breakfast place in SF. Great environment -- classic with a hint of hip. The pancakes and French toast others were having looked amazing. I had the Tex Mex Scrambled, which was fantastic, though a bit heavy on the minced chorizo. Tip: they allow substitutions.
author: Jason J.

description: I loved their hash brown plate. A thin crispy layer covering your whole plate. They have so many styles of egg benedict which was awesome. Great flavor combo as well. The place is VERY small, only has about 7 table in the whole joint so be prepared for a wait. Located in the beautiful Nobhill district. Will definitely be returning to try some more of their creations.
author: Caitlin C.

description: Great place for brunch! Lines look long but they move pretty fast, especially if you are only 2 people. We ordered the Baja shrimp benedict and salmon tartine and both were fabulous. The wedge fries and hash browns are quite delicious too. They have heated outdoor seating so that helps with keeping the wait short.
author: Mustansir M.

description:
French Toast Marscarpone please!!

Love this place especially because I used to live next door.  

Corned Beef Hash or the Garden Omelet were my go-to breakfasts, but I've recently moved out of the neighborhood.  

I miss you MyMys!
author: Alan S.

description: The chive and bacon pancakes with sunny side eggs on the side. I wasn't a fan of the honey drizzle but the eggs provided just enough sauce for dipping the pancakes into. The counter is my favorite spot. If you get here before 9 (they open at 8 on weekends) you won't have to wait in line.
author: Jay F.

description: Nothing out of the ordinary. My pancake had too much mascarpone cheese. Service was quick and friendly though (on a Wednesday afternoon) and there was no wait so I give Mymy three stars! My dad liked his burger on the other hand. I will likely be trying this place out again but will try a savory dish next time!
author: Goldie L.

description: Best eggs Benedicts ever and hash browns are perfectly crispy. The egg Benedicts aren't on English muffins but it is just as good. My only complaint is that it's a bit on the expensive side and the portions aren't that filling, but taste wise it definitely hits the spot!!
author: Sean W.

description: I have been to mymy many times to get my brunch fix. Every time it has been fantastic. Omelette, French toast, and Benedict are all great. The best thing on their menu is the hash browns. Hands down, the best hash browns I ever had. It's so crispy just the way I like em. The homemade orange juice is also excellent. I recommend this place to anyone wanting to have a great brunch. Solid!
author: Daniel K.

description: This place is great.  Food is excellent.  Only drawbacks are that line is always long and portions are a little small.
author: Lee W.

description: Nice place but not worth the wait. Poached eggs hard inside. Pancakes burnt so had to send back and by time new one came everyone else in our group had finished eating.
author: Donie L.

description: Nothing but rude service. Was not allowed a seat inside despite there being open tables and no line.
author: Jason W.

description: They did, what they claim to do, perfectly. Very efficient, friendly, delicious and reasonably priced. What else do you want from your breakfast place?!  Very imaginative food, executed well. Fully enjoyed and highly recommend.
author: Esti R.

description: Left a bad review for MyMy and I meant Olea!!!!! Sorryyyy!!!! MyMy was the sweet and yummy place we went to to escape the mean owner from Olea!!!!!!
author: Christina S.

description: Why people stand in line for this place each day is absolutely crazy to me! I would compare Mymy's to any other breakfast place - no frills. Go in, get your orange juice and your pancakes and be on your way. Across the street is a much better brunch place called Olea. If you're going to wait in line, wait in line there!
author: Sarah M.

description:
Spot is ligit. 

Great breakfast spot on nob hill. 

Good service at great price.
author: Paul O.

description:
Always a crowd but worth the wait! I yelped this place when I was visiting SF with family. It ended up being right around the corner from my hotel. We put our name on the waiting list and stood outside for about 20 minutes for a table.

The place is actually really small but the tables are always filled. The staff is very friendly and FAST. Their are always people waiting for a table so they serve you quickly which is nice after waiting for a table.

I ordered an omelette (Tex Mex) on my first visit. If you like a bit of spice in your food then this will be perfect for you. For those who want a more traditional pancake breakfast don't worry--there are plenty of options for the more traditional breakfast go-er.

Every time I go to SF this restaurant is on my itinerary. Awesome food, awesome service, San Francisco feel.
author: Autumn O.

description:
Been living in Nob Hill almost 5 years now and finally tried Mymy! Can't blame me for not having been here though -- the store front is pretty easy to overlook and the drawn curtains made me assume it to be a dingy and empty (suggestion for Mymy Coffee Shop, rip off those curtains!!)

Anyway -- so happy I tried it.  I love brunch and hate lines, so Mymy is perfect as an alternative to Dotties, Olea's -- or even as your first choice!!  The simple decor and fresh food in hearty portions made for the perfect start to a lazy Sunday :).  Pricing is moderate, with some menu items a better deal than others (e.g cheap omlettes, pricey benedicts):

We ordered:
--Pacifica Omlette ($11) -  Fluffly omlette filled with fresh shrimp, mushroom, spinach and swiss.  Fresh and simple like I like it.
--Croissant Scramble Sandwich ($6 w/o hashbrowns, $7.5 with) -- Huge sandwich.  Heart attack inducing, but delicious. Hashbrown are brown and crispy, definitely get.

See  you at my next lazy Sunday, Mymy!
author: Kendra W.

description: Hands down a gem with in the city...I can honestly say I have never had French toast this good...it has ruined my life for French toast forever..can't wait to come back!!
author: Hector V.

description: My husband and I grabbed brunch here. The food was pretty good. I had the Blt Benedict and he had the banana blueberry pancake. The hashbrowns were awesome! Very thin and crispy! The syrup wouldn't really stick to his pancake, but it was good without. They had a cream sauce on the plate for use. The service was pretty basic. They ordered our food and drink at the same time. So be prepared to get it together quick!
author: Ashton S.

description:
I new spot for me! I loved my eggs benedict dish! Perfectly cooked and fluffy in all the right places. 

Reason for my 4 star was that I was expecting a fluffy pancake but instead I got a wrapped thin crepe like pancake. It was still delicious but if its a crepe, put that on the menu!

I'll be back.
author: rachel w.

description:
Can you say yum??  I had brunch with a couple girlfriends to catch up and Mymy was the perfect place to go to.

The menu is fairly extensive, though I do wish they had corned beef hash (my fave breakfast/brunch treat).  They had 3 specials, including my dish - roasted vegetable scramble with balsamic reduction and goat cheese.  Comes with toast and hash browns for $12!  One of the other specials was a pork enchilada, and I can't remember the third...

Great deal, and really good food.  Lots of veggies, cheese, and balsamic to go with the scramble, though no one element was overpowering at all.  The hash browns are as good as everyone says, with the perfect amount of crisp on one side, but still soft/fluffy/creamy potato on the other.  My only complaint is that I didn't get more of it because it is so darn tasty!

If I lived in the neighborhood, I don't think I would have a problem working my way through their many omelettes/scrambles, benedicts, and other items.  

Service is friendly and I think the prices are very reasonable.  Cute spot!
author: Naoko M.

description:
Another case of me wishing Yelp did half stars, because this place is a step above average but not quite good enough to warrant a higher rating. I've been here a few times, mainly due to its close proximity to where I live. It's pretty good quality food, but the two strikes against this place are the wait time (which really isn't the fault of the establishment) and the price per portion ratio.

Eggs benedict ARE really good and tasty. The hash browns ARE deliciously crisp and golden. The fruit cups consist of fresh cut fruit (none of that canned or day-old stuff). But no pretty much no plate is under $10 after tax, and you really aren't getting THAT much food. I'd still say this place is worth a visit for brunch, especially if you're hoping to get into Olea across the street and turned away by its 2 hour wait time (though Mymy is only slightly better in regards to its big crowds). Another option is to phone in for an order! :)
author: Shira C.

description: First time me and the hubby try out this place.. delicious breakfast place.. must try the pancakes,  I don't really like pancakes but at MyMy there were delicious... if your ever in town come try this place out..
author: Angelica J.

description:
My. My. This place was pretty good. I had the eggs benedict with avocado, shrimp, and a mild jalapeno sauce (I forgot the actual name of the dish). I really enjoyed it. Quite flavorful. Cooked and presented to perfection. It came with a thin slab of hash browns, which were crunchy and goes great with ketchup. Everyone in the group ordered an eggs benedict dish so I didn't get to try any of the other dishes. 

I would love to go back in the future to try some of the other items like their pancakes. We found great street parking across the street. I loved the jazzy music that they had over the speakers. We went on a weekday at around 10 a.m. so the wait was only about five minutes for a table. The wait for the food was relatively quick also. I shouldn't have finished the whole plate but I did. I felt a little overwhelmed (a lot of cholesterol on my plate; eggs, avocado, and shrimp) at the end but that was my fault. I should have saved some for later. Oh well live and learn.
author: Cat F.

description: We stumbled on this place while visiting San Francisco for our anniversary. Easter morning and it was crowded but there were a few tables outside so we snagged one. Great breakfast!! Really interesting dishes with excellent presentation. They even made hash browns exciting. Excellent neighborhood spot. We were lucky to arrive a little early - buy the time we left it was packed and with good reason!
author: Laura C.

description:
