When I typed in the best eggs benedict on yelp, this place popped up.  Came here for breakfast today and it was OK.  The lady in the front of the house has a personality like a wall.  No hello, no goodbye, just meh.

The food however was good.  I had the traditional eggs bene.  The hollandaise sauce was good, the ham was very thick, the engish muffin could have been toasted a little longer, one of my eggs was cooked perfectly while the other one was a little overdone.  How is that possible?!?  The hashbrown is crispy though out.  If you like your hashbrown with no substance in the middle then this is it.

Can possibly get another star if the service was better.  I would come back to try some other items.  Their omelets look very good.

Will be back!!!!
author: jason g.

description: This place was so good. It's small and so make sure to get there early or you will have to wait in line. The Souffle Pancakes were delicious.
author: Adam S.

description: The best breakfast joint in the neighborhood hands down.  I always get the Frisco scramble or the surf and turf burger. Everything I've gotten there has been great.  My girlfriend always gets one of the benedictions and is always happy.  That's saying a lot right there!
author: Frank M.

description:
The wait here is usually about 15-20 mins for a party of 2 on any given weekend morning, anytime after 9am. This is just the way brunch happens in SF--you go to bed the night before with all the best intentions, wake up past 8:30am, and then walk over to your neighborhood brunch spot only to find a long, cruel line. How are so many other people also up already? How did they find your brunch spot? Who are these people?

Luckily, you'll have plenty of time to ponder these questions as you patiently wait for a spot to open. Don't worry, it's worth the wait. I'm giving this place three stars because there's no dazzle and the service is usually a bit curt. However, don't let my three stars rating fool you--the portion sizes are pretty generous and the food is consistently adequate (I mean that in the best way possible). You won't be disappointed when you go to MYMY, but you won't be blown away either.
author: Annie M.

description: Very good breakfast for a reasonable price. They have some classic options as well as some unique ones, and everything we tried was well prepared. Not much in the way of ambiance, and the tables are a little close, but the service made was good and we were glad we stopped in.
author: Daniel S.

description:
Just came back from Sunday brunch. Alex A., Neal L., and I originally planned to go to Olea across the street, but we were pressed for time and the wait at Olea seemed to be too long. So we just hopped on over to Mymy Coffee Shop, and I had faith it'd be good because of the favorable reviews on Yelp. There was a much shorter wait though - we were the next ones on the wait list when we put our names down. It'd be helpful if you have a party of two because they have many two-seater tables. We waited about 20 minutes for a table to seat the three of us, which isn't too bad.

I got the Frisco Omelette, Alex got the grilled cheese with jalapenos, egg, and chorizo, and Neal got the Italian Omelette. The omelettes come with your choice of toast, hashbrown, and a slice of orange. It was pretty heavenly. The Frisco Omelette had mild cheddar, scallions, and some sort of apple-smoked saussage with fresh avocado on top. The egg was soft and fluffy and all the flavors melded together perfectly. The hashbrown was cooked to perfection - nice and crispy on one side and still soft on the other side. 

I had a bite of Alex's grilled cheese. He thought it was amazing. I enjoyed it, but I liked my omelette better. I don't think I was in the mood for something as heavy as a grilled cheese for brunch. 

Everything was very affordable - around $10. And we were all stuffed to the brim. 

The service was nice and prompt. They only have a couple servers, but the restaurant was small enough that they were very responsive and didn't give you attitude like I feel most busy brunch places do. 

In all, I'm a fan, and I definitely recommend!
author: Jamie C.

description:
Oh mymy God! I forgot about rating the breakfast I had at MYMY.

It was so delicious! I* got two eggs scrambled well done with American cheese. Two turkey sausage. One buttermilk pancake with extra butter and lots of syrup. Cranberry juice. Coffee. Nice staff.

What more can I say other than Lesly and I (on her keen advice) made GREAT timing. We got there {...snap your fingers...} just before the AM rush. We were lucky enough to be seated within milliseconds of arrival. Next thing you know, the line was out the door. 

I hate to wait. I hate to be "those people" who are standing in the doorway, hovering over everybody else's table/food, glaring at the folks who are lingering around after their plates have been cleared, giving the side-eye to the waitress who won't hurry up with folks' checks. But this time, I wasn't among "those people."

We got in, got a good breakfast in, and got out. Add in a much needed walk home (groan, but up a huge hill, what is WITH THAT?!?!) and breakfast at MYMY was as good as it gets!

*The birthday girl had the honey ham steak, eggs over easy and the blueberry pancake. See pics. I tasted her ham. It was goooooood! see pics...
author: Kelly G.

description:
Says "coffee shop" but really more of a breakfast diner than a cafe. 

Good food. Reasonable prices. Good service. Innocuous easy listening. I'm a fan.
author: xx x.

description: Great service. This is the best food I have ever had in my life! The blueberry pancake has caramel all around it! This is just a really great restaurant. And I want to give Mymy 10 stars for "great food"!
author: Ben K.

description: I never leave reviews, but this was the best breakfast place I've eaten. I didn't expect pancakes could be like this. Fluffy pancakes, perfectly cooked crispy hash browns, and poached eggs.
author: Anthony N.

description:
Order Croissant French Toast+ 2 sunny side eggs- when egg yolk cover all over the toast, you can taste the beauty of this two mixture. I found another way to eat the toast!  

I saw some people compare MyMy with Olea. In my opinion, it is totally two different style of breakfast and brunch! I think Olea is fancier than mymy.
author: Rock C.

description:
SO GOOD!  Been here three times (Tex Mex scramble, french toast) and every dish has been amazing.  Best breakfast place in SF I've seen so far!

-the french toast marscapone topping is SO good, way better than at sweet maple

-prices are average, and the service is great!  get there before the crowd comes because it can get busy!
author: James M.

description: Best brunch in sf....the benedictions are incredible, pancakes and french toast are good too and if you like strong coffee they make the perfect cappuccino.
author: Juanita A.

description:
Some coworkers and I decided we wanted breakfast for lunch so we chose MyMy's since it was only 2 blocks away. There was no wait at 12noon which is always good since we only have an hour for lunch.

I got their Frisco Omelette. It was so delicious especially with all the avocado slices on top. *drool* Their omelette's are airy and fluffy. My coworker had the swedish pancakes with blueberries and that looked really good too. I'm going to have to try that next time.

Service was good and they are very friendly.
author: Jean T.

description: Absolutely not worth the 45 min wait for  Saturday brunch, however once we sat down and tasted the food it was fine! Service is ok, hurried with reason, a little pricy for what it is. I enjoyed a nice triple and only ate half of one crab cake~wouldn't order that item again. If it was my choice I would have gone to Top of the Mark~more my speed;)
author: yvette c.

description:
So this place has some decent dishes. I've been there on a weekday and was not super impressed, but intrigued enough by the sweet dishes that I wanted to come back to try them. 

The issue I have is with the service. The waiter I had during the week was a bit rude, but I passed it off as cultural as her English was a bit poor. 

Then I came back over the weekend and ended up waking out after being yelled at while in line to go in. Honestly, if a business is in the service industry, you just have to value customer service. We had our hostess come out and call our name, but it wasn't clear with her pronunciation, so a couple minutes went by and I thought to go in and just check to make sure that it wasn't us she was calling. I got openly yelled at in the restaurant. So.. We went across the street and had amazing French toast at Olea.
author: Craig d.

description: Nob hill's quintessential breakfast cafe/diner.  Lots of good hangover food here.  Nothing about it really stands out, but it's a fantastic place for a decent breakfast at a fair price.
author: Yan L.

description: Just stopped in for brunch with the bf. He unexpectedly ordered a hamburger which he never does, which was a pleasant surprise for him.  Throughly enjoyed. I have the Parma Benedict without prosciutto and it was fab. The bread got pretty soggy but such is life. The service sucked. We have been waiting the past 10 mins outside in a cold spot for the check.
author: Sophie I.

description: I really really enjoyed this place. Wait wasn't too long and the service/staff were sweet. I highly reccommend the caprese benedict. I don't think I left one bite on the plate it was sooooo tasty. I will be back!
author: Bree G.

description: Great grapefruit mimosas and eggs benedict. One of my favorite breakfast places in Nob Hill.
author: Alisha R.

description: Pillowy, delicious lemon soufflé pancakes... Unbelievable!  The crab shrimp cake with the lemon doll sauce was bursting with flavor and the corn beef hash tasted like it had been slow cooking for hours and hours.  There was a bit of a wait on a random weekday, but the food did not disappoint.  We will definitely be back!
author: Pooja S.

description:
The quality of the food is inconsistent; it can be wonderful to mediocre.
Most of the time the service is very slow, but overall not a bad place for breakfast.
author: Bogee B.

description: Had the blueberry banana pancake as well as the bacon with eggs. The blueberry banana pancake was so fluffy and perfect! Whenever I try blueberry pancakes anywhere else they tend to be undercooked near the blueberries but this one was delicious and perfectly cooked! The bacon with eggs came on a piece of bread which was good but soggy by the time I got to the bread on the bottom. The hash brown was thinner than I'm used to but very crispy and delicious! The service is awesome here as well! I will be back!
author: Jessica W.

description: The service is what brings this place down. After I've paid $12.5 for some of the most expensive pancakes in town, I don't want my enjoyment spoiled by a curt response that honey instead of maple syrup would be a dollar extra. Really? Since when was honey that expensive?! In fact 100% maple syrup is more expensive than honey, so are they serving you corn starch syrup instead of real maple syrup?! That's what I wonder when they feel the need to charge $1 extra for the tiny rationed container of honey, which barely covers one pancake. So, factor in $2 extra for your honey if you happen to be allergic to maple syrup - which may not even be maple syrup given that they view the honey as that much more expensive to charge extra for it!
author: FK R.

description: This place is amazing, the lemon soufflé pancakes and the home maid jam on grilled sourdough bread to the applewood chicken sausage just everything is good!
author: Stella A.

description:
Occasion: Post-partying breakfast with my little brother  

What I Had: 
Crab benedict 
Blueberry pancakes

Food Review: Granted I do crave fatty oily carby good food after a night out, this place fit the bill! My brother found it on his phone on the drive up, and the food was great. I am a huge seafood lover, and I love benedicts, so the crab benedict really brought two of my loves in life together in one beautiful assemblage of food. As for the blueberry pancakes, there's really something about blueberry IN pancakes that works like no other pancake and fruit combo can, and MYMY's did it fabulously. 

Service Review: Service was fine! My brother and I were actually here munching away and talking for at least a couple hours, and although it was a small restaurant, the waiter didn't rush us at all. 

Venue Review: This place is pretty small, but it's very clean and tidy. There are some large windows at one side of the restaurant which let in plenty of light in the day, so it didn't feel cramped at all.  

Overall Impression: LOVE this place. I don't know about the rest of their meals, but their breakfast foods were stellar, and it's a cute little restaurant that's perfect for small groups and quiet.
author: Rachael K.

description: Mymy coffee shop is delicious! The service is really fast and efficient and the food is always consistent.  I pretty much always order an eggs benedict because they have so many different styles I never get sick of them.  The hollandaise is light and lemony and they don't overdress the eggs either.  The eggs are always perfectly cooked, not too runny but not too hard either. The only negative would be that on weekends the wait can get pretty long so go early or be prepared to wait a while.  Otherwise, an excellent breakfast go-to with lots of delicious selections!
author: Charlotte B.

description: Their hash brown was great! It's thin and crispy just like how I want it. I ordered the chives pancake, trying to go with something different. But my tastebud did not agree with the taste. It's a bit too weird for me although I like to explore different food. The only comparison I could think about when I ate this was when I tried chocolate garlic ice cream. Maybe it's reserved for the more adventurous foodie. I'll skip. My friend got crabcakes but I didn't try it. It looked great though. Waiting is given because the place is a bit small and cramped. They have outdoor seatings too and will probably nice to be seated outside rather than inside
author: Cliff T.

description:
Classic relaxed diner feel, spendy-ish meals, mine was tasty. I had the Orignal Benediction - plenty of food. Yes, the hash browns are yummy and the coffee, mmm just right!
*Eggs Benedict and Coffee = $16 + tip
author: Megan Marie M.

description: I eat at MyMy every weekend and have brought every friend and family member here... I'm from Vegas and I'm pretty sure everyone I know in Vegas has come here when they visit just from all my Instagram photos. You won't find better brunch in San Francisco... You could try, but you would not succeed.
author: Emma D.

description: Long wait during weekends, but well worth it. The California eggs Benedict are what you want. Also try the lemon ricotta pancakes and add in some crab cakes if you want to go all in.
author: Walter Z.

description: LOVE mymy for breakfast!  My parents were recently visiting and we went to mymy for breakfast two days in a row!  The pancakes are the BEST I've ever had (both the lemon ricotta and the blueberry banana), and the salmon tartine is to die for.  Good service, strong coffee, and tasty food - what more can you ask for?  The place fills up quickly and is my new favorite neighborhood spot.  Check it out!
author: Angela R.

description: Since I hadn't eaten any crab during my entire trip, I figured this was the place to get my fix and still get breakfast.  At first, I thought about going to Mama's, but I ain't waiting an hour for food.  So we made the trek here and only waited 10 minutes for a table.  The crab benedict, crispy hash browns, and blueberry pancake (which was thin and tasted more like a crepe) were really good.  Their chicken fried steak with cream of mushroom gravy was...uh...alright.
author: Carol S.

description:
meal :: saturday brunch on a holiday weekend 
not sure if everyone was out of town or what, but the wait time was very reasonable.  30 mins for a hoping brunch joint?  you can't get that at mama's or plow!

{ service :: 4/5 stars }
* servers were friendly 
* coffee refills were not automatic

{ food : 4.5/5 stars }
* baja california benediction, 5/5 stars - flavor explosion in your mouth, the pepper aioli was mouth watering good
* blueberry souffle pancakes, 4.5/5 stars - great flavor, but the yummy souffle sauce did not smoother the pancakes, like they did in other pictures.  we just wanted more of that yummy souffle sauce!
* house made sausage, 5/5 stars - party in my mouth, although it does induce garlic burp-a-thons, that pack a huge punch! worth it though!  even the ones around you that must endure the punch(es) agree, it's worth it
* fresh grapefruit juice, 5/5 stars - always on the hunt for good g-juice, and this satisfied my craving!  only way it might have been better if i also had a version w/prosecco/sparking wine with it!  

{ atomosphere }
* it is a small space, you will be close to your 'neighbors'. get comfy and hope they showered after their AM jogs. ladies, leave your big purses at home.
* not a fancy place, but who cares they have good food

we'll definitely be back. hopefully the short-ish wait time wasn't a fluke!

happy eating!
author: Tina F.

description:
This place is so amazing that we went there twice during a five day visit.

All-in-all, I sampled the: San Diegan omelette, Frisco omelette, Pulled Pork scramble, French toast, Eggs Benedict (Classic and Italian). Everything was delicious. The Benedict's are spot-on, and as a hash brown lover I insist that everyone try the hash browns.

They also have fantastic service, from filling coffee cups to refilling tea pots, it's a pretty exceptional level of attention fron such an unassuming place.

Funny side-note: not all the omelettes are the same shape. Kind of funny, right?
author: Sheila S.

description: This is a one-of-a-kind brunch place with an Asian flare. I wouldn't go because of that uniqueness, because it's not that interesting, though. The atmosphere isn't bad, but it isn't the best, and it feels like San Francisco (i.e. stand in line for everything, sit in crowded places for everything), but man, the brunch food is good--everything from the egg dishes to the fluffy as f*** pancakes.
author: Keito U.

description: When the wait outside Mama's was too long, we decided to go here and we were more than impressed.  Cute little breakfast café with excellent food, I ordered the Norwegian and I am still thinking about it days later.
author: Brittany B.

description:
Word of the Meal: RETRO

This was my third or four time at Mymy Coffee Shop. It is usually my go to spot for brunch after hitting the gym on the weekends, especially if the thought of standing in line at Dottie's, Mama's or Brenda's is unfathomable. Don't get me wrong, Mymy is definitely a contender! I have never had to wait for a table; although, there is some limited space. The service is great and attentive. Some days the water is too warm for comfort and it can get hot as there is a lot of storefront windows and sunshine. On this particular visit, the Mister had a Frisco scramble and I has the chorizo tartine. Both were delicious. I would definitely come back for the chorizo tartine, much recommended! 

The best part about Mymy is that there is a subtle feel of a Japanese translation on on American retro. Having been to Japan before, the consumption of American culture - particularly the concept of Americana - is palatable. It's cool, retro and delicious! Definitely a win in my book!
author: Sean A.

description: Found on Yelp while vacationing.  The breakfast is amazing!!!  Every dish we tried was great.... great menu...some unique options.  As others say, there is a line but it definitely moved quickly.  I highly recommend this spot.
author: Jacob C.

description: This is a solid brunch place and a creative step up from the cookie cutter menus seen at every other comparable establishment. I have never been disappointed with my meal here and try to get something different every time. The wait staff is friendly and even though the place gets busy, they come around frequently to refill coffee (and I'm sure in part to turn over the table as quickly as possible). Would I wait 75 minutes in line as one previous reviewer did? Nope. But I will be back.
author: Sarah G.

description: Fresh squeezed grapefruit mimosa carafe for $18, amazing selection of benedicts (we tried the Baja and it was incredible), and other house specialties including some savory pancakes (got the zucchini, was a little sweeter than expected but definitely worth trying). This just went to the top of my list for brunch spots - we will be back!
author: Alex D.

description:
This place is GREAT! They had the best BLT Sandwich I've ever tasted. The service was great, the food was simply amazing. 

The only negative was the wait, and our seats were outdoors in the hot sun. But still worth it for the food.
author: Jonathan N.

description: Mymy is the best brunch I've had in SF and that's saying a lot. The portions are solid, prices decent and the food is delicious. The servers aren't the happiest I've seen, but they look really busy. I was a little annoyed the table next to us who ordered after got their food first, but no big. Tex mex and the blueberry pancakes are the must haves!
author: Emily H.

description: Went on a semi busy day so we didn't have to wait for a table. Walked in and were seated fast. Food was amazing!!! Ordered the French toast and it was so good. Will definitely be back the next time I'm in town. Found this place because the hotel receptionist recommended it. Glad we listened to her. Service was fast and good. Nothing sloppy at this place
author: Lydia O.

description: Hands down one of my favorite brunch spots! I have ordered a variety of dishes and have never been disappointed. My favorite is the Eggs Benedict. Their service is fast and extremely friendly. The line for brunch of the weekends can be quite the wait, but totally worth it!
author: Monique L.

description: Not totally mind blowing, but the service was good, the food was pretty good - a little oily in parts..  But all in all, not a bad place.  There was definitely a crowd of people and they moved people in and out pretty effectively which is always a plus on a busy weekend morning.
author: Edgar C.

description: Quality Breakfast!!!! Waitresses seem to have scowl look when serving but otherwise good food.
author: Sh J.

description: The wait (20 minutes on a Saturday 1.30pm) was well worth the brunch! Had the eggs tartine with an orange mimosa that packed a punch! So yummy. I don't know what it is that they did with those eggs but they were absolutely delicious. Its a bit cramped/cozy but focus on the flawless food and company and you'll be fine. Going back to try more!
author: Tee K.

description: I have been to Mymy a few times now and I love it.  They do things with eggs that make you question every breakfast you've ever had. The TexMex scramble is ridiculous, and the french toast has mascarpone in the middle.  Honestly, was not familiar with mascarpone, but it was awesome.  A little pricey for breakfast, but it's pretty worth it.  Oh, and my wife loves the BLT Benediction.  I also think it's good.
author: Kyle M.

description:
I love the banana pancakes. They are light yet rich and just plain delicious.  I should have taken the syrup pitcher off the plate because it spilled and the too sweet taste slightly contaminated the wonderful pancakes. 

The coffee was good, the service was very attentive. But the pancakes . . . You must try the pancakes.

Oh, also had a side of crab cakes - which were good, even very good. I was less than thrilled when I saw they were deep fried, but they were really good, especially with the sauce. The pancakes, though, order the pancakes they are INCREDIBLE.

I didn't see a wifi connection. Forget wifi, enjoy the pancakes.
author: Serena U.

description:
My second day in San Fran I acquired a cold. This review is based solely on the looks of the restaurant and food because my taste buds were non existent at this point. 

Stopped here for breakfast. The decor is cute. It looks like a little place in someone's home. 

The portions are GINORMOUS. Come with an open appetite and plan not to eat for the rest of the day. The hubby tells me that the hash browns were the best he's had by far.
author: Monica C.

description: Located in a neighborhood with safe and decent parking unlike dotties. Food was great especially the hash browns, service was fast and smooth. Pricey? maybe a little but they serve big portions. Didn't have to wait for too long for a table, either. I'd go back again!
author: Thara F.

description:
Love this place!  Tiny little dining area.  Casual, but obviously they take their food seriously.

Gorgeous omlettes and the hash browns are amazing.  I wasn't planning on eating much of the hash browns (carbs!) but they were just so good I couldn't help it.
author: Darcy J.

description: Delicious! Had the scrambled eggs, hashbrowns, bacon, and toast. Classic and simple and oh so tasty!! Service was great to boot! Not only better food than other "more popular" places, but less expensive too.
author: Samantha M.

description:
I've been here a handful of times for brunch now and I can say this place is consistent and delicious every time!  Don't let the lack of ambiance fool you - the food is definitely legit.  

I can recommend the turkey avocado omelet - my fav!  The portions are quite generous so be prepared to be stuffed.  The hash browns are excellent as well.  

I've been here when there wasn't a wait and sometimes there's a 45 min wait so it's a toss up.
author: Jennifer I.

description: Because I think the food was special and taste good when I came here the first time. That's why I bring my friend, drove about 30 mins all the way here from Daly City to just check out the restaurant again. But the waitress with light brown hair talked loud when we have some questions about the menu. We think that's rude and impolite.  So disappointed!!!!!!!!
author: Annie L. L.

description: I had the French toast and the lemon souffle pancake. They were both amazing with great taste. I would definitely come just for the lemon souffle pancake.
author: Andreas C.

description: A cute little French/American restaurant with a casual atmosphere, indoor and outdoor seating, and very good food. There was a unique but delicious variety of breakfast options to choose from. They have a great selection of Benedictus and the hash browns were delicious and crispy:) service was also very good.
author: Leah R.

description:
This is a great place for breakfast! I'm not really a breakfast guy, but I love their food here.

It has the look and feel of a dinner, but the food is (in my opinion) much better than you expect it to be by just looking through the window. Not that the place looks bad at all -it's clean and spacey- it's just better than you expect. They do mostly traditional food. Nothing to crazy I think.

I've had the benedict eggs every time I'm here, and they've nailed them real good each time :)

I wouldn't recommend for parties larger than 4 people. And if I remember correctly, it's pretty affordable.
author: Gerardo C.

description: Great brunch spot in the neighborhood. Hash browns superb and crab cake benedict was fantastic as well. Mimosas made of fresh squeezed orange juice. Wait wasn't that long at all. We were 8th in line and we're able to get a table in about 30 minutes. Definitely would recommend to anyone who lives in the area or are looking to add another great brunch spots to the weekend rotation.
author: Anthony D.

description:
My only advice when visiting MYMY's is to come hungry!!
Veryyyy hungry!!!!

They do not skip on the portions here! All the omelets are stuffed with heavenly goodness. BUT my favorite part of this mammoth breakfast plate was the hash browns!!  I'm usually a home style potatoes kinda girl but these are the best hash browns ever! Thin crispy and ohh so yummy.
author: Jackie S.

description: This place has the best ricotta pancakes. Omg. Our food came out quick and we were super happy with our meal. Lots of amazing choices here.
author: Humboldt C.

description: Best French toast in Nob Hill! 5-star service as well.
author: Saurabh D.

description: Wow was this meal delicious!! BLT benediction hit the spot!! Fresh squeezed OJ too!!
author: R A.

description:
One of the best omelets that I've had in a very long time. Thick, light and fluffy. Filled with lots of great stuff too. 
They have decent pancakes and good coffee.  They are famous for their "Benedictions" Egg Benedicts. I'm not a fan of any variety, so went for omelet. You won't be disappointed.
author: Robert P.

description:
I was a local and I used to love MYMY. I went on my own and also took friends and family there since I moved to the neighborhood over that last year. That was until they changed their seating policy. 

At first, I was reluctant to standing in line to sit in a restaurant, I think it's a silly and ineffective way to handle customers since in my teen years, I had hosted and served in restaurants. I gave it a shot. I stood in line with about 3 parties ahead of me. Then the head server, asked how many each of us had. There was only 1 party of 2 ahead of me, 1 of me, a party of 2 behind me. She chose to seat the party of 3 (after the party behind me) and after the people ahead of me and myself had been already waiting 10 minutes. I went inside to ask for a manager or an owner. No such luck from the staff about being so forthcoming so that I could give feedback. The server came in and I said, "You changed your seating policy and you sat those 3 when others and myself had been waiting." She was going to explain that it was because the table was for 4, but I saw that the table was able to be split so she could have sat the party of 2 ahead of me and myself on separate tables. I said, "That is not the point." She had nothing to say and basically opened the door for me to leave instead of trying to make the situation right or apologizing. Poor Poor customer service, especially since I had been there before. Even if you love the Salmon Tartine, who wants to be treated this way when they are just trying to get some breakfast? Good luck on keeping your repeat business, severely disappointed and won't be back.
author: V H.

description: This is out 3rd time here and we look forward to this breakfast every trip to San Francisco. Excellent food and service.
author: Sandra S.

description: Breakfast on last in in sfo- server was rude to my sister so it ruined it for me. Though the breakfast was tasty and the ambiance is quite quaint. I may go back for more eggs.
author: G T.

description: This is a no frills operation, but that's where the charm lies. If you like diners and greasy spoons, come here. The food is indulgent and delicious, but nothing too out of the box. I wouldn't choose it for a large brunch gathering--it's better for one or two people.
author: Caitlin T.

description: Great brunch spot. You're definitely going to have to wait in a nice line on the weekends. The servers are hard-working, but give you enough attention. The food was excellent and well-portioned. Fair brunch prices. Definitely a new go-to brunch spot.
author: Lauren P.

description: Love this place! If you're a crab cake fiend like me, you'll enjoy the lemon crab shrimp cake benediction. Definitely worth the wait! And I've found that even with a line outside, they do move tables rather quickly. I will gladly come back.
author: Riz W.

description: Stopped in on a Tuesday around 10am, ordered the Texas scramble- it was SO. GOOD. The hashbrowns were fantastic. Such a great breakfast. THANK YOU.
author: Donna P.

description: I love pancakes and these are really different but in a good way. The soufflé element gives them a light airy texture and the fruit flavors really come through.  Nice syrup is not straight corn syrup. The hash browns are awesome diner style plate covering hash browns cooked just right.
author: Bobby H.

description:
I love it here! It's GOOD brunch at a reasonable price and without all the crazy lines! Though I DID have to wait 20 minutes, it wasn't even half as bad as the brunch spots across the street! I just used that time to decide on what I wanted to order. Plus, the service is GREAT- it's quick, flexible and adaptable... as soon as they seated me, I told them I already know what I wanted to order, and they took my order RIGHT away. 

Their blueberry pancakes= 5/5!! Not only did they have blueberries cooked IN the pancake, but they also put fresh blueberries over the top. It comes with whipped butter and warm syrup on the side. Warning, these are NOT the thick, fluffy American pancakes that you'd usually get at places like I-Hop or Denny's. These are delicious crepe-like thin pancakes, so I don't feel like I'm swallowing a lump of dough when eating these.

Since it was our first time there, we decided on getting the Denver omelet= 5/5! It comes with hash browns and your choice of various breads. I got their English muffin, and I was severely disappointed by how much they over-toasted it! However, their hash browns TOTALLY made up for it! They were the thinnest hash browns I've ever EATEN! I usually hate thin hash browns, because it's always disgustingly crunchy. But they ensured that each sliver of potato was nicely browned on both sides without making it into potato chips. Love it!
author: Rose W.

description: Once again a great experience.   The corn beef hash with potatoes and eggs is a must to try.  MY MY is by far the most fantastic place to eat breakfast or brunch or lunch. For locals or tourist. DONT MISS THIS PLACE!
author: Paul B.

description: The wait for this place was sooo long, although I did have a rather large party (12 people) and it was early Sunday afternoon. The staff here was very kind to us; they held our table for an extra couple of minutes while the rest of our party was looking for parking. I had the Big Papa Burger and the wedge fries, and oh my goodness, it all tasted delicious. The burger was one of the best I've had and the wedge fries were perfect: crispy on the outside, hot and soft on the inside. Everyone else was very pleased with their food as well, though I was much too preoccupied with my own food at the moment to really care about anything else. ;)
author: Sandeep D.

description: creative brunches, friendly service, reasonable priced. GO !!
author: tj d.

description: Love the omelet here.  I think it's the best omelet I've had in SF -- and I like to think I've been to a couple of brunch places.  The place is extremely small so you'll most likely have to wait, but I thought the wait wasn't too bad.  The service is really good and the wait staff is very friendly.  As a warning, the portions are huge -- I couldn't finish my omelet and I barely made a dent in my hash browns.
author: S R.

description:
I'm going to go on the counter sense here, but I'll blame this 70% on management.
I went there with my husband on the 26th and we had a LOT of problems with the service. First of all we saw the server calling out names in the wait list and I asked if I could put my name down. She simply told me to wait and DIDN'T tell me that I had to put my own name down... By the time we figured it out, 2 other ppl went on the wait list ahead of us. I understand she was busy, but you have to explain how things work for the first time comers. 
Then, the same person with the wait list incidend ended up being our server. And she managed to make things even worse.
First if all, she came and ANNOUCED (literally for everyone to hear) that she was going to take the order for the new tables all together. I mean, I'm a server as well so I understand that you need to be efficient when is busy and it's totally ok to take the order for multiple tables at once, but don't EVER yell at the customers: "ok! I'm gonna take all your orders at once!". That's just poor service... 
After that, she made clear she wasn't paying any attention to what we order when she asked if we wanted drinks right after we order an orange juice.
Then, after our food came, she never came to check back and it took so long for us to get the check that I had to go inside and pay at the register.
I understand they are super busy, but you either put one more server on the floor or train your employees better.
The one star goes for the food that tasted amazing!!
I really hope a manager will read this and do something about it.
author: Cecilia S.

description: By far the best breakfast I have ever had, and by far the best in SF. I started off sharing the banana pancakes with my boyfriend and they were divine, then the crab cakes, and then the Parma benedict. They have a section called benediction dedicated to several different creative benedicts. This place was exceptional and very creative with the items on their menu! You should check it out if you are in the area!
author: Rachel H.

description: Just awesome!!!! Can't say much else if mom's likes it thats the best compliment i can give.
author: joseph g.

description: This little restaurant is great for a quick breakfast any time of day. The menu has a nice variety. I had the lemon soufflé pancakes and they were delicious and very unique. The coffee is amazing, I'm very picky, I had it with a shot of espresso.  The service is very friendly.
author: Karen B.

description:
we tried this place for Sunday Brunch after reading the yelp reviews.  Well, the reviews hold true...this place is really good and yummy!  The hash browns are so crispy and tasty.  I had that with the sun dried tomatoe, mushroom, guyere cheese.  I added avocado  and made it an egg white omelette...and well it was really flavorful, tasty and delicious!!!

the portions are big, so you won't be leaving hungry...although you may need to be rolled out of there!  give it a try...i think your tastebuds will thank you for it!
author: Mao K.

description: Excellent, fresh, flavorful breakfast food, especially the hash browns and parma benedict. Small space, friendly people, line on the weekend but not so much on weekdays. Consider ordering extra hash browns because you'll want a whole plate of them to yourself. Coffee's not good. If they started sourcing it from Contraband next door this place would be perfect.
author: Cecilia L.

description: Great breakfast place is SF.  Norwegian Benedict and the poached eggs and corned beef hash are my favorites. Great service. This is how you do breakfast.
author: Rob B.

description:
Despite it's unassuming exterior, MYMY Coffee Shop is the real deal.  It's not often that I pay a second visit to any restaurant when on vacation.  You want to try as much as possible.  That being said, MYMY more than earned its return visit.   Why, you ask?  Let me tell you.

Solid, reliable good food is the fare at MYMY.  They don't mess around with props or attitude.  The place is clean and run in a very efficient way.  The coffee is good diner coffee and they seem to clean the pots so, the coffee is never oily.  We never really ordered anything beyond egg white omelets and a side of fruit, so I can't say what their specialties might be.   OK, we split a pancake to be precise but, it was all done very well.  That's the point of a good diner and if you don't need parsley with your eggs then this is the place to consider for a great breakfast on Nob Hill.  

There were times when people had to wait but, never for very long.  The service was prompt and always polite.  That's why we went back!
author: Chris C.

description: It was love at first bite with the Lemon Ricotta pancakes, and enough for me to consider never brunching anywhere else in the city again. There's plenty of seating inside and the wait is much faster than Olea across the street. The only downside is they are only open until 2:30, so be sure you're not having a late brunch!
author: Staci L.

description: This place is amazing, best breakfast in nob hill by far and definitely up there in top brunch spots.  I had a chorizo scramble that was delicious and the hashbrowns are like no other.  I recommend this place to anyone that loves gourmet food and the service is exceptional!
author: Kelly B.

description:
We definitely recommend this for a weekend brunch, for the food if not for the atmosphere and service (which was a tad lacking - see below).  We had stopped by Mama's previously and were deterred by the long wait.  We arrived at Mymy's by 9:30 on Saturday morning, waited about 15-20 minutes and were seated inside, which is a perfectly nice atmosphere for dining.  The  Norwegian eggs benedict was DELICIOUS with very generous and good quality lox, capers and a wonderful sauce and spinach.  Highly recommended!  
The ricotta pancakes with berries was also delish!  Don't forego the unusual and tasty, crispy hash browns!  

The only word of caution is that the service is not stellar; the servers were pleasant, but we were not offered  coffee refills - had to ask for them and then were told they were brewing a new pot of coffee.  Really? On a Saturday morning at brunch "rush hour" you don't have multiple pots of coffee going continuously and someone walking around refilling cups continuously?  Then we had to remind the server again when we saw her refill others' cups but not ours.  This is the only negative I can see to the place.  Otherwise, it lived up to a four-star rating for sure!
author: Sandra S.

description: The sponge french toast was pleasant, not too sweet. The hash browns are distinct, fried with a lot of care. Service was prompt. Nice little cafe.
author: Bob C.

description: Holy smokes! The Texmex scramble is worth moving here for! Stop reading reviews now, just go there and eat already
author: Christian N.

description: First breakfast on our SF weekend vacation. Came in very hungry after a 45 minute wait outside. Ordered the Mexican scramble and the crab cake benedict. The hash browns were fabulous, the benedict was fabulous. We seriously gobbled it down so fast I couldn't really distinguish much but the poached egg on top of my benedict was perfect. A great, cozy little breakfast spot with a huge wait.
author: Aaron S.

description:
Love this place!  Have been going here about two or three times a week for the last six months and their food is delicious.  Their blueberry banana pancakes are a favorite.  Yes, it gets busy, especially at the weekends so you have to sign the sign-in sheet but the food is worth waiting for.  I've given it four stars instead of five for these reasons.

1. Because they get so busy, sometimes your food is left up at the counter for about five minutes before they bring it to you.  I have first hand experience of this, confirmed when putting the butter on the pancakes and it does not melt!  A small thing but I prefer my food hot, not warm.
2.  The chef(s) can't quite grasp the concept of making the hash browns 'crispy' on both sides. Whether my request is 'lost in translation' is hard to say.
3.  When you ask them for a top up or a question, they sometimes can get defensive and again, this might be because it is lost in translation or they are very busy.

These negatives are minor annoyances as the bottom line is the food and the service.  The girls are really friendly in their greetings and accommodating and all the wait staff work really hard, as do the chefs.  It's a neighborhood favorite and I would rather pay a little more here than go somewhere else for a little cheaper.  It's a small place, intimate, clean and affordable.

Try the blueberry and banana pancakes - I would be surprised if you did not like them.
author: Mary F.

description: Great place, excellent value for money (if you like eggs for breakfast)
author: Rolf D.

description: Excellent pancakes, loved that you could see the kitchen. Everything looked fresh and tasted good. It's the perfect breakfast lunch place, almost as good as Mama's but without the line during the weekdays. Not sure about weekends, I have seen a line as I've walked by but service was fast an efficient so I don't imagine the wait being too long. Definitely should be on your weekend brunch list.
author: Teisha F.

description: How did I not try this place earlier! It's awesome, hands down best brunch I've had in the city. Had the vanilla French toast, cooked and flavored to perfection. Oddly, the wait wasn't very long at all, second on the list, but it was also at the same time as the Pride Parade. Definitely a hidden gem! Wait staff was polite and efficient, and timely. Would highly recommend!
author: Paul H.

description: Not too notch, but very good. Food locally sourced from trader joes across the street.
author: Matt A.

description: Service was good and food came out fairly quick. I ordered the spicy pulled pork scramble and it was decent. The hash browns are too uniform...like the kind you find in the freezer section at the grocery store. My friend ordered a seafood Benedict, I am unsure of the exact name but it had shrimp in it that was clearly raw (still grey, very little pink). He said it was delicious and would definitely go back.
author: Tammy H.

description: The Frisco scramble with literally suck on your genitals. So fucking good I came under the table!
author: Jared G.

description:
REALLY enjoyed our breakfast at MyMy.  Waited about 20 minutes for a table for 5 at about 10AM on the day before New Years.  Very cute place, well decorated, and very clean and neat.  

We ordered

1.  The MOT Sausage Burger - eggs, cheddar cheese, grilled oyster mushroom, onions, tomato, and sausage patty on warm, soft bun served with wedge cut potatoes.  The non-breakfast eater who ordered this LOVED it!

2. Tex-Mex Scramble - chorizo, pepper jack, roasted jalapeno, tomatoes, garlic, chipotle aioli, and salsa fresca all scrambled with eggs and topped with thin slices of avocado.  Served with warm corn tortillas.  I opted for a fruit cup instead of hash brown - SUPERB.  Flavor was simply incredible and it had enough spice to feel the heat without burning your mouth.  The fruit cup had mixed fresh berries, pineapple, mango, banana, melon, and an orange slice.

3. Peasant Lorraine Flat Omelette - All the makings of a quiche Lorraine without the crust.

4.  Original "Benediction" - classic benedict, but served on a slice of crunchy sourdough with chive hollandaise sauce.  Wonderful!

5.  Eggs and bacon with hash brown (shredded potatoes spread ultra thin, crispy, and golden brown.

The food is excellent, the menu has a wide variety of inventive, mouth-watering items, and everything is prepared beautifully.

We enjoyed everything but the service. Our server did not seem with it, was very slow, and just didn't seem to give a crap.  Apart from the service, this is a 5-star place.
author: Casey N.

description:
Wandered in here one day and decided to get breakfast. Surprisingly amazing omelet. Thought it might have been a fluke so went back and still consistently AWESOME food. 

You should definitely check this place out. Decent prices and fantastic food. Small restaurant but haven't ever seen it too busy.
author: Renee P.

description: This place is incredible. Had their benedict with prosciutto and was drooling over every bite. The ingredients are fresh, really rich in flavor. I split the benedict and the lemon ricotta pancakes with my friend, we weren't disappointed! Definitely coming back here often
author: Lana B.

description:
One of my go-to places for breakfast/brunch.

Staff is friendly, food is delicious.

Orange juice is always freshly squeezed (one time it was on the bitter side, but I'd take bitter fresh OJ over carton OJ any day).  Coffee is solid.

French toast, benedict dishes, and swedish pancakes are all winners.  I will keep coming back for more.
author: Rafael Y.

description: I went here for breakfast. I had an omelette which was actually reasonable but nothing special. It came with a tasty but cold hash. All good I'm low maintenance and it's reasonable value. But the service. There is a big difference between sassy 'gotta get the job done and organise you people' and downright rude. To be fair some of the other staff were quite nice, but overall it was a jarring experience. Don't believe the hype.
author: Shane E.

description:
On Thanksgiving morning I was quite shocked that so few places were open for breakfast. I mean this is San Francisco, a tourist town. We luckily found that the MYMY Coffee Shop was open. We had been here before a few months back and thought it was pretty good, so we decided to start our holiday off there. A good thing about MYMY is that there never seems to be a line. The one time we went before, we were sat immediately and this time too. Plus whenever I walk by, there are tables open or the wait doesn't look long. I live by Red Door Cafe and I just don't get why people stand around for over an hour for food (and sometimes in the rain). How did this become the status quo?

Back to MYMY! The cafe is small with about 10-15 tables and a counter looking out to Larkin Street. The place is basic and resembles a classic coffee shop. I like their use of orange. We both ordered the Eggs Benedict, my eggs well done, John's poached traditionally. The eggs were done perfectly and the hollaindaise sauce done well with just a touch of lemon. The big problem I had with our meals was that our english muffins were chewy and stale. We really had to saw through them with our dull table knife to get a bite. Quite disappointing. The hash browns redeemed the dish though. Just shredded potatoes with nothing else. Crispy and delicious. Overall the food is average. This is a great breakfast spot if you don't want to wait in line. It's classic coffee shop food, nothing fancy but filling. Get the OJ, it's fresh squeezed and very refreshing.
author: Alice S.

description: Absolutely worth the wait. Tex Mex scramble rocked my world. Super fresh & original menu offerings. Delish coffee.
author: M C.

description: Wanted to like this place more. Wife and I both tried some benedicts - it was good...would recommend anyone to visit. The food is probably 3.5 stars or so...but necessarily worth a long wait that can develop here. That being said - I will be back since I live so close and love benedicts.
author: Sean S.

description: This place was awesome! Great environment and fantastic service. The food was the best we had on our three day vacay in San Francisco! I definitely recommend the tex mex scramble. Spicy and flavorful!
author: Chris M.

description: Great breakfast food! Good service and friendly, attentive servers in spite of it being very busy.  Spongy French toast is one of the most amazing things I've ever eaten.  I have looked far and wide for great French toast. Finally found it here at Mymy.  Good coffee, Benedict, and hash browns too.  I liked the Baja Benedict and my friend liked the Norwegian Benedict.
author: Susan C.

description:
We came here for breakfast on our second day in San Francisco for our honeymoon.  It was a Wednesday morning around 9am and the place was about half full. It isn't a very large space and probably wouldn't be good for large groups.  We sat at a little two seater right next to the window. 

Our server came right over to take our drink orders. My husband got a cappuccino that came with whipped cream and some nutmeg sprinkled on top.  For breakfast I got the Vanilla Sponge Pain Perdue With Butterscotch Drizzle and my husband got the MOT Sausage breakfast burger. Our food came out pretty quickly and it was amazing. The French toast was big and thick. It was sweet but not over powering. It melted in your mouth. It also came with a berry compote and sliced banans on the side. The sausage burger had fresh homemade sausage and was bursting with flavor. It came with potatoes on the side which were perfectly crispy and had a hint of seasoning to them. 

Each entree was around $11 or so and to us seemed well worth it. 
If we ever return to San Francisco, we will definitely be back here!!
author: Hillary S.

description: Saturday morning after waiting a half hour we finally get seated and I'm ready to get down to the food. Hungry as hell I decided on the Frisco omelette and the wifey ordered the Spicy pot pork scramble. Of course the daily caffine was supplied. Both dishes hit the spot and they didn't skimp on the ingredients so we couldn't say anything bad. If you can't take spicy food ask for less spice on the pork scramble otherwise enjoy a little heat. Cool joint to grab some no nonsense food. After reading some reviews about the hit or miss service I was sceptical but we were treated just fine. Water was always filled and the orders came out fairly quickly. Next time I'm ordering the French toast!
author: T L.

description: I love this place!  Delicious food, relaxing and social atmosphere with great service. Be prepared to wait in line outside for brunch and make sure ALL of your party are there with you: they won't let you in if your group is incomplete.  Went there recently on a weekday and didn't have to wait at all.
author: Margret C.

description: The place is small, so be prepared for a long wait if you have a larger group.  Still the food was fresh and tasty!  I really enjoyed my lemon meringue pancake.
author: Pam S.

description:
Woah. We tried to go to Mama's and the line was out the door. MYMY was our backup and it should have been our first choice. 

Small little joint with really nice unassuming staff. The water didn't have any ice which was weird. Flashed me back to central europe...anyway. 

I got the Southern Benedict. It was just enough spicy, but not over the top. The jalapenos were cooked down a bit, so the peppers didn't overpower the dish. The hollandaise sauce was homemade and the chorizo was legit. Straight up brat size sausage slices. Hash browns were cooked to perfection and the OJ was fresh squeezed. The sweet (contrary to savory) options on the menu sounded solid as well. 

If I lived in the Nob Hill area, this would be a staple.
author: Joseph H.

description: I am so happy that we stumbled into this place.  This is a very cute restaurant with a soft spoken, friendly staff.  The eggs are so, so, so fluffy!  I must say that I'm hooked on their hash browns!  Every bite if wonderfully crispy with out being crunchy.  I also highly recommend trying the fruit cup as this is perfection-perfectly ripened berries and melons.  If you're in the area, give this place a try.
author: Beth H.

description: Great food, better service... Don't be a chump and stand in line for an hour.  San Francisco has a thousand great coffee shops, this is one of them.
author: Steve D.

description:
The Zara (http://goo.gl/SOCob) of Swedish pancakes. The TATW350 Adrenaline Room (http://goo.gl/i0h95) of pulled chicken sandwiches. Holy criminy.

After an epic, epic, epic Andy Moor show last night (who kicked off his set with Arty's epic, epic, epic Zara), I awoke not by alarm clock, but by stomach. Feed me. Now. We assembled at MYMY and after an excruciating 30min wait (only because of how hungry we were), our highly anticipated table finally opened up.

I had to choose: breakfast or lunch. Or, after a night like last night, both.

And how was that first bite of both the honey glazed sandwich and the less than $5 massive absolutely smothered with strawberries and bananas pancake? You'll have to click on the Adrenaline Room link above and watch the part at 3m 45s. It tasted something like that.

Andy Moor. Zara. Swedish pancakes. Pulled chicken sandwiches. TATW350. MYMY Cafe. San Francisco. What do they all have in common? Simply mind blowing.

I have no idea if MYMY would been this good had the night before not been that good. Often these things just beautifully go hand in hand.
author: Jason B.

description: Mymy was one of the highlights of our San Francisco vacation.  I had the Lemon Ricotta pancakes and my boyfriend had an omelet.  Both were served quickly and were fantastic.  The servers were extremely attentive and offered recommendations enthusiastically.  Overall, Mymy is a great place to get brunch, and we will be sure to visit the next time we are in SF.
author: Aaron C.

description:
I wanted to try MyMy primarily because it was new and something different than my usual. Walked in, waited about ten minutes for a table for two, then was seated but waited another ten minutes or so for a server to come over.

It's a small place with an even smaller FOH team. That being said, as soon as our server came to our table, we ordered and were served in a timely fashion. Fresh squeezed orange juice - a little on the bitter side - a variety of eggs benedict and omelets, and three daily specials.

The food was delicious, that I can attest too. The hash browns that everyone's been talking to are the shit. This place isn't something that jumps out and screams 'BEST BREAKFAST ON THE WEST COAST!' But it does live up to a quality spot where you are guaranteed tasty food on the cheaper end.
author: Michelle L.

description:
My girlfriend and I wanted to grab a delicious breakfast.  I am very glad we chose to try MYMY.  I can't think of anything I didn't like.

The menu was egg-heavy, but they did have a section dedicated to swedish pancakes.  I opted for two swedish pancakes and two eggs, while my girlfriend ordered a frisco omelet (sausage, chesse and avocado).  The pancakes were just excellent.  They were thin and sweet with a yummy chewy texture.  The omelet was large and flavorful, with a very generous portion of avocado.  All of this was reasonably priced, but not a bargain per se.  You get what you pay for.  

All in all, I will definitely return.  Thank you MYMY for an excellent start of the day!
author: Josiah C.

description: Mymy is amazing. The staff is incredible and the food is delicious. I've been a few times and always get one of the eggs benedicts, yum! If you're in the neighborhood, it's a must for brunch! (really, the line is worth it!)
author: Emily M.

description: Delicious! Definitely a great place to eat. The French toast is really wonderful and the service is great!
author: Maura G.

description: This used to be my go to breakfast/ lunch spot when I lived a block away. It's been a few years and since we originally started going, the menus have changed a bit. It's all still very good! The benedicts, the scrambles, the swedish pancakes... I'm getting hungry just writing this. Even the way they cut the fruit and very generous avocado portions is done with quality. The orange juice is my only qualm, it claims to be freshly squeezed but tastes like concentrate.
author: Mel M.

description: Revisit today, Monday.  No wait at all. Enjoyed the Mambo Italiano scramble with crispy wedge potatoes---flavors just right and overall DELISH ---this visit, my meal was served piping hot.  Generous portions, fresh ingredients, variety, price, and pleasant service staff make  MyMy a neighborhood standout!
author: Nancy D.

description:
This is one of my favorite casual breakfast/brunch places. Not only do I live close by, but the food is tasty. The omelets are done really well, and are fluffy like clouds. I usually ask for fruit instead of the hash-brown. Let me tell you, they don't skimp on the fresh fruit. It isn't like some places, where they just throw a few melon slices on the plate...

The french toast is good as well! I've had several different things here, from the omelets to the MonteCristo sandwich (which is dangerously good), and I haven't been disappointed yet.

I rather go to MyMys than wait in line at 6:30am at  Mama's, which I felt wasn't as good (maybe I have to give it another shot).
author: Nadia M.

description: We were in town for a running race and decided to check this out. In short, best breakfast ever. My wife and I split the lemon ricotta pancakes. Simply wonderful. I had the shrimp Bennie....savory, fresh, delicious. Staff is super nice and prompt.
author: Atif S.

description: This place is ridiculously good, the Scramble might be one of the best breakfast meals I've ever had! Highly recommend!
author: Sam P.

description: The most wonderful fluffy light pancakes!  The lemon pancakes were very lightly flavored with lemon, so not overwhelming.  The blueberry banana had whole blueberrys with a slight banana flavor.  Small place but we got in quickly on a Thursday morning.
author: Laurie H.

description: Everything here is amazing - seriously the food is worth the wait, it's the perfect breakfast spot.  With that said if you don't like waiting then make sure to get here before 9am on the weekend!  The eggs are so fluffy, their hash browns are incredible, their pancakes are to die for.  The service is friendly and fast and you'll get your coffee as soon as you order it (a weekend must).  Can't wait for my next mymy experience!
author: Sonia L.

description: Came here for a New Years Day brunch with the group of friends I went out with the night before. Not only did I get to see a few other patrons eating in the clothes they went out in th night before, but I was treated to a very good meal. half the table ordered the corned beef hash which came with very large chunks of beef. I had the spicy pork scramble, which was also excellent
author: Greg D.

description: Quick and delicious, this is an excellent place to get breakfast or brunch.  Go early, it gets very busy!
author: Patrick P.

description:
quiant little place
mom and pop place
she had the brioche french toast. PRETTY DAMN GOOD
i had the tex mex omelette. pretty flavor food
place gets pretty packed but we arrived at the right time and got seated right away
definitely will come back
$30 bill
author: Andi I.

description: Great little place! Really interesting food... We had French toast and corn beef hash, both were great!
author: Jessica M.

description: Mymy's is such a great brunch place. I love you for your seriously amazing hashbrowns!!! So crispy like any hashbrown should be. Their hollandaise sauce is the only one I like besides the ones I make at home because it's so much more flavorful. They somehow are very good at hiding the egg yolk taste. Customer service here is great! Especially the little asian guy! I don't know if he's thai or so but I remember him as a customer from this boba place I used to work at. He's super nice and smiley. Kudos to you sir. The pricing is a bit more than I'd like to pay for brunch but it's worth it. It is cheaper than sweet maple though. Their lemonade here is super fresh and if you drink 1/4 of your lemonade and add water to the top of the cup, youll get more to drink! Hahahaha. The drink will still be amazing.
author: Jenny L.

description: My fiancé and I dined here on a  recent, beautiful Sunday morning. We heard there is often a huge line, but we were VERY lucky to get there around 10 AM and were seated immediately. We almost missed the place itself, though, as there is not a huge sign outside. The restaurant itself is very small, but it doesn't necessarily feel cramped. We ordered coffee, the vanilla sponge French toast, and the Norwegian Benedict. The hash browns are TO DIE FOR. Thin, crispy, and not greasy. The Benedict was done perfectly, the smoked salmon was fresh, and the chive hollandaise sauce was delicious. The french toast was fluffy yet crisp and melted in our mouths. The prices match the quality of the food. The service was quick and we didn't feel rushed to leave, even as a line formed outside. We left craving MyMy for the next few days. Do NOT miss this gem! W cannot wait to return and try out the rest of their menu!
author: Angelica G.

description: This place has an extremely friendly and fast service, they definitely get everything to you quickly. The food was terrible though. Both my friend and I had the frisco scramble. The hash browns were so thin and tasted a lot like a chain Diner hash browns (not in a good way). The scrambled eggs tasted terrible as well; the sausage tasted like it was microwaved, eggs tasted like powdered eggs, but they did have a generous amount of avocado! Also, it would be nice to get a toast that wasn't extremely burnt.
author: Maria G.

description:
What a great find!  
Ok, honestly, we were gonna eat at Olea at first but were 6 groups behind on the wait list.  So we came across the street and figured the menu sounds pretty good and we were just hungry and thirsty.  And wow, was it good!  The place is kept super clean and bright, perfect for a Sunday brunch rain or shine.  The owners were really nice but a bit timid and think they were a bit shocked by the mass flow of ppl coming (from Olea?) 

I had a sweet tooth so got the Swedish pancake which was decent but the guy next to me ordered the French toast and I really wish I did the same.... Next time!  Mr. ordered a Frisco omelet, super fluffy and perfect portion.  I think they are also known for their pulled chicken sandwiches so we cannot wait to come back again :)
author: Vickie L.

description: Great place! Very busy but excellent meal and outstanding service! If you have ever worked in this area of SF you know people are super picky and kinda kooky. We watched several people act like they were at French Laundry for a 1000 meal. Chill out people and enjoy Jimmy's great service!
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
Service was very attentive and server was really friendly. 

Food was good and I like the "homey" atmosphere of the restaurant.

The reason for only 3 stars is the price. I honestly think this place is WAY too overpriced for the food.  I can go one block over to the Crepe House and get a specialty omelette with 2-5 fillings for $6-7, whereas an omelette with 2 fillings here would be $10-12.

I'm really bummed because this is right next to my house and I LOVE breakfast.
author: Gina R.

description:
I ate Herbi Omelet and my BF ate South of border Omelet.
Both are excellent. 
Egg was so soft and perfect. Delicious. 
I love the their style of hash brown also. 
No complaint what so ever.

I sure will go back for more! 

Yam Yam!
author: Green Mango Y.

description:
I awoke coming out of a dreadful hangover. Between the random bodies scattered over the apartment and the missing people that were supposed to be here one thought surfaced in my mind.....FOOD. 

I hop on Yelp and find Olea.  We drag our dehydrated and abused bodies a couple of blocks to find that it's closed.  Lucky for us across the street is MyMys.  

The menu is full of amazing looking choices and being unable to decide I found myself wondering if they have a sample platter.  I finally decided on the south of the border omelet which was amazing. Just the right amount of spice (which for me is a lot) and delicious chorizo.  The juices ran into the omelet and flavored the whole thing.  The avocado looked beautiful on top making for a good presentation.  The hash browns were also very tasty and had a perfect crisp.

The eggs Benedict looked very good, two of my friends had it, one thought it was delicious, the other thought it was just okay.  My girlfriend made the mistake of letting me try her bacon and egg croissant sandwich and I wound up eating that as well.  

The old lady to our left kept staring at us and I kept staring at her Swedish pancakes (not sexual get your mind out of the gutter).  They looked amazing, very thin and almost crepe like.

This place was amazing and service was friendly. The only downside was the annoying music being played in the background, the hangover probably didn't help this at all.

This will definitely be a regular breakfast joint for me.  I can't wait to try more of the menu!


*Update*  Had the Mango Croissant French Toast.....OMG so good!  This place is definitely my go to breakfast joint!
author: Ryan J.

description: Found this place through yelp and have to agree with the other posts. I was able to be seated in about 10 minutes and the food was good. Service was also on point
author: Kofi F.

description: Accidently stumbled upon this restaurant while visiting San Francisco.  Had the hash.  Beef brisket - cut into large cubes, very tender, very flavourful.  Eggs poached perfectly.  Very large portion priced at $15(ish). Would definitely make a point of eating here again the next time I am in the bay area.  A great find.
author: Hugh G.

description:
This place is amazing. I don't want to call it a diner because that's not fancy enough but it had a lot of great diner dishes. This place is only open for breakfast and lunch but what they do, they do well. We went here twice during our week in San Fran.

The first time I got the pancakes and T got Southern benediction with chorizo, jalapeno and avocado. We also ordered a fruit bowl to share. Let me just make a side note about the fruit (and vegetables for that matter) in California. They are SO much better than the produce we have in PA. The melon doesn't just taste sweet, it tastes like cantaloupe or honeydew. The strawberries are bright red, the blueberries aren't tart, they're sweet and juicy. I thought I didn't even LIKE blueberries. Turns out I just don't like East Coast blueberries. I miss the fruit there ...

So, back to the task at hand, the pancakes were Swedish style, very thin served with fresh strawberries. Very good. I also had a glass of orange juice that was fresh squeezed. For realsies. Awesome. The second time we went I got the Norwegian benediction with smoked salmon and spinach. After I saw an order of French toast walk by, I regretted my order but after I dug in, it turned out to be delicious. I was a little worried how everything would mesh but the salty fish and the creamy yolk along with crunchy spinach were so good.

The service here is great. Very warm and friendly. This is a great neighborhood spot that I'm bummed isn't two blocks away from our current home like it was from our hotel. :)
author: Elena M.

description:
The food was excellent.  

This is a very small place, so don't be surprised if you have to wait. We were all satisfied with our food.

The down side of this place is that they don't bring all the food at the same time. I was pretty much done by the time my boyfriend got his food.  The service is mediocre. Have you ever been to a place and someone told you that you were ordering too much? Well, the server told me that she didn't think I needed to order more. It's not like I was ordering that much - ok, I'm a small person, but I can eat!
author: Amanda M.

description: Excellent food! Our waiter and entire staff, were very fast and attentive! ( but not the overwhelming type  ) I had the banana blueberry pancakes and my husband had the pulled pork hash... Both delicious!
author: Kelli C.

description: Had the Vanilla Sponge Pain Perdue. So good. The butterscotch drizzle was a nice touch, not too rich or sweet. Perfectly cooked. I was full with just the french toast and the fruit (and I'm hearty eater). My buddy had the Salmon Rotolone Tartine, said it was good. Looked beautiful and appeared to have good ratios of ingredients. Service was outstanding, coffee was always full and was greeted with a smile every time someone came to check on our table. Would recommend. Will definitely be going back next time I'm in the City.
author: Nick S.

description:
MyMy, what a coffee shop this little gem is!  I came here for the first time the other day to have brunch with my friend, and when I walked in I instantly thought, oh... high priced breakfast items?  But when I got the menu, everything was decently priced.

I don't remember what I ordered but I was very full when I was done.  The portions must have been generous.  

I would definitely come here again.
author: Tina L.

description: The texmex omelette I had was delicious. The jalapenos in there were spicy! My second bite was just a mouthful of jalapeno! But the burn wore off and I enjoyed the rest of my omelette. But the star here is the hash browns! They are SO crispy! Perhaps my favorite hashbrowns ever! Service is average. Prices for some things on the menu seemed a little steep.
author: Jessica L.

description: the bbq sauce on the pulled pork was underwhelming but if ever back in the area I will go back and try one of their other dishes.
author: Latavia K.

description: The swedish pancakes are still awesome but you also have to give the egg and grill tomato grilled cheese sandwich, its gooooood!!!
author: Kevin W.

description: MyMy's is amazing!! Go on a weekday because weekends are slammed.  Their food is excellent and presented beautifully. Well run and great service.
author: Julia S.

description: Mymy is a great little spot for brunch, but don't go too late- it closes at 3 pm! The breakfast foods are delicious, though I really love the salads as well (Asian salad is fantastic). The coffee is good and the staff has always been very friendly and helpful, even though they are always busy. If you are planning to brunch here on a weekend, particularly with a larger group, be prepared to wait! The menu is nothing out of the ordinary, but the food hits the spot, the waitstaff is perky and friendly and the prices are reasonable. I would recommend!
author: Kate B.

description: This place is amazing! We enjoyed breakfast on the last day of our trip and were so disappointed we didn't find it sooner. The TexMex Scramble was out of this world and the French Toast was superb. Overall a fantastic place to enjoy a delicious breakfast.
author: Anna P.

description: In all seriousness ... The best breakfast I've ever had. Do yourself a huge favor and stop by. I am still drooling over how good the food is. Amazing. Go. Now!
author: Haylea D.

description: We've been eyeing this place for a while but the lines on the weekend looked daunting-- so we were quite pleased to be seated immediately when we came on a Friday morning. We are both vegetarian and so we ordered the florentine benediction and the banana-blueberry souffle pancakes. Both dishes pleased us immensely. The thick-cut English muffins of the benediction were delicious as was the hollandaise sauce that smothered everything. We loved the texture of the oyster mushrooms in this dish as well. The side of hashbrowns was perfectly crisped lattice potato network that had just enough salt to satisfy. Our only complaint would be that the dish came out on the lukewarm side. The banana blueberry marscapone pancakes were as thick and perfectly fluffy as other reviewers have mentioned. You could definitely see and taste pockets of marscapone as you ate them. The flavor of the banana was barely there-- perhaps nonexistent, but we definitely saw some blueberries. The candied walnuts and vanilla anglaise sauce were wonderful to contrast the pancakes and add some flavor dimension to the otherwise simple (but comforting) dish. In short, this is a solid brunch spot-- they're not reinventing what it means to brunch, instead they do brunch favorites right. If we came back-- which we will likely do-- we'd probably order the same benediction, but switch the pancakes to another of their sweet offerings.
author: T K.

description:
My favorite part of breakfast is taking my time, enjoying my meal before a busy day. I ordered just a short stack with a fruit bowl on the side. Average price, but the pancakes were aweeeesome! Very fluffy and delicious, the fruit was fresh as well, which I can definitely appreciate. I took my time eating, read my paper and the staff was really nice and didn't try to rush me. 

All in all, great staff, awesome food and not too expensive, Score!
author: Annie S.

description: Love the food. My son got the French toast soufflé with marscarpone and loved it. I got the Tex-mex scramble the eggs were so light and fluffy. Stop here
author: Jennifer G.

description: I had the herbi- omelet. It had to be about 5 eggs or so it was huge! The veggies in it were fresh. It came nice and hot and was pretty good. My bf had the chorizo and French toast. The chorizo was some of the best I have ever had. His French toast was Nice and sweet and had cinnamon and sugar on it.  We will definatly be back to this place. Oh service was friendly:)
author: Monique Q.

description: Very enjoyable breakfast!  Good coffee, not too big portions, just right!  Corned beef hash...Yay!
author: Lorraine Crespo P.

description:
Wow!  From an unassuming cafe I would never have expected such excellent breakfast food!  

I trusted Yelp on this one and tried orange juice, pancakes, and poached eggs as a couple of reviews suggested.  Everything was excellent!  The juice is actually fresh, the pancakes are the incredibly thin and perfect in every way Swedish variety, and the poached eggs were spot on.

I could concieve of actually climbing into the car or onto the bus some morning and hauling myself out to MYMY for a weekend brunch.
author: Ivan L.

description:
You would think from the large yellow awnings, and the bay windows this place would be quite large, but it's actually really cozy inside. There are about 8 tables in close proximity to one another. The staff greets you at the door, and sits you down. 
My first visit I got the French Toast which had an awesome Orange Zest taste in it. It was slightly burned on one side, but nothing that would have made me send the order back. My second visit I got the Hass Omelet which was scallions, turkey, jack, and avocado. There was about a handful of scallions so, had a strong taste to it, but the omelet in general was a good one. The eggs were fluffy, and turkey came in good size pieces. The hash browns were thin, and crispy which was awesome, and not soggy at all. 
The place is not very busy for some reason even though it should be. It's located on California Street so, you can watch the Cable Cars to by which is enjoyable. 
In all if your looking for a clean, quaint breakfast place that serves no fuss food this is your place.
author: Nathan M.

description:
Good value and a great breakfast.  Small, cozy brunch spot and easily accessible.  I recommend the basil, mushroom and sun dried tomato omelet and hash browns.  Also, the coffee is from blue bottle and complements the food very well.  

Expect to pay $20-$25 for two people but overall a great, casual spot for a Sunday breakfast.
author: Joseph Z.

description: The mimosas tasted way better this time around. The zuccini pancakes with eggs were pretty good as well. Cons: they make you leave pretty fast ;-(
author: Chris S.

description: Service was solid. Quaint when you walk in and a little tough to spot on the corner - but was well worth it. Water comes in a jug so you can fill at your heart's desire. Ordered the chorizo with my eggs and was delighted. Great taste and smoky enough for my liking. Good bacon. Run of the mill hashbrowns. Homemade jam on the table went amazing on the wheat toast. Waitress was not overbearing which I liked. Place was actually packed. def will go back when I come to SF again. Enjoy!
author: Maks B.

description: Small place with no sign just look for the line of people. Food and service are both very good.
author: Alvin S.

description:
Don't let the cheap external decor fool you, MYMY has some legitimate brunch.
The plates are rather overpriced, considering the small portions, but the eggs benedict was delicious. 

I'd say MYMY's is a good back-up plan for brunch/breakfast if Mama's is packed.
author: Grace P.

description: I've been here before they became popular but the last time I won't go back again. I went almost before they were closing and a surly asian waitress was giving me attitude throughout.
