I gave the standard tip because I felt sorry for that *itch but won't go again. The food was also not great by the way.
author: N A.

description:
Went to this adorable little corner spot after a very long day and night at the North Beach Festival, and oh MYMY! 

We ordered some of the Swedish pancakes, and they were out of this world. I was a Swedish pancake virgin prior to my visit on this sunny Sunday afternoon, and I could not imagine a better place to loose my Swedish pancake virginity to. 

I also had the ham and cheddar omelet which was a perfect portion and one of the best fluffy omelets I have ever had. Their hash browns are to die for, they are cooked just the way I like them, nice and crunchy! 

I love love MYMY and can't wait to go back!
author: Katie H.

description: Probably one of the best brunches I've had in a long time. Got there around 1pm on a Sunday and there was no wait time to be seated. Their French toast is amazing. It is flavored with orange peel. It's the perfect balance of not too mushy and not too crispy. Also tried their eggs Benedict. This was another winner. Their hollandaise sauce is superb. Probably one of the best actually. I got mine florentine style with avocado added. A definite must try for all eggs Benedict lovers like me. The hash browns were perfectly crispy too. I also think the portions are just right. Not too much, not to little. Will definitely be going here again.
author: Devina S.

description: This place is insanely good. The pancakes and eggs Benedict blew me away. Worth the wait and worth every penny.
author: Bryan H.

description:
Yelped it. We came into town and staying at Fairmont hotel in Nob Hill. Food was excellent. I had lemon ricotta pancakes. They were light fluffy with the perfect amount of sweatness.

Amy had crab and shrimp cake Benedic with dill lemon sauces. Another hit.

Can't go wrong.highly recommend
author: Pat V.

description: Best breakfast I've had in San Francisco, by far. I'm almost positive everything on their menu is delicious. I had their Baja California eggs benedict, while my boyfriend had the lemon crab shrimp cake benedict, both made to perfection (of course we shared). Oh, and by the way, this place makes all the other places serving hash browns look like a joke. They make my absolute favorite hash browns, and mind you, i'm VERY big on hash browns. We accompanied our dishes with their vanilla sponge french toast, every bite was hea-ven-ly and surprisingly not heavy. Every flavor in my mouth was perfection. My boyfriend and I literally ate everything on our plates, including the french toasts and not to mention; our side order of bacon (insert piggy emoji here). As soon as we walked in we were greeted by the most welcoming ladies, i didnt feel for one second they were stuck-up or too busy to ask any of my requests to; more water, more coffee, etc. They were both very attentive. The atmosphere is cute, cozy, and clean. The music is chill and mellow. Definitely will be coming back here. I'm already craving their french toast. I didn't wait in a line, probably because I went on a tuesday. Thanks guys! You will see us soon!
author: Jamie D.

description: Don't be afraid to try one of their more creative dishes.  Zucchini pancakes with chipotle honey, delicious.
author: Mary L.

description:
For the past few years, the area around California and Hyde and Larkin Streets has lacked a decent coffee shop (and we used to have 2 good ones at Cal & Hyde), so it was such a nice surprise to see this one open in the space that previously housed Round Table Pizza.  

But what makes it even better is the care they have taken to make the place cozy and welcoming and the staff are just so nice!

They offer Breakfast, Lunch and Brunch and offer a good selection of traditional breakfast items, and a good array of salads, sanwiches, burgers and soups for lunch.  I've been there several times since they opened and have always been very pleased with the quality of the dishes and never left hungry.  Service is excellent and consistent, the place is kept very clean and just has a very comfortable feel to it.  

I'd be tempted to give them 5 stars, and I would if they had some cooked lunch entrees like meatloaf or if they had danish pastires or blueberry muffins.  Every time I go there I feel like I want to go back again soon.   Everything from the dishes to the decor seems to have been created with great care.

It's a block from Cala Foods, 2 blocks from St. Francis Hospital and the Golden Gateway Holiday Inn and, of course right on the California Cable Car line.  It's not expensive, yet is a cut above all the rest.
author: Bob S.

description: Bit of a wait but nothing outrageous by any means for bunch on a Sunday at noon.  We got seated right away and the staff was pleasant.  food was amazing, portions were good sized and priced appropriately.  It was a bit warm in the restaurant but it was also an unusually warm day.
author: Star E.

description: It's ridiculous how good their breakfast is! Lemon Ricotta Meringue Pancakes? Yes please!!
author: Susanne L.

description: Prompt and friendly service. Nice and clean venue. Good selection on menu. I had the pop pork scramble. The pork was very tender and the salsa had a good kick. I will be back!
author: Warren N.

description: I wouldn't give it any stars at all. I arrived at the restaurant and there were two tables if four open, but the waiter refused to seat me and wanted me to wait for a couple to leave. After 10 minutes I left. Horrible customer service. Seating a customer is better than saving tables. Will never go again.
author: Chan S.

description: Solid breakfast and brunch joint. I was staying nearby and had 3 breakfasts here to fuel my apartment searching. The Italian scramble is quite good, and their scrambles in general are unique and tasty. Not too crowded on weekends, making it a hidden gem amongst the innumerable amount brunch places with long lines and waits.
author: Justin L.

description:
At first I was quite hesitant with bringing my family to a small cafe I just found on Yelp, but it being New Year's Eve, every other breakfast spot was closed. We arrived and were told it would be about a thirty minute wait for six. The max. capacity is 26, so it was pretty obvious. I don't recommend this place for more than four people. Before we sat down I saw the waiters coming around with some really delicious looking dish. I asked what it was and they said it was the Monte Cristo. Unfortunately, I came too late and they ran out before I could order any. Anyway, it felt only like fifteen minutes until we were seated. I ordered the Brioche French Toast with two eggs and sausages. It was yuuuuuum. It was like flan or really soft, melt in your mouth goodness. The hash browns with my dad's dish was wonderful! It wasn't salty or too greasy like most hash browns are. The coffee was amazing. They really know how to make it! The servers were very nice and caring and always had a smile on their face. It's cute, very clean, considering it's only two and a half months old, but in an alright neighborhood. It's not bad, but it's not real nice either. I honestly can't think of anything too negative about it except that you might have to wait a while for a table. If you're two people, probably no more than ten minutes. 

I definitely will be coming back!
author: Rachel M.

description: Delish. I got the tex mex scramble without a tortilla but got whole wheat toast instead. Eggs were cooked to perfection, the sauce was nice and spicy and the hash browns were crunchy, thin and tasty. I will be coming back again
author: Ryan K.

description: Really excellent breakfast with fast and attentive service. Bravo. I had the Tex Mex Scramble with no cheese and it was full of fresh flavor.
author: Michael W.

description: I didn't get something that actually involved cooking, except for the side of potatoe wedges which were REALLY good!! What I got with a side of sliced avocado and mixed fruit bowl! They had a lot of decor from urban outfitters!! And it was a nice cozy small space almost the perfect little caffe!
author: Katie W.

description:
I wanted to try the new place on Polk - Toast - so boyfriend and I walked down there hung over and hungry on a Sunday morning. The wait was 40 minutes and it was drizzly outside so we decided to skip it and try something else. We were walking towards somewhere boyfriend swore he remembered being just down this way...when we passed MYMY Coffee.

I knew I'd passed this place on my way to work in the morning and the cute yellow sign outside always made me wonder what the restaurant was like. We decided to try it and I'm so so so glad we did. Not only did it mean sitting down and eating instead of continuing to wonder through the rain with an empty stomach but the food was fantastic.

Here's what you need to know about this place: the food isn't particularly fancy or special, it's just quality. The orange juice is an orange squeezed into a glass. Really. Not just saying "fresh squeezed" it really truly is. This first trip I got a simple egg breakfast with sausage and toast and was completely satisfied. (The hashbrowns here are to die for!) Second time I got the Frisco omelette and think that's definitely my favorite (plus you still get the hashbrowns! I swear one of these times I'll end up ordering just a huge plate of the hashbrowns...)

We ended up taking friends back here a week later (what can I say, when we know what we like we just want more) and reviews we're split. We liked it just as much (even being less hungover) but our friends were divided between loving it and feeling like it was just ok. I guess it depends on your taste but I highly recommend giving it a try. I know it will be on our rotation.
author: Katie V.

description: Delicious!!  The hash browns were AMAZING, and the omelets were yummy.  The french toast looked great, but it was just ok. Casual atmosphere, friendly/good service, big portions, great prices.  I'll definitely go back.
author: Danielle S.

description: Visiting from NJ. Yelped this and found it as reviewed.  Good food, fast, friendly and fresh.  Great local breakfast spot.
author: Pat D.

description: Yum that about says it all yum yum yum.  Pass on the hash browns get the fruit cup instead lemon ricotta pancakes were awesome.
author: Michelle K.

description:
Frickin love this place! Being that San Francisco is seriously lacking in the simple dinner breakfast places and overflowing with overpriced 'brunch' joints (all worthwhile bottomless mimosa places are excused) I had to check out Mymy's - also that is near my place. The food is great, staff is quick, hardly have to wait more than 5 minutes for a table and the weekend specials are really good and super heavy in the gluttonous amounts of meat department. I never had a benediction prior to Mymy's, but since their's had chorizo involved in the dish, I jumped all over it. Across the street is olea's - haven't been there yet, but due to the hipster quotient, line outside of marina-durs and lack of proper alcohol paraphernalia in the windows, I avoid it like, well - the marina and hipster territory. 
I wouldn't recommend going with a group of anymore than 4 - looks like they have maybe 4-5 tables which can seat more than 2, so just a heads up. When you sit down, it will be worth it.

side note - Cholula and Tobasco at every table = #winning.
author: Nic K.

description: The food was really good. It was better than another well-known popular breakfast place in SF. I got the parma eggs benedict, they were just okay. My friend got the chorizo scramble and it was really good. We shared the ricotta pancakes and they were almost perfect. The wait was worth it!
author: Maggie D.

description: I love my usual BLT benediction but decided to try something new- the TEX MEX scramble. It was  beyond delicious!!!!! and ofcourse you have to make sure you have the hash browns- they are just to die for!
author: Sanaya S.

description: Just ok. This place is very much a diner and def not worth the loooonng wait for a table. The mimosas are small compared to other nearby brunch places and I feel like I paid money for food that I can actually cook at home myself. Again nothing was bad but it was just ok.
author: Stephanie D.

description: The food is good but service comes with a bad attitude. If you like to be mistreated and have good food this is the place for you.
author: Eyal G.

description:
Great food, good service, unpretentious. Never a big line.  Amazing brunch/breakfast  option in the Nob.

Try the lemon ricotta pancakes (wonderful) or the French toast.  The savory options are awesome too, peasant omelet yum.  The only slight disappointment was the corned beef hash which was only good, not quite the melt in your mouth experience one expects from "6hour" corned beef.
author: Adam T.

description: This used to be my spot but I am sorry not anymore! The food used to be good and hash brown was my favorite but after the incident with the hostess (blond girl by the door) even the food doesn't taste the same! She is downright rude!!!! Talk to you like you are in the kindergarten and in trouble. I always ignored her attitude but today after waiting in line for one hour, she told us you guys have to squeeze your party in a smaller table that they have available now. Understandable, since it is a small place but when we replayed back that "it is okay" she waved her finger in my face that if you change your mind I put your name at the end of the list again. Really!!!! Instead of the thank you for understanding! Shocked but just ignored it because I thought it could be clash of cultures and I maybe making a big deal out of it. Towards the end ONE friend came to say hi to us and the hostess came to our table and started giving a lecture again and questioning us about interfering with other people's privacy  (3 min max saying hi conversation in a small restaurant) what privacy?!! Really?!!! Do you know how many other brunch places are in San Francisco that they are equally or better than this place. She needs to chill and be polite to people, it is not a military nor kindergarten. Next time if I decide to pay that $100s and something bill for five dishes it is not going to be at this place for sure!
author: A-B A.

description: Had breakfast there this past weekend... It was fantastic!! Had the Frisco scramble. Will definitely go back!!
author: Daisy R.

description:
I'm incredibly happy to have such a nice, clean, brunch spot with friendly service so close!  Noticed MyMy as they were preparing to open and I have to say wasn't expecting much, so I was more than pleasantly surprised by the friendly & attentive staff, not to mention the hot, fresh diner coffee.

Generally I'm a simple, scrambled eggs & bacon kind of girl but today I was tempted to try the Meat Lovers Scramble - which I'll be ordering again next weekend!  Diced ham, sausage (and bacon of course) with cheddar cheese.  Cooked perfectly fluffy, with a generous splash of Tabasco it was exactly what I was hoping for.

Another plus:  I asked if I could sub a small salad instead of bread & homefries (which did look yummy, with just the right amount of oil to crisp a few lucky spuds).  They did this at no charge and it was a lovely, mixed green salad of generous proportion.

On the sweeter side - a friend ordered french toast and fruit drizzled with Ghirardelli's dark chocolate.  She didn't make a sound while devouring the plateful of scrumdiddlyumptiousness, so I'm assuming this is a highly recommended dish.

On the lighter side - another friend ordered a scramble with egg whites and she was very happy with her choice.  Both scrambles were so generous that the other items on the plate went unaccomplished (a nice, light whole wheat toast, homefries & salad).

If you're in or around Nob Hill, please give them a go!  I know I'll be back and I hope our neighborhood can hold onto this little breakfast gem.

MyMy, that was a yummy brunch!
author: MJ P.

description: Decent, if salty, food - also overpriced, bad service, rude management, tiny cramped tables.  Wish I'd read alternate suggestions in reviews more closely before wasting a morning here.
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
great breakfast, which seems to be something that is difficult to find on Nob Hill. The orange peel french toast was delicious, my companions seemed to really enjoy their eggs, and though the place isn't fancy it's got flair. 
Good all-around place for a stress-free and good-quality meal.
author: Amanda M.

description:
The line at Olea was outrageous so we opted to go across the street. The wait was not that bad for prime Saturday brunch hour (11am). I had the tex-mex scrabble. I was pleasantly surprised, packed with flavor and very generous helping of fresh avocado. The hash brown was very good, thin and crispy the way I like. The BF had the chorizo tartine, which was also pretty good. Of course, I made the executive decision to chase all that savory goodness with the Swedish pancake (aka crepe). The pancake was unimpressive and a bit too thick.

The service is good. The ambiance is basic. Overall, I would likely go back. I would stick with the savory menu though.
author: Chanthi L.

description: My friend and I walked in there at 9am on Monday morning, they had a bunch of open tables, but unfortunately not for us, he did say that we can sit at the counter, which is not something I enjoy. I asked for a table, and he said it's going to be a wait, so I told him there are a lot of open tables, he said he cannot give us a table for 4 when there are only 2 of us. Dude, I'm pretty sure you are not going to get a lot of group of 4's at 9:30 am on Monday, on Thanksgiving week. I consider that a very poor customer service. On a brighter note, we did have an awesome breakfast a couple of blocks away, and they were happy to give us a booth. between the 2 places, I'm sure who's going to get my future business and my friend's.
author: Laila B.

description: Not too shabby for a neighborhood breakfast spot.  It's definitely a no-frills kind of place.  Mymy Coffee shop has a solid breakfast and I really enjoyed their Swedish style pancakes.
author: Colbert T.

description:
Easily one of the best neighborhood breakfast spots in town.  The service is incredibly attentive and friendly and the food is wonderful.  We went there two days in a row which allowed our party of 5 (2 adults and 3 kids) to try lots of different things.  The croissant's were flaky and light and the Hollandaise was perfectly done.  Everything was cooked perfectly and the food came out quickly.  j

If you live in this neighborhood, this should be your spot.
author: Rick D.

description:
Great breakfast. Friendly service.  Can't really ask for anything better at a place like this. 
Had a bacon and cheese omelette, girlfriend ate Swedish pancakes. Everything was fresh and delicious. We will go back for sure.
author: Mike G.

description:
I love this type of breakfast/lunch spot. Whenever I see the word sublime in a review, I get a bit nervous, however that describes the food at this fantastic place. I would say that it is new American cusine but someone has spent time in France and it shows up in the food created here. One eats at the very top of the food chain here. I have eaten here many times and each time it is a joy. Breakfast/brunch items are first rate whether you have pancakes or one of the several  Benedict's on offer. Try chicken with poached eggs with a Morney sauce. Most refined poached eggs and hash in SF. Crispy applewood bacon and real maple syrup ( $ 1.00 extra ).
Juice,coffee, tea and some high end sodas available. I wish that they had strong iced coffee but they do not. Prices around $ 11.50.
I am lucky that I can go mid week as there is a wait on weekends and no reservations.
author: David I.

description: The wait WAS worth it.  A party of seven is a hard fit for any breakfast place in the City in this area.  They did a great job and all of us enjoyed our food.  They have achieved a good price/quality balance without going over the top.  They say you can judge a chef on how they cook an egg.  If so, then then well done chef!
author: Patrick T.

description:
Great addition to the neighborhood. Open early (before 8:30am) which is great since breakfast in that area seems to start later. Reasonably priced ($27 for 2 with coffee) and friendly service. I would go back, I loved my Blueberry Pancake Breakfast and my partner had an omelet that was perfectly cooked. 

One suggestion - ask for beverage order right away. Coffee or OJ is essential and it's nice to sip while you make up your mind about what to have for breakfast. When you're coffee is so good, why not serve it! 

We hope to see you again soon.
author: Jim D.

description:
MUCH better breakfast joint than Olea. Cheaper bigger portions with more flavor, while still using fresh ingredients. And no wait.

The eggs Benedict was very good (4 stars).  Perfectly cooked eggs. And I got the southern style with jalapeño and chorizo and avocado. And they mean avocado. There was practically an entire avocado on my plate. The hollandaise was delicious as well. And good crispy string grated-style hash browns.

The coffee is decent, and they refill your glasses frequently. Very cheery and attentive service (5 stars). 

I ate everything and was carted out in a food coma. YUM
author: Melissa H.

description: One thing. Get the Tex Mex scramble and thank me later!!! Oh and the service was great and very friendly
author: John M.

description: Customer service is the biggest area lacking here, and the long lines. I don't recommend this place 1) if you're in a hurry, or 2) if you're a group of 3 or less. They won't sit less than 3 people at a larger table, so even when there are many large, empty tables available and no line outside, they will still make you wait for a small table to open up. You know, *just in case* several large parties show up at the same time...
author: Kate M.

description: THE Crunchiest Hashbrowns in town!  Love the friendly staff...feels like walking into a friend's house for brunch. Yum!
author: Alice H.

description:
I'm becoming a Toast fan more but I like to come here for a change of pace. I love how they are usually playing Brazilian Portuguese music (pleasantly) but it's all Asians working there. Maybe they're from Sao Paolo? But, I digress.

Good menu. Serve sodas in a can. Breakfast is above average. I usually get the Eggs Benedict. Defo better than the cheap cheap greasy spoons in the area. I just prefer others. Maybe I am choosing the wrong dishes
author: Mike T.

description: Great little place.  Mimosa and peach belini's.  Lots of unusual eggs and pancakes.  I could go here many times and try new things.  Not too expensive.  Great food. Vegetarian options.  If I lived in the area, I would go again.
author: Doc D.

description: This place is really, really good. I had the omelette with asparagus topped with Gruyère cheese. Delicious.
author: Kayla L.

description: We have been going to MyMy's since they first opened.  We were regulars.  They are still the best and it seems like everyone in San Francisco has now discovered this. I'm happy for them that they are doing so well, but I miss being able to go on weekends.  The wait is usually just too long.  They are a 5 star breakfast place but I am only giving 4 stars because of the wait time.
author: Jen T.

description: Hidden gem in nob hill!! This is a great breakfast, at a good price. Have never had a bad meal here.
author: Robert A.

description: They're a legit breakfast spot.  There aren't many good ones in town, but their eggs are fluffy, the hash browns are crispy, the service is quick and courteous.
author: Corey V.

description: Yummm! I'm not usually a big breakfast/brunch person, but occasionally I love a good morning outing with friends! MYMY was suggested by a friend and it did NOT disappoint. We all ended up with vastly different orders (between five of us we had a smoked salmon benedict, a chorizo benedict, Swedish pancakes, an omelet and a grilled cheese) and everyone walked away happy! The grilled cheese looked ahhh-mazing (a great hangover cure, no doubt) and my eggs benedict was incredible. The portions were perfect, in my opinion, and the pricing is definitely reasonable. You can grab most meals for $10 or less, with only a few being marginally more expensive. All in all, a great little brunch spot with great, attentive service and a delicious array of options. No doubt we'll be back!
author: Shannon E.

description:
My second visit to MyMy Coffee Shop confirmed my first impressions. 

This time, I had the french toast, which so many others have commented on favorably. 

For me, a coffee shop has three major acid tests; french toast, hash browns, and orange juice. See my other review for my comments on the hash browns and oj.

So, how was the french toast?

Quite good. MyMy starts with a large fluffy slice of brioche, dunked in a vanilla flavored batter, and grilled to a crunch. The inside texture varies from custardy to springy. The presentation is a bit unusual. One half of the toast is balanced on its side, to give the dish some height. The other half is laid flat and covered with a generous helping of fruit: about half a banana, 2 or 3 strawberries, and a handful of blueberries and blackberries. 

There's only one problem. The french toast is $11.50. This is a price that I associate with 5 star hotels, not neighborhood breakfast joints. And they have the nerve to charge a dollar extra for maple syrup!

Yes, the french toast is good, but not $12:50 worth of good. For that price, it had better be damned good, and generous, too. I was satisfied with the portion, but I have a small appetite.

MyMy Coffee Shop is nothing if not consistent. They make good quality breakfast food, but at inflated prices.
author: Michael K.

description: First of all the resevation was under my girls name and i wrote this review 2 months after my experience. Further i have no picture of myself posted. So to pretend to remember me and accuse me of cursing at the hostess is a flat out lie. By the numerous amount of bad reviews containing the exact same experience I had everyone can tell that this wasn't some one off experience or something my girlfriend and I deserved. As everone can also read in the restuatants response to my review, this same type of aggressive, you deserved it, hostility is exactly what we experienced. The also hostess yelled and at us in a condescending  demeanor in front of 30 or 40 waiting customers when questioned her on her method of seating customers, before I said to my girlfriend, "let's get the f*$! out of here" as I did not want to be yelled at in front of a group of people. Lastly, the wait was absolutely 2 hours, we had time to get coffee, go back for a pastery, then visit another restaurant, and we returned we still hadn't been called. This is also confirmed in other customers experience. So go and waste your time at this place then end up at one of the much better near by restuarnts when you've had enough of waiting, as do hundreds of other patrons.
author: Ali A.

description: Solid breakfast. Service a bit slow -- but i will definitely be coming back to try more items on the menu! The Hashbrowns make it all worth while!!!
author: Alison M.

description: Cute spot I must say.  Definitely has the old coffee shop feel but it's not old.  I went there for breakfast one morning and had no problem getting seated.  I had a coffee and an omelette with muchrooms, sundried tomatoes, gruyere cheese and spinach.  At first I thought for the price it was kind of small but it's full of the fillings and I ate maybe a quarter and got full.  I loved the flattened super crispy hash browns too.  I would definitely come back here for breakfast or even lunch!
author: Kirsten M.

description: Very Good! Party of 3 on a Wednesday @ 10:30 am.. no wait to speak of but I can see weekends would be a problem due to limited seating.We couldn't decide so ended up ordering too much and everything tasted good and fresh. I had two perfectly poached eggs over corned beef which was large chunks that were seared crisp on the outside and fall apart on the inside. I also tasted the ricotta pancakes...light, moist and delish, as well as the home made sausage patty which also had gread flavor and was cooked perfectly.We also had Mimosas which ran the bill up, so it was a $30 a person experience, but if you just ordered one plate and coffee ( also good) it would be quite reasonable!
author: Rick B.

description: So happy that MyMy is only a couple blocks from my place. Amazing omelettes, fresh vegetables, fresh squeezed orange juice, and the best hashbrowns ever. The wait here is only a few minutes, just make sure to write your name on the wait list! You won't leave here disappointed, or hungry.
author: Sarah H.

description: Instead of waiting at a highly rating place near Mymy for brunch we bailed and made the poor decision of coming here. I got the smoked salmon Benedict and the hubby got one of their recommended egg omelet type thing. Both were so disappointing. My 'poached' eggs were completely hard boiled and the smoked salmon was very low quality. The best part of both dishes were the hash browns, never a good sign. We each had half of our meals left when we finished and ended up throwing away the left overs. We were so disappointed. I can only hope it was an off day, but I know we won't be going back to find out.
author: Emily S.

description: Didn't have too long of a wait to get a table on a Sunday around 11am. They have really good eggs Benedict and the Orange fusion French toast is crazy good! We will be back for sure!
author: Jessie A.

description:
I wish this was my local cafe. The fluffiest omelettes, tastiest vanilla milkshakes and friendliest service you could wish for.

Just so you know, the pancakes at MYMY are thin like crepes. My thick pancake-loving daughter was very happy with them. And, there were loads of blueberries.

Sadly, we only had the chance to eat here once, so didn't get to sample the variety. I'm sure it's all good!
author: Susan W.

description: So yummy!!! Split the French toast and a Frisco omelette with your partner. You won't regret it.
author: Tom W.

description: Finally, a cozy yummy brunch spot in SF that reminds me of all the great Chicago brunch spots. Clean, warm environment and staff, fresh good food and nothing too greasy or sweet. Banana stuffed French toast was delish; the egg scramble croissant sandwich was perfect, fruit was yummy; my friend loved her veggie sandwich, as well. Great service, comfy seats.  Will be visiting again!
author: Z K.

description: I was craving a diner-ish brunch, and this hit the spot!   I ordered the Eggs Benedict Florentine with hollandaise on the side, and it came with a generous portion of hasbrowns.  My friend got eggs with special hashbrowns, and they were kind enough to substitute chorizo for bacon.  The coffee's great, not watery diner stuff.
author: Sona P.

description: I was craving a ricotta filled pancake and tried their blueberry and walnut one. Maybe I just don't love blueberries enough. They added a sourness I wasn't crazy about. The ricotta didn't seem well blended in either. Maybe I've been spoiled by the more artful pancakes at Griddle Fresh. Still, Mymy's version will likely hit the spot for the brunch bunch.
author: Aiko S.

description:
I came here for sunday brunch with some friends and it was a great choice.

This place is small and gives off that homey comfort vibe.  While we were waiting to be seated, we were looking at pictures of food that other yelper's put up and everything look mouth watering.  Although we wanted to try the dungeonous crab benedict, they no longer had it on the menu.  We were a little disappointed, but we ordered anyways.  The food here is AMAZING.  Just deliciousness everywhere.  We ordered orange infused french toast, parma benedict, and fresco omelet.  The french toast had a refreshing hint  of the orange and it was fluffy and crisp on the edges.  The parma benedict was so good.  They do not skimp at all on the benedict, there was tons of proscutto, cheese, and the eggs were huge.  Also, it comes with a side of amazing hash browns.  The fresco omelet was sufficiently stuffed as well.  The omelet did not have too much egg and it has plenty of apple chicken sausage in it.  

If you want a delicious breakfast/brunch and you are in the area, even if you aren't, come here and give it a try!
author: Elizabeth C.

description: Extremely rude manager, long lines, food got much worse in the past 2 years. We were given dirty glass and orders came scattered. French toast cream was acid.
author: Nick S.

description:
The wait was long, the muffins supporting my Eggs Benedict were burnt to bitterness, and after paying the bill we were shooed away to accomodate the list. (Other than that, service was friendly.)

Portions are generous, prices are maybe a couple of bucks higher than the norm, and the hash browns were unremarkable.

All in all, was it terrible? No. 

It is worth a special visit? No. It's a typical yuppie breakfast place, no better or worse than any other.
author: Michael J.

description: Amazing breakfast!!  Every dish I tried was great.... great variety... some unique options.  As everyone else states, there is a line but it does move quickly!  Highly recommended.
author: Jacob C.

description: Very unique pancakes, cool people, great clean restaurant and usually not too long of a wait, if any at all. This is a great breakfast place.
author: Paul C.

description: Best brunch I've ever had in San Francisco. Ok, I live a block away, so it's my "go to" but even if I were to move to the other side of the Bay Area I would still make Mymy a priority every time I came back to SF.  Amazing staff, great food, hash browns are second to none, and the wait is never too long. Plus Contraband is one door up on Larkin. My only criticism is their morning cocktail menu is a bit lacking.
author: Eric H.

description: Lemon ricotta pancakes! Wow! Great brunch!
author: Francesca C.

description: Ate at MyMy yesterday for brunch.  It was my 3-4th time dining there and everytime has been great.  Crab cakes as a side are always amazing.  I have been more than satisfied with every dish.  We will keep coming back.  New patio tables are great!
author: Rick J.

description: Great little neighborhood diner! They have a unique take on standard breakfast foods, giving them a fun twist. I highly recommend the Spicy Pacifica Benedict, Frisco Omelet and Eggs Tartine. The only downside is that they only serve wine and soju, so their bloody marys are a little sweet. Other than that, this place is great for a quick, standard brunch.
author: LionThings D.

description: decent prices but didn't end up coming here bc the hostess sucked at estimating what time our table would be ready. she told me 20 minutes so i went around the corner to get coffee went back and my name was crossed off the list. just know that its FIRST COME FIRST SERVE and don't get coffee bc you might lose your spot in 5 minutes.
author: Erika P.

description: My mother and I had breakfast here on a Friday morning.  She raved about the Brioche French Toast and I had a really fluffy omelet with fresh fruit and a side of hash browns.  I'm not a big fan of hash browns but these were really crispy on one side and cooked really well.  The service was pleasant and I would definitely go back here again.  Cute neighborhood spot.
author: Sara N.

description: Very solid 4 stars! I come here all the time, specially for those ricotta pancakes and the hashbrowns, I only wished they serve a better quality bacon, the very thin slices just doesn't cut it for me
author: Anna N.

description: Amazing place for a great bite at dawn. Well done. French toast, service and small shop feel all on point!! Eating here is a must. Two
author: Coach P.

description: Hash browns and Italian sausage were delicious. Nice relaxing atmosphere - great way to start the day.
author: Darby M.

description: While on vacation 2 weeks ago and on a very long walk, we stopped in early for coffee and breakfast, both were fantstic in this very cute, friendly place.
author: Jon U.

description: We dined here after reading the great reviews on yelp. There was a slight wait but it was so worth it. We ordered the buttermilk pancakes, eggs and bacon. The pancakes were awesome. The prices were extremely reasonable too.
author: K R.

description: I've been to this restaurant many times now, and they have never disappointed me.  They put an unusual spin on your typical breakfast fare, like adding mascarpone to their blueberry pancakes, and putting sourdough underneath their Original Eggs Benedict (which is fantastic-not too much hollandaise sauce).  They are a small, busy spot, but the service manages to stay excellent.  I highly recommend this place, and hope they maintain their level of excellence for years to come.  Namaste!;-)
author: Dana F.

description:
I've lived in the neighborhood for almost a year but never made it over to Mymy until I broke my ankle and could no longer fend for myself for breakfast.  I'm almost glad I did injure myself (almost) because I love this place.  The owners/staff are always so nice and the food is delicious.  The omelettes are huge and fluffy.  They have recently changed their menu a bit and in the process got rid of two of my regular choices ( two eggs with canadian bacon and avocado (the canadian bacon part) and the hass omelette). They brought back the hass omelette and somehow it tastes even better than before.  The turkey inside is not thin deli turkey, it's delicious chunks of turkey.
Today was the first day I tried something sweet, the chocolate chip banana bread French toast.  This is a deliciously dangerous combination.  I am always a sucker for chocolate chip banana bread but using it to make French toast?...genius.
author: Katy H.

description: Delicious omelettes and scrambles. The small restaurant is very popular on the weekend...expect to wait for 30 minutes during busy brunch periods. This place is great.
author: Tom W.

description: Small unassuming restaurant on the corner. Yummy artistically arranged blueberries, blackberries, strawberries, oranges slices with no pith or membranes, cantaloupe and honeydew melons. Very fresh. Had a blueberry Swedish pancake with blueberries cooked within the pancake and fresh ones sprinkled on top.
author: Mocha G.

description: Was so excited this morning to try MyMy since I always see a long line out, as soon as I arrived I had put my name on the board for a party of 2, I think there may have been 7-8 people ahead of me, when I asked the Asian lady hostess how long the estimated time it would till she called our name, she was so rude and was like " I don't know??".  She said it with attitude, but I just shrugged it off.  When she finally called our name, I had stepped out and missed her call just after a minute and saw that she entered No Show over our name.  When I told her we just missed her calling our name, she wouldn't let it slide and said I had to enter my name at the bottom of the list, where we'd have to wait at least an hour!  The whole experience was awful from the start and it all started with the hostess that worked this morning around 10am!  Rude customer service will not want me even come back.   It definitely left a bad taste in my mouth.
author: Anonymous R.

description: Loved it! Everything was flavorful and delicious! Definitely get the scallion bacon pancake and the crab Benedict.  Both to die for!
author: J F.

description: my go to spot for breakfast in my 'hood.  i'm not usually a big fan of hash browns but it's super thin and crispy here--the only way i like it.  egg dishes are good sized portions and satisfying. service is always friendly and they always keep my coffee filled!
author: Helen T.

description: A small breakfast place with a limited number of tables.  Street parking only, so everyone dining appears to be from the neighborhood.  Features Swedish pancakes.  I had the Cubano special featuring pulled pork and chorizo.  Nice service.  A very good place to have breakfast or lunch.
author: Doctor G.

description: Delicious breakfast every time. Everyone is very friendly and provides the best service.  Yummy for my tummy!
author: Aiko T.

description: This place was recommended to us and it lived up to expectation the corned beef hash was to die for. Don't delay try for yourself.
author: Geoff T.

description: Excellent breakfast.  BLT Benedict and Tex Mex Scramble both beautifully served and delicious.  Breakfast approx $12-13pp.  Worth the trip.  Service was excellent, made us feel at home.  Would definitely go back.
author: Jarred E.

description:
I went there yesterday at 11.00am and they were a few table free. Lucky us because soon after the place was crowded!

The food: decent American cafe fare: eggs any style, pancakes, French toast...

The service is decent.


This place is a bit in the middle of nowhere so I will go back again only if I am nearby for a particular reason.
author: Anastasia M.

description: The Monte Cristo was amazing as were the special special hashbrowns. The room is very bright and airy.  Presentation is high end even though it is a small coffee shop.  Service was outstanding.
author: April M.

description: Great service, great food, plenty of vegetarian options!  I will return again and again.
author: Sara F.

description: I had a very enjoyable breakfast here today. I had not been in this spot in years since it was The Front Room. Breakfast was great and the service prompt and friendly. This is a great neighborhood spot!
author: Tom B.

description: I ordered the cheesy scramble croissant sandwich and it was quite good.
author: Vince M.

description: We were visiting San Fran for the weekend and we were looking for a neighborhood breakfast place this morning.  Thank you Yelpers for helping us find MyMy!  The food is basic with a twist.  For example, I had an omelette (basic) with sun dried tomatoes, fresh basil, smoked mozzerella and olive sausage (the twist).  It came with hashbrowns.  I don't know about you, but I only like the crispy top layer of the hash browns.  That's all they make here, a very thin layer of hashbrowns that is totally crispy.  Delish!  It's a small restaurant but the wait was short.  Good food, I'd definately eat there again.
author: Jean P.

description: This was the best breakfast I've ever had!  The vanilla French toast was amazing!  My husband got scrambled eggs, and they were so fluffy & delicious!  Even the coffee was good.  The service was fast & friendly.  It got our morning off to a great start.
author: Sara S.

description: Wow, these might have been the best scrambled eggs I've ever eaten - I had the eggs with eggplant, fennel, grilled asparagus, Parmesan, and pesto... Even better tasting than I imagined.  For a $1.50 extra a large cup of nice fresh fruit instead of home fries.  Really, wow.  Go there for sure.
author: Ari S.

description: This place initially greeted me with weird smells, but the brunch food is awesome.  Had the special hash brown and chive/bacon/gorgonzola pancakes, which were delicious.  Pretty barebones place but I'd come back.
author: Josh Q.

description: Loved the omelettes (had the Margherite) and the fruit bowl was fresh and varied. Tea and coffee not so good. Sweet, prompt, attentive service and spotlessly clean.
author: Valerie P.

description:
Was In sf for vacation, and tried this place. Cute trendy little place that serves really good breakfast! After not having any luck with food the day before, we finally stumbled on this place hoping for a nice breakfast and it didn't let us down!

We had a vegetarian omelet and a salmon omelet (forgot the exact name of it) and it was goooooood! Unfortunately we didn't get to try other things, as we were only there for a couple of days. I'm sure if we ever do go back to SF this place will def. be thought of and given another try. =)
author: Rin R.

description: I came here early-ish on a Saturday morning - we were seated right away. It was fairly busy, but the staff was attentive and very no-nonsense. If you're looking for a fancy or glamorous brunch, this is not the place. But the food is great and the price is reasonable. I had a simple eggs, toast and hash browns, and I would definitely come back again. I would make sure to order the orange juice again - it really is fresh squeezed, and it's delicious.
author: Lynn H.

description: We were torn on giving this 3 stars. It took 15 minutes to get a cup of coffee but they seemed to be understaffed. My boyfriend loved his Italian olive sausage with eggs but I was not impressed with the southern Benedict. It was the worst chorizo ive ever had. We will go back again I think we may have just gone in on a bad day.
author: Keira B.

description: My parents make the trek up to SF every couple of months, and the past two times have included a request to hit up MYMY Coffee Shop. We quite literally went here for the first time on a whim, I live right up the block and had recently just noticed the yellow awnings. The restaurant itself is pretty small and only open for breakfast and lunch. Extremely reliable service and food. I tend to get a cup of coffee and Swedish pancakes. The menu is super egg oriented so I would definitely recommend trying one of their many options in benedicts and scrambles. You do tend to be in tight quarters with other diners which is my only qualm. Overall fantastic reliable breakfast place.
author: Melinda S.

description: Loved it. Yummy scrambles for sure.  Although they were playing some odd music.
author: Tom C.

description: Really great bfast.  Nice and low key...but really great food and a menu well considered.
author: Ray W.

description: Great coffee and wonderful French toast. Great place for a good breakfast.
author: Brandi R.

description: Stopped at MyMy after abandoning dotties /mama's plans thanks to 2 hr waits Sunday 8am.  VERY glad we did.  No wait, prompt service and smooth jazz set a good tone from the start.  Coffee was good but highlight was orange-infused french toast.  Wifey got two eggs plus ham and was a huge fan.  We'll be back soon.
author: Nick S.

description: I have heard good things about this resturaunt and I have to say after going there the other day, I cant wait to go again!  Great coffee, GREAT GREAT omelets!!The hash browns are really great!  Overall a great little coffee shop.
author: Julie C.

description: Such a wonderful place for a Sunday brunch. A simple yet neat set up, and the food is artfully crafted and satisfies the taste buds. We waited about 15 minutes for a spot Sunday at 10:30am, definitely their busiest time, but it was worth the wait. For such a small place, they offer quick service.
author: Lizzie C.

description: The front-desk at the Fairmont Hotel recommended this place, so we tried it for breakfast. The food was wonderful. I had an omelet. Many places seem to think the key to a good omelet is making it huge and packing it full of whatever fills it. MYMY gets that the real key is fluffiness. I had a two-egg cheese omelet filled with gruyere and it was perfect. The bacon was good quality and was cooked perfectly. My partner had a pancake and fried eggs and said both were very good. We will definitely go back if we are in the neighborhood again.
author: James S.

description: Yelpers, you have let me down!  Went here because Red Door wasn't open and this was the highest rated option close by.  Reviews are wrong, this place BLOWS!  Hubby got his food, which was lukewarm with cold hash browns several minutes before they brought out my plate.  Except it wasn't what I ordered.  Once I flagged someone down to point out the problem, they whisked it away and said mine was coming right out.  LIE.  My husband ate slowly and still finished his food before mine arrived at the table.  My hash browns were cold also!  Seriously, a half hour wait for cold food?  No apology from the awful waiter for the screw up or the wait.  Mediocre food served cold, AWFUL service, and an awful wait.  There are way better options all over this neighborhood.  In fact, I can't think of a worse choice than this place.
author: Susan A.

description: This place is awesome, very small establishment but oh dam is the food good! I had 2 pancakes with Bananas and almonds, and a side of eggs and chicken apple sausage. The pancakes were delicious, not dry and nasty like most pancakes. And the coffee was amazing.
author: Andre R.

description: When we got there, there were 7 tables ahead of us. But it didn't take that long for us to get served...only about a 20 minute wait. I had the florentine egg benedict and it was delicious! My friend got the french toast and that also looked really goo. I would deff recommend this place
author: Amanda L.

description:
Delightful place! 

The French toast was excellent. Crisp on the outside and moist on the inside, with a great orange flavor. We also had the eggs florentine. The spinach was well seasoned and delicious.
author: James D.

description: I had a good brunch here last weekend.  I ordered the croissant with sausage and cheese and quite liked it.  My husband ordered the veggie burger, but didn't care much for it.  Very reasonably priced; I would go back for an inexpensive brunch.
author: Rise G.

description: We came here last weekend with my husband for the first time...we were suuuper hungry and ready for some brunch. We'd been across the street to Olea before but wanted to try something different. It was really cute, we were seated quickly, very attentive service and most of all, very good food! My husband had the Monte Cristo and I had the Croque Madam. We left feeling very full and happy - we'll be back for sure!
author: Isabel M. L.

description: Excellent brunch on a Tuesday morning-which meant no wait! The server was super friendly. Food was delicious.
author: Demo L.

description: Really good brunch- eggs Benedict- and a cheery atmosphere. Service was really friendly. Nice neighborhood place.
author: Jennifer K.

description: I travel a lot in my line of work and its fair to say breakfast is my most important meal of the day. Mymy is my personal world favourite breakfast joint. By a long way. I always come away feeling sated and boy is the food good. The menu is imaginative without being over fancy, whilst the quality and flavours are fantastic. The service is swift( good because there is a short wait to get in if you arrive much after opening time) but you never feel rushed. The staff are all very friendly and polite. There is so much more I want to try on the menu so I hope I will return many more times. The corned beef hash is a great place to start on the menu.
author: Doug J.

description: Checked out the menu when olea line was too long snd looked good. Next day tried it and its solid. Been back several times and tried different items each time and always pleased. Unfortunately people have discovered this place. Not alot of seating so avoid on weekends during primetime especially if a big party. Definitely a solid addition to the brunch scene in sf with some unique dishes havent seen elsewhere.
author: Doctor Z.

description:
This place is great for a good, solid breakfast or brunch with no frills.

The food is a good value for the price, the interior has a nice ambiance and is always squeaky clean, and the staff is friendly and helpful. I'm not sure, but I'm thinking it's family owned and operated. (I see the same people working there every time I go.)

Try the Hass omelette (turkey, avocado, cheddar, and scallions) or the French toast with sausage and eggs. You can get real maple syrup for just $1 extra.

It gets pretty crowded on weekend mornings and afternoons, but it usually doesn't take more than 10 minutes to get a table, and they have limited counter seating that is usually available right away.

The only downside is that they don't serve espresso drinks, but that's a small price to pay.

This is a great place on the whole.
author: Alex C.

description: Good brunch place. Good selection of sandwiches, omelets, pancakes, french toast. They do not serve alcohol so don't come expecting any bloody mary's or mimosas! Very generous on their servings of avocado.
author: Landon Y.

description: Get the dungeness crab benedict with extra caperberries
author: Todd R.

description: I go there every time I am in San Francisco. The best breakfast you can get without a long wait. Crispy hash brown chewy pancakes and not as greasy as other breakfast places. This is one of those places you don't want it to become too popular cuz it's your spot.
author: JD L.

description: This place is small but cute and the staff is good.  I live up the street and it is the perfect neighborhood breakfast spot. The line isn't usually too bad and the wait is usually no longer than 10 minutes if at all.  My fav is the frisco scramble which had yummy sausage, avocado, mild cheddar cheese and scallions.  Perfect for curing a hangover with a nice cup of coffee.
author: Austin P.

description: Came here for bfast and had the swedish banana and almond pancake. It was good. Overall the food was okay but a bit overpriced. I would come here again if i had to but with so many choices in the city I probably wont.
author: Genaro R.

description: What a great find!  The boyfriend and I wanted to get brunch, and we tried to go to Red Door Cafe.  Since I'm too old to wait longer than 15 minutes to eat, we decided to walk around the Polk St area to see what else we could find.  I've decided that people like Red Door so much because by the time they're done waiting, they're so famished that anything they taste must seem like the best thing they've ever eaten.  But I digress.  Anyway, we stumbled upon Mymy, and were pleasantly surprised.  Looks like a hole in the wall, but both the service and the food were excellent.  Our omelettes were super tasty, and chock full of cheese and other goodness.  I loved their hash brown---was thinner and crispier than what I'm used to.  Since the bf and I both have sweet teeth we had to try their Swedish pancakes---yummy!  We left there in a food coma.  Thank goodness we had to walk a bit to get back to my apartment.
author: Danielle B.

description: great food! amazing breakfast options - it was difficult to decide which item to choose because they all looked so good!! The service was amazing as well.
author: Andrew A.

description: Loved the Finn Omelet and good service
author: JH K.

description: Delicious brunch!  I had the sweet potato and ricotta pancakes that were topped with honey and bacon. So good. It sounds like any negative experiences people have here are due to the long wait. We went early on a Saturday morning, and were seated immediately. We also got our food quickly. The prices were reasonable, and we'll definitely be back.
author: Amy K.

description:
This restaurant is a new comer in town and is an instant hit to me.  Their food is great.  The size of the meal is more than generous.  Everyone in my party loved it.  The price is good, too.  I had mushroom omelet.  It was very tasty and not greasy at all.  Even their hash brown was crisp.  I rarely eat hash brown because it is most of time too greasy.  I don't recall such a delicious hash brown in my past.  On a second visit, I had a hot sandwich named Monticello.  It is a sweet sandwich covered with egg.  Very sweet.  Very cool.  The coffee and fresh squeezed orange juice is also good.  The staffs are very courteous and never failed to refill my drinks.  

This place is very bright because one side of the entire wall is glass and is headed slightly to the east.  This place is a perfect place for a breakfast with newspaper under morning sun.  Love it!
author: Chris M.

description:
This was the pefect find for breakfast during my recent stay in San Francisco.  A quaint restaurant with great music, friendly servers, and 
fantastic food!  I had the french toast twice it was so good!  Excellent coffee and very fresh fruit as well. I wish I had time to get back for lunch, as it looked great on the menu.  Highly recommended!
author: Robin S.

description: The food was delicious. I had the almond banana pancakes with a side of eggs and bacon. The bill was 19 dollars with tip and tax. I find this expensive, but I'd go back for those pancakes.
author: Tiffany O.

description: We found this place so randomly, thanks to Yelp, and were blown away.  I had an omelette and my husband had eggs, bacon (the "best I've ever had"), and hash browns, and then a breakfast dessert of banana pancakes.  My omelette was awesome.  The bacon was thick and crispy.  The hashbrowns were thin and crispy.  The pancakes were the fluffiest pancakes ever..I don't know how they do it.  The venue is unassuming.  The service is excellent.  The food is awesome.  I would definitely be a regular here if I lived in San Fran!
author: A R.

description:
Excellent breakfast!

Good coffee. Great omelets. Cozy atmosphere.
author: Andrea H.

description: The breakfast food here is beautiful!!4stars at least...but service sucks!!1star at most..I came in with my grandparents (80/90 years old) and ordered some breakfast items. My grandma and I ordered two dishes to share and he said we won't split them for you...I am totally fine with that but there is a way to say it to people..ie use the word "sorry" I said that's fine, I don't mind cutting things. My pop ordered the pork sandwich and I asked the male Asian sever if they could put in on sliced bread instead of a hard roll as he can't eat a BIG sandwich...and he said NO!!he said it's too big and messy for bread and I said well can you give him less filling and just put it in the bread and was so SUPER AWKWARD and said no!!another customer (lovely man) overheard and could not believe how awkward he was being to an elderly man!!!He said to me the girl server will do it ...so she came over and was super nice and had them give me less coleslaw and put it inside bread...jeez who would have thought that was such a BIG deal on a Thursday miring at 11am when the place was quiet?!? The Asian girl was very nice but I will never go back because of that guy!pity as the food is great:-(
author: Anna D.

description: This place is Bullshit. Walked into this place and there was a couple waiting before us, and a single guy.  The person seating us told us there would be about a 20 minute wait.  Ok, that's fair.  We waited for 20 minutes and a 6 person group shows up and gets seated before us, or the single guy?  They arrived  20 min after we did, and the guy seating people TOLD them they'd have to wait 45 minutes!?!   They ended up waiting about 10, and weren't even around when he called them. ..rather than give us the table, or the single guy (to whom it should have gone) he WAITED for them to come back (they were outside, somewhere) and went out on the sidewalk to look up and down the street for them!!! The poor guy in front of us was by himself--he's probably ended up waiting hours for a solo spot! This place would rather seat the big group, rather than be FAIR to prioritizing people as they come in...BAD customer service!!
author: Lisa B.

description: We stumbled upon this place by convenience of location, as it was just across the street from our dainty hotel. I didn't expect much, and maybe that's why it was such a pleasant surprise. Either way, the name was enticing and the original place we wanted to eat at, Olea's, was closed. We stepped in to the small, quaint diner style breakfast joint and sat at the bar where we could watch the chefs at work. The menu was impressive, with seven different types of Benedictions (menu- http://sanfrancisco.menupages.com/restaurants/mymy-coffee-shop/menu). I ordered the Parmesan Benedict, which  must have been a special since it's not on the menu. It was one of the best Benedicts I've ever had, a real treat especially since it was my Birthday. It had two poached eggs on wheat toast layered with basil, tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, a perfect homemade chive Hollandaise sauce, asparagus, and topped with Parmesan cheese. Everything tasted really fresh and healthy. My friend got an omelette with an entire Avocado laid on top. The Hash-Browns were also perfect, very thin and crispy with great flavor, I hardly even added salt. The portions are just the right amount. I ate everything on my plate and didn't feel disgustingly full afterwards. I highly recommend this place and am anxious to get back.
author: Anthony P.

description: I have eaten here twice and I am satisfied every time. I've ordered the Tex Mex scramble and it is always amazing! My friend had the french toast and it was also so delicious, I am continuously impressed here and would recommend it to anyone.
author: Natalie L.

description: A diner that gets a little creative with its huge selection, which is great, but it's just a little too greasy for me. I do like that it usually has no line, unlike Olea across the street. The portions are pretty large here too!
author: Amy W.

description: Went in search of a delicious breakfast and was not disappointed. Southern-style (chorizo/jalapeno) eggs benedict with a home made hollandaise sauce. Excellent service too - never left wanting for coffee or water.
author: Jonathan F.

description: Never had a bad dish.  Could be cheaper.  Latest favorite is the special hash browns.
author: t k.

description: Food is great, service is terrible.  Had to get up and refill our water glasses 2x and get up to go ask for the bill.  S-l-o-w.   But...very reliable breakfast joint.
author: Ross E.

description: Delicious eggs Benedict. But even better is the South of the a border eggs. Fantastic breakfast.
author: Sandy G.

description: Tried it because it was close. Coffee was definitely not good. Sausages were frozen and the scrambled eggs weren't that good. The french toast was decent though.
author: Steve H.

description: I was torn between giving the place a 2 or 3 star but since my daughter liked her meal, I gave it a 3.  First, I was so looking forward to eating some luscious food in concert with all the amazing reviews.  We arrived at 12:15 and were pleasantly surprised it only took us 15 minutes to get a seat.  The waiter came around after a few minutes and we weren't ready so he said he would come back.  I was expecting more pressure than that because there were still people waiting to get a seat after we were seated.  That was nice and I thought "classy".  But, after we ordered it took 45 minutes for my daughter to get her "Frisco" scramble and my order of french toast with the butterscotch drizzle came about 8 minutes later.  After we thanked God for the food were about to enjoy and before my order came my daughter offered me some of her scramble.  It not only looked "old" but it was luke warm and I was very disappointed.  Had they cooked her order and forgotten about mine and then let hers sit for 30 minutes first?  And, it didn't taste very good at all.  My omelettes are better!  I also ordered a side order of hash browns because everyone raved about how good they were but they were average at best.  I have tasted better at Country Waffle and Black Bear easily.....  My order came and to my surprise it was very very good and I would go back for it a 2nd time.  The only reason I didn't rate this a 1 or 2 star is because of the french toast.  Not sure what all the fuss is about.  Aside from that, was very average or below average in taste, quality and overpriced for what you get.
author: Hugh M.

description: Really good food.  Bright and friendly environment.  Limited seating but worth the wait if there is one.  The food was great and filling.  Not a typical eggs and pancake menu.   We weren't stuffed and uncomfortable like you feel at a breakfast diner.  Next time we are here,  it would be worth revisiting this corner coffee shop.
author: Allan F.

description: We found this place on yelp and gave it a try. The service was really slow and they took awhile to refill our coffee. I ordered the Swedish pancakes and my bf ordered the spicy pop pulled pork scramble. He said his was amazing but the hash browns were cold. Overall the food was decent wouldn't go back.
author: M R.

description: Great place in my neighborhood! I've been there twice for breakfast. First time I went with the savory crab meat filled omelet and today I tried their amazing french toast w/mascarpone cheese and berries. Love their hash browns - perfect texture of crispy on the outside with softer shreds on the inside. Friendly and fast service once you get a table, but try to avoid the breakfast/brunch witching hours of 10:30am to 1pm - the word is definitely out on this place. Today it took over an hour for me to get a table for 4. If you are dining solo or with 1 other person, there is sometimes space at a short counter just inside the door. There is a sign-yourself-in waiting list system, which works fine, they do keep current with the list and will come out to call your name if you're waiting outside (most likely, since it's a small place.) Will be back to try some of their delicious sounding sandwiches.
author: Barbara K.

description: Excellent french toast and eggs! Very reasonable prices too. Definitely coming back here.
author: Nicole T.

description: Great little diner.  We were staying at the Fairmont and wanted to avoid the more touristy and high-priced places by Union Square.  This was a perfect choice -- clean, reasonable and very good food. Great pancakes and French toast,  fantastic fresh OJ and nice sides.  Would definitely recommend if in the area.  Lunch menu looks good too.
author: Laura F.

description: This cafe just opened up in my neighborhood so I thought I would give it a whirl. Clean and inviting and the staff are super friendly. The food was piping hot and good. However, although its nice to see another cafe in the area (and not on Polk) it is slightly on the pricey side. I only had breakfast but it is not a cafe I could see myself eating in more than once a week because of the prices. Tthey had no small pots to put hot water in for adding to tea and this item is a basic in coffee shops so I was surprised about that. Overall though I would recommend it to people and I hope they do well in the neighborhood. Another coffee shop is slated to open soon, literally around the corner from them. Two coffee shops, feet apart, might make for some fierce competition thought so I wish them all the best.
author: mary f.

description: omg how did I not know about this place until now?? my fiancé and I went there for brunch today and it was amazing! I ordered the croissant scramble with bacon and one Swedish pancake. it was the perfect amount of food. I was full but not stuffed. my fiancé had the eggs benedict and he loved them. the place is small so if you go with more than 2 people, you have to wait longer than parties of 2. we only had to wait about 5 minutes for a table. next time, I want to try the grilled cheese with bacon. this is definitely our new go-to spot.
author: susie r.
